The Dao spoke: Long ago in the tranquil void of heaven, amidst crimson descents of divine winds and the wondrous soil of the Great Mystery, the Primordial Beginning bestowed the *Limitless Upper Grade Scripture for Salvation of Humankind*—the stabilization of the eight directions of heaven and earth and the securing of the nation’s boundless fortune.

As the Celestial Worthy of the Primordial Beginning was about to expound this scripture, he circumambulated eight times to summon the eight directions. Only then did he ascend his throne. The great deities of the eight directions of heaven and earth, the lofty and venerable sagely lords, the Perfected Lords who stabilize the nation, and their innumerable hosts arrived upon the void. Jade radiance and purple qi, auspicious mists congealing into brilliance, jasper chariots drifting through rosy clouds, feathered banners interlacing in splendor, kingfisher canopies arrayed in rows, fragrant winds dispersing numinous essence, celestial spirits shining in clarity, the myriad forms pristine and luminous, divine light scattering and spreading, golden haze suffused with fragrance, green silken veils rippling with radiance—all illumined the Great Void in resplendent glory.

For eight days and eight nights, the sun, moon, and stars of all heavens, the warp and weft of the celestial sphere, the Northern Dipper and the Balance, all paused in their courses. Golden perfection and jade luminosity filled the tranquil void with numinous resonance; the thunder of the Dharma rolled gently, and none failed to stand in solemn reverence. The lands of the nation became uniformly level, mountains and rivers majestic and fair, forests and trees lush and flourishing. Mighty radiance responded to the signs, heavenly omens all arrived, and the assembled Perfected Ones attended as the Celestial Worthy of the Primordial Beginning, seated in mystery upon the transforming treasure-throne of jade petals unfolding in blossoms, began to expound the scripture.

After the first recitation, the great sages of all heavens simultaneously proclaimed its excellence. At that moment, all sentient beings across the ten thousand lands universally received enlightenment and together awakened virtuous minds.

After the second recitation, the eight directions were stabilized, and the imperial fortune flourished in perpetuity.

After the third recitation, the myriad classes harmonized, and the people enjoyed abundance and joy.

After the fourth recitation, calamities and disorders vanished forever, and noxious harms ceased to arise.

After the fifth recitation, the transformative power of the Dao spread universally, and all were refined by sagely models.

After the sixth recitation, heaven covered and earth bore, and harmonious qi surged in fusion.

After the seventh recitation, the numinous scripture manifested and spread, and the true Dao shone in clarity.

After the eighth recitation, the people and all beings lived in blissful harmony, free from worldly concerns.

After the ninth recitation, the true scripture appeared in revelation.

After the tenth recitation, auspicious omens arrived in abundance.

At that time, every man and woman in the land turned their hearts in devotion, all received protection and salvation, and each attained longevity.

The Dao spoke: At that time...

When the Primordial Heavenly Worthy recited the scripture once, the infinite and boundless hosts of the Azure Flower Palace Lords and their officers from the Eastern Limitless Realm arrived, floating through the void.

When recited twice, the infinite and boundless hosts of the Cinnabar Flower Palace Lords and their officers from the Southern Limitless Realm arrived, floating through the void.

When recited thrice, the infinite and boundless hosts of the Luminous Flower Palace Lords and their officers from the Western Limitless Realm arrived, floating through the void.

When recited four times, the infinite and boundless hosts of the Purple Flower Palace Lords and their officers from the Northern Limitless Realm arrived, floating through the void.

When recited five times, the infinite and boundless hosts of the Ghost Gate Palace Lords and their officers from the Northeastern Limitless Realm arrived, floating through the void.

When recited six times, the infinite and boundless hosts of the Earth Gate Palace Lords and their officers from the Southeastern Limitless Realm arrived, floating through the void.

When recited seven times, the infinite and boundless hosts of the Human Gate Palace Lords and their officers from the Southwestern Limitless Realm arrived, floating through the void.

When recited eight times, the infinite and boundless hosts of the Heavenly Gate Palace Lords and their officers from the Northwestern Limitless Realm arrived, floating through the void.

After the eight recitations were complete, the Palace Lords, officers, and their hosts who stabilize the nation’s fortune across the eight directions—the Eight Radiant Ones, the Eight Mighty Ones, the Eight Scribes, the Eight Spirits, and all the immortals of the various departments—arrived all at once. Every man and woman in the land turned their hearts in devotion and reverence. All wished for the eight directions of heaven and earth to be blessed with auspicious responses, peace, prosperity, and joy, to hear the Heavenly Worthy proclaim the essential Dharma, to stabilize the nation’s fortune, and to ensure the eternal endurance of heaven.

Like fine rain or dense mist, the boundless hosts encircled and surrounded, an encirclement that could not be restrained. Then, from the pearl upon the Heavenly Worthy’s brow, there emanated a radiance of wondrous hues. This light divided into eight beams, and within each beam appeared celestial scriptures—natural, numinous talismans of primordial qi. From these eight directions emerged eight talismans to stabilize the nation’s fortune, secure the cosmos, and reveal vermilion texts and jade-script divine chapters. Auspicious qi was summoned, and felicitous omens were drawn forth.

The Primordial Heavenly Worthy led the eight directions, the celestial and terrestrial bureaus, the Palace Lords, officers, and the perfected beings of the eight quarters. The immeasurable great spirits and the boundless hosts all entered the radiant light. From below, the people gazed upward, seeing only a gentle shimmer as they merged into the light, dissolving into the numinous talismans of primordial qi. Once within the radiant light, their whereabouts became unknown. The people dispersed, and the earth was veiled in misty clouds, lustrous as soft jade.

Within this wondrous vision, the Heavenly Worthy proclaimed the Great Dharma for Stabilizing the Nation’s Fortune in its entirety. The assembled perfected beings oversaw its transmission, bestowing it upon me. At that moment, joy and celebration were beyond words. When the ritual was roughly complete, the hosts of heaven returned to their stations, and in an instant, all fell silent without a trace.

At that time, all heavenly and earthly beings who encountered this scripture and Dharma were universally delivered, their allotted years preserved without harm or injury. The entire land turned in reverence, each with wholehearted devotion. There was no deceit, no falsehood, no malice, no scheming, no slander, no contention, no flattery, no cruelty. Their words upheld loyalty and uprightness; their mouths spoke no grievance or praise. They were united in compassion and love, and even foreign lands became kin. The nation was at peace, the people prosperous, and all rejoiced in great harmony.

From the scripture’s first proclamation, the entire land followed the Dao. Those who had cultivated sincere devotion, reverence, and veneration were all delivered across the ages.

The Dao spoke: The names uttered by the Primordial Heavenly Worthy during the scripture’s recitation are the inner names of the Heavenly Emperors. They stabilize the nation’s fortune, dispel misfortune from the eight directions, and bring supreme blessings and auspicious omens—these are the hidden tones of the divine. They are also the esoteric secrets of the highest spirits, the sacred texts of the jade tablets, the inner taboo names that summon the perfected, primordial, and wondrous beings, and the hidden names that protect the flourishing age of the emperor. These are not the common words of the world.

When the highest sages have attained perfection and the perfected beings have mastered the mysteries, descending with numinous power to uphold the imperial destiny, the Dao sustains the great fortune, subdues evil and ugliness, and its virtue extends to all living beings. Those who comprehend its chapters may recite it eight times: the eight directions will be at peace, the six harmonies will be tranquil, the hosts of heaven will chant from afar, the myriad emperors will offer rites, rivers and seas will be serene, mountains and peaks will manifest their numinous power, the sun and moon will cast double shadows, the stars will move in orderly procession, demonic hordes will be bound in form, ghostly spirits will lose their clarity, blessings will return to extend the age, and the people will be nurtured in peace.

For the devoted scholar who recites it eight times, the Five Emperors will guard the nation, the Three Heavens will assist and sustain, demonic spirits will lose their sight, ghostly evils will lose their clarity, and those on the verge of death will be delivered, cut off from death and restored to life. The reason for this is that though the scholar may uphold the highest precepts and the talismans of the eight directions stand firm, the numinous Dharma for stabilizing and securing remains unintegrated with their spirit and qi, and their body has not yet penetrated the true. They may summon and command the eight spirits, but their power has not yet governed the celestial administration. Their virtue may subdue and restrain earthly deities and bind demonic spirits, but they can only invoke blessings and bring forth fortune—they cannot restore life. To recite this chapter lightly is to invite calamity upon oneself. To honor and venerate it with reverence will cause one’s family and nation to flourish, generation after generation, thriving in goodness. Through this karmic connection, ten thousand disasters will not touch them, and divine luminaries will guard their gates.

This scripture is supremely wondrous, unmatched in the Jade Capital. It delivers countless beings and is the root of the ten thousand Daoist traditions. Its majestic model is vast, and its virtue is beyond measure.

The Dao spoke: Whenever this scripture is recited eight times, the eight spirits of the eight directions of heaven and earth, the Palace Lords, officers, the Eight Radiant Great Spirits, and the perfected beings of the eight quarters will all arrive together to stabilize the nation’s fortune. The Eight Great Divine Kings and the perfected beings of the eight directions will come as one. Evil and strange beings will hide in concealment, the people and all beings will be at peace, the nation will be secure, demonic spirits and malevolent specters will be dispelled by the eight talismans, and the true spirits will be protected. In the lands of the eight directions, the bones of the dead will be laid to rest. The thousand-year-old trees and stones, the water and fire spirits, the vermilion serpents and red rats, the yin shadows and lingering grievances, the ghosts of ancient times, the multitudes of past generations, the countless ancestors, and the suffering souls of the hidden realms will all be delivered, ascending to the Vermilion Palace. After nine years of refinement, they will be transformed and reborn, beholding the era of great peace.

Those who diligently study this sutra to its culmination, fulfilling their merit and perfecting their virtue, shall all attain divine transcendence, ascending to the Golden Gates and roaming the Jade Capital. For scholars who cultivate and recite this sutra, their bodies shall align with Heaven and Earth, resonating with the eight directions. The nine palaces within their heads shall connect to the Great Ultimate, and the jade script of the eight directions shall radiate, illuminating their bodily palaces. The Lord of the Heart, tranquil and non-active, shall harmonize the hundred spirits. Their hun and po souls shall undergo refinement, the yin and yang shall circulate their numinous essence. On the left resides Wu Ying, on the right guards Bai Yuan, and at the center shines the Morning Radiance, illuminating countless realms. The swift steeds shall report their merits, and the Scribe of Destiny shall record their deeds. All shall then be delivered, ascending to the Southern Palace.

When this sutra is recited universally, all shall attain the true Dao. Jade talismans shall summon the spirits, and the spirits shall be at peace, their qi numinous. Crimson sinews and frosty marrow shall form patterns of purple veins, and the script shall spread as a profound chapter, transforming their bones into cinnabar gold. Thus shall their lifespans be extended, and in the end, all shall achieve the Way of Corpse Liberation. Their ethereal souls shall briefly dissolve, sparing them the trials of hell, and they shall swiftly regain their forms, roaming the vastness of the heavens.

This sutra is wondrous and subtle, universally delivering boundless beings. All heavenly and mortal beings shall receive its blessings. Immeasurable fortune shall grace both life and death, for this is a treasure cherished by the heavens above, not to be transmitted to the lower realms. Only the most devoted shall offer gold and treasures in sincerity, swearing oaths to Heaven before its transmission. Those who lightly disclose or disrespect it shall bring calamity upon nine generations, condemned to eternal servitude in the Earthly Offices.

The eight directions are guarded by thirty-two Jade Lads and thirty-two Jade Maidens, who protect the sacred script and safeguard the bodies of those who receive this sutra.

The Dao declares: During the long fast of the first month, recite this sutra to pacify the directions of *yin*, *mao*, *chen*, *si*, *wu*, *wei*, *shen*, *you*, *xu*, *hai*, *zi*, and *chou*, the cardinal positions of the eight directions, and the central burial grounds. This shall liberate the souls of past generations from earthly bondage, delivering them to the Southern Palace.

During the long fast of the seventh month, recite this sutra to pacify Heaven and Earth, ensuring all living beings fulfill their Dao-nature and aspire to divine transcendence. Their names shall be inscribed in the heavens on yellow registers and white tablets, erasing death and granting rebirth.

During the long fast of the tenth month, recite this sutra for the king, emperor, lord, ministers, fathers, and sons, to secure the nation’s prosperity, preserve the Mandate of Heaven, and ensure its eternal continuity. The ruler shall perpetually govern, pacifying the land, and the people shall praise the era of Great Peace.

On the eight seasonal festivals, recite this sutra to pacify the eight directions of Heaven and Earth. Auspicious omens shall descend, and wondrous signs shall manifest. The sacred script and secret diagrams shall be carved upon the eight pillars, and the eight celestial offices shall record virtues, preserving the Dao’s transformation for eternity.

On the Three Primordial Days, recite this sutra to harmonize the twelve celestial palaces, the four directions, and the eight directions. Heavenly spirits and earthly deities shall bestow compassion and blessings, inscribing good fortune and ensuring the sagely ruler’s virtue ever ascends.

Their bodies shall become as the unbroken Cavern of Spirits, their forms adorned with jade blossoms, their faces golden. Their ethereal souls shall be pure and upright, their myriad qi enduring. All suffering shall cease, their bodies radiant with light. The Three Realms shall guard them, the Five Emperors shall receive them, and myriad spirits shall pay homage. Their names shall be inscribed in the heavens, and upon fulfilling their merit and perfecting their virtue, they shall ascend to the Supreme Clarity.

The Dao declares: On the day of practicing the Dao, one must bathe in fragrant waters, fast, and enter the chamber. Facing east, knock the teeth thirty-two times, making it heard in the thirty heavens above, and bow thirty-two times with utmost reverence. Close the eyes and meditate upon the body seated amidst clouds of blue, yellow, and white qi, both within and without shrouded in mist. A Green Dragon, White Tiger, Vermilion Bird, Dark Warrior, Lion, and White Crane shall array themselves to the left and right. The sun and moon shall shine brightly, illuminating the chamber. The talismanic officials of the eight directions and the merit-recording attendants of the eight sides shall stand in attendance. A circular image shall manifest above the head, revealing celestial script of dragons and phoenixes, pacifying Heaven and Earth and casting light upon the eight directions. This vision shall be vivid and clear.

Recite the secret incantation:
*"Supreme Mysterious Origin, Most High Lord of the Dao, summon forth the Three and Five Merit-Recording Attendants within my body, the officials and messengers to my left and right, the Jade Lads bearing incense, the Jade Maidens transmitting words, the talismanic attendants of the Five Emperors, and the incense officials of the day—thirty-two each—to open the gates and convey my words. Today is an auspicious day, a long fast in a pure hall, practicing the supreme sutra to deliver boundless beings. May my entreaties ascend swiftly to the presence of the Most High Primordial Lord of the Thirty-Two Heavens."*
Upon completion, draw in qi thirty-two times and recite the sutra facing east.

*The Primordial Beginning’s Wondrous Scripture of Boundless Salvation, Supreme and Marvelous*
*The Primordial Cavern-Mysterious Numinous Treasure’s Fundamental Chapter, Supreme and Marvelous Beginning, Pacifying and Delivering Beings*

The eight directions of Heaven and Earth, the eight mighty ones concealed in rhythm, the natural coagulation of celestial seal-script. The eight spirits’ crimson script. The primordial qi of the ancestral kalpas. The wondrous qi of the Primordial Beginning, giving birth to all heavens. Opening and spreading the eight directions, assisting in establishing the root of Heaven. The divine perfected of Heaven and Earth, dividing qi to form bodies. Once the directions were set, fortune and misfortune unfolded. The divine talismans of the Emperor repel demons and protect humanity.

Without script, there is no illumination; without script, there is no clarity; without script, there is no establishment; without script, there is no completion; without script, there is no pacification; without script, there is no stabilization. This is the Great Brahma, pacifying and securing the cosmos. The nation’s prosperity shall endure, and auspicious blessings shall perpetually flow.

The realm of Yu Luo Xiao Jing, the numinous capital of the Jade Emperor. At the utmost height of the Supreme Great Luo Heaven, vast as kalpas. Below to the Kunlun’s foundation, the eight directions distinctly divided. The myriad regions clearly demarcated, each position guarded by divine officials and spirit attendants. Memorials ascend to the morning court, virtues recorded and merits inscribed, all derived from the people.

The great circulation of Brahma-qi pervades the eight directions. Within reside the spirits of Heaven and Earth’s eight directions, the talismanic attendants who slay demons, the august ones who pacify the nation’s prosperity, the Great Lord of Longevity of the Southern Culmen, the True King of Divine Empyrean, and the Lord of Azure Radiance. They issue teachings and establish laws, protecting the nation and its people. The talismans pacify the eight directions, Heaven and Earth grow luminous, and the Jade Hall of the Celestial Province is overseen by the Prime Minister and True Lord. Within resides the Lord of the Supreme Minister’s Mysterious Office, who dispels calamitous qi and ensures the nation’s peace.

Within reside the Southern Supreme Director of Destinies and the Recorder of Lifespans, the august deities who prolong life and augment fate, who deliver from calamity and purify the four quarters, so that all things flourish in joy. Today, the transformation unfolds, and all heavens descend to the imperial terrace.

The Eastern Culmen’s Boundless Flying Heavenly Guardian-King of the World, the Great Sage of Longevity who delivers the immeasurable.
The Southern Culmen’s Boundless Flying Heavenly Guardian-King of the World, the Great Sage of Longevity who delivers the immeasurable.
The Western Culmen’s Boundless Flying Heavenly Guardian-King of the World, the Great Sage of Longevity who delivers the immeasurable.
The Northern Culmen’s Boundless Flying Heavenly Guardian-King of the World, the Great Sage of Longevity who delivers the immeasurable.
The Northeastern Culmen’s Boundless Flying Heavenly Guardian-King of the World, the Great Sage of Longevity who delivers the immeasurable.
The Southeastern Culmen’s Boundless Flying Heavenly Guardian-King of the World, the Great Sage of Longevity who delivers the immeasurable.
The Southwestern Culmen’s Boundless Flying Heavenly Guardian-King of the World, the Great Sage of Longevity who delivers the immeasurable.
The Northwestern Culmen’s Boundless Flying Heavenly Guardian-King of the World, the Great Sage of Longevity who delivers the immeasurable.
The Eight Culmens’ Talisman-Guarding Flying Heavenly Guardian-Kings of the World, the Great Gods of Longevity and Immeasurable Power.

Together they ride the dark clouds, with their hosts of officials and cavalry, the divine officers and functionaries of the eight directions. Their banners and pennants, mounted escorts, ride upon wind and cloud, spouting smoke and breathing fire. Dragon spirits and courier-demons, tiger-headed ghostly officers, four-faced generals, eight-armed divine warriors, crimson-browed and azure-armored, ride the whirlwinds and mount the unicorns. The direct-talisman minor functionaries pacify the numinous offices, the spirits of the earthly regions, with their myriad chariots and ten thousand riders, ascending and descending to attend the celestial cortege, to pacify the nation and protect life.

The Heavenly Mechanism’s Chancellor, the Southern Prosperity’s Supreme Palace, the Han Director of Records, the Eight Culmens’ Great Gods—holding the registers of Heaven and Earth, they inspect the myriad spirits, summoning them in secret flight to assemble before the Emperor. According to their respective directions, they solemnly report to the heavens above. Universally proclaimed to the Three Realms, the Boundless Divine Regions, the Yellow Springs’ Courts, the Northern Capital of Fengdu, the Three Offices and Nine Bureaus, the Twelve River Sources—hastily summon the Great Star Lord of the Accumulated Corpses to deliver the people.

The Eight Culmens subdue harm, shatter malevolent arrows, call back wandering souls, and deliver ancestors through countless kalpas, swiftly erasing their names from the ledgers of sin, extinguishing evil roots, so they may not be detained or pressed into ghostly throngs. By the Primordial Beginning’s talismanic command, they pacify and promote, guarding the Northern Capital’s Frigid Pool, escorting the forms and souls, with the Earthly Offices recommending them for promotion to the Southern Prosperity’s ranks. The Heavenly Mechanism’s Central Ministry ensures the Dao’s eternal renewal, as dead souls undergo refinement and the people are transformed into immortals. The people receive deliverance, enduring through kalpas, revolving with the ages, their years equaling Heaven’s. Perpetually delivered across the directions, no harm may assail them; by talisman they are pacified, securing long years of felicity.

When the Dao is perfected and virtue accomplished, they transcend the Three Realms, roaming freely in the Supreme Clarity. In the Heaven of Supreme Clarity, the Heavenly Emperor and Jade Perfected safeguard the nation’s borders with Brahma-conduct.

The Eight Heavens of the East:
The Heaven of Brightly Upholding Jade Yang, where the Emperor rules with Beneficent Might.
The Heaven of Horn and Womb’s Supreme Culmen, where the Emperor’s merit is vast and thoughts complete.
The Heaven of Storing Purity and Wondrous Being, where the Emperor gathers and questions the learned.
The Heaven of Eminent Traces and Lead Ancestry, where the Emperor’s calendar transforms and endures.
The Heaven of Clan and Zhang’s Auxiliary August, where the Emperor’s virtue is vast and compassionate.
The Heaven of Supreme Arrival and Wu’s Ancestry, where the Emperor summons and unites all threads.
The Heaven of Secret Obscurity and Han’s Transformation, where the Emperor transmits true knowledge and origin.
The Heaven of Remote Leisure and Rare Compliance, where the Emperor’s ancestors are illustrious and heroic.

The Eight Heavens of the South:
The Heaven of Scorching Ascent and Radiant Flame, where the Emperor’s dragon dissolves into flowing sands.
The Heaven of Forging Spirits and Bone-Thought, where the Emperor’s mystery is fresh and alive.
The Heaven of Brilliant Splendor and Soaring Elevation, where the Emperor is pure, still, and vast.
The Heaven of Proclaiming Reform and Celebrating Vastness, where the Emperor’s fragrance fills the capital’s rivers.
The Heaven of Changing Emblems and Wiping Away Exaltation, where the Emperor’s primal compassion is named.
The Heaven of Dipper’s Void and Blazing Alignments, where the Emperor’s truth dwells in secret capitals.
The Heaven of Obstructing Righteousness and Blazing Currents, where the Emperor’s might subdues and returns to the hall.
The Heaven of Sketching Wings and Trailing Dao, where the Emperor’s cavernous radiance transforms and prevails.

The Eight Heavens of the West:
The Heaven of Winding Discourse and Restraining Demons, where the Emperor’s decrees slay with good counsel.
The Heaven of Willow’s Abode and Proper Accord, where the Emperor’s elder establishes plans.
The Heaven of Bordering Connections and Purple Whales, where the Emperor’s memorials spread auspiciousness.
The Heaven of Proud Spirits and Joyful Emptiness, where the Emperor ascends to enlightenment.
The Heaven of Crossing Accumulations and Isle’s Peace, where the Emperor expounds and aids the worthy.
The Heaven of Proclaiming Seals and Observing Void, where the Emperor’s peaks plumb profound depths.
The Heaven of Righteous Spirits and Flying Huts, where the Emperor judges the ultimate and penetrates the clouds.
The Heaven of Praising Mystery and Flowing Radiance, where the Emperor’s peace is vast and tranquil.

The Eight Heavens of the North:
The Heaven of Hiding and Obscuring the Subtle, where the Emperor’s qi follows the dragon’s tracks.
The Heaven of Portending Transformations and Myriad Lights, where the Emperor preserves purity and harmony.
The Heaven of Scribes’ Alley and Xi’s Culmen, where the Emperor converges and flourishes.
The Heaven of Anticipating Constancy and Furthering Harmony, where the Emperor severs and follows firmness.
The Heaven of Guests and Zhang’s Talisman-Guarding, where the Emperor’s melody turns and brightens the directions.
The Heaven of Blessing Kings and Roaming Leisure, where the Emperor’s longevity dries in the dawn.
The Heaven of Still Origins and Flowering Tripods, where the Emperor’s measure perfects the celestial form.
The Heaven of Distant Dao and Vast Currents, where the Emperor’s words endure forever.

The Thirty-Two Heavens, the Thirty-Two Emperors. The heavens conceal their taboos, the heavens conceal their names. Within the Heavenly Center’s empty cavern, the nation’s prosperity is pacified, the natural numinous scriptures, the Eight Culmens’ hidden rhymes. The sound of pacification, the augustness of pacification. The Eight Culmens’ gods, the Eight Culmens’ great demons, the Eight Culmens’ numina, the talismans of deliverance and mysterious union.

Transforming into the Supreme Clarity, the immeasurable mysteries too profound to detail. Summoning and gathering the divine perfected, universally delivering gods and humans. Today’s exorcistic deliverance rite traverses the passes of all heavens, invoking the guardians of the nation’s directions. Severing and extinguishing demonic hordes, the flying immortals of the eight luminaries, their names inscribed in the Great Mystery, the true demons overseeing promotions, unbound by Heaven’s gates.

The Eastern Dipper determines transformations, the Western Dipper subdues demons, the Northern Dipper severs treachery, the Southern Dipper protects life, the Central Dipper pacifies evil—together they oversee the Eight Culmens. The Azure Emperor nurtures, the White Emperor assists in completion, the Red Emperor pacifies the people, the Black Emperor extinguishes misfortune, the Yellow Emperor protects life, safeguarding the times of the myriad people.

The Azure Heavenly Demon-King pacifies the Eastern Culmen.
The Red Heavenly Demon-King, with his precious talisman, guards the Southern Fire.
The White Heavenly Demon-King halts weapons in the West.
The Black Heavenly Demon-King universally pacifies the Northern Culmen.

The Yellow Heavenly Demon-King commands the Eight Mightly Divine Soldiers.
The Five Great Demon Emperors scour and capture the Eight Culmens.
They purify Heaven and Earth, commanding the ghostly legions,
brandishing banners and beating drums in rhythm, roaming and surveying the vast sky.
The numinous script shines resplendent, arraying its majestic radiance,
pacifying and securing the nation’s destiny, sternly seizing evil vapors.
The Divine Kings receive their mandate to eradicate the world’s misfortunes—
the dark serpent spews venom, the Nine Capitals tremble in fear.
The Heavenly Soldiers bind ghosts, the Northern Dipper slays spirits,
flinging fire for ten thousand leagues, streaming bells through the Eight Directions.
Should any dare to resist or obstruct the Eight Spirits,
golden blades will be wildly wielded, a thousand demons annihilated in form.
They roar upward to the Jade Flower, gnaw downward at the Crimson Abyss.
The Eight Culmens of Heaven and Earth, mindful of the Dao, pacify the true—
slaughtering and extinguishing calamitous omens, wind and fire never ceasing.
A thousand thousand heads severed, ten thousand ten thousand forms sheared,
demons dare not trespass, ghosts dare not harbor malevolent essence.
The Three Officials of the Northern Feng inspect the ghostly encampments,
allowing no concealment—reports are swiftly delivered by golden steeds.
Universally proclaimed without end, the myriad spirits all heed,
the Three Realms and Five Emperors, their declarations ascend to the Upper Clarity.

The Primordial Beginning Supreme Lord harmonizes the Three Qi,
the Eight Culmens of Heaven and Earth, the method for pacifying and securing the nation’s destiny,
secretly preserved in the Eastern Florescence’s Treasure Chamber, its prohibitions most solemn.
The true talismans of the Eight Culmens are all naturally numinous scriptures,
the blossoms of soaring mystery, the qi of the Nine Phoenixes,
forming purple characters.
Used to rescue and protect the world’s afflictions, the misfortunes of regions and boundaries,
the way to rectify unruly lands.
Should a nation’s borders suffer epidemics, warfare, banditry, or disasters of water and fire,
then perform incense offerings and purificatory fasts, practice the Dao in the six watches,
recite this wondrous scripture, and according to the afflicted quarter,
inscribe this talisman in cinnabar, using the propitious color for that direction,
and place it within the nation.
Burn incense and offer libations to the Three Heavenly Lords and the Eight Culmen Divine Kings and their officers.
In the central courtyard, the Dharma Master wields a sword, steps the Dipper’s steps,
restrains qi, recites incantations, and installs the talisman as needed.
After three or seven days, dismantle the altar, and great fortune will follow.

If a household suffers from harmful qi in its boundaries, or the killing force of yellow earth talismans,
use this talisman to perform exorcisms, and also sacrifice to the Eight Culmen’s officials, lords, generals, and officers.
This is the Upper Clarity’s scripture for protecting the world—it must not be treated lightly.
The guardian talismans all have spirit officials, youths, and jade maidens on duty,
to issue commands and carry out affairs.

The talismans are as follows—on silk, paper, cast in gold, or carved in stone, all are permissible.
For each culmen, nineteen direct talisman officers, three messengers,
and three thousand guardian officials, lords, generals, and officers.

**Pacifying and Securing the Eastern Culmen: The Azure Florescence Venerable’s True Talisman for Protecting the World and Prolonging Life**
Inscribed in green on black silk, placed in the Thunder Palace.

**Pacifying and Securing the Southern Culmen: The Crimson Numinous Perfected’s True Talisman for Protecting the World and Flourishing Fortune**
Inscribed in cinnabar on yellow silk, placed in the Fire Palace.

**Pacifying and Securing the Western Culmen: The Chapter-Simplicity Jade Maiden’s True Talisman for Protecting the World and Warding Off Warfare**
Inscribed in white on black silk, placed in the Lake Palace.

**Pacifying and Securing the Northern Culmen: The Dragon-Mystery Great Spirit’s True Talisman for Protecting the World and Safeguarding Destiny**
Inscribed in black on white silk, placed in the Water Palace.

**Pacifying and Securing the Northeastern Culmen: The Luminous Perfected Numinous Lord’s True Talisman for Protecting the World and Subduing Demons**
Inscribed in white on green silk, placed in the Mountain Palace.

**Pacifying and Securing the Southeastern Culmen: The Azure Immortal Divine Lord’s True Talisman for Protecting the World and Communicating with the Mysterious**
Inscribed in azure on purple silk, placed in the Wind Palace.

**Pacifying and Securing the Southwestern Culmen: The Dark Perfected Lady’s True Talisman for Protecting the World and Treasuring the Sovereign**
Inscribed in black on crimson silk, placed in the Earth Palace.

**Pacifying and Securing the Northwestern Culmen: The Heavenly Elder Emperor Lord’s True Talisman for Protecting the World and Securing the Nation**
Inscribed in white on black silk, placed in the Heaven Palace.

The above eight talismans are all transformed by the most refined qi of the Brahma realm,
naturally forming script. They pacify and secure the Eight Culmens of Heaven and Earth,
transforming disaster into fortune, ensuring the Emperor’s ten thousand years of reverence.
If the people possess sincerity, they may take yellow silk, inscribe the eight talismans in cinnabar,
and wear them on their person to repel the myriad evils and thousand calamities.
When going out or returning, they need not avoid the Grand Year or the killing forces of directions and culmens.
When constructing or renovating dwellings, place the talismans in the eight culmens—
*origin, prosperity, advantage, and perseverance* will follow.

**Pacifying and Securing the Nation’s Destiny for Ten Thousand Years of Peace and the Five Fortunes Perfected Lord**
Twelve characters inscribed in yellow, placed on the central stone terrace.

The twelve characters of the Central Jade Scripture pacify and secure the nation’s destiny,
bringing fortune and longevity to the Emperor. On the terraces and gates of the myriad heavens’ Supreme Lords,
they are all inscribed.

Within a nation’s borders, if the four seasons are unbalanced and disasters and epidemics arise,
libations must be offered. The Heavenly Perfected unfurl the dew, the Five Directions’ true scriptures,
pacifying talismans, and mountain-water contracts are installed. Within seven days,
responses will surely be received, bringing fortune and auspicious omens.

The Primordial Beginning’s chaos, the Five Qi’s revolving light,
descending above and ascending below, jade liquid flows abundantly.
It coalesces into the Jade Capital, encircling and standing in the Eight Directions.
Golden qi generates hardness, divine winds surge and billow.
Vast through the nine kalpas, the Great One’s Jade Chamber,
the Dao as the mother of qi, the Dragon Han’s era of peace extended.
Through countless eons, within the primordial chaos,
above, no realm of form; below, no wheel of abysses.
Golden grains moisten and nourish, the myriad dragons lie hidden—
within, a great spirit, its body like a jade serpent.
Roaring for ten thousand fathoms, spewing thunder and spouting smoke,
its eyes are the sun and moon, its blood and fluids are springs.
Vast waves in the distant darkness, the hundred rivers of the sea,
clouds congeal and qi surges, the jade radiance becomes the sky.
Above Heaven and below Heaven, no darkness nor obscurity,
no form nor shadow, no limit nor end.
The vast Brahma of the primordial flood, boundless and without light—
the Crimson Clarity unfolds its chart, the movements of destiny are natural.
The Primordial Beginning pacifies and secures, spreading the numinous perfected,
the Eight Culmens’ divine net, the constellations and stars intertwined.
The spirit officials are commanded, the dragon lords are assigned domains,
the celestial and terrestrial killings, the Eight Culmen great spirits.
The twelve officials divide above Qian and below Kun,
the Dao’s qi like a cord, threading pearls and binding tassels.
The divine talismans inscribed in red repel and expel demonic vapors,
preserving and controlling the kalpa’s fate, ensuring Heaven’s eternal existence.
The Brahma qi pervades the net of the universe, the myriad patterns unfold,
the primordial net flows and evolves, the thirty-two heavens.

The Wheel revolves without form, circling the Eight Culmens,
spinning the Dipper past the Winnowing Basket, the six qi entwined.
Thirty-five divisions govern the Celestial Pass,
victory and submission, encroachment and offense, movement and stillness, change and shift.
Within the Culmens, spirits guard, protecting the world without fault,
nurturing good and extinguishing evil, stabilizing the records of the Three Heavens.
The Eight Radiant Ones merge in darkness, qi enters the profound mystery,
within the mystery, the Supreme August One, the Highest Perfected.
The Eight Radiant Ones suffuse the Culmens, exorcising and pacifying all peace,
the Golden Perfected gleam resplendent, their echoes flowing through the cloud camps.
The Jade Tone gathers qi, the numinous wind assembles mist,
the Purple Void flourishes in elegance, aiding and sheltering the myriad immortals.
Dew scripts plant talismans, blessing the imperial throne,
water ascends and fire descends, naturally attaining perfection.
Within the perfected dwells the spirit, the Great Lord of Longevity,
the Peerless Duke, the Venerable White Prime.
The Great One controls destiny, ensuring health and harmony,
within the Eight Culmens, each has its revered spirit.
Together they safeguard the imperial plan, protecting the gates of the Emperor,
grasping talismans and holding registers, preserving the state and saving the people.
Above, they roam the Upper Clarity, entering and exiting the Flowery Chambers,
within the Eight Culmens, even in the most minute.
Below, they pacify the hundred spirits, the Crimson Palace at the center,
circulating the five qi, harmonizing the myriad spirits.
Ten revolutions complete the numinous, the ten thousand qi unite in perfection,
the true Dao treasures life, immeasurably delivering beings.
Above, the Eight Passes open, the directions of the Eight Culmens,
sin and fortune, prohibitions and precepts, karmic causes and conditions.
Universally receiving liberation, the dead souls gain new bodies,
the Nine Lands are pacified, qi descends upon the various heavens.
Above the various heavens, the Eight Dao numinous scripts,
within them, the Hollow Cavern, the hymns of chants.
The Perfected King’s numinous chapters, their verses matching the Highest Perfected.

**First: The Clear and Peaceful Culmen Domain of the Desire Realm, the Flying Void’s Melody**
The Dao transforms one form, yin and yang divide in two.
Above heaven and below heaven, jade chambers and palaces of nephrite.
Twelve divine camps, the Eight Culmens and four gates.
Water and fire, metal and wood, cold and heat mutually dependent.
The harmonizing qi brings balance, punishment and restraint both exist.
Following brings auspicious virtue, opposing becomes the root of misfortune.
The Eight Culmens of heaven and earth, where reliance and submission reside.
Resplendent vermilion talismans sweep away demonic villains.
Preserving virtue always brings fortune, revealing carelessness always brings calamity.
The Highest Numinous Cloud Sovereign, the green chariot arrives in the purple void.
I only wish the Dharma flourishes, life’s essence far and inexhaustible.
Dragon scripts spread through the Eight Culmens, dispelling the ancestral source of misfortune.
Do not allow the severing of the upright qi, preserving and extending the world’s prosperous fate.
Soaring through the void, reciting the Cavern Mystery, to gather the power of support.
Binding and sending off dark and evil spirits, severing the blades of demonic hordes.
Pacifying and securing for eternity, the sagely blessings daily flourish.

**Second: The Eight Culmen Felicitous Protection Chapter of the Form Realm**
The Jade Capital’s myriad spirits govern the Eight Directions.
The Round Net pervades the Hollow Void, the Great Brahma circulates.
Transformations vast and boundless, spreading across billions and thousands.
The Flying Mystery becomes script, wearing and serving the true numinous.
Severing baleful destinies, auspicious blessings link together.
Kan and Li clash fiercely, demonic qi swirls in chaos.
Where the divine talismans arrive, the numinous light abides in peace.
Fortune descends from the Purple Clarity, the workings of destiny are natural.
At this time, joyous! The grace of the Highest Emperor.
Exorcising demons and extinguishing misfortune, all living things harmonize in peace.
The Dao is hard to encounter, thus the Cavern Scripts manifest.
The wondrous patterns of the Flying Void merge with the Primordial Mystery.
The use of success and failure rests with you.
The protection and deliverance of all under heaven rely on this song’s melody.

**Third: The Pacifying Heavenly Fortune Hymn of the Formless Realm**
Azure clouds rise in towering layers, jade purity in the Round Net.
The Hollow Void is without form, illuminating the plain numinous waves.
Only the Primordial One, the spirit of chaos,
gives birth to heaven and earth, arranging the mysterious perfected.
The world divides into Eight Culmens, within them the Purple Void.
The Imperial Ultimate reigns as king, governing the myriad directions.
Flying spirits transform in myriad ways, the Dharma Dao is true and constant.
Vermilion scripts radiant and splendid, subduing demons and summoning auspiciousness.
Spreading and extending numinous transformations, all things are at peace.
The bestower of fortune is the heart, truly not dependent on others.
The heart connects with wondrous intent, the three qi congeal into splendor.
The nation’s blessings thereby secure, teachings and transformations differ not.
The myriad spirits enjoy the celebration, the numinous youths strike drums and bells.
Above these Three Realms, within the Flying Void,
the flying immortals’ song melodies, their sounds matching the Cavern Chapters.
Reciting them a hundred times, the name enters the Southern Palace.
Reciting them a thousand times, the Demon Kings protect and welcome.
Ten thousand recitations complete the Dao, ascending to the Great Void,
passing beyond the Three Realms, attaining the rank of Immortal Duke.
Those who hear the numinous melody, the Demon Kings show reverence,
commanding and restraining the earthly deities, serving and guarding the Sagely Lord.
The Eight Strings are at peace, forever free from calamity and disaster.
Ancestors ascend and advance, roaming and feasting in the Jade Heaven.
Joy without end, delighting in the kalpa’s years.
This is called the immeasurable, preserving and delivering without limit.

There are secret celestial scripts, revered by all heavens,
revealing carelessness casts one into hell, misfortune extending to seven generations of ancestors.
The Dao states: These two chapters are the hidden melodies of the Celestial Emperors
and the Numinous Perfected Kings, all words of the Great Brahma,
not the common speech of the world.
Their words lack ornate beauty, their tunes lack florid elegance,
thus they are called profound and obscure, difficult to fathom in detail.
The heavens treasure them, secreted in the Purple Tenuity’s Upper Palace of the Mysterious Capital,
transmitted once every forty thousand kalpas according to the Mysterious Regulations.
If there is a perfected person who offers gold and treasures with a sincere heart,
following the old statutes to pledge alliance with the Ten Heavens, only then are they bestowed.

The Dao states: When the revolutions of heaven and earth reach their end,
the sun, moon, and five stars wane and wax,
the most sagely and divine persons prosper or decline,
the ill and afflicted among the lesser learned,
extending to national borders with floods and droughts,
the people and creatures suffering from epidemics,
within the divisions of the Eight Culmens, various calamities and anomalies arise.
Those of the same qi and lofty scholars should all unite in heart to perform purification rites,
burn incense in the six periods, recite the scriptures eight times,
offer libations to the Celestial Perfected, distribute talismans to the Eight Culmens,
place the twelve jade characters at the center,
diligently and earnestly pray—
blessings and virtue will immediately descend,
dispelling all inauspiciousness.
The immeasurable script universally delivers without limit.

The Dao states: When governance and transformation are incomplete,
morality and virtue not yet fulfilled,
affairs require broad implementation,
the unfolding of mysterious merit—
one should select the most learned and perfected persons
to burn incense and recite the scriptures.

Then the Eight Culmens of Heaven and Earth shall universally attain peace and stability, the imperial destiny shall prosper and flourish, and people shall be free from harm and malevolence. The true and upright divine spirits, with all things enveloped in virtue, receive life and imbibe numinous power, while stagnant ghosts and lingering spirits are purged. The deliverance of form and soul shall proceed directly to the Southern Palace. According to the merit of one’s study and practice, rebirth is attained by the reckoning of days. With the Wheel of Dao turning ceaselessly, one thereby achieves immortality as a divine transcendent.

The Dao states: When the revolutions of Heaven and Earth reach their end, the stellar lodges fall into disorder, the sun and moon lose their proper times of rising and setting, the four seasons deviate from their courses, yin and yang fall out of harmony, and the realm suffers calamities—floods, fires, warfare, banditry, epidemics, and poisons spread—causing the multitudes to perish and masters and disciples to meet untimely deaths. All these are the result of the punitive qi of the Eight Culmens inflicting their influence. In such times, one must distribute talismans, perform purification rites according to the proper methods, burn incense, and recite the scriptures. For the merit of purification rites and scripture recitation is most weighty: above, it dissolves celestial disasters and safeguards the emperor; below, it wards off poisonous harms and delivers the multitudes. Both the living and the dead depend upon it, its blessings immeasurable. Thus it is called "immeasurable," universally delivering gods and humans alike.

The Dao states: Whoever possesses this scripture and performs these meritorious deeds for the sake of Heaven, Earth, the sovereign, and the multitudes—on days of calamity, should one resolve to perform purification rites, burn incense, recite the scriptures, offer libations to the Eight Culmens, distribute talismans, and employ the proper methods, reciting the scriptures eight times—then all the heavens shall record their names, and the myriad spirits shall attend and protect them. Those of exceptional attainment shall become ministers of the Golden Gates of the Sage Lord, with the heavens meticulously recording their merits and demerits, not a hair’s breadth amiss. The True Kings of Heaven shall also safeguard and commend their persons. Those who attain the Dao shall thereby thoroughly comprehend the most profound teachings.

Composed by the Lord of the Immeasurable Sound of the Great Brahma Hidden Language in the Heavens
*The Jade Chapters of the Numinous Scripture of the Primordial Beginning for Pacifying the Imperial Destiny in the Eastern Eight Heavens*

The Caverns resound with the roar of the Great Turtle, discerning harmony in the scattered remnants.
Teachings ascend and drift, transcending the flourishing seals.
Radiant tablets stream forth, their axles set in motion; jade-like patterns are inscribed upon the catalpa.
Exquisite strokes descend with precision, their inception glowing and boundless.
Lush diagrams trace the ancestral origins, profound and robust in their density.
Pipes of catalpa and ochre rings align in harmonious accord.
Resplendent bells resound in distant reaches, the Dao’s jade and verdant perfection.
Veiled membranes drift like silk, distant peaks contend in their inscriptions.

**Southern Eight Heavens**
The Reclusive Pool establishes repose, its brilliance steadfast and questioning.
Vast mysteries guide the primal, thunderous expanses embrace the honored guests.
Indulgence gathers in spheres of grace, celestial crystals mark the lineage of the sun.
Cries echo in lofty confinement, tiny seals ripple in profound reverence.
Carved rhinoceros and twisted cords, discourses surveil the demonic paths.
Majestic maidens stir the threads, repeatedly dissolving in the saline marshes.
Immortal Xiao ascends the capital, inscribed pacts resound with Confucian clarity.
Day merges with the porcine depths, chaos swirls within the cavernous abyss.

**Western Eight Heavens**
Reverence converges with Peng, bending to observe the scribe Geng.
Forbearance and profit incline toward retreat, the obscure flourishes with martial spirits.
Jade and silk accumulate in the earth, their unique countenances draped in sashes.
Excessive splendor severs the vast, infants leak into the abyssal brilliance.
Crowns and dwellings embrace the firmament, purity unfolds in the twilight’s balance.
Life’s threads weave joyous strands, encountering the turbid depths of the primordial abyss.
Profound elegance propels the flourishing, the solitary departs for distant springs.
Pathways bathe in overflowing patterns, scribes hasten toward the western immortals.

**Northern Eight Heavens**
The Hidden and Sturdy surge with keen edge, the sun’s brilliance graces the celestial countenance.
Spokes extend to distant traces, amassing the rhinoceros’ thunderous might.
Radiance blazes in subtle splendor, trailing orchids and hanging wisteria.
Nourishing harmony streams in banners, the void’s kalpas bear crimson fissures.
Coiling peaks bow to the summits, entangled wings trace their painted couriers.
Buttons gleam in distant mystery, true vastness proclaims the celestial expanse.
Vast and boundless, the dragon’s abode gleams with crystalline purity.
The Feng’s severance commands confinement, the northern flames consume the sacrificial Ding.

The Dao speaks: These are the Great Brahma’s hidden languages within the heavens, the sounds of the Immeasurable. The ancient script, wrought from five-colored divine metal, was forged into talismans to pacify and establish them above the Eight Culmens of Heaven and Earth. They regulate the cycles of destiny, harmonizing qi with the primordial harmony, upholding the imperial destiny, and ensuring the Dao’s eternal flourishing. Each character spans a full *zhang* in breadth, once inscribed by the Heavenly Perfected and August Ones to serve as the true sounds. Those who know these sounds and recite them with sincere devotion shall have the Eight Directional Divine Kings and the governors of the Eight Culmens descend to observe their persons, recording their merits and diligence. These shall be reported to the heavens, where the myriad spirits shall pay homage. Earthly deities shall attend their gates, and the great merits of true immortals shall be preserved. Those who are commended as Perfected Ones shall attain the Dao in full, roaming the Three Realms and ascending through the Golden Gates. These sounds repel all, exorcise all, deliver all, and accomplish all—such are the spontaneous sounds of the Heavenly Perfected. Thus, their recitation summons the Eight Perfected to descend in observation, the Celestial Thearch to chant from afar, the myriad spirits to pay homage, the Three Realms to attend in reverence, and all malevolent forces to bow their heads. As demonic essences perish of themselves, the jade-like resonance reverberates, the ten directions grow solemn and clear, rivers and seas fall silent, mountains and peaks swallow their mists. The myriad spirits tremble and submit, gathering the host of immortals. The heavens are free of impurity, the earth devoid of demonic dust. Profound wisdom illumines the purest clarity, and the vastness of the Dao abides in the most profound mystery.

*The Primordial Treasure’s Measureless Upper Chapter of the Wondrous Scripture for the Salvation of Humanity, Scroll the Third Concludes*
*Scroll the Fourth*

**The Chapter on Eternally Extending the Kalpic Destiny to Preserve the World and Ascend in Peace**

The Dao spoke: In ancient times, within the August Numinous Heaven, amidst the wondrous transformations of the soaring tones of the Great Li Paradise, the *Primordial Beginning’s Scripture for Eternally Extending the Kalpic Destiny to Preserve the World and Ascend in Unlimited Supreme Peace* was received. When the Celestial Venerable of Primordial Beginning expounded this scripture, he circumambulated ten times to summon the ten directions. Then, the celestial perfected, the great spirits, the exalted sages, and the perfected of wondrous conduct—an innumerable host—rode the void to arrive. Auspicious radiance suffused the air, numinous incense soared through the heavens, dragon-drawn chariots and purple canopies interlaced in mutual reflection, while streaming auroras blazed with splendor, illuminating the myriad heavens.

For nine days and nine nights, the floating canopies of the various heavens arrayed themselves in perfect order. The pivot of the Dipper halted its motion, the two luminaries merged their light, the eight extremities were swept clear, and all became serene and limpid. Throughout the land, mountains and forests, rivers and marshes, deep pools and thickets—all grew lush and verdant, blossoming in brilliance. The earth transformed into yielding jade, its luminous glow congealing in fresh purity, without a trace of discordant hue.

The host of perfected attended in reverence as the Celestial Venerable of Primordial Beginning, in profound repose, sat upon the Nine-Colored Dark Dragon Treasure Throne in the Great Void. When the scripture was recited once, the great sages of the various heavens simultaneously voiced their approval, and all beings and people fulfilled their natures. When recited twice, no pestilence afflicted creatures, and the people were freed from care and anxiety. When recited thrice, people dwelled in harmony with transformation, without contention or desire. When recited four times, the age was called abundant and joyous, and none knew calamity or misfortune. When recited five times, the myriad regions submitted in compliance, and distant and near lands shared the same wind. When recited six times, winged and scaled creatures, those born from wombs and eggs, each preserved their generation and growth. When recited seven times, qilin and phoenix arrived in proper form, and heaven and earth responded with auspicious signs. When recited eight times, supreme virtue flourished in harmony, and people and creatures returned to simplicity. When recited nine times, the lords of states and kings and marquises eternally preserved their dynastic succession. When recited ten times, all under heaven universally realized the wondrousness of the Dao.

At that time, every man and woman in the land turned their hearts in devotion. All received protection and deliverance, and each attained longevity.

The Dao spoke: At that time,

When the Primordial Heavenly Worthy recited the sutra once, the boundless and measureless ranks of Perpetual Epoch-Preserving Perfected Great Spirits of the Eastern Direction, their numberless hosts, arrived floating through the void. When recited twice, those of the Southern Direction, their numberless hosts, arrived floating through the void. When recited thrice, those of the Western Direction, their numberless hosts, arrived floating through the void. When recited four times, those of the Northern Direction, their numberless hosts, arrived floating through the void. When recited five times, those of the Northeastern Direction, their numberless hosts, arrived floating through the void. When recited six times, those of the Southeastern Direction, their numberless hosts, arrived floating through the void. When recited seven times, those of the Southwestern Direction, their numberless hosts, arrived floating through the void. When recited eight times, those of the Northwestern Direction, their numberless hosts, arrived floating through the void. When recited nine times, those of the Upper Direction, their numberless hosts, arrived floating through the void. When recited ten times, those of the Lower Direction, their numberless hosts, arrived floating through the void.

When the ten recitations were complete, the boundless Perfected Great Spirits of the Ten Directions arrived all at once. Every man and woman in the land turned their hearts in devotion, and those who came numbered in the tens of millions, filling every region. All rejoiced in their aspirations, coming before the Heavenly Worthy to behold and hear the supreme Dharma, to penetrate its wondrous emptiness. The kalpas stretched long, preserving the world in peace; the myriad states took refuge, and heaven and humanity were in harmony. The numberless hosts pressed upon the land until half the earth sank beneath them, an irresistible force.

Thereupon, the Primordial One composed his gaze and gathered his spirit, emitting wondrous qi that coalesced into a radiant orb, vast as the red sun, suspended in the dark void nine *zhang* above the earth. The Primordial One ascended and led the Perfected Great Spirits, the exalted sages, the lofty Worthies, the Perfected of Wondrous Conduct, and the boundless Perfected Great Spirits of the Ten Directions, their numberless hosts, all into the radiant orb. Heavenly beings gazed upward, seeing only a shimmering light into which they entered. Once within the orb, their whereabouts were unknown, and the people of the land dispersed, the earth restored to levelness, no longer sunken.

Within the radiant orb, the Primordial One completed the recitation of the sutra in full. The assembled Perfected oversaw the transmission, bestowing it upon me. At that time, the kalpas were extended, the world preserved in peace, and boundless blessings and virtue prevailed. The Dao was spontaneous, all things flourished in joy, and the celebration was beyond words. When the Dharma rites were roughly concluded, the hosts of heaven returned to their stations in the space between breaths, leaving no lingering echo.

At that time, the heavenly beings who encountered the sutra universally attained deliverance, preserving their allotted years without harm. The entire land turned in devotion, all attuning to the great Dao. There was no premature death, no obstacles, no suffering, no calamity, no strife, no disturbance, no evil, no perversity, no bias, no faction. Minds were free of greed, hearts free of resentment and hatred. All shared in loving-kindness, and even those of different lineages became kin. The states were secure, the people prosperous, and all rejoiced in great peace.

When the sutra first emerged as teaching, those in the land who had cultivated utmost sincerity, revered and honored it, and perpetually extended the kalpas. The Dao spoke: What the Primordial Heavenly Worthy recited in the sutra are the inner names of the Heavenly Thearchs, the hidden rhymes of sound, as well as the inner taboos of demon kings and the concealed names of the hundred spirits. All are the divine mechanisms of the supreme Dao, the secret script of heaven and earth. They can perpetually extend the great and small kalpas, preserve the world in peace, grant the emperor ten thousand generations, and ensure the flourishing of all people and creatures. These are not ordinary words of the world.

The exalted sages who have already attained perfection, the Perfected who have penetrated the mysteries and fathomed the subtle, can fully grasp its verses. Reciting it ten times harmonizes heaven and earth, ensures the kalpas proceed without error, dissolves the three disasters, stabilizes the five qi, and brings all auspicious signs. The imperial lineage endures in prosperity. For scholars of the highest learning who recite it ten times, their bodies become eternally firm, their lifespans extended, preserving the world for countless ages. They summon the Perfected and attain immortality, delivering the dying and reviving the deceased.

The reason for this is that scholars’ Dao-qi is not yet pure, and their bodies have not merged with the numinous. They cannot summon and command the Ten Directions, nor wield authority over heaven. Their virtue can only subdue earthly spirits, extending deliverance from disasters and decline. They may only avert death, not restore life. To recite this chapter lightly brings calamity upon oneself. To honor and revere it brings prosperity to one’s household, flourishing through the generations, forming good karmic connections. Ten thousand disasters will not touch them, and divine beings will guard their gates.

This sutra is supremely wondrous, unmatched in the Jade Capital. It preserves and extends boundlessly, serving as the root of the myriad Dao. Its majestic model is of virtue beyond measure. The Dao spoke: For those who recite this sutra ten times, all the heavens arrive together, extending wondrous qi to restrain water and subdue fire, preventing their encroachment. The kalpas are perpetually extended, free from temporal disasters, eternally preserving peace.

For all who study this supreme sutra, when their merit is complete and their virtue perfected, they can safeguard and bring about the utmost governance, rejoicing in abundant years. Scholars of the highest learning who cultivate and recite this sutra externally protect the Six Directions and internally preserve their own bodies. Inner and outer follow the same principle, both attaining perpetual extension. Great and small receive blessings, and both the hidden and the manifest are enveloped in grace. This sutra is subtly wondrous, its protection and preservation inexhaustible. All heavenly beings receive its blessings, boundless fortune bestowed across ten thousand kalpas.

This sutra is treasured by heaven and not transmitted to the lower world. Only the most worthy, offering gold and treasures with sincere hearts, may transmit it after swearing an oath to heaven. To leak or slight it lightly brings calamity upon nine generations, condemning them to long servitude under the ghost officials. Five Emperors attend the sutra, along with twenty-four Jade Lads and twenty-four Jade Maidens, who safeguard the divine script and protect the bodies of those who receive the sutra.

The Dao speaks: In the first month, observe a prolonged fast and recite this sutra, and across ten thousand kalpas and countless assemblies, the transformative power of the Dao shall endure eternally. In the seventh month, observe a prolonged fast and recite this sutra, dispelling discord and misfortune while summoning supreme blessings and auspiciousness. In the tenth month, observe a prolonged fast and recite this sutra, and for kings, emperors, lords, ministers, fathers, and sons, it shall stabilize the nation’s destiny, safeguard the celestial mandate, and ensure the throne endures unbroken through generations, ever ruling as sovereigns, securing their realms, and bringing the people to proclaim great peace.

On the eight seasonal festivals, recite this sutra to perpetually extend the kalpic cycle and preserve worldly peace. Those who embody the Dao and receive its virtue shall ascend with their ancestors, attaining the rank of the Nine Palaces and becoming Perfected of the Three Heavens. On the days of parting and reunion, recite this sutra to universally deliver all living beings, granting them fortune and longevity, forever dispelling strife and discord, bringing universal harmony and tranquility. The myriad spirits shall guard and protect, the Five Emperors shall oversee, and boundless blessings shall extend across infinite ages.

The Dao speaks: On the days of practicing the Dao, one must bathe in fragrant waters, observe purification rites, enter the chamber, face east, and knock the teeth thirty-two times to ascend to the Thirty-Two Heavens. Bow in reverence thirty-two times, close the eyes, and meditate upon the body seated amidst clouds of blue, yellow, and white qi, both within and without shrouded in mist. There shall appear the Azure Dragon, White Tiger, Vermilion Bird, Black Tortoise, Lion, and White Crane arrayed to the left and right, the sun and moon illuminating the chamber with radiant brilliance. A circular halo shall emerge from the crown of the head, its light suffusing the ten directions—all this must be visualized with perfect clarity.

Recite the secret incantation:
*"Supreme Mysterious Origin, Most High Dao Lord, summon forth from within this servant’s body the Three and Five Merit Officers, the Attendant Envoys of the Left and Right, the Jade Lads who tend the incense, the Jade Maidens who transmit words, the Direct Attendants of the Five Emperors, and the Incense Officials of the Day—thirty-two each—to convey these words. On this auspicious day, in a purified hall during a prolonged fast, practicing the supreme sutra to deliver boundless beings, may these entreaties ascend directly to the august presence of the Most High Primordial Sovereign of the Thirty-Two Heavens."*

Upon completion, draw in qi thirty-two times and face east to recite the sutra.

*The Primordial’s Wondrous Scripture of the Upper Chapters of the Numinous Treasure, the Supreme Scripture for Delivering Innumerable Beings*

The Primordial’s Scripture of Boundless Deliverance, the Uppermost Wondrous Scripture:
Ten cycles deliver beings, the hundred spirits conceal their rhymes; parting and reunion arise naturally, wondrously transforming into Jade Perfected. The lofty and mysterious upper spirits nurture the primordial qi, coalescing the myriad heavens, revealing luminous radiance, and harmonizing yin and yang. As yin and yang transform, the Five Phases advance; cold and heat alternate, and the myriad transformations come into being. The vast and obscure great pattern encompasses all wondrous numbers, cyclically distributing prosperity and decline, each with its ultimate limit.

The ninety-six cycles of yang, when water and fire clash, are called kalpic disasters, wherein creation is wholly undone. When the great kalpa converges, water and fire scour and burn, heaven and earth perish in darkness, and only the Dao endures alone. The Primordial stabilizes and guards, the upper chapters of the Jade Scripture, commanding the numinous destinies of all Perfected and inspecting the various heavens. The stellar lodges divide their degrees, their movements flawless, summoning dragons to bear and block the river sources. The Eastern Well remains unshaken, rivers and seas still their depths; the world is upheld, each with its true spirits.

The sovereigns who guard the world, the exalted ones of great peace, the Five Numinous Elders, the Three Qi Venerables—among them are the Ten Directions’ Great Saints who protect the nation, the Perfected Lords who eternally restrain kalpic disasters and deliver from calamity, who reverse misfortune and disperse woe, preserving the world’s purity. Today, they proclaim this decree as the various heavens descend in attendance.

The Boundless Flying Heavenly Kings Who Preserve the Kalpic Cycle and Extend the World’s Destiny:
- Of the East: the Long-Lived Great Sage Who Delivers Innumerable Beings
- Of the South: the Long-Lived Great Sage Who Delivers Innumerable Beings
- Of the West: the Long-Lived Great Sage Who Delivers Innumerable Beings
- Of the North: the Long-Lived Great Sage Who Delivers Innumerable Beings
- Of the Northeast: the Long-Lived Great Sage Who Delivers Innumerable Beings
- Of the Southeast: the Long-Lived Great Sage Who Delivers Innumerable Beings
- Of the Southwest: the Long-Lived Great Sage Who Delivers Innumerable Beings
- Of the Northwest: the Long-Lived Great Sage Who Delivers Innumerable Beings
- Of the Above: the Long-Lived Great Sage Who Delivers Innumerable Beings
- Of the Below: the Long-Lived Great Sage Who Delivers Innumerable Beings

The Ten Directions’ Perfected Flying Heavenly Kings eternally extend the kalpic cycle, preserving worldly peace, the boundless great spirits. Together, they ride upon auspicious clouds of numinous radiance, jade chariots adorned with emerald canopies and flowered wheels, drawn by jade dragons, attended by guardians who repel evil. They bear the purple-tasseled standards, cloud-brocade divine banners; before them, phoenixes sing in harmonious melodies, behind them, flutes and panpipes blend in chorus. All under heaven rejoice, none fail to exult.

Jade Lads scatter incense, Jade Maidens flank the chariots; the Great Generals Who Pacify Heaven, clad in red armor with ten thousand soldiers, advance together under unified command, escorting the exalted Perfected to deliver from kalpic disasters and extinguish demonic influences. The Orthodox Officers of the Three Origins, the Upper Spirits of the Nine Heavens, the Elders Who Govern Transformations, and the Great Spirits Who Stabilize and Guard—inspecting the cycles of destiny, they memorialize before the Emperor. Where yin and yang stagnate, they respond and resolve; turning the great pivot, they regulate the numinous gates, harmonizing the cycles of adversity.

Water and fire flow and spread, creation arises naturally; surpassing peril, they bring tranquility, cutting off the roots of disaster. Malevolence is annihilated, myriad blessings converge; no discord is permitted, no misfortune invited. The Numinous Treasure’s Jade Script stabilizes and extends the kalpa, bringing peace to rulers and people, enduring for infinite kalpas. Heaven and earth are serene, sun and moon unite in brightness; insects fulfill their natures, and the supreme transformation knows no bounds. The divine Perfected assist in harmony, the world’s destiny endures; their virtue equaling the Dao, their merit returns to the myriad heavens. Transcending the three disasters, their fortune and prosperity remain pure and complete.

The myriad beings abide in non-action, roaming carefree in Great Peace. The mechanism of Great Peace encompasses the Supreme Mystery, the formless realm of Brahman conduct.

**The Eight Heavens of the East:**
Righteous Brightness and Illumination Heaven, ruled by Emperor Shu Shiyan Xi.
Grand Wisdom and Cloudlight Heaven, ruled by Emperor Miao Ding Wuyan.
Prosperous Mechanism and Wandering Mystery Heaven, ruled by Emperor Zhao Chu Zi Cheng.
Luminous Thought and Primordial Elevation Heaven, ruled by Emperor Zhuang Hua Yong’en.
Mysterious Chapter and Transformative Brahman Heaven, ruled by Emperor Wu Ji Ruan Jian.
Elegant Motion and Rare Sound Heaven, ruled by Emperor Yang Yu Li Sheng.
Deliverance and Salvation of Spirits Heaven, ruled by Emperor Bian Hun Chi Lei.
Encompassing Void and Emptiness Heaven, ruled by Emperor Yun Liang Zao Mi.

**The Eight Heavens of the South:**
Vermilion Sea and Radiant Concealment Heaven, ruled by Emperor Hao Sai Chong Tu.
Jade Gate and Jade Companions Heaven, ruled by Emperor Ji Qin Dong You.
Auspicious Rectitude and Capital Talisman Heaven, ruled by Emperor Jin Gou Yi Ze.
Six Constants and Guest Assembly Heaven, ruled by Emperor Jiu Fang Zhen Tong.
Summoning Shame and Reversal Heaven, ruled by Emperor Bao Ji Ding Ming.
Mighty Spirits and Commanding Orders Heaven, ruled by Emperor Peng Gang Fei Xiao.
Embracing Sun and Celebrating Union Heaven, ruled by Emperor Que Sheng Ding Fu.
Measuring Vastness and Literary Splendor Heaven, ruled by Emperor Se Na Dong.

**The Eight Heavens of the West:**
Scrutinizing Wrongs and Upholding Law Heaven, ruled by Emperor Chong Si Qin Ling.
Numerous Records and Net of Lords Heaven, ruled by Emperor Zhan □ Dou Bing.
Paper Shepherd and Wondrous Vision Heaven, ruled by Emperor Lou Du Nei Zhen.
Heavenly Stability and Daoist Constancy Heaven, ruled by Emperor Le Ming Bao Xian.
Dragon Net and Towering Support Heaven, ruled by Emperor Piao Cu Wei Yi.
Awaiting Constellations and Pushing Radiance Heaven, ruled by Emperor Da Wei Liang Zong.
Dao’s Perfection and Jade Brush Heaven, ruled by Emperor Qi Ming Ju Tang.
Upper Void and Treasure Possession Heaven, ruled by Emperor Qu Ze Hui Fang.

**The Eight Heavens of the North:**
Abyssal Depths and Overflowing Life Heaven, ruled by Emperor Guang Hou Wu Xi.
Dark Reversal and Faint Traces Heaven, ruled by Emperor Wei Jian Bian Xiang.
Feathered Display and Basket Weaving Heaven, ruled by Emperor Ju Men Yun Mang.
Abyssal Spirit and Wavelike Primordial Heaven, ruled by Emperor Tu Rong Geng Qu.
Distant Subtlety and Severed Extremes Heaven, ruled by Emperor Jian Bo Zhen Mou.
Cauldron’s Glow and Summoning Qi Heaven, ruled by Emperor Lü Wu Gou Gui.
Measuring Wells and Defiant Darkness Heaven, ruled by Emperor Zhuo Han Lian.
Subtle Mystery and Kun Stability Heaven, ruled by Emperor Dao Yan Zhong Huang.

The Thirty-Two Heavens, the Thirty-Two Emperors—each heaven conceals its taboos, each heaven veils its names. Within the heavens lies the Hollow Cavern, the natural numinous scripture; each heaven conceals its rhymes, the sounds within the heavens, the honor within the heavens, the spirits within the heavens. Extending kalpas and great demons are the numina within the heavens. Harmonizing the imperial qi, they govern the transformations of the Supreme Clarity, the boundless mysteries too profound to fathom. Spreading the teachings of the Divine Empyrean, they safeguard for endless ages.

Today, rejoicing in the reception of deliverance, passing through the gates of all heavens, they govern the kalpic transformations and preserve worldly peace. Opening and extending the records of eras, the qi’s movement knows no error; uniting with the Great One, they revolve and deliver the Five Phases. Jupiter guards life, Venus presides over completion. Mercury conceals and nurtures, Mars spreads glory. Saturn serves as the central sovereign, the August One circulates throughout. The Azure Spirit stabilizes benevolence, the Radiant Spirit assists righteousness. The Cinnabar Spirit praises ritual, the Mysterious Spirit guards wisdom. The Central Primordial Elder expands and diffuses the harmonizing qi.

The Great Spirit of the Eastern August, sweeping away the demonic influences of wood.
The Perfected of the South, pacifying calamities to their utmost.
The White Emperor Great Spirit, dissolving the weapons of metal.
The Primordial Crystal Great Spirit, uniting and harmonizing virtue.
The Central August Great Spirit, governing the talismanic numina.

The gods of the ten directions and myriad realms, the spirits of all Daoist paths, wielding bells and brandishing halberds, sternly guard in countless thousands. Drumming the net of transformations, they summon and command the divine Perfected. Through kalpas of heaven and earth, they preserve and stabilize without faltering. The Twenty-Eight Constellations resist the four celestial courses; the Central Dipper faces and directs, averting misfortune and opening life. The four seasons revolve in order, cold and heat cycle in turn. Yin and yang alternate, and no monstrous aberrations dare intrude.

When the great kalpa reaches its term, they repel and dispel the thronging disasters. The Five Rivers’ sovereigns, the vast and numinous spirits of the deep, hasten to record and inspect, clearing the watery passages. By the Primordial Beginning’s talismanic decree, none dare delay or linger; they are seized and sent to the Upper Palace, where those condemned are utterly annihilated. Treachery and malevolence lose their qi, demonic chaos is eradicated at its root. The world receives great fortune, the Dao’s transformations become limpid and clear. Eternal blessings and prosperity abound, benevolence and goodness flourish. Universally advancing all wondrous beings, they ascend together to the Upper Palace. Following and upholding the celestial reckoning, they array their reports in the highest heavens.

The Primordial Beginning’s Great Brahman, propelled by the Three Qi, divides and judges the Two Images, establishing the myriad heavens. Spirits and numina spread throughout, creation arises and takes form. In nurturing and fostering, the Five Qi flow; the Six Qi alternate, flourishing and decaying in succession. When the qi’s movement is obstructed, the great kalpa entangles. Destiny has its appointed meetings, bringing disasters of water, fire, and wind. Splendor collapses and perishes, living spirits are extinguished at their root. The deep abysses are desolate, the Three Luminaries conceal their radiance. Good and evil are indistinguishable, misfortune and calamity rush forth.

The Primordial Beginning stabilizes and pacifies, and fortune and virtue arise naturally. The Numinous Scriptures and Great Strategies, the precious records of the Upper Chapters, hasten to summon all heavens and the great gods of the ten directions. Grasping the Mysterious Chart, they endure without end. Encompassing the Dao’s qi, their wondrous efficacy opens and connects. The divine net’s warp and weft, the kalpic turning of the Dharma Wheel, pivot and govern creation, eternally preserving the primordial integrity.

The numinous winds stir and fan, bringing peace to the eight directions. Harmonious qi surges and merges, all auspicious signs converge. Spreading and proclaiming heavenly governance, they present reports to the Supreme Perfected. Within the Perfected dwell the spirits, the Great Lords of Longevity. The Divine Empyrean’s Later Sage, the Azure Flower Emperor Lord. The Eastern Ultimate and Western Terrace, the left and right immortal ministers. Holding talismans and determining decrees, they preserve the subtle and tranquil. Mighty and luminous generals and officers sweep away all wrongs. Above, they serve the Nine Heavens; below, they restrain the Three Disasters. The four quarters and eight regions unite in a single virtue.
