Filth and defilement are swept away, demons and pestilence are shattered and crushed.

For countless kalpas, wealth and joy abound in tranquility. No treachery is permitted, and the highest goodness renews daily. The loyal and good assist in transformation, uniting with the Dao in brilliance. The Dao treasures preservation and extension, the boundless ford of kalpas. All ghostly thieves are eradicated, wind and fire do not cease. The seas and lands are serene, heaven and earth vast and clear. Blessings reach the hidden depths, the stagnant and benighted ascend; sunken souls are extinguished and confronted, grievances and transgressions are released and resolved.

The pure transformation flows vast and boundless, lauded by all the heavens.
The great sages of the heavens all rejoice and speak in joy.
At its heart lies the "Empty Cavern Hymn and Song," the "Numinous Chapter of the Demon Kings,"
whose words ascend to the loftiest perfected ones.

The first is the "Eternal Melody of the Desire Realm’s Flight through the Void,"
where divine transformations expand in grandeur, and auspicious blessings flourish.
The perverse ways are extinguished, and felicitous omens arrive.
The Dao of Heaven shines brightly, dispelling all demonic mists.
The benevolent and good return to the highest virtue, while the treacherous and wicked plant the roots of evil.
Greed and attachment forget true preservation; the celestial scriptures are misapplied in errant conduct.
Do not let this become a flowering transgression—now is the time to safeguard great peace.
Malevolent demons delight in ruin and decay, harming and exhausting living spirits.
They disturb our realm of purity, their venomous grievances enduring without cease.
The August Jade-Pure King on High bestows upon us the sacred talismanic chapters,
to restrain and govern the long kalpas, ever receiving the supreme merit.

The true wind flows vast and boundless; the world’s fortunes daily rise and prosper.
The "Purple Clarity’s Blessing, the Eternal Talisman of the Cavern-Subtle Heavenly Worthy"
is the "Chapter of the Demon King of the Form Realm, Extending the Kalpa’s Fortune."

The primordial chaos embraces heaven and earth, its course ever-changing.
Yin and yang fall into disorder; calamities block the ford of kalpas.
Wherever the kalpa’s disasters strike, water and fire scour and burn.
The myriad phenomena and three luminaries vanish into darkness, no longer existing.
Yet by the grace of our host of spirits, peace is secured throughout the heavens.
We extend the great cycle, unraveling the roots of disaster.
We regulate the four qi, harmonizing cold and heat.
How could mortals know this and thus enjoy our favor?
Disasters and harms sink and cease; clarity and tranquility arise naturally.
At this time, joy abounds, and protection spans countless ages.
Radiant are all living beings, united as one in truth.
The Emperor’s sacred talismans descend upon mountains and rivers.
Lineages and altars stand serene; great peace is eternally preserved.
Auspicious responses arise from the primordial; our Dao remains eternally revered.
The "Eternal Talisman of the Heavenly Worthy of Myriad Blessings, Extender of Kalpas."

The "Hymn of the Demon King of the Formless Realm, Preserver of the World" says:
Above the Three Heavens, at the origin of the myriad phenomena,
the Primordial August One governs and commands, revered within our realm.
We command and restrain the spirits, safeguarding the roots of heaven.
The Three Disasters are transformed and swept away; the Eight Paths grow clear and bright.
The wheel of kalpas flows without obstruction, following the current of transformation.
We inspect the stellar constellations, each celestial station precisely divided.
By the Emperor’s talisman, we command and restrain the demonic hordes.
Should any dare act with treachery and violence, the sunlight will flare in wrath.
Great peace unfolds in transformation, securely established for eternity.
Ever receiving blessings and fortune, the future remains unshaken.
The mysterious pivot of creation governs from above, seizing the mechanisms of heaven.
If one knows not this Dao, how can they ascend the ladder to perfection?
Do not let the turning of the kalpa’s fortune allow the demonic hordes to unleash their might.
The "True Talisman of the Heavenly Worthy, Protector of the State and Preserver of the World."

These three talismans, cast in bronze or gold, are to be installed above the ruined gates and halls of palaces—most auspicious.
Those who study the Dao wear them upon their person to extend their years, avert disasters, and transcend calamities.
Inscribed in cinnabar on red paper, as prescribed by the rites.

Above these Three Realms, within the flight through the void,
are the hymns and chants of the true demons, their melodies harmonizing with the cavernous chapters.
Receiving them eternally extends the kalpa’s fortune; the imperial destiny flourishes.
Reciting them a hundred times dispels the disasters of the age.
Reciting them a thousand times ensures the demon kings guard the spirits.
After ten thousand recitations, the Dao is complete, and boundless ages of peace ascend.
They preserve and deliver through the kalpa’s transformations, toppling the myriad evils.
Those who hear these numinous melodies find the demon kings reverent in form.
We command the earthly deities, attended by divine spirits.
Ministers and people enjoy well-being, transcending misfortune and disaster.
Great blessings and fortune arrive without exception.
This is called the boundless, preserving and delivering without end.
These are the secret celestial texts, revered by all the heavens.
To leak or profane them is to fall into hell, bringing calamity upon seven generations of ancestors.

The Dao says: These two chapters are the hidden melodies of the Heavenly Emperors and the numinous demon kings,
all spoken in the great Brahma’s tongue, upholding the kalpa’s fortune, guarding the world and bestowing blessings,
summoning the perfected and drawing the divine, benefiting the people and pacifying the state.
Their words lack ornate rhythm; their tunes lack florid embellishment.
Thus they are called profound and obscure, difficult to fathom in detail.
They are treasured by the heavens, secreted within the Divine Empyrean’s Jade-Pure Jade Treasury,
the scriptorium’s resplendent halls, transmitted once every sixty thousand kalpas in accordance with the turning of the age.
Only if a perfected one offers the inner treasure of a sincere heart,
and follows the ancient rites to pledge allegiance to the Nine Heavens,
are they then entrusted with these texts.

The Dao says: The revolutions of heaven and earth also have their ends.
The sun, moon, and five planets also wax and wane.
The reckoning of kalpas and the fortunes of the age also shorten and extend.
Even the sagest and most divine of beings also have their flourishing and decline.
Those of shallow learning also suffer illness and harm.
Whenever such disasters arise, all of like mind should gather to perform the fast,
burn incense in the six periods, and recite the scriptures ten times.
Virtue and blessings will descend at once, dispelling all inauspicious omens.
These boundless texts universally deliver without end.

The Dao says: Those of shallow Daoist learning, whose immortal rank is yet unfulfilled,
whose destined time of extinction approaches, and whose bodily kalpa nears its end,
whose spirit passes through the Great Yin—
at the hour of their passing, fellow students and perfected ones should burn incense on their behalf
and recite the scriptures ten times to deliver their corporeal form,
following the method of the Five Refinements to animate the corpse.
Their hun-souls will then ascend directly to the Southern Palace,
where their names are recorded in the Heavenly Mechanism’s Mysterious Register.
According to the merit of their studies, they will be reborn after a calculated number of days.
Unconfused by the turning of the wheel, they will attain the rank of immortals.

The Dao says: When the revolutions of heaven and earth reach their end, one should perform the fast,
burn incense, and recite the scriptures.
When the stellar stations fall into disorder and the sun and moon lose their proper times,
one should perform the fast, burn incense, and recite the scriptures.
When the four seasons lose their proper order and yin and yang fall out of harmony,
one should perform the fast, burn incense, and recite the scriptures.
When great or small kalpas end, the Five Movements shift, and the age’s fortunes extend,
one should perform the fast, burn incense, and recite the scriptures.
When pestilence spreads and the multitudes perish,
one should perform the fast, burn incense, and recite the scriptures.
When the harvests fail,
one should perform the fast, burn incense, and recite the scriptures.

The merit of fasting, maintaining precepts, and reciting scriptures is most weighty.
Above, it dispels celestial disasters and secures the protection of the emperor.
Below, it wards off poison and harm, delivering the multitudes.
In life and death, all rely upon it; its blessings are beyond measure.
Thus it is called boundless, universally delivering heaven and humanity.

The Dao says: Whoever possesses these scriptures can perform these meritorious deeds
for the sake of the Lord of Heaven and Earth, the Emperor, and the multitudes.

When disasters arise, if one resolves in the heart to perform the fast, burn incense, and recite the scriptures ten times, all the heavens record their name, and ten thousand spirits stand guard. Those of exceptional attainment may thereby become ministers of the Golden Gates of the Sage Lord. The heavens record each person’s merits and transgressions with unfailing precision, down to the finest detail. Even the demon kings of heaven will protect and recommend them. Those who attain the Dao shall fully comprehend these profound words.

Within the heavens, the Great Brahma’s hidden speech resounds in boundless tones. The *Dao Lord* composed the *Primordial Numinous Writ of Everlasting Kalpas, the Jade Chapters for Protecting the World and Ensuring Great Peace*.

**The Eight Heavens of the East:**
Yu Luo stands lofty, transforming through mysterious workings.
Chronicles trace the threads of the world, moved by compassion in the Palace of Mercy.
Fortune aids the humble, dispelling deceit and desire.
The carriage warns of distant perils, awakening the dull and drawing the hook.
Prayers and sacrifices meet their needs, jade and stones gather in hidden depths.
Great patterns discern urgency, the prime minister’s records align with reason.
Offerings ascend to the sacred peaks, clouds part and the Dao is released.
Imperial chambers bestow domains, briefly setting aside admonitions.

**The Eight Heavens of the South:**
Bao and Shao store and divide, stars and tablets dawn in peace.
Divine voices are reverent, the Jiao Lord calls forth presence.
Deserts extend to distant halls, striking the spirit’s core with power.
The first flourishes in brilliance, lofty beginnings shine in prosperity.
Luminous talismans flow with the river’s plea, mountains and corpses mingle in the thicket.
Resentment and grievance spread like spokes, scrolls and whiteness pass through the gate.
Ascending youths illuminate the mind, essence extends inward in reflection.
Intent moves through divine divination, a moment’s vastness finds true leisure.

**The Eight Heavens of the West:**
Bright thoughts roam the land, bells and songs resound in purity.
Jade mounds drift in mist, uniting with the verdant maidens.
Vast emptiness conveys sincerity, dew and nectar bring secret joy.
Embracing the linked ruins, the Dark Mystery awakens in profound realization.
Chaos and crystal entwine in constancy, life’s desires shun solitude.
Fiery movement seizes fate, yet the kalpa’s void remains.
The root is secured in defense, the true and absolute diverge.
As one with the dragon’s beginning, the child’s womb shifts like illusion.

**The Dragon’s Womb shifts like illusion.**

**The Eight Heavens of the North:**
Endless light sways and moistens, foam congeals in the sinking sea.
Hills are drawn to emulate ridges, flows overflow and spread.
Sudden shadows scatter like images, rising and falling, submitting and vanquishing.
Falsehood claims what is not its own, chaos alone dissolves and ceases.
Life’s grace is named compassion, striking poison and banishing wrong.
Following the self, one receives blessings, heaven gathers and advances the subtle.
The distant cord is firmly bound, woven baskets peer into the distant.
Glory’s end brings no sorrow, taboos yield to revelation and bestowal.

The Dao says: Within these heavens, the Great Brahma’s hidden speech resounds in boundless tones. The ancient script was each a *zhang* in length, but the Heavenly Perfected inscribed its words upon cinnabar-jade tablets, establishing the correct pronunciation. These were displayed upon the terraces and gates, as well as in the halls of the Grand Tenuity and Purple Tenuity, to govern the great and small kalpas, the cycles of the world, and the disasters of water and fire, restoring harmony and dispelling misfortune.

Those who know these sounds and perform the fast while reciting them will have the heavens dispatch flying spirit-kings to descend and observe them, recording their meritorious diligence. This is reported to the heavens, where ten thousand spirits pay homage, earthly deities stand at the gates, and the Great Merit Realized Kings recommend them as perfected immortals. Once their Dao is complete, they may wander the Three Realms and ascend through the Golden Gates.

These sounds repel all, ward off all, deliver all, and accomplish all— they are the heavens’ spontaneous, natural tones. Thus, reciting them summons flying spirits to descend in observation, the Celestial Thearch chants from afar, ten thousand spirits pay homage, the Three Realms attend in reverence, all demons bow their heads, ghostly essences vanish of themselves, jade-like chimes resound, the ten directions grow solemn and clear, rivers and seas fall silent, mountains and peaks swallow their mists, all spirits tremble and submit, immortals gather in assembly, the heavens are free of impurity, the earth is cleansed of demonic dust, dark wisdom shines in clarity, and the vastness of the mysterious abides in profundity.

The *Supreme Wondrous Scripture of the Numinous Treasure, the Limitless Deliverance of Humanity*, Scroll Four, concludes.
Scroll Five begins.

**The Chapter on Dispelling Calamities and Warding Off Misfortunes for Lords, Kings, and Feudal Lords of the World**

The Dao spoke: In ancient times, within the tranquil and blessed heavens, at the Great Realm of Peace and Splendor, the Jade Radiance of Serene Florescence, the *Primordial Beginning’s Scripture on the Limitless Deliverance of Humanity: The Supreme Wondrous Chapter on Dispelling Calamities and Warding Off Misfortunes for Lords, Kings, and Feudal Lords of the World* was received.

As the Primordial Celestial Worthy was about to expound this scripture, he circumambulated ten times to summon the ten directions, and only then ascended his seat. The celestial perfected, the lofty sages, the radiant treasure perfected ones, the celestial immortal kings, the lords of the Great Ultimate, the left and right immortal ministers, the divine officials and spirit officers—an immeasurable host—arrived borne upon the void. Their jeweled steeds and celestial horses, their cloud chariots with trailing canopies, cast forth resplendent light; their luminous canopies gleamed afloat, their golden wheels flew in motion, the five clouds intermingled in radiance, their attendants arrayed like stars, the nine numina unfolded auspicious signs, and the eight directions shone in clarity. For seven days and seven nights, the myriad heavens and the Three Realms, the domains of immortals and perfected beings, rejoiced as one. The host of perfected ones harmonized their virtue, humans and celestials enjoyed health and longevity, disasters and misfortunes were dispelled, and all reveled in great peace.

The lands of the myriad heavens, their mountains and rivers, forests and trees, were leveled as one, no longer distinguished by high or low. The earth transformed into yellow jade, without variation in hue. As the host of perfected ones attended in assembly, the Primordial Celestial Worthy sat in profound stillness upon the Ninefold Radiance of the Jeweled Lotus of Supreme Harmony, the jasper dragon afloat in the void.

When the scripture was recited once, the great sages of the myriad heavens voiced their approval in unison. At that moment, throughout all lands under heaven, the winds and transformations grew serene and clear. When recited a second time, no inauspicious influences arose. When recited a third time, the seasons harmonized in peace. When recited a fourth time, the stars and planets followed their proper courses, and the sun and moon shone with constant brightness. When recited a fifth time, the five grains flourished abundantly, without famine or misfortune. When recited a sixth time, the people preserved authenticity and cast aside falsity, free from covetous desires. When recited a seventh time, the people’s virtue returned to benevolence, and they enjoyed enduring prosperity and health. When recited an eighth time, the true Dao flowed freely, and all beings fulfilled their natures. When recited a ninth time, kings and emperors extended their longevity by ten thousand years. When recited a tenth time, heaven and humanity rejoiced as one, and blessings endured without end.

At that time, every man and woman in the land turned their hearts in devotion, all received protection and deliverance, and each attained longevity. The Dao spoke: As the Primordial Celestial Worthy recited the scripture once, the Boundless Great Sage of the East, the Great Spirit of Dispelling Disasters, arrived with an immeasurable host, afloat in the void. When recited a second time, the Boundless Great Sage of the South, the Great Spirit of Warding Off Misfortunes, arrived with an immeasurable host, afloat in the void. When recited a third time, the Boundless Great Sage of the West, the Great Spirit of Dispersing Calamities, arrived with an immeasurable host, afloat in the void. When recited a fourth time, the Boundless Great Sage of the North, the Great Spirit of Eliminating Afflictions, arrived with an immeasurable host, afloat in the void. When recited a fifth time, the Boundless Great Sage of the Northeast, the Great Spirit of Eradicating Ugliness, arrived with an immeasurable host, afloat in the void. When recited a sixth time, the Boundless Great Sage of the Southeast, the Great Spirit of Suppressing Evil, arrived with an immeasurable host, afloat in the void. When recited a seventh time, the Boundless Great Sage of the Southwest, the Great Spirit of Scouring Filth, arrived with an immeasurable host, afloat in the void. When recited an eighth time, the Boundless Great Sage of the Northwest, the Great Spirit of Punishing Deviance, arrived with an immeasurable host, afloat in the void. When recited a ninth time, the Boundless Great Sage of the Upper Realm, the Great Spirit of Annihilating Pestilence, arrived with an immeasurable host, afloat in the void. When recited a tenth time, the Boundless Great Sage of the Lower Realm, the Great Spirit of Subduing Demons, arrived with an immeasurable host, afloat in the void.

After the ten recitations were complete, the true great spirits of the ten directions, the boundless ones who dispel calamities and ward off misfortunes for the lands of the world, arrived as one. The lands of the myriad heavens, their rulers, ministers, and multitudes of people, turned their hearts in reverence. They came like clouds converging and mists gathering—an immeasurable host—filling half the land, causing the earth to sink unevenly, beyond all restraint.

Thereupon, the Primordial Beginning transformed a divine pearl, vast as the sun, its radiance congealed and luminous, ascending and descending, lingering in the great void. The Primordial One drew them in, its effulgent rays extending to all. The celestial perfected, the lofty sages, the radiant treasure perfected ones, the lords and ministers of the boundless lands of the ten directions, the immeasurable host of great spirits who dispel calamities and ward off misfortunes for the lands of the world—all entered the divine pearl. From below, the celestials and humans gazed upward, seeing only the lords, ministers, and multitudes of the myriad lands, along with the great spirits who dispel calamities and ward off misfortunes, swiftly entering through the effulgent rays. Once within, their whereabouts were unknown. The people dispersed, the land returned to levelness, and the uneven sinking ceased.

Within the divine pearl, the Primordial Celestial Worthy completed the recitation of the scripture in full. The host of perfected ones oversaw the deliverance and transmitted it to me. At that moment, joy and celebration were beyond words. When the ritual was roughly concluded, the myriad heavens returned to their stations, and in an instant, all was silent, without lingering resonance.

At that time, the celestials and humans who encountered the scriptural Dharma were universally delivered, their allotted years preserved intact, free from harm. The lands were at peace, all prospered and flourished. There was no strife, no contention, no illness, no injury, no punishment, no killing, no encroachment, no theft, no premature death, no mutilation. Above and below shared a single virtue, preserving the harmony of the Great Peace. They were united in compassion and love, and even those of different lineages became kin. The land was secure, the people abundant, and all rejoiced in great peace. From the scripture’s first promulgation, the myriad lands followed the Dao. Those who had cultivated utmost sincerity, revered and upheld it with devotion, all attained deliverance across the ages.

The Dao spoke: The words uttered by the Primordial Celestial Worthy in the recitation of this scripture are the hidden, resonant tones of the inner names of the Celestial Thearchs of the myriad heavens, as well as the concealed names of the true kings and the hidden appellations of the hundred spirits. Within the lands of the ten directions, if the lords, kings, and feudal rulers wish to perpetuate their hereditary lines, safeguard their territories, prevent the rise of warfare, avert floods and droughts, quell banditry, ensure the people’s abundance, and secure the prosperity of the times and the flourishing of all things, they must establish and display the *True Writ for Dispelling Calamities and Warding Off Misfortunes for the Lands of the Five Directions*.

Those who wear and receive it shall summon blessings and auspiciousness. The talismans for pacifying the realm are established through altar rites and offerings. Chanting this divine writ dispels calamities and averts misfortunes, ensuring the preservation of great peace—words not of this mundane world. The perfected sages have already attained it; true persons fathom its mysteries and delve into its subtleties. Those who master its verses and recite them ten times shall hear the distant echoes of the myriad heavens, and the lands of the world shall flourish afar. Disasters and illnesses shall be eradicated, floods and fires pacified, governance and education perfected, Dao and virtue equally exalted. Blessings shall descend in abundance, and all people and things shall thrive in harmony.

Scholars of the highest learning who recite it ten times shall harmonize heaven and earth, moving the spirits to respond. The warp and weft of cosmic order shall align in sequence, and the workings of creation shall bring forth life. The dynastic mandate shall endure, and auspicious signs shall multiply daily. The reason for this is that once the world’s impurities are dispelled and the qi of the Dao returns to purity, the wondrous model summons and commands the majestic spirits, safeguarding the times and seasons, warding off misfortune without fail, and preserving the ultimate governance. Yet this is but non-action, and no further anxieties remain.

Those who recite these verses lightly shall bring misfortune upon themselves. Those who honor and revere it with devotion shall see their states prosper, their eras flourish, and their lands thrive. Bound to good karmic causes, they shall be untouched by the ten thousand calamities, and divine protectors shall guard their gates. This scripture is most venerable and wondrous, unmatched in the Jade Capital. It dispels all manner of calamities and auspices, serving as the root of the ten thousand Daoist teachings. Its majestic model is vast, and its virtue beyond measure.

The Dao spoke: When this scripture is recited ten times, the myriad heavens shall gather in unison. Across the billions of kingdoms, the lords, kings, and feudal rulers of the world shall all receive the mysterious transformation, universally partaking in the grace of the Dao. They shall nurture all beings, and their virtuous influence shall spread evenly, silently transforming bandits and thieves. Thus, treachery shall vanish, harmonious qi shall flourish, and purity and spontaneity shall prevail. Blessed with radiant fortune, they shall align with the Jade Perfected.

Scholars of the highest learning who cultivate and recite this scripture shall all be able to dispel harms and calamities for their states, summoning auspicious signs. Those who recite it in the world shall safeguard their families and nations above, and below, they shall be free from personal misfortunes, forever loyal and filial, extending their years and enjoying longevity. Thereafter, they shall undergo refinement and transformation, transcending the depths of suffering, returning to their original essence, and ascending as immortals to roam and feast in the Great Clarity. This scripture is subtle and wondrous, universally delivering boundless beings. All heavenly and mortal beings shall receive its blessings, and immeasurable fortune shall grace the lands of the world.

This treasure of the heavens is not transmitted to the lower world. Only the most devoted scholars, offering gold and treasures to pledge their sincerity and swear oaths before heaven, may receive it. Those who lightly divulge or disrespect it shall bring calamity upon nine generations, consigning them to eternal servitude in the dark realms. The Five Thearchs shall assign twenty-four Jade Lads and twenty-four Jade Maidens to attend the divine writ, protecting those who receive the scripture.

The Dao spoke: During the long fast of the first month, recite this scripture to dispel and pacify calamities for the lords, kings, and feudal rulers of the world, rectifying the disharmonies of heaven and earth, yin and yang, that give rise to disasters. During the long fast of the seventh month, recite this scripture to dispel and pacify the transgressions of inauspicious conjunctions of the sun, moon, and stars that descend upon the palaces of the lords, kings, and feudal rulers, wielding its wondrous efficacy to ensure that heaven’s mandate does not end. During the long fast of the tenth month, recite this scripture to dispel and pacify calamities for the lords, kings, and feudal rulers of the world, extending their reigns, summoning immortals and perfected beings, stabilizing their dynastic mandates, and preserving the eternal endurance of heaven. Thus, their lineages shall never be severed, and they shall forever rule as sovereigns, pacifying their domains and bringing their people to proclaim great peace.

On the days of the eight seasonal nodes, recite this scripture to bestow divine blessings and spread protection over the common people. On one’s own life-destiny day, recite this scripture to dispel calamities and misfortunes, safeguarding the body’s three fields, eight luminous spirits, nine palaces, joints, and passages, the numinous spirits of the viscera, and the hundred deities that weave through the entire form. The register of life shall remain unshaken, and the scripture shall pacify and dispel calamities from the lands of the world, preserving the myriad things in shared prosperity. Honoring the supreme merit, the sagely virtue shall shine equally, the three realms shall serve as guardians, the Five Thearchs shall oversee the reception, and the ten thousand spirits shall pay homage. One’s name shall be inscribed in the heavens, and upon the fulfillment of merit and virtue, one shall ascend to the Great Clarity.

The Dao spoke: On the days of practicing the Dao, one must bathe in fragrant waters, enter the chamber in purity, face east, and knock the teeth thirty-two times to ascend to the thirty-two heavens. Bow thirty-two times with utmost sincerity. Close the eyes and silently visualize oneself seated amidst clouds of blue, yellow, and white qi, enveloped within and without in misty obscurity. A blue dragon, white tiger, vermilion bird, dark warrior, lion, and white crane shall array themselves to the left and right. The sun and moon shall illuminate the chamber with radiant brilliance, and a circular halo shall emanate from the crown of the head, casting light in the ten directions—all vividly clear.

Recite the secret incantation:
*"Supreme Mystery and Primordial One, Supreme Dao Lord, summon forth from within this servant’s body the Three and Five Merit Officers, the attendants of the left and right, the Jade Lads who tend the incense, the Jade Maidens who transmit words, the direct talismans of the Five Thearchs, and the thirty-two officials of the incense altars for the day. Open the gates to relay these words. Today is an auspicious day, a time of long fasting in the pure hall, of cultivating the supreme scripture, the boundless deliverance of beings. May these words ascend swiftly to the presence of the Most High, the Primordial Celestial Worthy of the Thirty-Two Heavens."*

Conclude by drawing qi thirty-two times, then face east and recite the scripture:

*The Supreme Primordial Wondrous Scripture of Boundless Deliverance*
*The Supreme Cavernous Mystery, Numinous Treasure Root Chapter for Dispelling Calamities and Pacifying Auspices for the Lords, Kings, and Feudal Rulers of the World, Supreme Wondrous Beginning*
*Ten recitations deliver beings; the hundred spirits’ hidden resonances unite and part by nature.*
*The jade texts of the five qi, the wondrous roots of the three heavens.*
*At the dawn of chaos, the divine perfected were moved to respond.*
*They ordained the ten thousand images and shaped the myriad things.*
*Radiant splendor spreads its brilliance, merging with the Dao in luminosity.*
*They govern the three realms and weave through the eight directions,*
*The domains of states and lands, the celestial lords, kings, and feudal rulers,*
*Each ruling their realms, all revered by the Supreme Mystery.*
*Governance and virtuous transformation emulate and exalt this.*
*The mechanisms of movement and stillness manifest blessings and calamities.*
*Goodness summons fortune; evil bequeaths misfortune.*
*In profound union with the subtle and formless, the heavens’ fortune flourishes.*
*This wondrous model resides in the Golden Writ of the August Ultimate, pervading the qi of the primordial pattern.*
*It gathers and records the spirit-kings,*
*Examining and verifying fortunes and misfortunes, assembling in the Jade Hall,*
*The left and right mysterious terraces, the cinnabar numinous cloud chambers.*

They examine adversity and obstruction, dissolving and dispelling them with the flow of qi,
Unfolding and overflowing with the Great Harmony, circling and lingering in its midst.

All grasping the pivotal mechanisms.

The Jade Consort of the Western Florescence reverses transgressions and scatters misfortune.
Boundless merit unfolds today, as the myriad heavens descend in state.

The *Eightfold Radiance’s* jade scriptures, their phrases matching the lofty Perfected.

**First: The Chapter for Protecting and Securing the Lord of the State, the Flying Air’s Sound**
The pure net’s divine mounds receive the records of the Purple Emperor.
Riding clouds and descending mists, the eight paths intersect in radiance.
The Jade Gates’ dragon scripts protect and secure the emperor.
Wondrous indeed, the Divine Empyrean’s honor, raising this great Dharma Bridge.
Heavenly light descends upon the Purple Tenuity, treasure talismans subdue the myriad demons.
Flitting and fluttering, they return to the Supreme Emperor, in throngs ascending the Crimson Empyrean.
The lord of the state receives great fortune, heavenly songs resound in the serene void.
The world’s mandate enjoys great peace, flourishing and prospering as the Dao summons.
The Primordial Beginning bestows the divine chapters, how resplendent the great model!
The boundaries now pacified, evil roots all annihilated and dispersed.
Rectifying oneself, the Dao comes to accord—even ten thousand kalpas are not distant.

**Second: The Chapter for Dispelling and Warding Off the Calamities of Kings and Lords**
The Great Dao expands mightily, its transformations boundless.
Lofty and towering, the various heavens all establish lords and kings.
Assisting in defense are billions and thousands, together rectifying the grand principles.
Extending below to the human world, they emulate the lofty vault.
Vast and numerous, the myriad kinds, their merit归于 the emperor.
Revolving the Dipper’s handle, aligning with Kunlun,
Summoning immortals and assembling the Perfected, opening transformation and ascending transcendence.
They induce the descent of harmonious qi, nurturing and fostering the people.
Sweeping away and annihilating the hideous and vile, repelling and extinguishing the sources of evil,
Purging and cleansing the world’s lands, the imperial ultimate truly luminous.
The Three Mysteries’ treasure talismans command the myriad soldiers.
Attaining to fly with the immortals, together ascending the Jade Stairs,
Roaming the vast heavens, wherever they go, fortune and prosperity.
Revolving the divine above the scene, eternally dwelling in the Purple Court.

The Third Song for Dispelling and Averting Disasters in the World’s Lands Proclaims:

Above arrayed the Nine Heavens, below divided the Nine Abysses.
Vast and boundless the Dao’s radiance, its warp and weft without limit.
Revolving the primordial net, it fixes the realm within.
Once the nation’s borders are rectified, the imperial ultimate abides in honor.
The three realms of the forest of phenomena securely anchor the Five Mountains.
The emperor dwells in the Divine Continent, governing the myriad spirits.

Should disasters arise, they are averted with jade scriptures.
The eight mystic tones, sixty-four chapters,
Penetrate heaven and earth, intertwining the six qi.
Sweeping away inauspicious filth, memorials ascend to the Supreme Mystery.
Preserving and securing grand peace, the Three Realms rest in tranquility.

The Supreme Dao is originally formless, its divine wonders transmissible.
Its profound virtue blankets all existence; we bow our heads to the Divine Empyrean scriptures.
Here above the Three Realms, amid the flying void,
The True Kings’ song resounds, its notes harmonizing with the cavernous chapters.
Recite it a hundred times, and the Four Seas unite in harmony.
Recite it a thousand times, and the people transform in timely concord.
Ten thousand recitations perfect the Dao, the world’s fortune endless,
Transcending the Three Realms, virtue and merit flourish in majesty.

Those who hear the numinous tones may seal mountains and summon spirits,
Command earth deities, escort and receive with attendants,
Safeguard the nation’s lands, universally deliver all beings.
This is called boundless, delivering multitudes across kalpas.
The secret celestial scriptures, revered by all heavens—
Should one recklessly disclose them, they fall into hell,
Calamity extending to seven generations of ancestors.

The Dao declares: These two chapters are the hidden tones of the Heavenly Thearchs
and the Divine Empyrean True Kings.
They eliminate all disasters within the lands of kings, princes, and lords,
Repel misfortune, avert warfare, famine, locusts, drought,
Floods, pestilence, unseasonable frost, thunder, lightning,
Violent storms, and all strange anomalies.
They ensure the world’s lands endure, lineages flourish,
Suppress demonic forces, summon harmonious qi—
All are the words of the Great Brahma, not common speech of the mortal realm.
Their words lack ornate beauty, their melodies lack florid grace,
Thus they are called profound and obscure, difficult to fathom.

Treasured by heaven, they are secretly stored in the eastern chamber of the Divine Empyrean Jade Clarity King’s Palace,
Transmitted downward in accordance with the cyclical signs *ding*, *ren*, and *chen*.
Should a perfected one offer gold and treasures with sincere heart,
Following the old rites to pledge allegiance to the Ten Heavens,
Only then shall they be bestowed.

The Dao declares: The revolutions of heaven and earth also know decline.
The sun, moon, and five planets also wax and wane.
Even the most sagely and divine may know prosperity and adversity.
The lesser learned may also suffer affliction and harm.

When such calamities arise, all of like qi must unite in heart to perform purification rites, burn incense in the six periods, and recite the scriptures ten times through—whereupon blessings and virtue shall descend at once, dispelling all inauspicious omens. The boundless scriptures universally deliver infinite beings.

The Dao declares: Should the lesser learned possess shallow attainment in the Dao, or their immortal rank remain unfulfilled, and they encounter calamity in the course of their destiny, facing peril and collapse, they need only concentrate their minds to burn incense and recite the scriptures ten times through. Thereby shall they traverse their trials and tribulations, ascending in rank according to their merit, reckoned by the day. They shall avoid divine trials and swiftly ascend to join the ranks of immortals.

The Dao declares: When the revolutions of heaven and earth reach their end, the stellar lodges fall into disarray, the sun and moon lose their radiance, the four seasons lose their order, yin and yang fall out of harmony, and the realm suffers calamities and portents. Epidemics and poisons spread, the people perish in great numbers, masters and companions pass away—then, outside the gates of the capital, one must erect altars of the Five Directions. At the site of the calamity, facing toward its location, one shall display the True Writs of the Five Directions, burn incense in the six periods, offer praises and recitations, and submit memorials to present petitions, summoning the true numina. The heavens shall then dispatch the Ten Great Divine Generals of the World to Consummate and Dispel Calamities, who shall descend as one, driving away disasters, severing and slaying demonic spirits. The world shall know peace, and the Five Fortunes shall arrive in abundance.

The merit of purification rites and scripture recitation is most profound: above, it dispels celestial calamities and safeguards the emperor; below, it averts poisonous harms and delivers the people. From life to death, all depend upon it—its blessings are beyond measure. Thus it is called boundless, universally delivering heaven and humanity.

The Dao declares: Whoever possesses these scriptures and performs these meritorious deeds for the Lord of Heaven and Earth, the Emperor, and the people—on the day of calamity, should they resolve to perform purification rites, burn incense, and recite the scriptures ten times through—all the heavens shall record their names, and the myriad spirits shall attend and protect them. Those of exceptional attainment shall become true ministers of the Jade Treasury of the King. The heavens record the merits and transgressions of people without the slightest error. The True King of Heaven shall also safeguard and promote their persons. Those who attain the Dao shall thereby thoroughly comprehend the most profound teachings.

The boundless hidden language of the Great Brahma in the heavens—
Composed by the Dao Lord,
*The Jade Chapters of the Primordial Beginning on Consummating and Dispelling the Calamities and Fortunes of Lords, Kings, and Marquises of the World*
The Eight Heavens of the Eastern Direction.

The Radiant Position of Śītā, with distant forests joining in song.
Distinguishing the cage’s utmost grasp, Wei Xun’s vast abundance.
The hook’s white fierce uplift, Han Yuan’s competitive splendor.
Pervasive mists command talismans, horizontal aid to the scriptural sands.
The liquid of Ji awaits Qin’s encampment, the halted marquis gathers the rivers.
No barrier hastens the feast, parted clouds lave the waves.
The ramparts of compassion bequeath brightness, light expands the hidden net.
The proper conduct of the Brahmā-dragon, the celestial mechanism of jade streams.

**Southern Direction, Eight Heavens**
The starry palace’s primordial foundation, traversing the flourishing edge.
Revolving and casting at the Gate of Congratulations, the Nine Peaks uphold heaven.
Transforming directly to occupy the palace, the trustworthy emperor’s carefree authority.
Casually returning to pour into the flask, the radiant fortune of the jade sphere.
Bing manifests to guard the marsh, Pingyao bends in connection.
Celebration eternally soars on post-horses, the immortal of flowing branches and mysteries.
Sweeping the region’s scriptural structures, jade constructs hasten to firmness.
Chen and Dong cannot sustain it, the fierce oak merges the fields.

**Western Direction, Eight Heavens**
The Sword Yi’s true court, linked ridges of swift crystal.
Transforming the plain to the Śāla terrace, governing the distinct to dissolve spirits.
The divination chamber locks the frontier, soaring and alighting to secure the latch.
Shading the ends of mountain peaks, Wen bestows the offering of Ding.
Extending the sincere and humble, the ancestral hall of Lou decides the campaign.
Ancestral judgments and younger disciples, auspicious reliance on cultured tranquility.
Frequent Feng’s winding springs, the example of Su’s clouded city.
The primordial covers the vortex’s origin, rescuing compassion to raise the lotus.

**Northern Direction, Eight Heavens**
Crimson silks welcome the talisman, the Pivot Star’s northern chart.
Investigating the continuous and dense incantations, the infant’s sequence entwines the pillar.
Gou and Li in the silent bureau, the moon’s threads spread and weave.
The first tinkling congeals the record, the distant reed-pipe shepherds the ranks.
Rosy clouds overflow with distant gazing, commands distinguish the generals and spirits.
Carving and congealing the edict to completion, strength proclaims solid wholeness.
Recording the Brahmā’s vast retribution, the netherworld’s scrutiny enriches the mysterious.
The subtle and imperceptible, awakening the kiln’s wheel of thorns.

The Dao states: Within these heavens, the Great Brahmā’s hidden language resounds with boundless tones. The ancient script, concealed within the Nine Heavens’ Jade Gates, descends in accord with the turning of the kalpa to dispel and avert calamities and pestilence from the lands of the world below. Each character spans a full *zhang* in height, inscribed long ago by the Heavenly Perfected and August Ones to establish the correct pronunciation. Those who know these sounds and can purify themselves to recite them shall have all the heavens dispatch spirit-messengers on flying chariots to descend and observe their persons, recording their meritorious diligence to be reported above. The myriad spirits shall pay homage, earth deities attend at their gates, and the True Kings of the Four Poles shall safeguard and recommend them for ascent. When their Dao is complete and they attain mastery, they may wander the Three Realms and ascend through the Golden Gate.

These sounds repel all, avert all, deliver all, and accomplish all—such is the spontaneous sound of the Heavenly Perfected. Thus, reciting them summons flying immortals to descend and observe, the Supreme Emperor to chant from afar, the myriad spirits to pay homage, the Three Realms to attend at their chariots, the host of demons to bow their heads, and ghostly essences to vanish of themselves. The chiming of jade pendants resounds, the Ten Directions grow solemn and clear, rivers and seas fall silent, mountains and peaks swallow their mists, the myriad numina tremble and submit, and immortals are gathered in assembly. The heavens are free of defilement, the earth devoid of demonic dust. Profound wisdom illumines the pure, and the vastness of the mysterious attains its ultimate profundity.

The Supreme Five Directions’ True Writings, along with the talismanic commands for lords, kings, and marquises to dispel and avert calamities and fortunes, are appended below.

**Eastern Direction’s True Writing**
**Southern Direction’s True Writing**

**Western Direction’s True Writing**
**Northern Direction’s True Writing**
**Central Direction’s True Writing**
**Talisman for the Lord of the State**
**Talisman for the King**
**Talisman for the Marquises**

The talismans on the right stabilize the realm and dispel calamities. Inscribe them in the dominant color of the season upon green silk, and store them in a crimson pouch. Offer incense, bow three times, and wear them for auspiciousness. Burying one in the earth-altar yields even greater efficacy.

*The Supreme and Limitless Scripture on Salvation of the Highest Grade, Scroll Five* **Ends Here**

**Scroll Six**
*The Divine Transformations of the Great One: The Five Blessings for Protecting the State and Averting War*

The Dao speaks: Long ago, in the Azure Heavens of the Beginning, amidst the vast emptiness of the Blue Firmament, in the Great Floating Li Land, the Primordial Beginning received the wondrous scripture of the *Divine Transformations of the Great One for Salvation*. As the Celestial Worthy of the Primordial Beginning was about to expound this scripture, he circled ten times to summon the Ten Directions, and only then ascended his seat.

Heavenly Perfected Spirits, Supreme Sages, Exalted Worthies, Perfected Ones of Wondrous Conduct, the True Lords of the Three Primes and the Great One, the Nine Palaces and Eight Scribes, the Divine Charts and Jade Boards, and an innumerable host arrived upon the void. Ninefold radiance suffused their chariots; purple auroras bore forth orchid incense; green mists wafted fragrance; vermilion phoenixes drew cloud-borne carriages; ranks of dragon steeds followed; carved wheels bore layered canopies; jade ornaments cast congealed splendor; embroidered hues vied in brilliance; immortal clouds displayed their beauty; and the Eight Poles were illumined throughout.

For nine days and nine nights, the divine peaks of all heavens stilled their numinous winds, sweeping away the slightest obscurity, clearing the vast expanse of the seas, and revealing the Great Harmony. The land, mountains, rivers, forests, and trees of the realm were equally suffused with fragrant moisture; azure mists coiled and receded; all was surveyed in boundless emptiness, and wondrous light merged into one hue.

The assembled Perfected Ones attended the Celestial Worthy of the Primordial Beginning, who sat in profound stillness upon the Jade Capital of the Void, the Golden Beam of the Eight Winds, the Floating Terrace of Cloud Pearls, the Curved Dawn of Ten Thousand Dragons, the Seat of Heavenly Virtue. As he expounded the scripture once, the Great Saints of all heavens simultaneously proclaimed its excellence.

At that time, the womb of chaos nurtured form from formlessness.
As he expounded the scripture a second time, the Great One was conceived, resembling a lotus bud.
A third recitation: it unfolded its petals, and true qi flowed forth like a rainbow.
A fourth recitation: nine-colored cloud-sprouts burst forth, their hooks forming armor.
A fifth recitation: the Great One dwelled at the center, encircled by the Eight Effulgences.
A sixth recitation: the mysterious liquid flourished in unison, and primordial qi inwardly sustained it.
A seventh recitation: the celestial infant opened its seven apertures, awakening to clarity and sound.
An eighth recitation: humans and beings emerged from the womb, and the Great One gazed upward.
A ninth recitation: the Great One took its first steps, circling through the Nine Palaces.
A tenth recitation: its body was clad in brocade robes, and it held a jade celestial chart.

At that moment, all men and women of the realm, beholding the Celestial Worthy and witnessing the divine transformations of the Great One’s Dao-mysteries, received the descent of the Primordial Clan’s blessings for salvation. Those who inwardly believed and sincerely submitted were all granted deliverance and protection, attaining long life.

The Dao speaks: As the Celestial Worthy of the Primordial Beginning expounded the scripture once, the True Lord of the Three Primes and the Great One of the Eastern Direction, Celebrating Life, arrived with an innumerable host upon the void.
A second recitation: the True Lord of the Three Primes and the Great One of the Southern Direction, Vast Illumination, arrived with an innumerable host upon the void.
A third recitation: the True Lord of the Three Primes and the Great One of the Western Direction, Divine Tiger, arrived with an innumerable host upon the void.
A fourth recitation: the True Lord of the Three Primes and the Great One of the Northern Direction, Concealing the Dao, arrived with an innumerable host upon the void.
A fifth recitation: the True Lord of the Three Primes and the Great One of the Northeast, Ghostly Strategist, arrived with an innumerable host upon the void.
A sixth recitation: the True Lord of the Three Primes and the Great One of the Southeast, Original Birth, arrived with an innumerable host upon the void.
A seventh recitation: the True Lord of the Three Primes and the Great One of the Southwest, Earth Mother, arrived with an innumerable host upon the void.
An eighth recitation: the True Lord of the Three Primes and the Great One of the Northwest, Great Elder, arrived with an innumerable host upon the void.
A ninth recitation: the True Lord of the Three Primes and the Great One of the Upper Direction, Heavenly Wailing, arrived with an innumerable host upon the void.
A tenth recitation: the True Lord of the Three Primes and the Great One of the Lower Direction, Earth’s Teeth, arrived with an innumerable host upon the void.

After ten recitations were completed, the True Lords of the Three Primes and the Great One of the Ten Directions, with their innumerable hosts, arrived simultaneously. All men and women of the realm turned their hearts in reverence.

Those who came were led by the True Lords of the Great One of the Nine Palaces of the Upper Prime, the Nine Palaces of the Middle Prime, and the Nine Palaces of the Lower Prime. Each of the Three Primes’ Nine Palaces of the Great One transformed into three palaces, and within those three palaces, they further transformed into nine palaces. Within each of the nine palaces, nine palaces were again transformed—nine times nine, each yielding eighty-one palaces—with the Great One dwelling at the center.

The Great Ones of the Ten Directions cast forth their radiance to save humanity, and all the heaven-dwellers hastened to the Primordial Beginning to behold and hear the Great Dharma. Their numbers were incalculable. The attending True Lords of the Three Primes and the Great One filled the realm like clouds crowding the sea; the sacred land trembled, the celestial towers swayed, and boundless radiance blazed forth, irresistible.

Then, without rising from his seat, the Primordial Beginning grasped the Jade Net, seized the Great Dipper, and suddenly let it fall from the void. Heaven-dwellers gazed from afar as the canopy of flowers gleamed brilliantly, myriad treasures intertwined. Only the Dipper’s mouth and the Primordial Dipper were seen descending through the void; the Six Stars shone resplendent amidst the azure radiance, their golden hues round and luminous, glowing like a great conflagration.

Within it sat the Supreme Perfected Lord upon a golden couch and jade canopy, draped in purple embroidered robes, a nine-colored aura upon his neck, holding a starry pearl that gleamed like a jeweled capital. The Celestial Worthy surveyed the heaven-dwellers and proclaimed to the innumerable host:

“Let the True Lords of the Three Primes and the Nine Palaces of the Great One each ride their palaces, manifesting divine transformations and blessings. Within the human body, they are called the Central Yellow Great One, dwelling in repose within the Mysterious Cinnabar.”

Now the divine transformations commence, as the Dao descends with the Primordial Dipper. Gazing afar upon the Jade City, yet it does not surpass a single square inch. Through boundless spiritual power, I ferry all beings across; the Great One transforms his body to expound the Dharma as I do.

Thereupon, the Primordial Beginning ascended, leading the Celestial Perfected, the Supreme Spirits, the Exalted Worthies, the Perfected of Wondrous Conduct, the Boundless Ones of the Ten Directions, the True Lords of the Three Primes and the Great One, the Most Perfect and Great Spirits—an innumerable host—all entering into the Primordial Dipper. The heaven-dwellers looked up and saw them surge forth, entering from the stars of the Dipper’s handle. Once within the stellar palace, their whereabouts became unknown. The lands of the realm dispersed, the earth returned to level stillness, and the tremors ceased.

Within the stellar palace, the Primordial Beginning expounded the sutra in full. The assembled Perfected oversaw the deliverance and bestowed it upon me. At that moment, joy and celebration defied expression. When the Dharma rites were roughly complete, the hosts of heaven returned to their stations. In the fleeting instant, all fell silent, leaving no lingering echo.

At that time, the heaven-dwellers who encountered the sutra’s Dharma were universally delivered. The divine transformations of the Great One followed the turning of fate to bestow blessings, preserving their allotted years without harm or injury. The entire land turned in reverence, awakening the resolve for the Dao. There were no calamities, no wars, no hunger, no illness, no violence, no untimely deaths, no upheavals, no punishments, no fears, no terrors. Their words aligned with auspicious responses, and their speech overflowed with benevolent tones. Compassion and love became universal, and even those of different bones became kin. The realm knew peace, the people abundance, and all rejoiced in great harmony. From the moment the sutra’s teachings emerged, the entire land followed the Dao. Those who held sincere devotion, revered and honored it, all attained deliverance across the ages.

The Dao declares: The names spoken by the Primordial Heavenly Worthy within the sutra are the inner appellations of the Three Primes and the Great One, the hidden rhymes of sound, as well as the secret taboos of the Nine Palaces and the concealed names of the Hundred Spirits. They are not the common words of the mundane world. Only those Perfected who have attained the status of True Persons, who penetrate the mysterious and fathom the subtle, can fully grasp their verses. When recited ten times, the Great One gazes downward, the Three Primes strike their rhythms, the celestial wheels interlock in emerald splendor, the earthly domains are bounded by gold, the sun and moon conjoin like jade disks, the stellar lodges align like strung pearls, the Milky Way stirs with clarity, the mountains and peaks stand majestic, numinous winds sweep through the void, and the myriad apertures blow their flutes. The celestial net shifts, the mechanisms of transformation operate of their own accord, demonic hordes are bound in form, ghostly essences extinguished in brilliance, the dead return to life, and white bones become human once more. The blessings of the Great One perish and yet revive again.

For those devoted to study, reciting this ten times summons the Five Emperors wielding their halberds, the Three Primes commanding their banners, the Great One riding his chariot to encircle the eight boundaries. Blessings flow with the qi, a myriad paths open before them. Misfortunes are severed, disasters and famines dispersed, demonic and ghostly traces swept away, and the obscured and departed ascend as immortals. Where the sovereign’s virtue extends, jubilation flourishes for a hundred million years. The divine might knows no bounds, and their station stands at the forefront of the celestial net. Even those on the brink of death from illness, when they encounter this, are preserved whole.

The reason for this is that the scholar awaits the qi and bides the time, while the Great One commands the Perfected to govern the ten directions, overawe the myriad heavens, subdue the earthly deities, bind the demonic spirits, avert disasters, repel death, escape calamity, and attain life. The divine script of the Great One transforms and revives the numinous. To recite this chapter lightly brings misfortune upon oneself. To honor and revere it ensures the prosperity of one’s household, flourishing across generations, forging good karmic connections. Ten thousand calamities will not intrude, for the Great One guards the gate.

This sutra is supremely wondrous, unmatched in the Jade Capital. It delivers boundless beings and serves as the origin of the myriad Dao. Its majestic model of virtue is beyond measure.

The Dao declares: Those who recite this sutra ten times should understand the Dao of the Great One’s divine transformations. The Three Primes and Twenty-Seven Palaces—comprising the Three Divisions of Heaven, Humanity, and Earth—each have a True Lord of the Great One presiding over them. Following the colors of the nine qi, nine stars, and nine palaces, they determine the realm’s fortunes and misfortunes. They rescue the times and protect the world, safeguarding the realm and preserving the sovereign, ensuring the emperor’s longevity and prosperity, and the harmony of celestial phenomena. Such is the profound merit of the Great One.

The Nine Palaces of Heaven: the North Emperor resides there, the Northeast is the Pivot of Wandering, the East nurtures life, the Southeast gazes upon the dawn, the South is the Vermilion Mound, the Southwest is the Woman’s Chamber, the West is the Luminous Pure, the Northwest is the Empty Constellation, and the Center is the Yellow Numinous.

Their Great Ones are named: Ancient Azure, Bamboo Trust, Dark Origin, Purple Ceremony, Nine Heads, White Banner, Fixed Auspice, Swift Fortune, and Warrior Prisoner.

The Nine Palaces of Humanity: the North is the Mysterious Path, the Northeast spews souls, the East is the Infant, the Southeast is the Ghost Metropolis, the South is the Fire Mountain, the Southwest is the Tiger’s Body, the West is the Bear Woman, the Northwest is the Heavenly Father, and the Center is the Hall of Blessings.

Their Great Ones are named: Long Life, Imperial Prosperity, Earl Wheel, Minister Axe, Mysterious Chart, Nine Slaughters, Cinnabar Essence, Seven Armors, and Human Mother.

The Nine Palaces of Earth: the North is the Mysterious Chamber, the Northeast is the Azure Lift, the East is the Dark Azure, the Southeast is the Proper Brilliance, the South is the Crimson Soldier, the Southwest is the General’s Seal, the West is the Crouching Slayer, the Northwest is the Capital of the Dao, and the Center is the Universal Ascent.

Their Great Ones are named: Dark Tiger, Green Teeth, Disheveled Hair, Nine Bodies, Azure Serpent, White Mist, Blood Devourer, Mad Slave, and Meng Dun.

The hidden names of the Three Primes differ from those used in the world, for their Dao is most secret. The Central Palace is the Court of the Five Blessings, the essence of the earth spirit. Above, it is the Heavenly Sovereign; in the middle, the Great One; below, the Mysterious One. For those who cultivate the Dao, the body becomes the sovereign’s abode, and they contemplate it as the Mysterious One. Those who attain this Dao unite the one with the myriad and the myriad with the one, mastering transformations and knowing the roots of life. They live without dying, attaining the immortality of the Transcendent.

The qi of the Five Lands serves as the sovereign’s master of blessings. Thus, after forty-five years, the residence shifts. Those dwelling in the North move after nine years; in the Southwest, after eighteen years; in the East, after twenty-seven years; in the Southeast, after thirty-six years; in the West, after sixty-three years; in the Northeast, after seventy-two years; and in the South, after eighty-one years.

Shifting one’s residence must not go against the natural order; below, there is no oppressive rule, and above, no punitive retribution. Thus, no disasters or harms arise, and one daily enjoys great peace. Should one tread where one does not belong or encounter times that are not one’s own, with superiors and inferiors out of harmony, misfortune follows the palace like a shadow, and calamities arise—all tied to the workings of Dao and virtue.

Those who recite this scripture will cause the Great One to turn his banner, and envoys bearing tallies will summon blessings and summon qi, achieving victory without battle. The Dao of warfare brings great fortune; auspiciousness returns to the imperial throne, and one’s years equal those of Heaven. The divine transformations of the Great One are difficult to fathom in detail. The Great One is the noble spirit of the Three Origins, bestowing blessings upon the lord of men. His transformations are without constancy; those who know them enjoy boundless longevity, and the fullness of Dao and virtue descends.

The qi of the Great One transforms at dawn into auspicious clouds, at midday into layered halos, and at dusk into flowing gold. When starlight streams by night, these are its remnants. Upon seeing them, one should burn incense and recite the scripture to welcome its blessings, thereby effortlessly attaining heavenly emolument, becoming a Transcendent, and ascending in joyous flight, naturally attaining the Dao.

Clouds resembling a scholar’s cap signal the Five Blessings in the North.
Clouds resembling a flying dragon signal the Great One in the East.
Clouds resembling a boat or fish signal the Great One in the South.
Clouds resembling banners and standards signal the Great One in the West.
Clouds resembling a canopy signal the Great One at the Center.
Clouds resembling a wandering maiden signal the Great One in the Northeast.
Clouds resembling a torch signal the Great One in the Southeast.
Clouds resembling a burial mound signal the Great One in the Southwest.
Clouds resembling armored warriors signal the Great One in the West.
Clouds resembling a ceremonial chariot signal the Great One in the Northwest.

Those who study, whether of Daoist or secular background, should gaze at the clouds, burn incense, and recite the scripture ten times. The Great One will dispatch riders from the Nine Palaces to protect the state and pacify the people, spreading blessings universally, so that all receive deliverance and attain long life as Transcendents. The Perfected Lord of the Great One shields the emperor and safeguards the people.

Those who know the Great One oversee the myriad heavens, and when they dwell near within their own bodies, even their ancestors of a hundred thousand generations—suffering souls in darkness—all receive deliverance and ascend to the Vermilion Palace. After nine years of cultivation, they undergo transformation and rebirth, becoming noble persons. Those who recite this scripture with understanding in heart and mind extend their years and longevity, and later all attain the Dao of corpse liberation. Their ethereal souls briefly vanish, avoiding the underworld, and immediately regain form, roaming the vastness of the heavens.

This scripture is subtle and wondrous, universally delivering boundless beings. The divine transformations of the Great One bring deliverance to Heaven and humankind, bestowing immeasurable blessings that grace both life and death. Treasured by the heavens above, it is not transmitted to the lower world. Only the most devoted offer gold and treasures to pledge their sincerity, swearing an oath to Heaven before passing it on. Those who lightly divulge or neglect it bring calamity upon nine generations, consigning them to long servitude under the ghostly officials.

The scripture is attended by the Five Thearchs, twenty-four Jade Lads and twenty-four Jade Maidens, who guard its divine writ and protect the body of the reciter.

The Dao says: During the long fast of the first month, recite and chant this scripture to welcome the Perfected Lord of the Great One of the Upper Origin, along with his attending officers and the great spirits of the Nine Palaces. They will deliver the souls of past generations from earthly servitude, those who perished by warfare or punishment, and guide them to the Southern Palace.

During the long fast of the seventh month, recite and chant this scripture to welcome the Perfected Lord of the Great One of the Middle Origin, along with his attending officers and the great spirits of the Nine Palaces. They will dispel warfare and repel enemies, aiding and assisting the emperor, bringing blessings to the people, and enabling the practitioner to attain Transcendence. Their names will be inscribed in the heavens, recorded on yellow registers and white tablets, erasing death and granting life.

During the long fast of the tenth month, recite and chant this scripture to welcome the Perfected Lord of the Great One of the Lower Origin, along with his attending officers and the great spirits of the Nine Palaces. They will protect the emperor and lord of the state, averting the Five Weapons, pacifying the Eight Directions, causing bandits to lose their forms and treachery to vanish. Rulers and ministers, fathers and sons, will stabilize the state’s destiny, ensuring the throne’s eternal preservation, generation after generation, so that one remains the lord of men, securely ruling the land, and the people enjoy great peace.

On the days of the Eight Nodes, recite and chant this scripture to welcome the Perfected Lord of the Five Blessings and the Great One, who will enter the Central Palace, enabling one to become a Perfected Person of the Nine Palaces. On one’s natal day, recite and chant this scripture to welcome the Perfected Lords of the Three Origins and the Great One, who will enter the Palace of Destiny, bestowing blessings upon one’s person. The ethereal soul will be purified, and the myriad qi will endure forever, free from suffering. The body will radiate light, attended by the Three Realms, received by the Five Thearchs, and revered by the myriad spirits. One’s name will be inscribed in the heavens; with merits fulfilled and virtue perfected, one will ascend to the Highest Clarity.

The Dao says: On the day of practicing the Dao, one should bathe in fragrant water, fast, and enter the chamber. Facing east, knock the teeth thirty-two times to reach the thirty-two heavens, and bow thirty-two times in the heart. Close the eyes and silently visualize the body seated amidst clouds of blue, yellow, and white qi, both within and without shrouded in mist. Clearly behold the Great Ones of the ten directions, each riding their respective palaces, spreading qi throughout the heavens. Green Dragons, White Tigers, Vermilion Birds, Dark Warriors, lions, and white cranes array themselves to the left and right. The sun and moon illuminate the chamber, which shines brilliantly, and a circular image appears above the neck, its light radiating in all directions—all vividly manifest.

The secret incantation says:
Supreme Mystery beyond mystery,
Most High Lord of the Dao,
Summon forth from within my body the Three and Five Merit Officers,
Left and right attending envoys,
Jade Lads bearing incense,
Jade Maidens transmitting words,
Direct Talismans of the Five Thearchs,
Incense Officials of the day—
thirty-two each—to report my words.
Today is auspicious and joyous,
a long fast in a pure hall,
cultivating the supreme scripture,
delivering boundless beings.
May my entreaties ascend swiftly
to the presence of the Most High,
the August One before the thirty-two heavens.

Conclude by drawing qi thirty-two times, then face east and recite the scripture.

*The Supreme Scripture of Boundless Salvation, Most Wondrous Upper Chapter*
The Primordial Mystery of the Cavernous Darkness,
the original text of the Numinous Treasure.
The divine transformations of the Great One,
delivering humankind through the Five Blessings.
The Three Origins conceal their rhymes,
parting and uniting naturally.
The Primal Yellow is dim and distant,
without gate or side.

Vast and radiant the Great Void,
the Dao’s qi boundless in every direction.
For eighty-one kalpas,
expansive and without light,
a primordial embryonic sac,
not born of yin or yang.
Suddenly arose the Supreme Spirit,
forcedly named the Great One.
Riding a yellow dragon,
grasping the celestial net,
its form like a jade infant,
clad in cinnabar brocade and green robes.
Revolving left and right,
in the eight true directions,
the myriad spirits submit,
none dare oppose.
The Great One, the Great Spirit,
is called the Root of Heaven.
At times it roams the Jade Purity,
body of the Most Sage.
From the Nine Palaces of the Mud-Pill,
it descends to generate the myriad heavens,
and with humankind,
each endowed with knowledge.
Distinguishing kinds and lineages,
differentiating forms into the ten thousand things.
Dwelling in the human brain’s palace,
it is the Radiant Awareness, the One True Great Spirit,
above residing in the Grand Tenuity,
in the center establishing the Court of Blessings,
below in these Nine Palaces,
guest of the Thearch.

The Great One’s birth,
coeternal with the Primordial Beginning,
above without further ancestry,
its body is the Dao alone.
Once it took root and stood firm,
heaven and earth congealed.
Nothing that is not illumined,
nothing that is not bright,
nothing that does not stand,
nothing that is not accomplished,
nothing that is not delivered,
nothing that is not born—
this is the Great Brahmā Heaven within Heaven.

The Great One’s true form
roams and strides the Jade Capital.
Ascending to the utmost height,
the Great Luo of Jade Purity.
Vast as kalpas and fathoms,
now present, now absent.
Riding the purity of the Dao,
the Three Origins array their palaces.
Using nine as the measure,
the Great One governs them.
Bestowing blessings and quelling warfare,
it transforms with the Dao.
Coeternal with the Primordial Beginning,
in movement and stillness, waxing and waning,
advancing and retreating, obscurity and brightness.
Before it lies the Golden Portal,
behind it the Jade Chamber.
To the east, mist contends; to the west, fog—
the Great One traverses these.
Extending and unfolding the Brahmā qi,
revolving through the ten directions.
Within are the spirits of the Three Origins and Nine Charts,
within are the Lords of the Jade Bureau who perform calculations,
within are the spirits of the *Yi*’s degrees and the Chamber of Transmigration,
within are the standard-bearers, the Year-Watchers, the Red-Turbaned, the Directing Talismans, the Venerable Elders,
within are the Great One, the Vanguard, the Rear Guard, the Eight Slayers, the Five Blessings, the Six Qi, the Nine Void Honored Spirits—
they restore bones and raise the dead,
delivering boundless beings.
Today, as the records are examined,
the various heavens descend to the imperial terrace.

The Great One, True August of the Three Origins and Nine Palaces of the Infinite East,
Great Sage of Boundless Deliverance and Eternal Life.
The Great One, True August of the Three Origins and Nine Palaces of the Infinite South,

The Great Ones, True August of the Ten Directions,
Great Spirits of Boundless Deliverance and Eternal Life,
all ride upon azure mists,
purple and white clouds intertwining,
flowing light illuminating the void,
cinnabar chariots and green carriages,
toad-wheel phoenix chariots,
feathered canopies and vermilion tassels,
shimmering and swaying.
Their steeds are nine-colored giant celestial beasts,
dragons of the Jade Throne swift as the whirlwind.
They bear the green-tasseled standards,
the Seven Luminaries’ spirit-penetrating banners,
ahead the Nine Songs resound in unison,
behind the Eight Sounds harmonize.
Celestial horses and apotropaic creatures,
dancing and prancing,
phoenixes, cranes, swans, and simurghs,
crying and gathering in flocks.
The Six Jia open the way,
Jade Maidens support the shafts,
myriad chariots and ten thousand riders,
floating through the void they come,
their radiant procession turning,
governing deliverance and salvation.

The Great One’s Directing Talismans,
the Three Origins and Nine Palaces,
deploy their strategies and cast their lots,
summoning the great spirits.
The Heavenly Eye, the Flying Bird,
measuring qi and reckoning time,
descend to the realms beyond,
blessings and misfortunes manifest in due season.
Holding registers and grasping records,
all arrive before the Thearch,
to be strictly examined by the various heavens
according to those to be delivered.

Universally proclaimed to the Three Realms,
the Nine Contingents and Eight Extremities,
the twenty-eight divisions,
and the lands they oversee:
war, famine, floods, drought,
sudden death, pestilence,
auspicious omens, blessings,
the sovereign’s longevity and virtue.
Matching talismans above and below,
mastery over all they traverse.
The Three Offices and Nine Bureaus,
the Twelve River Sources,
the configurations of yin and yang qi,
the inner and outer twelve hundred degrees of destiny,
the celestial realms and human domains,
governing blessings and misfortunes.
Extending even to the living people’s ancestors,
the myriad kalpas’ kindred spirits—
wherever blessings converge,
the Great One descends with qi,
the hidden souls are delivered,
the Dark Springs radiate light,
sins are erased from the ledgers,
evil roots extirpated,
none may detain or confine them,
nor herd them with ghostly multitudes.

By the Great One’s talismanic command,
they ascend in due time.
Welcoming the qi, reciting the scriptures,
ascending the altar and invoking the spirits,
to pray for blessings.
Though a land lies beneath the constellation of calamity,
if one sincerely prays and performs expiations,
the Three Offices sound their chariots’ wheels,
the Great One turns the procession,
disasters transform into blessings,
the realm enjoys great peace,
the Thearch’s reign endures for myriad years.
If a person’s fate is afflicted by impending harm,
by following the method and praying,
heavenly light will shine upon their body,
and they shall attain longevity in this world.

The Great One’s Purple Palace
bestows blessings upon heaven and humankind.
Even those who perish
depend on the measure of their fortune and blessings.
Then the Cold Pool of the Northern Capital
guards and protects their forms and souls,
restraining demons and ensuring promotion,
delivering them to the Southern Palace’s ranks.
The dead souls undergo refinement,
transmuting into immortals.
Those whose bodies receive deliverance
abide for kalpas without end.
Revolving with the charts,
governing the eras and years.
Those who know these spirits
become perfected immortals,
forever transcending the Three Calamities and Four Slayers,
the Five Ghosts and Six Harms,
the Seven Injuries, Eight Difficulties, and Nine Perils,
ascending beyond the Three Realms,
carefree in the Upper Purity.

In the heaven of Upper Purity,
the Jade Perfected of the Heavenly Thearch,
the colorless realm of Brahmā conduct.

The Eight Heavens of the East:
The Nine Palaces and Thirty-Two Heavens where the Great One (Taiyi) traverses,
with the nine-colored qi flowing through each palace.
The Thirty-Two Heavens are also divisions of the Nine Palaces,
where the Great One presides and governs.
Cultivators who visualize and absorb the celestial qi,
ward off harm and welcome fortune,
as true qi descends and the Great One responds,
enabling the attainment of immortality.
Those who rule the world regard this as the Heaven of Blessings,
offering prayers and petitions, where divine mechanisms respond instantly.

The Heaven of Feathered Perfected and Cavernous Emptiness,
where the Thearch’s goodness harmonizes with the abyssal void.
The Heaven of Primordial Islets and Flowing Auspices,
where the Thearch descends with luminous hibernation.
The Heaven of Purple Span and Nine Palaces,
where the Thearch’s splendor establishes the chest.
The Heaven of Grand Mystery and Stepping Qi,
where the Thearch awakens to eliminate excess life.
The Heaven of Jade Registers and Stored Fortune,
where the Thearch penetrates the floating left majesty.

where the Thearch’s law governs observation and waiting.
The Heaven of Harmonious Yang and Treasured Charts,
where the Thearch’s awakening bestows self-surpassing.
The Heaven of Radiant Brilliance and Concealed Luster,

The Eight Heavens of the South:
The Heaven of Crimson Calamity and Flying Wandering,
where the Thearch vigorously oversees the eaves.
The Heaven of Thunderous Stillness and Shining Spirit,

The Heaven of Flooding and Submerging Child’s Punishment,
where the Thearch’s dragon awakens the Great Net.
The Heaven of Spreading Transformation and Shining Separation,
where the Thearch unfurls authority.
The Heaven of Falling Mystery and Wandering Qi,
where the Thearch ascends the luminous ancestral temple.
The Heaven of Substantial Net and Brahmā’s Treasury,
where the Thearch safeguards prosperity and longevity.
The Heaven of Bright Assistance and Nurturing Madness,
where the Thearch’s vermilion liquid is offered at night.
The Heaven of Disciplined Rectitude and Reverent Correction,
where the Thearch pacifies the abyssal hall.

The Eight Heavens of the West:
The Heaven of Dao and Righteousness Permeating the True,
where the Thearch’s lush basket holds immortals.
The Heaven of Awakening to the True Principle,
where the Thearch discerns the hills and plains in silence.
The Heaven of Daoist Schemes and Heavy Expectations,
where the Thearch’s dragon shines without obstruction.
The Heaven of River Capitals and Chess Rivalry,

The Heaven of Nine Paths or Subtle Decline,
where the Thearch’s emolument banner connects all.
The Heaven of Sincere Removal and Overflowing Truth,
where the Thearch convenes the family’s absence.
The Heaven of Immortal Origins and Ordered Chaos,
where the Thearch’s radiance lifts the tripod’s light.
The Heaven of Blessed Convergence and Distant Domains,
