*In the court of the Great Crimson, Perfected Ones and Jade Assistants, the High Mystery transforms immortals, governing the nine ranks below.*
*Heavenly offices are opened; life knows no limit. Kalpic disasters do not strike; the vast expanse floats in emptiness.*
*Gazing down upon the distant realm, the twelve domains, the Eight Luminaries ascend in lofty clarity, traversing the Three Paths.*
*The numinous script transforms, manifesting at thought’s bidding. The great image unfolds—this is the Mysterious Brahma.*
*The Heaven within Heaven, the Three Sovereigns’ Cavernous Spirit, the Great Ultimate and Great Darkness, floating beyond the Jade Capital.*
*Golden Flower Dragon Mountain, the First Emperor treading the luminous, the Supreme Primordial Spirit, the Correct Primordial Mysterious Qi.*
*The threefold sacred apertures, ascending to the utmost, the Great Net of the Jade Clarity, vast as kalpas, neither existing nor ceasing.*
*Jade Flower’s grand banquet, the vastness of numinous chambers, golden gates and jasper towers, resplendent and orderly.*
*The upright qi of the Great Empyrean pervades the ten directions, descending to stabilize the eight directions and extend through the center.*
*The Great Cavern of the Yellow Elder, the transforming chapters of the Three Heavens, the primordial qi of the Central Void, safeguarding the world’s prosperity.*
*Within it dwells the divine spirit of the Great Crimson’s numinous script; within it dwells the Lord of Longevity of the Southern Culmen; within it dwells the Venerable One of Azure Florescence who preserves life; within it dwells the Great Deity of the Primordial August One who stabilizes existence; within it dwells the Venerable Han Lord who cherishes life; within it dwells the Primordial Crimson Supreme Unity, the Perfected Lord of the Purple Culmen; within it dwells the Luminous Jade Record of the Mysterious Dao, the Venerable Deity of the Southern Prosperity Bureau of Life and Transformation.*

The dead arise in transformed bones, the boundless deliver humankind—today the celestial tally is recorded, as all heavens descend to the imperial terrace.

The Limitless Flying Void Divine King of the East, the Great Saint of Longevity who delivers the boundless.
The Limitless Cinnabar Radiance Divine King of the South, the Great Saint of Longevity who delivers the boundless.
The Limitless White Cavern Divine King of the West, the Great Saint of Longevity who delivers the boundless.
The Limitless Purple Empyrean Divine King of the North, the Great Saint of Longevity who delivers the boundless.
The Limitless Eight Luminaries Divine King of the Northeast, the Great Saint of Longevity who delivers the boundless.
The Limitless Illuminating Transformation Divine King of the Southeast, the Great Saint of Longevity who delivers the boundless.
The Limitless Life-Dao Divine King of the Southwest, the Great Saint of Longevity who delivers the boundless.
The Limitless Qi-Ancestor Divine King of the Northwest, the Great Saint of Longevity who delivers the boundless.
The Limitless Numinous Movement Divine King of the Above, the Great Saint of Longevity who delivers the boundless.
The Limitless Safeguarding Stabilization Divine King of the Below, the Great Saint of Longevity who delivers the boundless.
The Perfected Divine Kings of the Ten Directions, Great Transformers who soar through the heavens and deliver the world—boundless great deities.

Together they ride the azure-luminous jade-empyrean chariots, the Cavern-Yang cinnabar palanquins, the phoenix-perfected plain canopies, the Eight Luminaries jade wheels.
They drive the nine-dragon vast-and-boundless carriages, raise the vermilion-cloud flying-life chariots.
They brandish the command-sage’s staffs, the ten-flowered great banners; before them, jade hymns are sung in unison; behind them, harmonious chants resound as one.
Lions and striped unicorns roar to repel evil; the Five Wefts open the paths, the Dipper’s handle and crossbar flank the way.
A hundred million chariots and ten thousand riders float through the void, their light cascading as they turn their reins to oversee the deliverance of the living.

The great marshals of the Three Heavens, the venerable elders of high rank, the Perfected Kings of the Four Poles, the numinous spirits of the Nine Heavens—
holding registers and grasping ledgers, they assemble before the August One, following those to be delivered as they strictly examine the heavens.
The Great Crimson Numinous Script’s divine qi flows in mystery, transforming above into the celestial palaces, extending below to the deepest springs.
The Most High wields the tally, the Supreme August One transcribes the chapters, universally proclaiming to the Three Realms and the azure empyrean’s divine lands.
The star-arrayed bureaus, the Northern Culmen’s primordial net, the Three Enclosures and Nine Paths, the Twelve Celestial Thoroughfares—
they swiftly release ancestors and forebears, kin of a hundred kalpas, swiftly erase the ledgers of transgressions, sever the roots of evil.
No longer detained, their forms unite with the lofty immortals; by the Primordial Beginning’s talismanic command, they ascend in due time.
In the Northern Capital’s Frigid Pool, the guardians of form and soul restrain demons, ensure promotion, and deliver ranks to the Southern Palace.
The dead souls undergo refinement, transformed into immortals; the living receive deliverance, enduring through kalpas without end.
Revolving with the kalpas, their years equal heaven’s. Forever delivered from the Three Paths, Five Sufferings, and Eight Difficulties, they transcend the Three Realms and roam freely in the Highest Clarity.

In the Highest Clarity’s heavens, the Celestial Emperor’s Cavern Clarity—a realm of formlessness, the practice of brahmā-conduct.

The Eight Heavens of the East:
The Celestial of Benevolent Numinous Perfection, where the Emperor Hou governs the harmonious unfolding.
The Celestial of Grotto Numinous Firmness, where the Emperor Ba radiates connectedness.
The Celestial of the Great Unity’s Contemplative Wandering, where the Emperor Zhi traverses the vast borders.
The Celestial of August Awakening and Ancestral Celebration, where the Emperor Xian reveals the secret vastness.
The Celestial of Nine Transformations and Mysterious Yellow, where the Emperor Du resides in Jingnanu.
The Celestial of Cloud Ford and Mastery, where the Emperor Meng weighs the minute.
The Celestial of Lofty Numinous Aid to Life, where the Emperor Lu abides in constant stillness.
The Celestial of Numinous Thunder and Eight Powers, where the Emperor Yu nurtures Shang Gengyuan.

The Eight Heavens of the South:
The Celestial of Vermilion Mound and Pledged Worthies, where the Emperor Xian offers thoughts of compassion.
The Celestial of Cinnabar Vault and Utmost Subtlety, where the Emperor Han harmonizes the Cavern Script.
The Celestial of Supreme Virtue and Great Ancestry, where the Emperor Mo silently presides over the rare.
The Celestial of Scenic August and Numinous Dragon, where the Emperor Dang harmonizes the spreading mist.
The Celestial of Mysterious Dao and Penetrating Sagacity, where the Emperor Fang delivers the scorching radiance.
The Celestial of Nurturing Spirit and Inspired Thought, where the Emperor Yang raises Xi and Lingbang.
The Celestial of Central Numinous True Insight, where the Emperor Xiu suffuses with jade’s fragrance.
The Celestial of Cinnabar Refinement and Divine Rectitude, where the Emperor Hu calls forth Zhen and Qizhen.

The Eight Heavens of the West:
The Celestial of Jade Perfection and Solemn Beauty, where the Emperor Zuo rules Liang Shisun.
The Celestial of Memorial Immortals and Rare Blessings Descending Mystery, where the Emperor Duo rests Hua Xiyin.
The Celestial of Root-Tail and Primordial Spirit, where the Emperor Zhuo’s toes transcend time.
The Celestial of Great Thousand and Benevolent Stillness, where the Emperor Ding’s crown is the empty true soul.
The Celestial of Mysterious Dao and Transformative Rites, where the Emperor Shi offers blessings and ancestral rites to Wen.
The Celestial of Celebrating Yang and Virtue’s Vastness, where the Emperor Zhao begins Bo Yuan.
The Celestial of Universal Conduct and Celebrating Blessings, where the Emperor Wu governs Qiang Li Rong.
The Celestial of Lofty Numinous Proclaiming Wisdom, where the Emperor Bi’s child tends to Jing Ji.

The Eight Heavens of the North:
The Celestial of Mysterious Numinous Clarity of Intent, where the Emperor Liao comprehends the Cavern Subtlety.
The Celestial of Treasure Courier and Fixed Perfection, where the Emperor Yi peacefully transforms Yi.
The Celestial of Fourfold Clarity and Jade Dragon, where the Emperor Zhao manifests the Northern Mystery’s chapters.
The Celestial of Upholding Splendor and Gazing the Ultimate, where the Emperor Bao embraces the void and relinquishes Juan.
The Celestial of Treasure Movement and Cavern Spirit’s Vast Aid, where the Emperor Yue gazes upon Gao.
The Celestial of Empyrean Culmination and Primordial Dew’s Initiation, where the Emperor Zu begins Chang Ming.
The Celestial of Supreme Void and Luminous Spirit, where the Emperor Duo’s pillar unfolds Bang.
The Celestial of Congealing Transformation and Net Cloud, where the Emperor Mian glances at Suo Bu An.

The Thirty-Two Heavens, the Thirty-Two Emperors—each heaven’s hidden taboos, each heaven’s concealed names.
Within the heavens, the empty caverns; the Great Crimson Numinous Script; each heaven’s hidden rhymes, the Supreme Ultimate’s sounds.
The honorable of the Great Darkness, the divine of the Great Void.
The true demons of the mysterious qi, the numinous of the Great Crimson.
Divine qi harmonizes and unites, transforming into the Great Clarity; the boundless mysteries are too profound to detail.
The Numinous Script is disseminated, universally delivering celestial and human beings.
Today, rejoicing in the reception of deliverance, passing through the heavens’ barriers, they beseech the eradication of the Three Evils and the severing of earthly roots.
Bearing the Numinous Script, their names are inscribed in the Supreme Mystery; the Perfected Kings oversee their promotion, unrestrained at the celestial gates.
The Eastern Dipper engenders perception, the Western Dipper receives destiny, the Northern Dipper divides spirit, the Southern Dipper attains nature, the Central Dipper embodies true intent—thus the Five Offices are rectified.
The Azure Emperor’s jade script, the White Emperor’s golden script, the Crimson Emperor’s cinnabar radiance, the Black Emperor’s mysterious crystal, the Yellow Emperor’s perfected intent—flying spirits summon the numinous.
The Azure Script Divine King roars with the thunderous qi of the East.
The Crimson Script Divine King crushes and subdues demonic evil.
The White Script Divine King strikes with wind and fire.
The Black Script Divine King opens all obstructions.
The Yellow Script Divine King flourishes the primordial transformation.
The Five Script Divine Kings, the mighty of the Great Crimson.

The Transformative Numinous Script, the ancestral authority of the myriad spirits,
soars and drums in accompaniment, commanding the immortal legions.
Brandishing standards and beating rhythms, it roams the Great Void,
radiant with brilliance, where all heavens unite in merit.

Those who wear the Numinous Script strictly subdue the Northern Feng,
as the Divine Kings receive their mandate to universally sweep away inauspiciousness.
The Jade Rhinoceros annihilates the vile; the Golden Beasts charge in four directions.
Fire-soldiers lead the advance; divine standards bear the banners.
Crimson phoenixes stream with bells; lightning and smoke surge forth.
Clouds and thunder strike fiercely; green-fanged apes devour.
Should any dare to challenge or obstruct the Numinous Script,
the golden axes execute first, the mighty swords punish thereafter.
Demons and specters are butchered; wind and fire never cease.
Thousands upon thousands are beheaded; tens of thousands upon tens of thousands have their souls slain.
Demons dare not trespass; ghosts harbor no malevolent essence.
The Three Offices and Northern Feng rigorously examine the sources of evil,
allowing no concealment—swift as the Golden Horse Courier, all is reported.

Universally proclaimed without end, the myriad spirits all heed.
The Three Realms and Five Emperors declare to the Highest Clarity.

**The Precious Chapter of the Numinous Script of the Great Crimson Heaven of Grand Clarity**
Written in vermilion on azure bamboo slips,
burned to ash on the Three Primordials’ days,
consumed with east-flowing water,
it commands ghosts and spirits, granting seated knowledge of longevity.
Those who wear it as immortals find stone spirits bowing in reverence, all endeavors succeeding.
Those who grasp its essence attain the Dao and ascend to perfection.

Primordial qi undergoes refinement; true fire blazes through the cavern.
Ninety-nine thousand nine qi transform into vermilion script.
When the six sixes’ count is complete, the celestial origin is perfected—
jade towers and cinnabar palaces, soaring pavilions of the divine capital.

Of old, within the Mysterious Womb, the initial dragon had not yet flourished.
Through countless eons in the midst of primordial chaos,
above, no color existed; below, no abyss.
Winds coursed through the empty void, accumulating hardness into firmness.
Firmness’s nature became metal; metal dew flowed as springs.
Springs became white water, which received the metal abyss.
Metal and water congealed, transforming into earth and generating heaven.
Above heaven and below heaven, no darkness, no obscurity,
no form, no shadow, no limit, no end—
the vast, uncarved primordial, boundless and lightless.
The Great Crimson’s Numinous Script operates and conveys naturally.
The Primordial Beginning pacifies and stabilizes; the Cinnabar Origin is the supreme scripture.
Vermilion script and jade characters, fire-forged dragon script,
preserve and regulate the kalpic destiny, ensuring heaven’s eternal endurance.

Primordial qi pervades the boundless; myriad patterns unfold.
Original essence flows and cascades through the thirty-two passes.
Revolving without color, it ascends into the Muddy Pellet,
circulating through the ten directions, treading fire and wading springs.
Rotating the Dipper and traversing the Winnowing Basket,
it cycles through the five constants.
White clouds transform into liquid; jade dew and mysterious frost.
Thirty-five divisions gather qi into the Upper Origin.
The Eight Effulgences merge in darkness; qi enters the Mysterious-Mysterious.
Within the mysterious dwells the utmost numinous—
the Primordial Lady, the Mysterious Sovereign,
floating through the Purple Void, whistling and chanting cavernous tones.
Golden radiance harmonizes qi, flowing through the cloud palaces.
Jade tones transform into effulgences; divine luminosity revolves with the wind.
The Grand Clarity’s supreme transformation flourishes in eightfold splendor.
A thousand harmonies, ten thousand unions—naturally attaining perfection.
Within perfection dwells the spirit, the Great Lord of Longevity,
the Most Mysterious of the Golden Watchtower, the White Prime of the Non-Ultimate.
The Jade Consort of Flourishing Yang, the Supreme Perfected of the Great One,
the Nine Palaces’ Controller of Destiny, the Peach and Ginseng of Longevity.
Grasping the Numinous Script, they preserve life and root existence,
roaming the Highest Clarity, entering and exiting the Flourishing Chamber.
Within the Eight Darknesses, amid the minutest subtleties,
they descend to guard the human body—the Muddy Pellet and Crimson Palace.
Centrally governing the five qi, blending the hundred spirits,
ten revolutions return the numinous; myriad qi unite as immortals.
The immortal Dao values life; the qi of life conveys humanity.
Opening the eight gates above, the celestial methods are transmitted.
Transgressions and blessings, prohibitions and karmic conditions—
universally received and delivered, the dead souls gain new bodies.
Those whose bodies receive new life ascend to report to the heavens.
Above the heavens, each has its gate of life.
Within lies the chapter of the Empty Cavern’s chants,
the numinous scripture of the Perfected Kings, whose words join the loftiest perfected.

**First: Primordial Qi Generates the Flying Song of the Great Crimson Heaven**
Red and black in equal measure, it is called the Mysterious.
Subtle yin and wondrous yang—also named the Grand Origin.
Vast emptiness without defilement, the original substance made clear.
Comparing this luminous emptiness, it names itself through self-cultivation.
Red and black come to reside; primordial qi then spreads.
The Mysterious is yin and yang, distant and unopened in diagrams.
When yin is exhausted, the red appears—the Great Crimson is its domain.
Below the Highest Clarity, above the seed people,
it governs the twelve heavens, the Supreme’s abode.
The third qi’s contemplation is the Dao’s celestial thoroughfare.
Like one who practices the Dao, desiring to exhaust the shadow’s residue—
if the mind’s emptiness is incomplete, the shadow’s traces remain.
Unpenetrated by the Dao, one is constrained by emptiness.
Thus it is called Grand Clarity, the courtyard of the nine immortals.
Only by eliminating shadows and forsaking desire can the Dao be seen.
If you do not know the true, you merely dwell in mountains and forests.
The Great Crimson possesses the Numinous Script—chanting it, you ride the whirlwind’s wheel.

**Second: The Great Crimson Heaven as the Immortal Realm of Grand Clarity**
Qi vast and boundless, pure yang emits smoke.
Refined by true fire, red jade becomes heaven.
Before the fire’s color subsides, the Great Crimson gains its name.
When fire departs and truth remains, the Grand Clarity is vast and desolate.
Cinnabar towers become palaces; purple clouds become courtyards.
Towering within the Great Crimson, above it connects the Jade Capital.
The Supreme dons yellow brocade robes, floating through effulgences with golden bells.
To the left, nine dragons are commanded to harness; to the right, divine tigers are reined.
Wind and rain lead the advance; bells and drums form the rear guard.
The demons of the Three Realms’ heavens bow their heads, entreating true deliverance.
Yin and yang rightly descend to the dust; all things are stirred by this dance.
The Great Crimson’s Numinous Script is revered by all lofty spirits.

**Third: The Divine Transformation of the Numinous Script’s Perfected King, Sung**
Primordial qi like broken threads rides the wind like a wandering dragon.
Floating, floating through the Great Void, nine suns arise within.
Spontaneously, the Great Crimson’s color, curved like a slanted bow.
Weaving emptiness, it forms characters—the Numinous Script’s body soars aloft.
The august one wields the purple brush, naturally matching the celestial perfected.
Talismanic writings command the myriad spirits; the merit of conveying humanity is boundless.
If you can arouse faith in your heart and wear it, gazing up to the vault of heaven,
swallowing and summoning primordial qi, jade nectar flows freely.
The stomach’s pool generates crimson smoke; bones and joints are polished like bronze.

The Six Dings come bearing silken cloths, transforming the mysteries of the nether darkness.
Whistling songs, they ascend to the Great Purity; their divine movement leaves no trace.
Above these Three Realms, amid the flight through emptiness,
the True King’s song resounds—its tones interweave with cavernous hymns.
Recite it a hundred times, and your name is recorded in the Southern Palace.
Recite it a thousand times, and the True King personally welcomes you.
After ten thousand recitations, the Dao is complete: you soar through the Great Void,
pass beyond the Three Realms, and ascend to the rank of Immortal Duke.
Those who hear the numinous sound—before the True King’s reverent form,
he commands the earth spirits to attend and escort them.
Drawn forth from the earthly gate, freed from the Five Sufferings and Eight Hardships,
their seven generations of ancestors ascend, forever departing the Yellow Springs’ barrier.
Their souls cross to the Divine Empyrean, undergo refinement, and are reborn—
this is called the boundless, the universal deliverance without end.

There exists a secret celestial scripture, revered by all heavens.
Those who leak or slight it fall into hell, their misfortune extending to seven generations of ancestors.
The Dao declares: These two chapters are the Great Crimson’s numinous script,
the hidden tones of the Celestial Thearchs.
They harmonize heaven and pacify earth, exorcise and stabilize the nation,
induce perfection when worn, avert calamity and dispel misfortune,
assist the Dao’s transformation above, and eternally protect the people.
All are the words of the Great Brahma, not the common speech of the mundane world.
Their words lack ornate beauty, their melodies lack florid grace—
thus they are called profound and obscure, difficult to fathom in detail.
Treasured by the heavens, they are secreted in the Divine Empyrean’s Jade Purity Jade Treasury’s eastern repository.
The Dao Lord enacts the teaching, transmitted below in accord with the karmic moment.
If there be a perfected person who offers gold and precious goods with sincere heart,
following the ancient protocol to pledge alliance with the Jade Purity,
only then shall they be bestowed.

The Dao declares: The Great Crimson’s numinous script is the origin of the Three Qi,
rescuing those on the brink of death, accomplishing all without fail.
When heaven and earth’s revolutions reach their end, when sun, moon, and five planets wane and wax,
when the most sagely divine persons prosper or decline, when lesser scholars fall ill or perish—
whenever such disasters occur, all of like qi must unite in heart to perform purification rites,
burn incense in the six periods, and recite the scripture ten times.
Virtue and blessing will descend at once, dissolving all inauspicious omens.
This boundless script is the universal deliverance without end.

The Dao declares: When lesser Dao students, their immortal rank not yet fulfilled,
face the karmic moment of passing, their bodies entering the Great Yin—
at the hour of their departure, their fellow students and perfected persons
shall burn incense and recite the scripture ten times to deliver the corpse according to ritual.
With the Great Crimson’s numinous script, written in cinnabar on azure silk,
worn upon the body or placed before the heart,
the soul will ascend directly to the Southern Palace,
there to be reborn according to the merit of their studies, their days counted.
No longer bewildered by the turning wheel, they attain divine immortality.

The Dao declares: When heaven and earth’s revolutions end,
when stellar lodgings fall into disarray, when sun and moon lose their light,
when the four seasons falter, when yin and yang fall out of harmony,
when the nation suffers calamity, when demonic qi flows freely,
when pestilence and plague spread, when the people perish and are harmed,
when teachers and friends pass away, when loved ones meet their end—
in all such times, perform purification rites, burn incense, and recite the scripture.
The merit is most weighty:
above, it dissolves celestial disasters and safeguards the emperor;
below, it exorcises poison and harm, delivering the people.
In life and death, all depend upon it—its blessings are beyond measure.
Thus it is called boundless, the universal deliverance of heaven and humanity.

The Dao declares: Whoever possesses this scripture
and performs these meritorious deeds for the Thearchs of heaven and earth and the people—
on days of disaster, if they arouse their hearts to sponsor rites,
burn incense, and recite the scripture ten times,
all the heavens record their names, and the myriad spirits attend and protect them.
Those who distinguish themselves as perfected persons shall become ministers of the Golden Gates of the Sage Lord.
The heavens record the merits and faults of all people, not missing even the slightest measure.
The True King of the Celestial Center also vouches for your words and person.

The boundless hidden speech of the Great Brahma in the heavens—
*Composed by the Dao Lord*
*The Central Chapter of the Primordial Great Crimson’s Numinous Script*
*The Eight Heavens of the Eastern Direction*

At Yi and Tan, embracing the seasons, the azure springs are dim and obscure.
Through cavernous passes and forked capitals, the land winds in reverence and turns in awe.
The radiance of the Primordial Immortal’s site gleams; the halls congeal with subtle masters.
The banner of Jianhu remains unfurled; compassionate knocks draw forth the mechanism.
Profound benefits are further explored; depths multiply their branches and covenants.
Hence the realm hastens in frequency; the Dao refines and the mountains rest.
Qi weaves through the Dark and Yellow; the unseen moves through the regions.
The Pure and Mighty Han Palace unfolds its warp and treads upon firmness.

*The Eight Heavens of the Southern Direction*

The essence-child floats in dawn’s glow; seven reflections mirror the jade pool.
The settled steeds of qi are rewarded; the profound ripples are clarified and stilled.
Flowering strands meet the fluid; the spirit perches where the soul bows.
Gentle luster bathes in moisture; sudden radiance is concealed and held.
Bright and joyful, roaming in forbearance; careful crossing knows no constancy.
Refined threads gather wondrous saltiness; the tranquil and free raise their cheeks.
The Purple Mountain’s Great Void—trust and thought are fitting for merit.
Inquiring of immortals shines with clarity; cinnabar brightens and jade glimmers.

*The Eight Heavens of the Western Direction*

In stillness, what is there to do? Guarding the spirit, its radiance is complete.
Vast brilliance alternates with luminescence; transformations bind the Kunlun peaks.
The Dao nurtures and the essence transmits; overflowing cries compose the seasons.
Celestial nectar ripples of itself; dark splendor illumines the River of Stars.
Seals of command bestow charts; Yin’s balance subdues demons.
The fountains’ hosts are restrained; the fierce are beheaded and the malevolent slain.
The script of the numinous commands the perfected; it guards the Golden Gates of the Thearch.
Awaiting the sea, listening to emptiness; the substance of sincerity receives the tally.

*The Eight Heavens of the Northern Direction*

The Dipper’s handle grasps the Chou; principles and words transform into immortals.
True exchanges are resplendent and blazing; qi abounds in the dark springs.
Grasping the pendants, they greet the desert; establishing regions, they follow the walls.
The stalks of destiny bear nine teeth; the couriers’ shrines stretch in continuity.
The toad’s essence blends with the blossoms; the Dipper’s clans meet in chariots.
The Han oversees the Lesser Primordial; the Mounds draw from the First Chamber.
Judgments disperse the Cao decrees; the Horn innovates and the Platter departs from its dish.
The Moon’s outskirts and Du’s palace; Teng’s brightness and Ruan’s radiance.

The Dao states: These are the boundless hidden speeches of the Great Brahma in the heavens,
the sounds of the immeasurable, ancient texts inscribed upon the Crimson Towers of the Great Red Heaven,
to govern the affairs of heaven and earth, assist the transformations of Yin and Yang,
and command the myriad spirits. Each character spans a full *zhang* in breadth.
The Heavenly Perfected Sovereign of Old inscribed these words to establish the correct sounds.
Those who know these sounds and can purify themselves to recite them—
all the heavens dispatch the divine kings of the Red Heaven to descend and observe their persons,
record their diligent merits, and report them to the Divine Empyrean.
The myriad spirits pay homage; the earthly deities attend at their gates.
The Great Merit True King vouches for them before the Upper Clarity.
When the Dao is complete and they distinguish themselves, they may wander the Three Realms
and ascend through the Golden Gates.

These sounds repel nothing, dispel nothing, deliver nothing they do not, and accomplish nothing they do not.
They are the natural sounds of the Heavenly Perfected.
Thus, to recite them is to make the numinous script appear in the void,
purple clouds fill the chamber, a hundred spirits attend at the eaves, and ten thousand immortals pay homage.
To wear them is to have the Thearch descend with a tally; the Eight Effulgences ascend at dawn.
To ingest them is to blend the five viscera, circulate the jade essence,
delight the Three Primordials, and congeal auspicious qi.
To embody them is to wander in the Grand Clarity, ride the crimson qi,
wondrously merge with the Great Void, and transcend the ten thousand existences.
To divide one’s form into a thousand myriads, to sit and yet be gone, to stand and yet vanish—
the chiming of jade pendants resounds, the ten directions grow solemn and clear,
rivers and seas fall silent, mountains and peaks swallow their mists.
Numinous demons submit in awe; immortals are summoned and gathered.
Emptiness and clarity unite with the mysterious; spiritual transformations arise naturally.
Dark wisdom pervades the pure; through vast kalpas, nothing shifts.

*The Upper Chapter of the Numinous Treasure’s Immeasurable Scripture for the Salvation of Humanity, Scroll Ten, Concludes*

*Scroll Eleven: The Jade Brightness’s Conveyance of Salvation*

The Dao spoke: Long ago, in the Azure Vault of Heaven, within the Great Jeweled Realm of Jade Radiance, the Primordial Beginning bestowed the *Jade Brightness’s Conveyance of Salvation*, the Immeasurable Upper Scripture. When the Primordial Heavenly Worthy was to expound this sutra, he circumambulated ten times to summon the ten directions, and only then ascended his seat. Celestial perfected spirits, exalted sages, transcendents of wondrous practice, and boundless multitudes arrived riding the void. Purple auroras flared with splendor; crimson blossoms unfurled their hues. Phoenix-borne chariots and dragon-drawn carriages, cloud-canopied and rainbow-wheeled, cast shimmering shadows, their fivefold colors luminously intermingling, adorning the vast firmament with resplendence.

For nine days and nine nights, the sun, moon, and stars of all heavens, along with the lingering glow of dawn, halted their courses. The Jade Celestial Mechanism stilled its light; the Golden Balance ceased its motion. Divine winds hushed; clouds withdrew from seas and mountains. The six qi aligned in clarity. Throughout the land, mountains, rivers, forests, and groves leveled as one, no longer high or low. The earth transformed into jade brightness, its azure hue undifferentiated.

The assembled perfected ones took their seats as the Primordial Heavenly Worthy, in profound repose, occupied the floating jeweled throne—an efflorescence of golden ninefold phoenix qi. After he expounded the sutra once, the celestial great sages simultaneously voiced their approval. At that time, the men and women of the land enjoyed long lives, free from calamity or premature death.

When he expounded it a second time, waters surged and fires descended; harm and punishment ceased to arise. A third recitation harmonized the six qi, and the world grew tranquil. A fourth brought forth wondrous incense wafting through the sky, with floating canopies filling the void. A fifth caused mountains and marshes to manifest auspicious signs—jade gleamed and pearls drifted. A sixth awakened beings to the roots of life and death, as spirits attested to the true realm. A seventh purified the denizens of the Desire Realm, eradicating all dust-like defilements. An eighth equalized the five movements, and the myriad things flourished. A ninth drew the gaze of heavenly light downward, illuminating the dark prisons. A tenth universally conveyed salvation, deeply imparting the Dharma gate.

At that time, every man and woman of the land turned their hearts in devotion, all receiving protection and deliverance, attaining longevity without end.

The Dao spoke: When the Primordial Heavenly Worthy expounded the sutra once, the boundless multitudes of the *Jade Brightness’s Conveyance of Salvation* Perfected Great Spirits from the immeasurable Upper Realm of the East arrived floating through the void. A second recitation summoned those from the South; a third, the West; a fourth, the North. A fifth brought those from the Northeast; a sixth, the Southeast; a seventh, the Southwest; an eighth, the Northwest. A ninth called forth those from the Upper Realm; a tenth, the Lower Realm. When the ten recitations were complete, the Perfected Great Spirits of the *Jade Brightness’s Conveyance of Salvation* from the ten immeasurable directions arrived simultaneously. The men and women of the land turned their hearts in reverence.

From afar, they beheld the Primordial Beginning ascend his seat to preach the Dharma, scattering great radiance that illumined the boundless heavens and worlds. The men and women of the land, along with the celestial beings—numberless in their multitudes—each dwelled in their own heaven, abiding in their own transformed realm. Each listened with rapt attention, reverently hearing the Heavenly Worthy’s jade-like voice resound as he proclaimed the subtle *Jade Brightness’s Conveyance of Salvation*. Then they conferred among themselves, saying: "The Primordial Heavenly Worthy now expounds the *Jade Brightness’s Conveyance of Salvation*, revealing the reckoning of great and small kalpas. We know that the root of life and death for all celestial and human beings lies entirely in this conveyance. The reckoning of conveyance originates in yin and yang. The qi of yin and yang is none other than life and death. Yang qi is life; yin qi is death. Once we take form through the turning of yin and yang, the reckoning of life, death, and conveyance arises. If we attain the Dao and ascend into formlessness, transcending yin and yang, then life and death—and the reckoning of great and small kalpas—will cease to bind us. Let us, this great assembly, each direct our minds to the Great Jeweled Heaven of Azure Vault, to entreat the essential teaching: How does one cultivate the *Jade Brightness’s Conveyance of Salvation*? How does one depart from yin and yang, escape life and death, realize the wondrous embodied existence, become a great Dharma king, and deliver all beings from the vast kalpa-sea?"

Those who came were like fine rain or dense mist—boundless multitudes so vast that half the land sank beneath their weight, an influx beyond restraint. Thereupon, the Primordial Beginning suspended a single precious pearl, no larger than a millet grain, in the void five measures above the earth. Ascending with divine guidance, the Perfected Great Spirits, exalted sages, transcendents of wondrous practice, and boundless multitudes all entered the pearl. Gazing upward, the celestial beings saw only a shimmering stream entering the pearl’s mouth. Once within, they knew not where they were.

Then the Primordial Beginning revealed a divine transformation: within the pearl, the vastness embraced the heavens of the ten directions and all lands. Amidst the great assembly, he emanated purple-golden radiance, forming sevenfold hues. From each color arose clouds of wondrous fragrance, suffusing the pearl’s interior. Turning his sapphire-lotus eyes, he gazed down upon the multitude, then took up a table inlaid with hundred-jeweled, dragon-carved auspicious jade. His voice, harmonious and joyful, addressed the great assembly: "Jade Brightness is the celestial designation of innate talent."

The myriad heavens each enact their revolutions, their revolutions ceaseless, and birth-and-death unending. All celestial beings, ensnared by views of activity and inactivity, toil and repose, fall into the revolutions, forsake the ocean of virtue and power, and enter the stream of birth-and-death. This arises from sentient beings’ minds clinging to preferences, severing habitual views, and yielding to greed, desire, joy, and anger. They enter the forging of yin and yang, the revolutions’ transformations, dying and being born ten thousand times, never attaining formlessness, never recognizing the essence of the Dao.

Now I proclaim the essential Dharma, the radiant revolutions. These revolutions are the reckoning of Heaven and Earth. One yin, one yang—these are the roots of Heaven and Earth, the roots of birth-and-death. Qi has beginning and end, thus there is the reckoning of revolutions. Heaven’s reckoning shifts slightly every thirty years, transforms in a century, and undergoes great change every five hundred years. Three great changes make one epoch, three epochs make a grand completion—six thousand years in all. Heaven’s round has twelve guiding principles, Earth’s square has twelve records. Heaven’s guiding principles span three hundred sixty days, completing one revolution. Earth’s records turn three thousand three hundred days, advancing the mechanism once. Heaven’s revolution completes three hundred sixty cycles as yang surges—three hundred years. Earth’s mechanism advances three thousand three hundred degrees as yin wanes—thirty thousand years. When nine thousand nine hundred degrees pass, Heaven and Earth’s qi intermingle, totaling ninety thousand years, called the Great Yang Nine, the Great Hundred Six, the Great Kalpa Revolution. The Lesser Yang Nine, Lesser Hundred Six, and Lesser Kalpa Revolution follow likewise.

At the time of the Great Revolution, Heaven’s qi is exhausted in the Supreme Yin, becoming fire. Earth’s qi reaches its limit in the Supreme Yang, becoming water. The two qi oppose each other, and all things dissolve. Then the primordial qi reunites, returning to chaos—this is called the reckoning of kalpas. When the Great Kalpa arrives, the disasters of water and fire ascend to the heights above the Three Realms and descend to the depths below the Nine Earths, annihilating all without a trace. Since all things are born of yin and yang, they perish with these two qi. Above the Three Realms, the heavens of the Four Peoples, and the realm where I dwell—the Three Clarities’ Great Luo City, the ultimate boundary of the Dao—water and fire cannot reach, calamities do not arrive, transcending the dual qi of yin-yang and birth-death.

Nine great revolutions make one kalpa, eighty-one myriad years form the Great Revolution. Ninety thousand years make a Lesser Kalpa, the Lesser Revolution. When the Great Kalpa Revolution concludes, from my realm flow forth golden texts and jade characters, dragon-script and phoenix-writings, all scriptures returning to the Great Luo Jade Capital. Chaos divides anew, the true texts reemerge, sages disseminate them, transmitting them once more to the world below.

All sentient beings who weary of birth-and-death, sever all defilements and worldly habits, and cause this spirit-qi to wondrously merge with the Great Void—its empty essence being natural, not belonging to yin and yang—will be free from birth-and-death. Harmonizing with this wondrous emptiness, they respond to thoughts by manifesting forms, ascending into formlessness. When the revolutions end, they soar into the Great Luo, escape the Three Realms’ lands, forever leave birth-and-death, attain the Dao’s fruition, and become Celestial Perfected—only then is it called "attaining the Dao."

All sentient beings who study the Dao dwell in the Lesser Vehicle, some with lifespans spanning kalpas, flying and traveling, multiplying forms and scattering shadows, riding dragons and phoenixes—these are all attachments, not yet called "exhaustion of outflows." Hearing these words, the great assembly transcended the Three Voids, realized the Supreme Perfected Dao, the multitudes dispersed, and the land returned to levelness, no longer slanting or sinking.

Then, within the pearl, the Primordial Beginning completed the sutra’s discourse. The Perfected Ones oversaw the transmission, bestowing it upon me. At that moment, joy and celebration were beyond words. The Dharma affair roughly concluded, the celestial beings returned to their positions. In an instant, silence reigned—utter stillness without remnant echo.

At that time, celestial beings who encountered the sutra’s Dharma universally attained deliverance, preserving their original years without harm. The entire land turned in reverence, all realizing the Supreme Perfection. Killing, harm, jealousy, lust, theft, greed, hatred, and all karmic minds dissolved into emptiness. They saw neither yin nor yang, neither birth nor death. Speech was free from fear and attachment, mouths devoid of wishes and fortune. Equal in compassion, they transformed strangers into kin. The land was secure, the people prosperous, rejoicing in great peace.

From the sutra’s initial teaching, those with utmost sincerity in one realm followed the Dao, revered and honored it, all attaining deliverance from the world. The Dao declared: The Primordial Heavenly Worthy’s sutra contains the inner names of the Jade Brightness Emperor, hidden rhymes and sounds—also the inner taboos of demon kings, the concealed names of the hundred spirits.

Know that primordial qi is the root of birth-and-death, and yin-yang is the gate of birth-and-death. Birth-and-death arise from revolutions. If revolutions do not arise, there is no death. Attaining the Dao and becoming Perfected, embodying the Great Void, forever leaving birth-and-death, transcending the Three Realms—these are not the common words of the world. The Supreme Perfected, having become Perfected Ones, penetrate the mysterious and investigate the subtle.

Those who master its chapters and recite them ten times will have the myriad heavens chant from afar, the ten thousand emperors pay homage, rivers and seas fall silent, mountains and peaks conceal their clouds. Heaven’s gates cease movement, Earth’s mechanisms halt, revolutions pause, and people attain longevity. Demons bind their forms, ghostly spirits lose their clarity, the dead revive, and white bones become human.

For devoted scholars who recite it ten times, the Five Phases align harmoniously, yin and yang remain unharmed, revolutions and transformations endure, bringing fortune, joy, longevity, and health. Demon spirits lose their sight, ghostly demons lose their clarity, delivering the dying and reviving the deceased. The reason is this: scholars and Perfected Ones are bound by qi to yin and yang, their bodies not yet penetrating the true. They summon and command the ten directions, their might not yet governing Heaven’s governance, their virtue able to subdue Earth’s deities, bind demonic spirits, and merely delay death—but cannot restore life.

Those who recite this chapter lightly will bring misfortune upon themselves. Honoring and revering it will cause households to flourish, generations to prosper, forming good karmic connections. Ten thousand calamities will not approach, and divine beings will guard the gates.

This scripture is most venerable and wondrous, unmatched in the Jade Capital, delivering boundless beings and serving as the origin of all Dao. Its majestic and vast model is of virtue too great to be surpassed.

The Dao declares: Those who recite this scripture ten times will summon all the heavens, which will open the radiance of deliverance. Those sunk in dark ignorance, bidding farewell to yin and yearning for yang, along with the suffering souls of billions of ancestors, will all be delivered at once. They will ascend to the Crimson Palace, where after nine years of refinement, they will be transformed and reborn as noble persons.

Those who diligently study this scripture, their merit complete and virtue perfected, will all attain immortality, soaring to the Golden Gates and roaming the Jade Capital. Advanced scholars who cultivate and recite this scripture will be delivered at once, ascending to the Southern Palace. When the people of the world recite it, the Jade Luminance descends with qi, and the Way of Life comes to dwell, extending their years and granting long life. Thereafter, they will all attain the Way of Corpse Liberation. Their souls will briefly dissolve, avoiding the hells, and immediately regain form, roaming the vast heavens.

This scripture is subtle and wondrous, universally delivering the limitless. All heavenly beings receive its blessings. Boundless fortune bestows grace upon life and death. Treasured by the heavens above, it is not transmitted to the lower world. Only the most devoted scholars, offering gold and treasures with sincere hearts and swearing oaths to Heaven, may receive it. To carelessly leak or profane it brings calamity upon nine generations, condemning them to long servitude under the ghostly officials.

Five Emperors attend this scripture, along with twenty-four Jade Lads and twenty-four Jade Maidens, who safeguard its divine writ and protect the bodies of those who receive it.

The Dao declares: During the long fast of the first month, recite this scripture, and the Jade Luminance will revolve eastward, delivering those born under *ding* and *ren*. Life’s virtue will unfold its radiance, the Nine Perfected will record their names, and the Great Unity’s Azure Talismans will deliver the imprisoned souls of past ages, severing their earthly bonds and sending them to the Southern Palace.

During the long fast of the seventh month, recite this scripture, and the Jade Luminance will traverse the west, delivering those born under *yi* and *geng*. The solemn qi will congeal into metal, and the Tortoise Terrace will dredge its numinous power. The White Silk Jade Talismans will refine and transform their forms, allowing them to attain immortality. The heavens will inscribe their names on the Yellow Register and White Slips, erasing death and granting life.

During the long fast of the tenth month, recite this scripture, and the Jade Luminance will ascend northward, delivering those born under *bing* and *xin*. The upright qi will form dragons, and the Purple Court will command immortality. The Imperial Perfected will issue the Mysterious Edict, assisting the Emperor in attaining long life. For kings, emperors, lords, ministers, fathers, and sons, it will secure and stabilize the nation’s destiny, preserving Heaven’s eternal existence. Generation after generation, they will remain sovereigns, securing their domains, and the people will proclaim great peace.

On the days of the eight solar terms, recite this scripture, and the Jade Luminance will converge in radiance, delivering those in perfect harmony. The primordial qi will divide its splendor, the Eight Gates will open in brightness, and the Divine Tiger’s Red Writ will inscribe their names upon the Emperor’s steps, granting them the rank of Perfected of the Nine Palaces.

On one’s natal day, recite this scripture, and the Jade Luminance will protect one’s life, delivering a thousand years. The Dipper Palace will record their merit, inscribing their destiny as true. The Seven Primes’ Treasure Chapters will flow like stars into the Great Abyss. Their souls will be purified and rectified, and the myriad qi will endure forever. They will avoid suffering and affliction, their bodies suffused with light. The Three Realms will attend them, the Five Emperors will welcome them, and the myriad spirits will pay homage. Their names will be inscribed in the heavens above. With merit complete and virtue perfected, they will ascend to the Highest Clarity.

The Dao declares: On the days of ritual practice, one must bathe in fragrant waters, fast, and enter the chamber. Facing east, knock the teeth thirty-two times, making it heard in the thirty-two heavens. Bow thirty-two times in reverence, close the eyes, and silently visualize oneself seated amidst clouds of azure, green, and white. Within and without, all is lush and dark. A Green Dragon, White Tiger, Vermilion Bird, Dark Warrior, Lion, and White Crane stand arrayed to the left and right. The sun and moon shine brightly, illuminating the chamber. A circular halo appears above the head, its light radiating in all directions. All this must be clearly envisioned.

The secret incantation is as follows:
*"Supreme Mysterious Origin, Most High Dao Lord, summon forth from within my body the Three and Five Merit Officers, the Left and Right Attendant Envoys, the Jade Lads who tend the incense, the Jade Maidens who transmit words, the Direct Talismans of the Five Emperors, and the Incense Officials of the Day—sixty-four each—opening the gates to relay my words. Today is an auspicious day, a long fast in a pure hall, cultivating the supreme scripture to deliver boundless beings. May my entreaties ascend swiftly to the presence of the Most High Primordial Sovereign of the Thirty-Two Heavens."*

After this, draw qi thirty-two times, then face east and recite the scripture.

*The Supreme Primordial Most Wondrous Scripture of Boundless Deliverance*
The original harmony dwells in the Cavernous Mystery, the numinous guest of the root chapter. The Jade Luminance delivers, the wondrous beginning of the supreme.
Countless beings are delivered, the hundred demons hide their rhymes. Separation and union arise naturally, merging with the Great Vastness.
The Nine Voids’ Dao Ancestor, the primordial qi within the expanse, the Jade Luminance illumines the mysterious.
The Primordial divides into two. Yin and yang are then complete, commanding qi and moving the spirits.
The peerless supreme truth, the Primordial Ancestral Kalpa. Delivering all heavens, eight, nine, six, seven—kalpas turn without end.
The Great Yin generates fire, the Great Yang becomes water, the five phases reverse their transmission.
The Three Luminaries open in brightness—this is the root of Heaven. The Jade Luminance’s Brahmanic splendor, only the Dao as body.
Deliverance shifts and moves, the five colors ride the heavens. Mysterious light forms the script, fire refines it into fathoms.
The five colors settle into place, rosy clouds weave the chapters. The five writs array their images, universally planting the divine spirits.
No writ without light, no writ without brightness, no writ without establishment, no writ without completion, no writ without deliverance, no writ without life.
This is the Great Brahman Heaven within Heaven, the Yü-luo Hsiao Terrace, the Jade Luminance’s Upper Capital, the supreme of the supremes, the Great Luo’s Jade Clarity.
Vast and distant, kalpas measured in *jen*, as if absent, as if present—three flowers part and depart. The Great Existence’s wondrous court.
Golden gates and jade chambers, a forest of purity and clarity. The divine auroras of the Divine Empyrean encircle the ten directions.
Within it dwells the immortal-delivering spirit, within it dwells the Southern Culmen’s Lord of Long Life, within it dwells the Jade Luminance’s Deliverance Marshal, the Great Divinity, within it dwells the Life-Cherishing Elder Lord Han, within it dwell the Southern Supreme’s Registrar of Life and Destiny, the Extender of Lifespan, the Reliever of Calamities, and the Venerable Divinities.
They turn bones back to life, deliver boundless beings. Today, the celestial audit begins, and all the heavens descend in attendance.

In the East, the Boundless Flying Celestial Jade Luminance’s Sovereign Conveyor Divine King, the Great Sage of Long Life who Delivers Boundless Beings.
In the South, the Boundless Flying Celestial Jade Luminance’s Sovereign Conveyor Divine King, the Great Sage of Long Life who Delivers Boundless Beings.
In the West, the Boundless Flying Celestial Jade Luminance’s Sovereign Conveyor Divine King, the Great Sage of Long Life who Delivers Boundless Beings.
In the North, the Boundless Flying Celestial Jade Luminance’s Sovereign Conveyor Divine King, the Great Sage of Long Life who Delivers Boundless Beings.
In the Northeast, the Boundless Flying Celestial Jade Luminance’s Sovereign Conveyor Divine King, the Great Sage of Long Life who Delivers Boundless Beings.
In the Southeast, the Boundless Flying Celestial Jade Luminance’s Sovereign Conveyor Divine King, the Great Sage of Long Life who Delivers Boundless Beings.
In the Southwest, the Boundless Flying Celestial Jade Luminance’s Sovereign Conveyor Divine King, the Great Sage of Long Life who Delivers Boundless Beings.
In the Northwest, the Boundless Flying Celestial Jade Luminance’s Sovereign Conveyor Divine King, the Great Sage of Long Life who Delivers Boundless Beings.
Above, the Boundless Flying Celestial Jade Luminance’s Sovereign Conveyor Divine King, the Great Sage of Long Life who Delivers Boundless Beings.
Below, the Boundless Flying Celestial Jade Luminance’s Sovereign Conveyor Divine King, the Great Sage of Long Life who Delivers Boundless Beings.
The Perfected of the Ten Directions, the Flying Celestial Jade Luminance’s Sovereign Conveyor Divine Kings of Movement and Deliverance, the Great Divinities of Long Life who Deliver the World in Boundless Measure.

Together they ride upon purple scaled dragons, their forms adorned with patterns of jade, borne upon crimson clouds of auspicious radiance, phoenix chariots and dragon carriages, jade canopies and golden wheels, drawn by beasts of cinnabar whales and jade-maned golden essence. They raise the standards of the Nine Qi and the banners of the Ten Poles. Before them, resonant chants and harmonious hymns intertwine; behind them, celestial choruses and Brahmanic chants resound in unison.

Immortal maidens and pure youths sing with the voices of simurghs. The Three August Ones open the path, the Nine Elders [ ] the way. Myriad chariots and ten thousand riders arrive floating through the void.

Their radiant light bends the course of their journey, inaugurating kalpas and renewing life. They propel the movement of deliverance, kalpas turning without end, driving yin and steering yang, revolving through death and rebirth.

The Jade Luminance’s Chancellor, the Supreme Minister of Southern Prosperity, the Pivotal Perfected in array, the Registrar Han, the Overseers of Life and Death, the Mighty Spirits of the Numinous and the Demonic—conveying the reckoning of destinies, encompassing the Six Voids, discerning the fates of beings amidst water, fire, and the calamities of war.

Holding the registers and grasping the ledgers, they assemble before the Emperor. According to those who are to be delivered, they strictly audit the heavens.

Universally proclaimed to the Three Realms, the Boundless Divine Lands, the Yellow Springs’ courts, the Northern Capital of Fengdu, the Three Offices and Nine Bureaus, the Twelve River Sources.

They absolve the sins of ancestors and kin across kalpas, swiftly erasing the records of transgressions, extinguishing the roots of evil, forbidding their detention or coercion into ghostly throngs.

By the Mandate of the Primordial Beginning, at the appointed hour, they ascend and advance. In the Frigid Pools of the Northern Capital, they guard and escort the forms and souls.

They restrain demons and uphold deliverance, elevating ranks in the Southern Palace. The dead receive refinement, transformed into immortals. The living receive deliverance, enduring through kalpas, revolving with the turning of ages, their years harmonized with heaven.

Forever delivered from the Three Paths, the Five Sufferings, and the Eight Adversities, they transcend the Three Realms, roaming freely in the Upper Clarity.

In the Heaven of Upper Clarity, the Celestial Emperor abides in the Cavernous Void, the realm of formlessness and Brahmanic conduct.

The Eight Heavens of the East:
The Heaven of the Azure Chamber’s True Talisman, where the Emperor’s melody resounds from the Secret Hinge.
The Heaven of Jade Spirit’s Utmost Mystery, where the Emperor’s palace stands in solemn trust.
The Heaven of the Treasure Cavern’s Boundlessness, where the Emperor Bo Shi Dun Qian reigns.
The Heaven of Upright Will and Luminous Immortality, where the Emperor’s pure net is woven with subtle threads.
The Heaven of the Nine Perfected’s Righteous Pledge, where the Emperor Yang Chi Kong presides.
The Heaven of Level Balance and Double Splendor, where the Emperor’s crimson craftsmanship commands awe.
The Heaven of Divine Elixir and Refined Pearls, where the Emperor governs the people with all provisions.
The Heaven of Pure Capital and Nine Dragons, where the Emperor Zan Yun Ci Zhang holds court.

The Eight Heavens of the South:
The Heaven of Crimson Capital’s Descending Chariot, where the Emperor’s radiance flows in pure continuity.
The Heaven of Radiant Fusion and Spreading Perfection, where the Emperor transforms through the mysteries of Xu Lou Kan.
The Heaven of Vast Extremity and Ascending Flame, where the Emperor Hui Yu Wu Yuan reigns.
The Heaven of Profound Stillness and Boundlessness, where the Emperor’s strategy unfolds in the courts of Gao Hui.
The Heaven of Universal Benefit and Illuminating Openness, where the Emperor Zhuo Hun Si Qiang presides.
The Heaven of Cinnabar Spirit and Contemplative Perfection, where the Emperor governs in tranquil foundation.
The Heaven of Solemn Supplication and Memorials, where the Emperor Liao Qu Chi Guang holds sway.
The Heaven of True Light and Brahmanic Assistance, where the Emperor Yi Shuang Du Qi reigns.

The Eight Heavens of the West:
The Heaven of Disciplined Inspection over Myriad Demons, where the Emperor aids the Nine Whirlwinds of the Dragon.
The Heaven of Golden Splendor and Vast Spirit, where the Emperor Tai Wei Bing Si presides.
The Heaven of Plain Memorials and Curved Dawn, where the Emperor Yao Fu Zhi Lan reigns.
The Heaven of Divine Tigers and Mighty Chapters across the Eight Poles, where the Emperor Sheng Che Xiang holds court.
The Heaven of Bright Deliverance and Cultivated Kalpas, where the Emperor governs with awakened equilibrium.
The Heaven of Sacrificial Ascent and Pledged Alliance, where the Emperor Wu Yun Ci Xian presides.
The Heaven of Yang’s Bureau and Bestowed Regulations, where the Emperor Liang Hua Mei Jing reigns.
The Heaven of Commanding the Myriad Demons’ Registers, where the Emperor Zhuan Yan Sha Hou holds sway.

The Eight Heavens of the North:
The Heaven of Mysterious Spirit and Inspired Splendor, where the Emperor Huai Fang Zhi Bin presides.
The Heaven of Chariots of Discipline and Inquiries of Direction, where the Emperor Peng Ding Si Jiang reigns.
The Heaven of Refined Clarity and Jade Imperial Court, where the Emperor Lü Ci Jing Qian holds court.
The Heaven of the Numinous Pass and Restraining the Divine to Awaken Yin, where the Emperor Jian Dou Shi Nan presides.
The Heaven of Cavernous Whiteness and Vast Achievement in Primordial Transformation, where the Emperor Yan Di Si Luo reigns.
The Heaven of Vibrant Radiance and Illuminating Light, where the Emperor Fu Zhang Yi Xing holds court.
The Heaven of Northern Severity and Guarding the Primordial, where the Emperor Xue Chu Zuo Ci presides.
The Heaven of Measured Passage and Determined Destiny, where the Emperor Chao Huang Jing Tong reigns.

The Thirty-Two Heavens, the Thirty-Two Emperors, the Sixty-Four Layers—all governed by the Jade Luminance’s Movement and Deliverance.

Encircling and returning to the beginning, the Dharma’s image weaves the net of interdependence. Yin and yang rise again, kalpas interlinking, generation and transformation unceasing.

The secrets of the heavens, the hidden names of the heavens, the empty caverns within the heavens, the spontaneous numinous chapters.

The hidden melodies of the heavens, the sounds of the Jade Luminance, the honor of the Jade Name, the divinity of the Jade Luminance.

The Nine Yang Brahmanic Realms, the numinous power of deliverance, transforming into the Upper Clarity—boundless mysteries too profound to detail.

The divine perfected descend in array, universally delivering celestial and mortal beings.

Today, they propel the movement of deliverance, governing death and distinguishing life. The marvel of the Dao’s convergence lies in formlessness as truth, unity with the void, hidden yet eternally named. Divine transformations emerge and vanish, the spontaneity of the numinous.

Delivered through water and fire, through the great kalpas of blades and warfare.

Their bodies gleam with golden hue, steadfast and unshaken. Rejoicing in their deliverance, they pass through the barriers of the heavens, beseeching transcendence beyond the Three Voids, severing the roots of yin and yang.

Soaring through the Five Passes, their names inscribed in the Great Mystery. The Perfected and Demons oversee...

Raise, unbound by the Celestial Gate.
The Eastern Dipper receives consciousness, the Western Dipper forges form,
The Northern Dipper bestows wisdom, the Southern Dipper governs the heart,
The Central Dipper embodies the Great Void—this is the true form of the Dao.
The Azure Emperor manifests color, the White Emperor illumines emptiness,
The Vermilion Emperor stirs awareness, the Black Emperor darkly pervades,
The Yellow Emperor directs intention—resonant convergence gives rise to transformation.

The Azure-Realm Perfected King governs the Wood Kalpa, *Dī Ā*.
The Vermilion-Realm Perfected King governs the Fire Kalpa, *Bù Nán*.
The White-Realm Perfected King governs the Metal Kalpa, *Gāng Cuó*.
The Black-Realm Perfected King governs the Water Kalpa, *Yān Luó*.
The Yellow-Realm Perfected King governs the Earth Kalpa, *Shén Qiū*.
The Five-Realm Perfected Kings are the origin of the ten thousand spirits.
They restrain and extend the movement of deliverance, their moments unyielding,
Soaring in flight, drums resounding, commanding the divine hosts.
Banners wave, drums beat in rhythm, roaming and gazing through the Great Void,
Their mighty commands resplendent, all heavens unite in merit.
Transcending kalpas of tribulation, sternly subduing the Northern Feng,
The Perfected Kings receive their mandate, universally sweeping away inauspiciousness.
White tigers spew venom, celestial steeds spread forth in four directions,
Crimson-armored vanguards advance, wielding the great slaughtering blade.
Flinging fire for ten thousand leagues, streaming bells through the eight directions—
Who dares to test or obstruct the perfected above?
Golden axes execute the foremost.
The Great Heavenly Queen metes out punishment, butchering and severing demonic fiends,
Wind and fire unceasing.
Thousands upon thousands of heads severed, myriad upon myriad forms—
Demons dare not trespass! Ghosts dare not harbor malevolent essence.
The Three Officials of the Northern Feng inspect the demonic camps,
No concealment permitted, reported by the Golden Horse Courier.
Universally proclaimed without end.
The ten thousand spirits all heed, the Three Realms and Five Emperors,
Arrayed before the Highest Clarity.
The Primordial Cavern’s Jade Chronicle records the kalpas’ weighty barriers,
From the inception of the Primordial Beginning, giving birth to heaven and earth,
Chaos coalesced—its numbers countless.
Since the primordial qi first conjoined with the undifferentiated,
The ages have been immeasurable.
Vast kalpas stretch into the distant past, from *Yuánlóng* to *Dákāng*,
Jade luminosity and the round void, the movement of deliverance in mutual accord,
The Great One containing the movement—its form spontaneous.
Vast and boundless, the empty radiance, the origin of the Great Dao,
Giving rise to the two luminaries, gestating the Two Modes.
This Dao is most wondrous, yet the world knows it not.
The movement of deliverance cycles to its utmost, jade luminosity taking form,
The great qi suffuses the radiance, now floating, now sinking.
The true earth transmits it, shaped like an egg’s roundness,
Its movement coursing through the center, myriad circuits without deviation.
Within the Five Phases, the movement of deliverance takes precedence,
Jade luminosity as its color, primordial qi as its abyss.
Its principle resembles steaming: qi ascends as dew, descends as springs,
Stirred by the divine wind.
Refined into true lead, lead as the ancestor of metal,
Metal as heaven—its movement proceeds leftward.
Ninety-nine thousand cycles complete the Five Movements’ measure.
Ninety-nine thousand cycles, then water succeeds it.
Water courses through heaven, flowing beneath the nine earths,
Kunlun’s springs surge forth, above heaven and below,
No darkness nor obscurity, no form nor shadow,
No limit nor end—all reverently follow the Great Dao,
Vast and boundless, without light.
The Vermilion Clarity unfurls its chart, the movement of deliverance spontaneous,
Its course harmonizing with measure, the six qi forming heaven.
When movement errs, the ten thousand things falter.
The numbers of jade luminosity are transmitted through the movement of deliverance.
The Primordial Beginning securely establishes, unfolding the Five Chapters,
Vermilion script on jade, the eight mighty dragon scripts,
Preserving and regulating the kalpas’ tribulations, ensuring heaven’s eternal endurance.
The Brahmanic qi pervades the net of Indra, myriad patterns unfolding,
The primordial warp flowing forth, the sixty-four heavens.
Revolving without color, circling the ten directions,
The Dipper and Winnowing Basket traverse, their movement encompassing the four quarters.
Passing through the Five Constants, thirty-five divisions.
The Upper Origin of the total qi is the homeland of jade luminosity.
The Eight Radiant Ones obscurely merge, qi entering the empty mystery,
The Mysterious Void and the Great Sovereign, the Highest Perfected of the Celestial Emperor.
Suffusing the great rosy clouds, chanting the cavernous hymns,
Golden perfection’s luminous luxuriance, flowing echoes through the cloudy encampments.
Jade tones gather qi, numinous winds amass mist,
The Purple Void’s luxuriant elegance, aiding the ten thousand immortals.
A thousand harmonies, ten thousand unions, the movement of deliverance pervading the body,
Heaven’s movement conjoining with humanity, spontaneously becoming perfected.
Within the perfected, jade luminosity—the Great Lord of Longevity,
The Azure Radiance Noble, the Eastern Florescence Emperor,
The Luminous Azure Imperial Consort, the White Primordial Venerable Spirit,
The Purple Court’s Great One, the Controller of Destinies Perfected Lord,
Peach Blossom Longevity and Union, Jade Radiance and Purple Numinosity.
Grasping talismans, wielding registers, preserving life and rooting existence,
Ascending to roam the Highest Clarity, entering and exiting the Flowery Chambers.
Within the Eight Obscurities, amid the subtlest realms,
Jade essence flows as liquid, descending to stabilize the human body.
The Crimson Palace of the Muddy Pellet, centrally governing the five qi,
Merging with the hundred spirits, ten revolutions returning the numinous.
The ten thousand qi unite as immortals, the immortal path valuing life,
Delivering beings without limit, the movement flowing through the eight gates.
The great Brahmanic wheel of the flying heavens, revolving through brightness and darkness,
Turning and propelling death and life, transgressions and blessings, prohibitions and precepts,
Karmic causes and conditions—universally receiving liberation,
The dead souls and living bodies, bodies attaining rebirth,
Ascending to be heard by the various heavens.
Above the various heavens, each has its gate of life,
Within, the empty cavern’s hymns and songs, the Perfected Kings’ numinous scriptures,
Verses that join the Highest Perfected.

**First: The Jade Luminosity’s Soaring Void Hymn**
Vast and desolate, the Primordial Azure—names of ten thousand kalpas.
Dyeing the void to become emerald, transforming jade to soft luminosity,
Becoming the mother of the nine qi, the root of all heavens.
Profoundly serene, the radiant clouds, towering above the azure forests,
Above, intermingling with the soaring clouds, branches overspreading the ten thousand heavens.
True rosy clouds in a thousand strands, golden hues in myriad layers—
All are celestial scriptures, shaking the divine winds.
The Nine Elders of the Imperial Perfected, the divine immortals and perfected humans,
Emerging and vanishing, manifesting within this heaven.
A single leaf of the precious scripture, the words of the Eight Assemblies,
Whistling and singing the cavernous tones, extinguishing the ten thousand evils.
Those who hear this jade luminosity’s decree attain the Dao without end.

**Second: The Jade Luminosity’s Movement of Deliverance Hymn**
The movement of Highest Clarity, the nine qi as its bulwark,
The Dipper and Winnowing Basket revolving, traversing the five directions.
Life follows the current, death opposes it—bearing the hundred flourishing things.
The Five Movements’ course begins with yin and yang,
Yin and yang’s creation and transformation, possessing number and name.
The domain of names and numbers is the process of life and death.
The qi’s flowing movement forms the wheel of the Three Realms.

The movements of deliverance summon forth, their flow unceasing.
The joys of heaven’s halls, the torments of hell’s depths—
None of these are the Dao, but the karmic fruits of causes.
Why not refine your nature to emptiness?
Emptiness that is no-emptiness, subtlety beyond form.
In an instant or kalpas, a thousand years as an infant,
Transcending yin and yang, departing the Five Movements,
Without birth or death—this is true eternal life.

I move this hymn to open the hearts of all beings.
The world’s desires surge and sink, floating and drowning.
But if you preserve this heart, measure it against emptiness,
In time it will settle, hidden in the Great Vastness.
Emerging as a perfected one, blessings vast and boundless,
Seated in witness of the Highest Heaven, the Jade Pool and Golden Gates.

**Third: The Jade Luminosity’s True King Hymn**
The nine heavens stand like ramparts, leaning upon this terrace of mirrors.
The mystic canopy’s jeweled tiers, the master gates swing open.
Flowering chambers and bud-palaces, containing pearls and sprouting down,
Crimson and azure in ten thousand strands, radiance entwining the six dragons.
The net of deliverance’s discipline, governed by divine Brahma’s principle.
The King’s luminosity vast, embracing the Nine Clarities within.
Named the Void Sovereign, the court of unending light.

If you would be true, you must witness the formless.
The movements of deliverance do not constrain—take the Dao as your body.
Divine transformations and changes arise at will.
If you wish to know this, first cast out the five desires.
Let the empty light remain unobstructed, companion to the Dao.
Abiding in non-action, roaming with the perfected ones.

This hymn of jade sound serves as a vessel of compassion,
Ferrying you from the shore of birth and death,
Ascending Kunlun’s heights.
Sun and moon like tossed pellets—how can they bring you sorrow?
Above these Three Realms, in the midst of soaring emptiness,
The True King’s hymn resounds, its tones interwoven with cavernous hymns.
Recite it a hundred times, and your name is recorded in the Southern Palace.
Recite it a thousand times, and the True King himself welcomes you.
Ten thousand recitations complete the Dao,
Soaring into the Great Void, traversing the Three Realms,
Ascending to the rank of Immortal Duke.

Those who hear this numinous sound,
The True King honors in form,
Commanding earthly deities to attend and escort,
Liberating them from the earth’s gates,
The five sufferings and eight hardships.
Seven generations of ancestors ascend,
Forever departing the Three Palaces,
Their souls crossing the Vermilion Mound,
Undergoing refinement and rebirth.
This is called boundless deliverance, universal salvation without end.

There is a secret celestial scripture,
Revered by all heavens.
To leak or profane it is to fall into hell,
Bringing calamity upon seven generations of ancestors.

The Dao says: These two hymns are the hidden sounds of the Heavenly Emperors and the Numinous True Kings.
The celestial body of jade luminosity, naturally exalted and congealed,
The movements of deliverance forming kalpas, drifting through life and death.
The perfected one stands alone, remote and formless,
Unbound by existence, untouched by wisdom or emotion,
Merged in primordial purity—from this the Dao arises.
Roaming the Three Realms, eternal peace spans the kalpas.
All are the words of the Great Brahma, not the common speech of the world.
Their words lack ornate beauty, their melodies lack florid grace,
Thus they are called profound and obscure, difficult to fathom.

Heaven treasures them, secreting them in the Eastern Chamber of the Jade Capital’s Highest Mystery, the Jade Treasury Scripture Hall of the Divine Empyrean.
The Dao Lord enacts transformation, the movement aligned with the *ren-chen* year,
Transmitting them according to the statutes.
If there is a perfected one who offers gold and treasures with a sincere heart,
Following the old rites to pledge allegiance to the Divine Empyrean,
Advancing on knees with exposed cinnabar,
Only then are they entrusted.

The Dao says: When the movements of heaven and earth reach their end,
When the sun, moon, and five planets wane and wax,
When the most sagely and divine suffer decline,
The unlearned and hasty invite harm.
Whenever such disasters arise,
All of like qi must unite in heart to perform purification rites,
Burning incense in the six watches, reciting the scriptures ten times.
Blessings and virtue will descend at once, dispelling all misfortune.

This boundless scripture delivers without end.

The Dao says: When the unlearned’s Dao is shallow, or their immortal rank unfulfilled, their jade brightness and qi exhausted, the celestial cycles reaching their end, their fate nearing extinction—when their body enters the Great Yin and the hour of passing arrives—fellow students and perfected ones shall burn incense for them and recite the scriptures ten times, conducting the rites to deliver the corpse-form according to the law. Then the Great Unity shall turn back the banner, the Lord of No-Flourishing shall command the pennant, the Noble Son shall transmit the talisman, and the jade brightness shall return in its course. The hun-soul shall ascend directly to the Southern Palace, where, according to their accumulated merit, they shall be reborn after a calculated span of days. Once the wheel turns without confusion, they shall attain the rank of divine immortals.

The Dao says: When the cycles of heaven and earth reach their end, the stellar lodgings fall into disarray, the sun and moon lose their light, the four seasons fail in their governance, yin and yang fall out of harmony, the land suffers yearly calamities, armies and famine arise, ghosts and bandits appear, plagues and poisons spread, the multitudes perish, teachers and friends pass away, and clans and lineages are extinguished—then one must perform purification rites, burn incense, and recite the scriptures. The merit of purification, recitation, and scripture-chanting is exceedingly weighty. Above, it dispels celestial disasters and safeguards the emperor; below, it wards off poison and harm, delivering the multitudes. In life and death, all receive its grace—its blessings are boundless, universally delivering heaven and humanity.

The Dao says: Whoever possesses this scripture and performs these meritorious deeds for the rulers of heaven and earth and the multitudes—on the day of calamity, if they resolve in their heart to perform purification rites, burn incense, and recite the scriptures ten times—all the heavens shall record their names, the ten thousand spirits shall attend and guard them, and those distinguished as perfected ones shall become ministers of the Golden Gates of the Sagely Lord. The heavens record the merits and transgressions of people without the slightest error. The True Kings of Heaven shall also protect and recommend them, and those who attain the Dao shall fully comprehend these most profound words.

The Great Brahma’s hidden speech in the heavens, the boundless sounds—
Composed by the Dao Lord,
*The Central Scroll of the Numinous Writ of the Primordial Beginning*,
*The Eight Heavens of the Eastern Direction*.

At the brink of Yang’s cauldron, the Dipper’s winnowing—
The peaks stand straight, the mysteries gather in darkness.
The Qiang sweep clear the bright beams,
The sandalwood and music roll back resentment.
The Peng and Chou guard the immortal precincts,
The Li and Fan blaze in radiant transformation.
Refined and tempered, they cherish their jade ornaments,
The chambers examine and present their offerings.
The intercalary moon augments the fruitful journey,
The Lan and Lin determine the welcoming.
Pervasive compassion devises the plan,
The ranks of rivers and branches govern.
The gleaming blades array their splendor,
The sheltering grounds establish their foundations.
They chant the southern Yi’s calendar,
Rushing toward the sun’s eclipsed faintness.

*The Eight Heavens of the Southern Direction*

The rosy clouds ignite in radiant ascent,
The Wen and Lu assist the perfected.
They reform the masters and cloud flutes,
The pavilions rest and suddenly return.
The Xiang and Mang repeatedly extend,
The Bo and Kui part in speech.
The Ye and Shen adorn the palace,
The talismans follow in the rosy observance.
The Bao peaks and orchid companions,
Repay the Ying’s dark descent.
They pour forth mist and raise their plumes,
The crowned youths bestow their calculations.
The Zhuang and Xi soar through kalpas,
The Dong and Mian trace their ancestral roots.
They略 the primordial purity of the peaks,
The moon’s steeds follow the wild geese.

*The Eight Heavens of the Western Direction*

The light weaves and subdues the ramparts,
The blazing and writhing renew.
The profound and vast shake the cords,
The hidden dragons record their ministers.
The companions assist the azure,
The Yue and Jia fill with jasper.
The river’s pivot and swallow’s treasury,
The courts align in stillness and green.
The radiant thoughts command the following,
The military charts compile the registers.
The hooked halberds uphold their might,
The fire’s rhythm extends its power.
The Song spirits and Chu’s lingzhi,
The Lang and Du behold the capital.
The lodging stars and Dipper’s Han,
The flourishing life hastens the call.

*The Eight Heavens of the Northern Direction*

The mysterious caverns flee in strength,
The qi’s chariots boundless.
The wondrous fingers urge the hosts,
The eight luminaries stand in tranquil majesty.
The lightning’s mouth leaks its veins,
The propping branches and Kun’s yellow.
They bestow and proclaim the nine celestial bodies,
The Xiao and Ci grasp their leisure.
Far and without hearing emotions,
The cold huts gleam in freshness.
The empty numen and sea’s prosperity,
The flowing mist and Meng’s mountains.
The veiled vessels bow to the mystery,
The parables of flowers curse the immortals.
The southern Kui holds the spirits,
The distant and unbound wear serene countenances.

The Dao states: These are the Great Brahma’s hidden speech within the heavens, the boundless sounds. The ancient texts inscribed them upon the Jade Luminance Gate, within the Mystery’s Left Terrace, above the Heavenly Pass and Earthly Mechanism, to rectify the five kalpas, nine completions, and ten realms, the revolutions of water, fire, metal, and wood, to enact the flowing evolution of the Three Luminaries and Five Celestial Bodies, the degrees of the stellar palaces and lodgings—retreat, stay, and retrogression. The celestial revolutions and stellar degrees record the kalpas’ numbers, the great and small Yang’s ninety-six cycles of beginning and end. The lesser extremity spans three hundred and sixty-five days, the greater extremity eighty-one myriad, or nine thousand nine hundred and ninety billion qi’s reckoning.
