The heavens conduct their solemn audit.

Proclaiming universally to the Three Realms,
The boundless divine lands,
The subterranean courts of the Yellow Springs,
The Northern Capital of Fengdu,
The Three Offices and Nine Bureaus,
The Twelve River Sources—
Absolve the ancestors,
Relatives of past kalpas,
Swiftly erase the ledgers of sins,
Extinguish the roots of evil,
That they may not be detained
Or forced into the company of ghosts.
By the Primordial Beginning’s talismanic command,
At this very moment, ascend and be promoted.
In the cold pools of the Northern Capital,
Guard the forms and souls,
Restrain demons and protect the promoted,
Delivering them to the Southern Palace for ranking.
The dead souls receive refinement,
Transforming into immortals;
The living receive deliverance,
Abiding through kalpas,
Revolving with the kalpas,
Their years equaling heaven’s.

Ever deliver them from the Three Ways,
The Five Sufferings and Eight Hardships,
Transcend the Three Realms,
And roam freely in the Supreme Clarity.

In the Heaven of Supreme Clarity,
The Heavenly Emperor dwells in the Formless Realm of Brahmanic Conduct.

**The Eight Heavens of the East:**
The Heaven of Illuminated Bodies and Penetrating Life—Emperor Chuan Huizi Tan.
The Heaven of Righteous Brightness and Primal Yang—Emperor Yu Huzhe Cheng.
The Heaven of Divine Transformation and Numinous Change—Emperor Wu Jing He Sun.
The Heaven of True Wisdom and Boundless Dao—Emperor Bao Yuan Li Nan.
The Heaven of Light-Bearing Azure Radiance—Emperor Jiang Hui Shu Jia.
The Heaven of Treading Prosperity and Gathering Destiny—Emperor Zai Qiang You Di.
The Heaven of Cavernous Emptiness and Radiant Spirit—Emperor Zhi Yi Xun Lou.
The Heaven of Pure Transformation and Daoist Might—Emperor Wei Ding Nei Xian.

**The Eight Heavens of the South:**
The Heaven of Dragon-Brahmanic Faith and Light—Emperor Huan Qiu Er Guang.
The Heaven of Great Origin and Departing Flame—Emperor Zhe Yu Bian Hui.
The Heaven of Cinnabar Chariots and Level Clouds—Emperor Dang Yao Fu Jiao.
The Heaven of Radiant Splendor and Nine Lights—Emperor Zhuo Yan Lian Ju.
The Heaven of Literary Emptiness and Sea of Void—Emperor Yi Ling Bo Cheng.
The Heaven of Vermilion Brightness and Scattered Radiance—Emperor Tao Gai Shuang Tu.
The Heaven of Assisting Trust and Holding Talismans—Emperor Mi Yue Jing Liang.
The Heaven of Radiant Crimson and Floating Cultivation—Emperor A Li You Gong.

**The Eight Heavens of the West:**
The Heaven of Storing Spirits and Extending Hills—Emperor Chong Ji Zhong Wen.
The Heaven of Golden Truth and Vast Embrace—Emperor Lu Shi Bi Xian.
The Heaven of True Marvel and Simplified Ascent—Emperor Liang Gang Zhi Tuo.
The Heaven of Great Emptiness and Thoughtless Void—Emperor Hu Fan Dao Han.
The Heaven of Grand White and Fixed Truth—Emperor Tai Wu Tian.
The Heaven of Fruitful Talent and Ultimate Assistance—Emperor Luo Ru Qi Ni.
The Heaven of Harmonious Brilliance and Equal Light—Emperor Tu Lu Yan Zhi.
The Heaven of Sincere Merit and Reverent Celebration—Emperor Bing Kang Yu Chui.

**The Eight Heavens of the North:**
The Heaven of Pure Refinement and Earthly Press—Emperor Lue Ru Jing.
The Heaven of Mysterious Canopy and Severed Purity—Emperor Jue Xuan Ben.
The Heaven of Bearing Splendor and Cavernous Emptiness—Emperor Du Xian Bian Ming.
The Heaven of Dao-Dragon Pact and Bright Understanding—Emperor Zhi Shun Si.
The Heaven of Spring Palace and Calculating Truth—Emperor You Xuan Ding Meng.
The Heaven of Dipper’s Stern Inspection and Record—Emperor Ju Shen Wan Lao.
The Heaven of Demon-Driving and Merit-Assisting—Emperor Miao Zai Jing Gao.
The Heaven of Profound Interception and Pearl Conception—Emperor Xiang Xi Mi Yun.

The Thirty-Two Heavens,
The Thirty-Two Emperors—
The hidden taboos of the heavens,
The concealed names of the heavens.
Within the heavens, emptiness and cavernous void,
Natural numinous scriptures,
The hidden rhymes of the heavens,
The sound of the Great One.

The Great One’s majesty,
The Great One’s spirit,
The Great One’s primordial essence,
The Great One’s numen.
From the Void One comes Nine,
One becomes the foundation of Earth;
The utmost number is Ten,
Ten completes the Earth.

Earth is not mere form—
It transforms into Supreme Clarity,
An unfathomable mystery,
Too profound to detail.
It scatters divine perfected ones,
Universally delivering heaven and humanity.

Today, rejoicing in receiving deliverance,
Return to the origin and know the ancestors,
Perceive the Dao and return to truth,
Gaze upward and draw harmony from the void.
The Earth-Womb and Metal-Spirit
Establish the omens of life,
Becoming your true form,
Passing through the barriers of all heavens.

Entreat the eradication of the Three Evils,
Sever the roots of death,
Soar through the Five Gates,
Your name inscribed in the Great Mystery,
Watched over by the True Kings,
Unrestrained by heavenly barriers.

The Azure Dragon of the Eastern Dipper,
The Golden Tiger of the Western Dipper,
The Numinous Tortoise of the Northern Dipper,
The Quail’s Head of the Southern Dipper,
The Great Pivot of the Central Dipper—
The Four Symbols rely on Earth,
Earth as the yin womb,
Shedding the womb to be born.

The Azure Emperor bestows the soul,
The White Emperor nurtures the po,
The Red Emperor engenders the spirit,
The Black Emperor transmits the numen,
The Yellow Emperor governs intent,
Imprinting nature and soaring the spirit.

The Azure Earth Divine King
Drives away demons and dispatches corpses.
The Red Earth Divine King
Summons and severs blood and breath.
The White Earth Divine King
Grinds away hardness and dispels rituals.
The Black Earth Divine King
Illuminates essence and severs demonic forms.
The Yellow Earth Divine King
Subdues the many and binds the hordes.

The True Earths of the Five Directions,
The primordial essence of the Great One,
Universally pervading the Great Void,
Assuming the same form as emptiness.
Mother of transformations,
Ancestor of the myriad spirits,
Soaring and drumming in procession,
Commanding the ghostly legions.

Brandishing banners and drumming rhythms,
Entering and exiting the Great Void,
Self-proclaimed resplendent,
All heavens unite in merit.
Giving birth to the Two Modes,
Transforming into the Nine Palaces,
The Three Realms established,
True Earth receives and contains.

The primordial essence of the Great One
Enables you to attain the Dao,
Ascend to truth and reach the numinous,
Ascend to heaven and deliver humanity.

Sternly governing the Northern Fengdu,
The Divine Kings receive their mandate,
Universally sweeping away inauspiciousness—
Long fangs spewing venom,
Square skulls with four gaping maws,
Brocatelle foreheads leading the vanguard,
Stern Dipper-wielding banners,
Hurling fire for ten thousand miles.
Flowing bells of the Eight Directions—
Dare any resist or obstruct the perfected ones?
Golden axes execute them at the fore,
Mighty beasts punish them from behind.
Slaughtering and dismembering ghostly shades,
Wind and fire never cease,
Severing a thousand thousand heads,
Shearing ten thousand ten thousand forms.
Demons dare not trespass,
Ghosts dare not harbor malevolent essence.
The Three Offices and Northern Fengdu
Inspect the ghostly camps,
Permitting no concealment.
Golden Horse Post presents their reports.

Universally proclaiming without end,
All spirits heed,
The Five Emperors of the Three Realms
Declare to Supreme Clarity:
The primordial essence of emptiness and cavernous void,
The Great One’s namelessness.
Earth traverses the Six Voids,
Transforming the myriad beings,
Jade Capital and Golden City,
Divine Granary of the Nine Clarities.

From one Earth all things are born,
All heavens are perfected—
Without Earth, nothing is born,
Without Earth, there is no yang.
Ancestral Earth is emptiness,
Below, the Dragon’s Prosperity emerges,
In the boundless kalpas of the distant past,
Within the primordial chaos.

Above, emptiness generates color,
Below, emptiness generates the abyss,
Emptiness’s extremity generates wind,
Wind sways and waters topple,
Wind and marsh cavernously void,
The Diamond rides the heavens.
Above and below the heavens,
No darkness, no obscurity,
No form, no shadow,
No limit, no end.

The primordial Earth of the vast expanse,
Named the Great One,
Internally called the Primordial Essence.
The yang of the Primordial Essence—
Vast and dim, without light,
Crimson brightness unfolds the chart,
Revolving deliverance naturally.
The Primordial Beginning precedes the Dao,
Pacifying and stabilizing Earth’s origin.
Emptiness and Brahman compose the scripture,
Scattering the Five Chapters.
Crimson Script and Jade Palace,
Eight Mighty Dragon Scripts,
Preserving and controlling the kalpic destiny,
Ensuring the heavens endure forever.

Brahmanic qi suffuses the net of the cosmos,
Myriad patterns unfold,
The primordial net flows and evolves—
The Thirty-Two Heavens.
Revolving without color,
Circulating the Ten Directions,
Orbiting the Dipper and passing the Winnowing Basket,
Revolving through the Five Constants.

The Thirty-Five Divisions.
The Primordial Qi converges in the Upper Origin,
Eight Luminaries merge in darkness,
Qi enters the Profound Mystery.
Within the Mystery dwells the Supreme August,
The Celestial High Perfected.
Radiant light floods the Great Thunder,
Chanting the cavernous chapters.
Golden Perfected shines resplendent,
Flowing echoes through cloudy encampments,
Jade tones gather qi.
Spirit winds amass mist.
Purple emptiness flourishes in elegance,
Aiding and sheltering the myriad immortals—
All are true earth,
The Primordial Essence of the Great One.
Transforming qi to bring forth completion,
No earth is not formed,
Allied with the Dao.
Though earth has no form,
Within it lives the true.
Earth is both female and male,
Disseminating essence and nurturing spirit,
A thousand harmonies, ten thousand unions—
Naturally becoming true.
Within the true dwells the spirit,
The Lord of Longevity,
The Azure Radiance Noble Son,
The Jade Consort, revered spirit.
The Primordial Essence of the Great One,
The Great Spirit Who Oversees Destiny,
Peach and Plum unite to extend life,
Embodying jade and spreading essence,
Holding talismans and grasping registers,
Preserving life and rooting existence.
Ascending to the Upper Clarity,
Entering and exiting the Flowery Chamber,
Within the Eight Darknesses,
Amid the subtlest realms.
Below, it stabilizes the human body,
Within the Mud-Pill Palace and Crimson Palace.
Centering the five qi,
Blending the hundred spirits.
Ten revolutions return the numinous,
Myriad qi unite as immortals.
The immortal Dao values life,
Limitlessly delivering beings.
Above, the Eight Gates open,
The Dharma Wheel of Flying Celestials,
Karmic prohibitions and precepts,
Past-life causes and conditions.
Universally receiving liberation,
The dead soul revives in a new body,
The body attains rebirth,
Ascending to the various heavens.
Above the various heavens,
Each has its Gate of Life.
Within lies the cavernous hymn of chanting,
The sacred scripture of the True Kings,
Verses that join the High Perfected.

**First: The Sound of the Primordial Essence of the Great One and the Vast Emptiness**
Before the Three Realms were formed,
Heaven and Earth had no name.
The Ten Directions were all empty—
Emptiness, too, was but a borrowed term.
Not knowing the Dao’s Ancestor,
One describes form through emptiness.
Emptiness is non-being,
Pervading all in undifferentiated completion.
All sentient beings
Know only the name of earth.
Obstructed by emptiness,
They do not see the truth of the Dao.
Those who do not know emptiness
Take emptiness as its original name.
Clinging to emptiness, they abandon the Dao,
Attached to emptiness, they stagnate in sound.
Not knowing that emptiness
Is the emptiness of formlessness.
What is formless?
It is the essence of true earth.
Not knowing true earth,
They mistakenly regard it as emptiness.
The nature of emptiness is stubborn and sluggish—
How could things arise from it?
Thus, the Three Realms,
The myriad heavens and the Nine Clarities,
The Jade Capital’s great mountain,
The lofty terraces of Yu Luo—
None can exist of themselves,
But arise through earth.
Earth is named true emptiness,
Giving birth to the ten thousand transformations.
To seek the true apart from emptiness
Is all illusion and falsity.
Do not grasp this emptiness,
Lest it blind your eyes.
Brush away the obscuring film of emptiness,
And true earth reveals its form.
The boundless body of the Dao
Accomplishes all without exception.
Your mysterious female,
Daily drinks the essence of earth.
Thus can you attain long life,
Roaming the Crimson City.
The qi of true earth
Instantly establishes the immortal body.

**Second: The Chapter of the True King of the Primordial Essence of the Great One**
The Highest Divine Empyrean,
A million leagues from earth,
Surrounding the Eight Directions,
The true journey descends in gaze.
The realm of the Divine Empyrean,
With azure emptiness as its companion.
Not knowing azure emptiness
Is where earth resides.
This is not the yin-turbid earth
Of the mundane world,
Which alone can nurture life,
Changing with the years and months.
Reviving at spring’s arrival,
Flourishing in summer.
How much more is this true earth,
Formless and without action,
Neither existing nor non-existing,
The gateway of the ten thousand transformations.
Accumulated clouds form the empyrean,
Sustained by the qi of hardness.
Treading upon it is like silk,
Yet it supports ten thousand jun.
Jade terraces endure for a thousand kalpas,
Vast towers with eightfold eaves.
Carried by Brahmanic qi,
Though high, it does not tower.
Within lies true earth,
Its divine power firmly upholding.
The Primordial Essence of the Great One—
The world cannot know it.
Now I compose this chapter,
Its pure tones naturally harmonize and part.

**Third: The True King of the Primordial Essence of the Great One Sings**
At dawn, I ascend the Great Primordial Peak,
At dusk, I feast at the source of the Celestial River.
In the human realm, two kalpas have passed,
In the Chambered Wind, spring is fresh.
Star-feathered ones adjust their towering crowns,
Reining dragons to ride the divine winds.
The empyrean journey knows no measure of distance,
Only purple clouds, dim and hazy.
Jade maidens strike the ringing *geng*,
Their pure tones echo in the vastness.
Calling to those lost in the vast kalpa,
Joyful and carefree, they mount the cloudy waves.
Incense smoke rises from green windows,
Crimson brocade winds through the purple empyrean.
Emerald hues startle the long towers,
Lightning banners follow the drifting clouds.
Rainbow bridges span the jade beams,
Myriad immortals dance to the numinous hymns.
The world measures three thousand,
Molded by true earth.
Not knowing the Mother of Dao and virtue,
They abandon the sacred to chase after vanities.
Mourning those adrift in the dust,
I sing this to soothe the cloud harp.
Above the Three Realms,
Amid the flying emptiness,
The song of the True King,
Its tones joining the cavernous chapters.
Recite it a hundred times,
And your name ascends to the Southern Palace.
Recite it a thousand times,
The True King protects and welcomes you.
Ten thousand recitations complete the Dao,
Ascending to the Great Emptiness,
Transcending the Three Realms,
Attaining the rank of Duke of Position.
Hearing the numinous tones,
The True King manifests in reverence,
Commanding earth spirits,
To escort and receive you,
Delivering you from the earthly prison,
The five sufferings and eight difficulties.
Seven generations of ancestors ascend,
Forever departing the ghostly bureaus,
The soul crosses the Vermilion Mound,
Undergoes refinement and is reborn.
This is called the limitless,
Universally delivering without end.
There is a secret celestial scripture,
Revered by all heavens.
To leak or profane it
Is to fall into hell,
Bringing calamity to seven generations of ancestors.

The Dao says: These two chapters are the hidden tones of the Celestial Emperors and the Numinous True Kings, pointing to true earth as the return of the Dao, the Primordial Essence of the Great One, which nurtures and radiates splendor. If you can embody this, no misfortune or decline will befall you. Nature is metal, emptiness is earth—child follows mother in harmony. Stabilize and guard it, never parting even for a breath.

The mountain of the Great Primordial,
Twin streams of the colossal tower,
Inhales the true and exhales qi,
The foundation of your destiny.
Extinguish emptiness to see earth,
The myriad qi can be replenished,
Spirit and qi merge,
The gate of death seals itself.
All are the words of the Great Brahman,
Not the common speech of the world.
Their language lacks ornate beauty,
Their melodies lack florid embellishment.
Thus they are called profound and obscure,
Difficult to fathom in detail.
Treasured by the heavens above,
Secretly kept in the Jade Clarity Palace of the Divine Empyrean in the Mysterious Capital,
Circulating in the *ren-chen* year,
The Great Lord descends,
Transmitting by decree.
If there is a perfected one who offers gold and treasures with a sincere heart,
Following the old protocols to pledge alliance with the Ten Heavens,
Only then will it be bestowed.

The Dao speaks: When heaven and earth complete their cyclical decline, when the sun, moon, and five stars wane and wax, when the most sagely and divine persons prosper or falter, when those of shallow learning fall ill or suffer harm—whenever such calamities arise, all of like qi must unite in heart to perform the six-hour purification rites, burn incense, and recite the sutra ten times in succession. Blessings and virtue will descend at once, dissolving all inauspicious omens. The boundless scripture delivers limitless salvation.

The Dao speaks: Those of shallow learning, whose immortal rank remains unfulfilled, whose destined time of passing arrives, whose bodies enter the Great Yin—when the hour of their departure draws near, their fellow students and perfected ones shall burn incense and recite the sutra ten times on their behalf, guiding their corporeal forms according to the proper method. Then the Great One will guard their dwelling, primordial essence will bathe their form, and the True King’s everlasting life-qi will merge with their ethereal and spiritual souls, ascending directly to the Southern Palace. According to the measure of their cultivation, they shall be reborn after a calculated span of days. Freed from the cycle of delusion, they shall attain the immortality of the divine.

The Dao speaks: When heaven and earth reach their cyclical end, when the stellar lodgings fall into disarray, when the sun and moon lose their radiance, when the four seasons fall out of order, when yin and yang fall into discord, when the land suffers calamity—when warfare, punishment, malevolent spirits, banditry, epidemics, and poisons spread, when the multitudes perish or are wounded, when masters and companions pass away, when the Dharma and its students meet with misfortune—then too must purification rites be performed, incense burned, and sutras recited. The merit of purification rites and sutra recitation is profoundly weighty. Above, it dispels heavenly disasters and safeguards the sovereign; below, it wards off poison and harm, delivering the multitudes. In life and death, all depend upon it—its blessings are beyond measure. Thus it is called boundless, universally delivering heaven and humanity.

The Dao speaks: Whoever possesses this sutra and performs these meritorious deeds for the sake of heaven, earth, the sovereign, and the multitudes—on the day of calamity, if they resolve in their hearts to perform purification rites, burn incense, and recite the sutra ten times—all the heavens will record their names, and the ten thousand spirits will attend and protect them. Those of exceptional attainment shall be distinguished and become ministers of the Golden Portals of the Sagely Lord. The heavens record the merits and transgressions of all people, leaving not even a hair’s breadth unaccounted. The True Kings of the heavens shall also safeguard and elevate such persons, and those who attain the Dao shall come to comprehend these most profound words.

The great, hidden speech of the Brahman in the heavens resounds with boundless tones.
Composed by the Dao Lord,
*The Central Scripture of the Primordial Essence of the Great One from the Numinous Writ of the Origin*,
The Eight Heavens of the Eastern Direction.

Amidst the flourishing horns of splendor, the radiance pervades the numinous obscurity.
To the darkest valleys of discernment, the stern decree gallops in even measure.
Offering the sun’s cyclic path, severing the bonds of neighboring lands.
Summoning witnesses to bear the crown, the mat of deliverance beckons the lords.
Huan stands tall in the wilds, Lu and Ding are famed in purity.
The horse’s enclosure calls to stillness, crossing the well of Geng.
The sprouting lingzhi and the sphere’s domain, the soaring numen ascends the heights.
Overflowing and yielding, bearing and slackening, guilt and slander purified in clarity.

The Southern Eight Heavens:
Yue and Yu in solemnity, Bi and Yan in fiery advantage.
The vast and lustrous span time, the recumbent Ruan wheels his skill.
Bursting wells and courier posts, the ox and the rain-laden chariot’s tally.
Governance ceases and all things grow solemn, the cinnabar peaks and ancient isles.
The swallow’s leak and the cauldron’s cavern, the Peng’s confluence flows apart.
The handle of negation spurs the earnest, strength and mystery blaze in the profound.
Seeking in concealment the fierce demand, the liquid cauldron records the Kun’s lineage.
The true and lofty perch on the few, the radiant Brahman approaches warmth.

The Western Eight Heavens:
Beholding the boundless expanse, the mind’s Brahman in tranquil kindred.
Joy in vastness and singular grandeur, sincere thoughts in the dark and vast.
The blessing’s enclosure and cultured mastery, the Dipper’s pass and the vast reliance.
Treading joy and hastening power, the refined and true drift in subtle clouds.
The withered and the blooming await the hour, welcoming the east’s stomach banner.
Refining the ancestors in sudden thought, the distant and boundless draped in jade.
The town’s copy and the calamity’s inscription, the harmonious faction builds the grand.
Spreading and bestowing the lineage, the abyssal awakening in secret whispers.

The Northern Eight Heavens:
The reeking and desolate marsh’s halls, the Dipper’s army and the Han’s governance.
The courtyard’s reckoning and Pan’s truth, the golden chamber and the jade’s perfection.
The servant’s livestock and the turbid isles, the Ba’s dragon in the hidden rapids.
Releasing the pond’s sudden soul, the myriad completions coil to the left.
The axle’s fence in lush patrol, the You’s crags and the zither’s gaze.
The Xia’s rosy clouds pour wisdom, the brief Qian’s cavernous pass.
Seizing the writ and commanding the spirits, the Emperor’s tally in the misty deep.
Forging the covenant in the scorching sea, the ravine’s chapter in full splendor.

The Dao speaks: These are the great Brahman’s hidden words within the heavens, the boundless tones. The True Kings of the Primordial Beginning of old inscribed them with the profound hunt’s brush, summarizing and writing them within the Great Void. Now concealed, now revealed, they summon the qi of the Primordial One’s essence. The Primordial Ancestral Earth gives birth to the myriad numina, becoming the mother of the formed within the chaos, the forerunner of the mandate within the Great Mystery. Those who can comprehend this merge with the hidden and the submerged. The self’s body is fundamentally empty, lodging essence to form the body. From having comes loss of reality; reality departs and returns to the void. The void is but an empty name; the body enters the Great Nothingness. Entering the void like smoke, dispersing and transforming across the ten thousand heavens; emerging from the void to become an immortal, responding to stimuli and following the verdant. Contemplating it, it manifests; forgetting it, it returns to the mysterious. Not knowing the reason, it is naturally so.

Each character spans a full *zhang* in length. The Heavenly Perfected and August Ones of old inscribed these words to establish the correct pronunciation. Those who know these sounds and can purify themselves to recite them shall have all the heavens dispatch the Flying Heavenly Spirit-Kings to descend and observe their bodies, recording their meritorious diligence. This shall be reported to the heavens above, where the myriad spirits shall pay homage, the earthly deities shall attend at the gates, and the great demon-kings shall safeguard and recommend the perfected. With the Dao complete and mastery attained, they may roam the Three Realms and ascend through the Golden Portals.

These sounds repel all, expiate all, deliver all, and accomplish all—such are the Heavenly Perfected’s natural tones. Thus, reciting them causes the True Kings to descend in observation, the Supreme Emperor to chant from afar, the myriad spirits to pay homage, the Three Realms to attend in reverence, the legions of malevolence to bow their heads, and the ghostly essences to perish of themselves. The jade-like resonance vibrates, the ten directions grow solemn and clear, rivers and seas fall silent, mountains and peaks swallow their mists, the myriad numina tremble in submission, and the host of immortals is summoned. The heavens are free of foul vapors, the earth is free of demonic dust, the hidden wisdom shines in clarity, and the vast measure is profoundly mysterious.

*The Wondrous Scripture of the Upper Chapters of the Numinous Treasure’s Boundless Deliverance of Humanity*, Chapter Thirteen Concludes.
Chapter Fourteen.

**The Radiant Yang of Solar Essence**

The Dao spoke: In the past, during the Red Clarity Heaven, the Purple Yang chanted in the Great Treasure Light Land, receiving from the Primordial Beginning the *Upper Chapters of the Boundless Deliverance of Humanity: The Radiant Yang of Solar Essence*.

When the Primordial Heavenly Worthy was about to expound this scripture, he circumambulated ten times to summon the ten directions, and only then ascended his seat. The Heavenly Perfected, the Supreme Sages, the Exalted Honored Ones, the Perfected of Wondrous Conduct, the Empresses and Consorts of the Solar Palace of Cavernous Yang, the Celestial Officials and Immortals within the sun, and an innumerable host arrived borne upon the void. Crimson clouds and cinnabar auroras, jade chariots and wheeling constellations, canopies of blossoming shade, the solar essence and radiant yang—nine-hued vapors surged in abundance, illuminating the vast heavens. For seven days and seven nights, the stellar spirits of the myriad heavens flew forth, their trailing rays intersecting in splendor, their brilliance piercing the farthest reaches of the void. The divine palaces grew still, the celestial pivots ceased their turning, the Jade Armillary and Golden Balance stood poised and motionless, the divine winds fell silent, mountains and seas concealed their clouds. The celestial landscape shone with radiant yang, the flow of qi gleamed with clarity. The land, mountains, rivers, forests, and groves of the entire realm were leveled to perfect evenness, no longer distinguished by height or depth, and the earth transformed entirely into red jade, without variation in hue.

The assembled Perfected attended the seat as the Primordial Heavenly Worthy, in profound repose, sat upon the floating nine-dragon throne of the Radiant Yang’s Flaming Pearl Treasure Mountain. When he had expounded the scripture once, the Great Saints of the heavens simultaneously voiced their approval. At that time, the men and women of the realm gazed upward at the solar essence, its ninefold resplendent rays, the radiant yang’s rosy qi spreading throughout the heavens. They recognized this true essence as the progenitor of the ten thousand things.

When he had expounded the scripture a second time, the palaces within the sun appeared in a thousand jeweled hues, and the celestial immortals and people all returned to the true Dao.

When he had expounded it a third time, the world within the sun, upheld by the adamantine winds, stood alone in the midst of the void, traversing boundless space.

When he had expounded it a fourth time, jade axles rode the clouds, amassing purple-golden light that shone downward without limit, ripening and maturing all things.

When he had expounded it a fifth time, the great celestial patterns and the vast Brahmā were all beheld within the sun. The characters revolved and spiraled, their rosy rays bending and curving, their hidden words and profound mysteries all thoroughly comprehended.

When he had expounded it a sixth time, the qi of Cavernous Yang, nine million leagues in height, descended to the eight extremities, and the worthy sages and golden treasures were formed by its power.

When he had expounded it a seventh time, the luminous clarity of Cavernous Yang pierced the darkest night. White bones and frozen remains were warmed by its radiance, ascending with its light to emerge from the sea of darkness.

When he had expounded it an eighth time, vermilion light spread in all four directions, and jade and stone absorbed its essence. The yang souls responded to its touch, all transforming into cinnabar blossoms.

When he had expounded it a ninth time, the cavern-chambers and mountain peaks, where Perfected and hidden immortals dwelled, drew in the light and hastened toward the dawn, their ancestral roots flourishing in abundance.

When he had expounded it a tenth time, the solar essence abided in auspiciousness, the ten thousand things congealed and thrived, golden nectar flowed in abundance, and the withered and decayed became treasures. At that time, every man and woman of the realm turned their hearts in devotion, all received protection and deliverance, and each attained longevity.

The Dao spoke: At that time, when the Primordial Heavenly Worthy had expounded the scripture once, the Great Spirit of the Azure Emperor of the Solar Palace in the Eastern Limitless and Boundless Realm arrived borne upon the void with an innumerable host.

When he had expounded it a second time, the Great Spirit of the Vermilion Emperor of the Solar Palace in the Southern Limitless and Boundless Realm arrived borne upon the void with an innumerable host.

When he had expounded it a third time, the Great Spirit of the White Emperor of the Solar Palace in the Western Limitless and Boundless Realm arrived borne upon the void with an innumerable host.

When he had expounded it a fourth time, the Great Spirit of the Black Emperor of the Solar Palace in the Northern Limitless and Boundless Realm arrived borne upon the void with an innumerable host.

When he had expounded it a fifth time, the Great Spirit of the Yellow Emperor of the Solar Palace in the Northeastern Limitless and Boundless Realm arrived borne upon the void with an innumerable host.

When he had expounded it a sixth time, the Great Spirit of the Crimson Whirlwind of the Solar Palace in the Southeastern Limitless and Boundless Realm arrived borne upon the void with an innumerable host.

When he had expounded it a seventh time, the Secondary Spirit of the Purple Crystal of the Solar Palace in the Southwestern Limitless and Boundless Realm arrived borne upon the void with an innumerable host.

When he had expounded it an eighth time, the Great Spirit of the Blazing Elephant of the Solar Palace in the Northwestern Limitless and Boundless Realm arrived borne upon the void with an innumerable host.

When he had expounded it a ninth time, the Great Spirit of the Golden Treasury of the Solar Palace in the Upper Limitless and Boundless Realm arrived borne upon the void with an innumerable host.

When he had expounded it a tenth time, the Great Spirit of the Radiant Yang of the Solar Palace in the Lower Limitless and Boundless Realm arrived borne upon the void with an innumerable host.

When the ten recitations were complete, the Solar Soul Emperor Lords of the Ten Limitless Directions and the Heavenly Perfected, the Boundless Great Spirits, all arrived at once. The men and women of the realm turned their hearts in devotion and reverence. Each addressed the others, saying together: "We have long enjoyed the causes of good fortune and for ages received the power of the Dao, born and dwelling in the realm of the Dao, abiding above the sun and moon. Yet we knew only how to ride the flowing light and radiant essence, illuminating the heavens, surging and rushing through seas and mountains. Our palaces and gardens, all transformed into the wondrous hues of true gold. Today, the Primordial Beginning has revealed to us the method of the Radiant Yang of Solar Essence, refining and purifying the double yang, inhaling the resplendent hues, permeating the marrow with supreme yang, transmuting flesh and bone into gold. The Three Origins and Nine Qi nurture and foster the ten thousand things—without the solar essence, none could be nourished. Those who pursue learning externally refine metals and minerals, regulating water and fire. The sun and moon have their cycles, and transformation attains numinosity. Those who cultivate internally nurture their singular form, for the sun is the image of the heart. The qi within the sun illumines the hundred passages, and thirty thousand divine youths hasten toward the yang’s rising light. The sun is the Fire Dragon, producing jade nectar. The stomach is the earthen cauldron, where the primordial fire refines and smelts. With a thousand days of effort, the true Dao is swiftly accomplished. What we have known are but the outer edges of the method. What the Primordial Beginning has proclaimed must surely be the most profound and hidden. We wish to hear the supreme method, to remove the mountains of our obstructions."

Those who came were like fine rain or dense mist, an innumerable host, pressing upon the land until half the realm sank beneath them, an unstoppable force.

Thereupon, the Primordial Beginning surveyed the great assembly, gazing upon all in attendance. Extending his arm of purple-golden radiance, adorned in the nine-hued Cavernous Auroral Fire Jade Net Garment, he reached forth with his hand, and through his great divine power, stretching thirty-three myriad leagues in length, he plucked the solar orb as one might pluck a sweet fruit.

The radiant flame stood resplendent, its light suffusing the ten directions, emanating from the empty mystery. The solar orb shone perfectly round and lustrous, within which lay mountains and forests, rivers and seas, palaces and cities, gates and battlements—countless immortals dwelling in carefree ease, as though golden hues were contained within a jewel of beryl. All the heavenly beings in that assembly drew near to behold it.

Thereupon, the Primordial Beginning transformed this solar orb into a precious pearl, vast as a grain of millet, suspended in the empty mystery nine *zhang* above the earth. The Primordial Beginning ascended and led the Celestial Perfected, the Great Divinities, the Exalted Worthies, the Perfected of Wondrous Conduct, the Emperors and Empresses of the Sun, and the boundless host of great spirits—all entered into the precious pearl. The heavenly beings gazed upward, seeing only a gentle stirring as they passed through the pearl’s mouth. Once within, their whereabouts were unknown.

The people of the land dispersed, and the earth returned to levelness, no longer slanted or sunken. Within the precious pearl, the Primordial Beginning expounded the sutra in its entirety. The assembled Perfected oversaw the transmission, bestowing it upon me. At that moment, joy and celebration defied description. The affairs now roughly settled, the deities of the heavens returned to their stations. In an instant, all fell silent, leaving no trace of sound.

From that time forth, the heavenly beings who encountered the scriptural Dharma were universally delivered, their original lifespans preserved without harm. The entire land turned in reverence, their hearts inclined toward goodness. They illuminated the Dao and the True, the Dharma and the Precepts, the Sutras and the Principles. They illuminated yin and yang, the divine and the qi. Their words aligned with the profound chapters, their mouths free of reckless speech. United in compassion and love, even those of different bones became kin. The land knew peace, the people abundance, and all rejoiced in great harmony. From the scripture’s first promulgation, the kingdom was guided by the Dao. Those who had cultivated utmost sincerity, who revered and honored it, all attained deliverance across the ages.

The Dao spoke: What the Primordial Heavenly Worthy expounds within the scripture are the inner names of the Sun’s Supreme Emperor, the sounds of the yang rhymes—also the hidden names of the Sun’s officials, the concealed appellations of Yang Brightness. The Sun is the origin of the Three Qi and the father of all yang. Gazing upon it, immortals become boundless; drawing from it, the Celestial Valley fills with emptiness and plenitude. Within it arises the Purple Perfected; preserving it dispels the corpse and refines the hun-soul; facing it, the Nine Auroras pour forth numinous power. Through it, creation attains its course; by it, the divine and sagely gain illumination—these are no ordinary words of the world. Only the perfected Realized Ones, who have penetrated the profound and plumbed the subtle, can fully grasp its chapters. Reciting it ten times, auspicious light manifests portents: the Five Emperors offer rites, divine crows fan their radiance, golden essence soars in splendor, crimson chariots halt their wheels. The cinnabar hubs cease turning, all demons bind their forms, ghostly spirits lose their clarity. The dead beyond decay rise again; from bones, humans are reborn.

For scholars of the highest learning, if their masters recite it ten times, the Five Emperors stand guard, the Three Realms bow in reverence, Yang Brightness illumines all with penetrating light. Flowing fire blazes fiercely, demonic essences lose their sight, ghostly perils fade in clarity. The dying are delivered, the severed restored to life. The reason for this: scholars’ impure qi has not yet dissipated, their bodies have not fully attained the Perfected Dao. They harness the essence of the Sun, yet their power does not govern the celestial administration. Their virtue may subdue and command earthly spirits, binding and dispelling demonic numina—but this only releases the dead, not restores them to life. To recite this chapter lightly brings calamity upon oneself. To honor and revere it with offerings ensures the flourishing of one’s household, prosperity through generations, and karmic bonds with goodness. Ten thousand disasters will not assail them; divine luminaries guard their gates.

This scripture is most revered and wondrous, unmatched in the Jade Capital. It delivers countless beings, serving as the root of all Dao. Vast and majestic, its virtue is beyond measure.

The Dao spoke: For those who recite this scripture ten times, Yang Brightness descends with immortals, the Sun’s gate turns its mechanism, the Nine Yin dispel their obscurations. The gates of the Yellow Springs radiate light; ancestors of a hundred million generations, suffering souls in the dark realms, all immediately receive deliverance. They ascend to the Vermilion Palace, where after nine years of refinement, they are transformed and reborn, becoming noble persons. Those who diligently study this scripture cast off the yin of the Dao. The Nine Yang refine their substance, divine light enters their hearts, their hearts shine like the morning sun, their five viscera become gold. All receive deliverance, ascending to the Southern Palace.

For those in the world who recite it, their lifespans are extended, their years prolonged. Thereafter, they all attain the Dao of corpse liberation. The essence of the Sun floats in the void, purple mist swirls thickly, their divine dwellings are serene and tranquil, celestial numina soar on high. Their hun and shen briefly vanish, yet they do not pass through hell, immediately regaining their forms to roam the Great Void. This scripture is utterly wondrous, universally delivering boundless beings. All heavenly and mortal beings receive its blessings. Limitless blessings bestow grace upon life and death. What Heaven truly treasures is not transmitted to the lower world. Only the most devoted scholars, offering gold and treasures with sincerity, may swear oaths to Heaven and transmit it.

Reckless disclosure and negligent transmission bring calamity upon nine generations, condemning them to eternal servitude under the officials of the netherworld. Those who uphold this scripture are attended by the Five Thearchs, with twenty-four Jade Lads and twenty-four Jade Maidens each, who safeguard the sacred writ and shield the bodies of its recipients.

The Dao declares: In the first month, observe a prolonged fast and recite this scripture. The Five Thearchs will bestow registers, the Radiant Yang will deliver souls, and for the departed of former generations, it severs earthly bonds and liberates them from servitude, ascending them to the Southern Palace.

In the seventh month, observe a prolonged fast and recite this scripture. The essence of the Sun flows like molten gold. The Crimson Lad bears a flask, offering you jade nectar to drink, ensuring eternal stability and immortality. Your name is inscribed in the heavens, recorded on yellow registers and white tablets, erasing death and granting life.

In the tenth month, observe a prolonged fast and recite this scripture. The Sun’s pool radiates light, crimson blossoms and jade petals play amidst dewdrops, golden auroras waft fragrance. For kings and emperors, rulers and ministers, fathers and sons, it secures the throne, stabilizes the nation, and preserves Heaven’s enduring favor. Dynasties endure unbroken, perpetually ruling as sovereigns, pacifying their realms, and bringing joyous peace to the people.

On the eight seasonal festivals, recite this scripture. The essence of the Sun merges with primordial light, circulating through the Jade Capital. Gazing upon the golden radiance, aspiring toward the Radiant Yang, one becomes a Perfected of the Nine Palaces.

On one’s natal day, recite this scripture. It fortifies the divine palace within, crimson chariots and brocade banners arise with the Sun. Attaining the name of the Dao, the hun and shen become pure and upright, the myriad qi endure eternally, sparing one from suffering and affliction. The body emanates luminous brilliance. The Three Realms provide escort, the Five Thearchs oversee reception, the ten thousand spirits pay homage, names are inscribed in Heaven, merits are fulfilled, and virtue is perfected. One ascends in flight to the Upper Clarity.

The Dao declares: On the day of practicing the Dao, one must bathe in fragrant waters, observe purification rites, and enter the chamber facing east. Knock the teeth thirty-two times, making it heard in the thirty-two heavens. Bow thirty-two times in reverence. Close the eyes and silently envision oneself seated within a nine-colored purple cloud, enveloped in profound darkness, with the Azure Dragon, White Tiger, Vermilion Bird, Dark Warrior, Lion, and White Crane arrayed to the left and right. The Sun and Moon illuminate brilliantly, suffusing the chamber with radiance. A circular halo emerges from the crown, its light pervading the ten directions—this vision must be held clearly. Recite the secret incantation:

"Supreme Mystery and Origin, Most High Dao Lord, summon forth the Three and Five Merit Officers within my body, the attendants of the left and right, the Jade Lads bearing incense, the Jade Maidens transmitting words, the Five Thearchs’ direct talismans, and the thirty-six incense officials of the day. Open the gates to convey my words. Today is an auspicious occasion, a prolonged fast in the purified hall, practicing the supreme scripture to deliver boundless beings. May my entreaties ascend directly to the presence of the Most High, the Primordial Celestial Worthy of the Thirty-Two Heavens."

Conclude by drawing qi thirty-two times, then face east and recite the scripture:

*The Supreme Primordial’s Wondrous Scripture of Limitless Salvation*

The Supreme Primordial’s Cavernous Mystery, Numinous Treasure’s fundamental chapter, the Sun’s essence and Radiant Yang’s supreme scripture, pours forth light to deliver humanity. The hundred demons conceal their tones, parting and uniting naturally. The Crimson Clarity of the Primal Cavern, the peerless Perfected of Non-Being, existed before Heaven and Earth, eternally self-subsistent since antiquity.

The Moon is the water’s embryo; the Sun is the gold’s essence. The Sun resembles a pellet, enveloped by the Moon’s dark embryo, shaped like a hen’s egg, containing five colors that swirl into five luminosities. The Sun resides within; the Moon embraces it without. Primordial qi enfolds them, gradually transforming into Heaven and Earth. Earth ascends to Heaven; Heaven merges with Earth. Their essence intermingles in chaos, pure and turbid yet undivided, called the Embryo of Origin.

Once Heaven and Earth opened, the Sun and Moon separated from the embryo. The Sun’s essence, Radiant Yang, holds the number nine-five, corresponding to the Qian position. The Sun ascends the Eastern Mulberry, the flying dragon soars in the heavens, metal and water part forms, and the Sun’s essence takes shape. Rising by day and descending by night, the Zi and Wu hours serve as its meridian.

The Sun is ninety thousand li in circumference, containing within it the Golden City and the Cavernous Yang Palace, the Azure Grove. Consuming its blossoms and fruits grants longevity equal to the Sun’s, enabling flight to the Upper Clarity and traversal of the firmament’s paths.

In the Primordial Ancestral Kalpa, the Supreme Primordial transformed and gave birth to the myriad heavens, illuminating the Three Luminaries—this is the root of Heaven. Above, there is no further ancestor; only the Dao is its body.

The Treasured Chapters of Yu Yi, the Sun Thearch’s divine writ, the Crimson Script’s expansive revelation, universally establishes the numinous. Without script, there is no illumination; without script, there is no clarity; without script, there is no establishment; without script, there is no completion; without script, there is no deliverance; without script, there is no generation. This is the Great Brahma Heaven within Heaven, the Crimson Pool and Vermilion Terrace, the Crimson Grove and Cinnabar Capital, the Nine Dragons’ Solar Forge ascending to the Sun’s city.

Vast and distant, the kalpa’s blade exists as if absent, yet present. The earth’s blossoms part, revealing the wondrous court. Golden gates and jade chambers stand in serried ranks, pure and resplendent. The divine auroras of the Numinous Empyrean circulate through the ten directions. Within resides the Sun’s essence and Radiant Yang’s spirit, the Lord of Longevity of the Southern Culmen, the Azure Florescence Thearch of the Eastern Culmen, the Great Divinity Sima who delivers the world, the Venerable Lord Han who cherishes life, the Exalted Divinities of the Southern Supreme who govern fate, record years, extend lifespan, and deliver from calamity.

These reverse decay and revive the dead, delivering boundless beings. Today, the celestial records are examined as the myriad heavens descend in attendance.

The Boundless Flying Celestial Sun-Centered Divine Kings of the East, Great Sages of Longevity, deliver boundless beings.
The Boundless Flying Celestial Sun-Centered Divine Kings of the South, Great Sages of Longevity, deliver boundless beings.
The Boundless Flying Celestial Sun-Centered Divine Kings of the West, Great Sages of Longevity, deliver boundless beings.

The Boundless Flying Celestial Sun-Centered Divine Kings of the Below, Great Sages of Longevity, deliver boundless beings. The Perfected of the Ten Directions, Flying Celestial Sun-Centered Divine Kings, deliver the world with longevity, boundless great spirits. Together they ride clouds of rosy dawn mist and radiant hues, their ranks adorned with flowing bells and cinnabar jade. Crimson hibiscus and vermilion wheels bear them forth, drawn by vermilion phoenixes and fire-dragons of solar essence. They raise standards of luminous gauze, crimson coral banners fluttering before them as nine phoenixes cry in unison, while eight simurghs sing in harmony behind. Divine lions and sacred birds chant and intone, their melodies resounding. The Five Thearchs open the way, solar immortals steady the shafts, and a hundred million chariots with ten thousand riders float through the void. Their light bends back as they turn their reins, overseeing the Perfected and delivering the living.

The Gold Tower’s Chancellor, the Southern Prosperity Upper Palace, Han the Director of Records, and the Great Spirits who oversee life—holding registers and grasping ledgers—all assemble before the Emperor. According to those who ought to be delivered, they strictly examine the heavens.

Universally proclaimed to the boundless divine realms of the Three Realms, the subterranean courts of the Yellow Springs, the Northern Capital of Fengdu, the Three Offices and Nine Bureaus, the Twelve River Sources: may the ancestors of past generations, the karmic kin of a hundred kalpas, swiftly have their names stricken from the ledgers of sin, their evil roots severed and destroyed. They must not be detained or forced into the ranks of ghosts. By the Sun Emperor’s talismanic command, they ascend at the appointed hour. From the Cold Pool of the Northern Capital, their forms and souls are guarded and escorted, demons restrained, merits protected, and their ranks delivered to the Southern Palace. The dead receive refinement and transform into immortals; the living receive deliverance and endure through kalpas. With each turning of the kalpa, they share the same lifespan as Heaven. Forever delivered from the Three Paths, the Five Sufferings, and the Eight Difficulties, they transcend the Three Realms and roam freely in the Upper Clarity.

In the Heaven of Upper Clarity, the Jade Emperor’s radiance illuminates the formless realm of Brahman conduct. The Eight Heavens of the East: the Heaven of Imperial Splendor and Jade Beams, where the Emperor subdues demonic might; the Heaven of Nine Elixirs’ Radiant Glory, where the Emperor feasts in profound harmony; the Heaven of Azure Forests Stirring the Sun, where the Emperor’s jade resounds with rare brilliance; the Heaven of Sun Perfection and Treasure Wisdom, where the Emperor’s grace purifies and guards the golden; the Heaven of Dawn’s Enlightenment and Secret Mystery, where the Emperor’s essence ascends in subtlety; the Heaven of Joyous Realms Observing the Origin, where the Emperor’s arts abide; the Heaven of Azure Wilds Transforming the Capital, where the Emperor stirs clouds in the cavernous heights; the Heaven of Starry Brilliance and Radiance, where the Emperor’s orchids flourish in the pavilion.

The Eight Heavens of the South: the Heaven of Vermilion Chariots and Crimson Light, where the Emperor’s gaze burns red; the Heaven of the Crimson Sphere’s Left-Turning Divine Chariot, where the Emperor’s profit lies in hidden origins; the Heaven of Rounded Scenery and Lush Terraces, where the Emperor’s virtue spreads in distant dispatches; the Heaven of Purple Flourishing and Divine Preparation, where the Emperor’s audience is profound and sincere; the Heaven of Yellow Qi and Solar Essence, where the Emperor’s vastness extends to the celestial houses; the Heaven of Vermilion Splendor and Imperial Capitals, where the Emperor’s majesty holds the subtle; the Heaven of Floral Pavilions and Cloud Patterns, where the Emperor’s jade exudes fragrant rectitude; the Heaven of Yang’s Circumambulation, where the Emperor aids in resolute righteousness.

The Eight Heavens of the West: the Heaven of Absolute Peace and Pristine Spirits, where the Emperor seals the passes and swears to the yin; the Heaven of Elegant Joy and Celebratory Ascension, where the Emperor solemnly establishes the foundation; the Heaven of Golden Auras Gathering Radiance, where the Emperor’s azure clouds congeal into jade; the Heaven of Pristine Qi and Seven Classics, where the Emperor’s sword gleams with cinnabar marvel; the Heaven of Resourceful Strength and Swift Action, where the Emperor commands lightning and spirits; the Heaven of Recorded Substance and Protective Guardianship, where the Emperor’s distant journey is cultivated; the Heaven of Ritual Prohibitions and Demon-Severing, where the Emperor’s upright seal weighs heavily; the Heaven of Aspiring Immortals and Jade Dragons, where the Emperor’s blue axe reaches the teeth.

The Eight Heavens of the North: the Heaven of True Circulation and Boundless Extension, where the Emperor roams the high pivot; the Heaven of Divine Protection and Ancestral Harmony, where the Emperor examines principles and investigates the chambers; the Heaven of Solar Fullness and Capital Perfection, where the Emperor treads the numinous and shines with brilliance; the Heaven of Treasure Radiance and Life’s Mandate, where the Emperor’s utmost thoughts establish peace; the Heaven of Bluegreen Pillars Locking the Vast, where the Emperor’s brilliance diminishes and spreads; the Heaven of Silent Constancy and Embodied Clarity, where the Emperor’s connection is diligent and reverent; the Heaven of Reported Moments and Awakened Origin, where the Emperor’s rebuke reaches the profound; the Heaven of Primordial Clarity and Peaceful Compliance, where the Emperor’s casting completes the profound.

The Thirty-Two Heavens, the Thirty-Two Emperors—each heaven’s hidden taboos, each heaven’s hidden names. The empty void within the heavens, the natural numinous verses, each heaven’s hidden rhymes, the sounds within the sun. The honored within the sun, the Emperor within the sun, the Perfected August One within the sun, the numen within the sun. Nine lights and ten blossoms transform into Upper Clarity, boundless mysteries too profound to detail. They bestow upon the divine Perfected, universally delivering heaven and humanity.

Today, rejoicing in receiving deliverance, they descend to welcome the sun’s Perfected. They rinse with auroral mists and swallow solar effulgences, donning the radiance of yang brightness. Golden liquid tempers their bones, jade nectar restores their spirits. Their bodies ascend upon jeweled chariots, becoming the Emperor’s exalted guests. They rise to the ancestral halls of mystery, passing through the barriers of the heavens. They beseech the eradication of all evils, severing the roots of desire, flying beyond the Five Sufferings, their names inscribed in the Great Mystery.

The Eastern Dipper assists on the left, the Western Dipper aids on the right, the Northern Dipper commands the host, the Southern Dipper governs the Great Hub, and the Central Dipper follows the wheel, riding behind the sun. Vermilion peaks tower like palace gates, crimson capitals stand in jade splendor. As essence circulates and life is bestowed, the world’s Dao proceeds.

The Azure Thearch guards the hun-soul, the sun’s essence transmitting to the liver. The White Thearch attends the po-soul, the sun’s essence passing through the lungs. The Red Thearch nurtures qi, the sun’s essence refining the heart. The Black Thearch circulates the blood, the sun’s essence dispelling yin. The Yellow Thearch governs the spleen, upon which all things depend.

The Azure Thearch’s Divine King, with the majesty of Horn and Straddler constellations; the Red Thearch’s Divine King, swift as billowing smoke and scorching separation; the White Thearch’s Divine King, pristine as silver auras and blazing radiance; the Black Thearch’s Divine King, dark as profound purple light; the Yellow Thearch’s Divine King, golden and numinous with eightfold flight. The Five Thearchs, great spirits, are the ancestors of solar yang. They roam the empty brightness, flying and drumming in procession, commanding divine soldiers, wielding banners and drums, surveying the great void. Proclaiming their resplendent titles, the heavens unite in merit. Delivering humanity above, they strictly oversee Fengdu in the north.

The Divine Kings receive their mandate. Universally sweeping away misfortune, flames spew poison. Four crimson-armored fire soldiers with flaming heads lead the vanguard, solar generals brandish banners, hurling fire for ten thousand leagues, their flowing bells resounding in eight directions. Should any dare to challenge or obstruct the Perfected Above, the golden axes strike first. They behead the Queen of Heaven’s rebels, slaughtering and dismembering ghostly wraiths. Wind and fire never cease—thousands upon thousands of heads severed, ten thousand upon ten thousand forms destroyed. Demons dare not trespass, ghosts dare not harbor malevolent spirits. The Three Offices and Fengdu in the north clearly inspect the ghostly camps, permitting no concealment. The Golden Horse Post presents their reports.

A universal proclamation without end. All spirits hearken, the Three Realms and Five Emperors array their words before the Supreme Clarity. The Primordial Cavern’s Jade Chronicle, the Great Beginning’s Dragon Prosperity, the Cavern Yang’s qi-Origin, the hidden embryo’s latent store—dim and distant through kalpas untold. Within the chaos, it was as an egg in form. The sun’s essence, the crimson numen, embraced and gave birth. The root of the Three Luminaries. When metal and water split, the waxing and waning crescents divided. That which becomes light and brightness is the sun’s hun-soul. Above, the Crimson Cavern; below, the Painted Abyss. Wind and marsh expand the void. Great brilliance adorns the heavens. Above the heavens, below the heavens—no darkness, no obscurity, no form, no shadow, no limit, no end. The primordial flood is the Dao, vast and unillumined. The Crimson Radiance’s vast plan unfolds by its own measure. The Primordial Beginning—settled and secure. The reckoning scatters five scrolls: crimson script on jade, sun-borne jasper texts. They govern the kalpa’s course, ensuring heaven’s eternal endurance. Brahmā’s qi fills the cosmos; myriad patterns unfold. The sun’s essence, yang brightness—thirty-two heavens revolve without color, circling the ten directions. The Dipper wheels past the Winnowing Basket. The Five Constants revolve; thirty-five divisions gather the qi of the Upper Origin. The Eight Luminaries merge in darkness; qi enters the Mystery of Mysteries. Within the sun, the Grand August One, the Five Emperors and lofty Perfected, drift upon the Great Rosy Clouds, whistling and chanting cavern hymns. Golden Perfected gleam in radiance; their flowing echoes fill the cloud camps. Jade tones gather qi; numinous winds assemble mists. The Purple Radiance’s solemn splendor. Within the sun, ten thousand immortals. The sun’s essence enters the body, descending through the Three Fields. Refining gold into liquid, gestating earth as lead. Casting it into the stomach’s furnace, heart-fire and kidney-spring, the ceasing yin fans the bellows. Liquid flows through a hundred rivers; the azure sea’s divine turtle exhales qi like smoke. The golden liquid transmits through the ears. The embryo becomes a jade infant. A thousand harmonies, ten thousand unions—naturally attaining perfection. Within the Perfected dwells a spirit: the Ageless Great Elder. The Peerless Lord, the White Prime Honored Spirit, the Great One Who Oversees Destiny, the Peach Prosperity’s assembly hall. They grasp talismans and hold registers, preserving life and planting its root. Ascending to the Supreme Clarity, entering and exiting the Flowery Chambers, within the eight poles, amid the most subtle. Below, they settle within the human body: the Mud-Pill Palace and Crimson Palace. Within, they order the Five Qi and harmonize the hundred spirits. Ten revolutions return the numen; ten thousand qi unite the immortals. The immortal’s path values life, delivering boundlessly. Above, the Eight Gates open; the Wheel of Flying Heaven turns. Transgressions and blessings, prohibitions and precepts, karmic conditions from past lives. Universally receiving deliverance, the dead soul gains a living body. The body attains rebirth, ascending to be heard by the various heavens. Above the various heavens, each has its solar gate. Refining yin to complete yang, flowing fire transforms form. The sun’s essence congeals and infuses—thus one becomes an immortal Perfected. Within it are the empty cavern’s chants and songs, the Perfected King’s numinous scrolls, verses that join the lofty Perfected.

**First: The Sun’s Essence, Yang Brightness, Flying Void’s Sound**
The Primordial Beginning’s crimson essence. The Three Origins rely on its completion; vermilion radiance illuminates the colorless cavern’s dark depths. Azure forests, golden blossoms. Jade fruits glow faintly. Crimson walls stretch ten thousand leagues; vermilion towers and red courts. The Five Emperors act without contrivance; ten thousand immortals array as ministers. Countless people wander freely, drinking light and consuming blossoms. Consorts and jade maidens burn incense and present offerings. Those who can draw in the rosy clouds race to the numinous Supreme Clarity. Golden countenances, jeweled crowns, brocade banners, embroidered standards. Six Jia spirits lead the way; six Ding spirits follow behind. The might of yang brightness annihilates yin’s ugliness. The Emperor bestows long life, extending years and enduring ages. The path of the Supreme Perfected is called the Nine Yangs.

**Second: The Sun’s Essence, Yang Brightness, Perfected King’s Scroll**
The sun’s boundary roams the void, floating through the Nine Palaces. Riding solitary strength, it circles upon the numinous wind. The cosmos is golden; mountains and seas are as one. Myriad beings rely on it for life; the Three Origins share its merit. This is the Primordial Beginning’s body, dividing form and transforming appearance. Nine refinements of cavern yang emerge before the primordial flood. Vermilion rays, the numinous crow, inhaling and exhaling the Great Hub. Those who can resonate with it gain luminous wisdom and numinous penetration. Still observation, distant discernment—returning to youth from old age. Beings that resonate with it flourish in purity and elegance. Cinnabar, precious jades, resplendent jasper mushrooms. Pearls swim in cloud seas; phoenixes perch in the Purple Tenuity. The sun’s essence, yang brightness—this is the Dao’s true return. I chant the Boundless Scroll to protect you from misfortune and decline.

**Third: The Sun’s Essence, Yang Brightness, Perfected King’s Song**
Crimson rosy clouds fly with purple mist; jasper wheels surge from the bright sea. Fusang congeals golden rays—through ten thousand ages, its hue never fades. Thus we know the Primordial Beginning’s essence, concealed in the abyss before heaven. Nine dragons harness the yang chariot, suddenly rising beyond the world. Heaven and earth form a valley; the Three Qi are already harmonized. Sun and moon become the divine elixir; absorbing essence dispels death’s decay. Alas, these stubborn immortals, forging stones into mere lumps. Why not draw the dragon shafts, circulate the liquid to drop pearl and cowrie? Pierce the nodes, connect the hundred gates—solar qi shatters the dark and dim. Chew clouds, shatter red glass. Drink the radiance to intoxicate the spirit. Do not fathom Penglai’s waters, ever mourning life’s opposition to death. At dawn, before the Five Emperors, the Dao’s secret seeks the profound meeting. Above these Three Realms, within the flying void, the Perfected King’s song. Its sound joins the cavern hymns. Recite it a hundred times—your name enters the Southern Palace. Harmonize it a thousand times—the Perfected King safeguards and welcomes. Ten thousand recitations complete the Dao—ascend to the Great Void. Traverse the Three Realms, attain the rank of Immortal Duke. Those who hear the numinous sound, the Perfected King reveres their form, commands the Earth’s Only, and dispatches attendants to escort them. Drawn from the earth’s gates, freed from the Five Sufferings and Eight Woes. Seven ancestors ascend; forever parted from the Dark Offices. The hun-soul crosses Crimson Mound, receives refinement and rebirth—this is called the Boundless. Universally delivering without end.

There is a secret celestial text; all heavens revere it. Those who leak or slight it fall to the earth’s joy, calamity extending to seven ancestral grandfathers.

The Dao states: These two scrolls are the hidden sounds of the Five Emperors’ Solemn Splendor Perfected Kings within the sun, illuminating the sun’s essence, yang brightness, and the Gate of Dawn. They enter and exit the rosy clouds, aiding the Perfected’s deliverance. The Three Realms compare them to enlightenment; the Two Modes hold them to divide and judge. Those who can absorb the sun’s essence’s qi.

Adorning oneself with the radiance of yang brightness,
then golden blossoms transform into immortality,
and seven ancestors receive refinement.
All these are the words of the Great Brahma,
not the common speech of the mundane world.
Their words lack ornate rhythm,
their melodies lack florid embellishment—
thus are they called profound and obscure,
difficult to fathom in detail.
Treasured by the heavens above,
they are concealed within the Jade Clarity Kingly Palace of Highest Divine Empyrean in Mystic Capital.
When the Dao Lord descended to the world,
he transmitted them in accord with the turning of the kalpas.
Should a perfected one offer gold and treasures with sincere heart,
and follow the ancient rites to pledge alliance with the Ten Heavens,
only then shall they be bestowed.

The Dao states:
When the cycles of heaven and earth reach their end,
when the sun, moon, and five planets wane and wax,
when the most sagely divine ones face decline,
and those of shallow learning suffer affliction—
whenever such calamities arise,
all of like qi must unite in heart to perform purification rites,
burn incense through the six watches,
and recite the scripture ten times in full.
Virtue and blessing shall descend at once,
dispelling all inauspicious omens.
This boundless text universally delivers without end.

The Dao states:
When those of shallow learning in the Dao,
whose immortal rank remains unfulfilled,
face the destined end of their kalpa,
their bodies pass through the Great Yin.
At the moment of their crossing,
fellow perfected ones of the same learning shall burn incense for them
and recite the scripture ten times,
to deliver their corporeal forms according to the method.
The essence of the sun flows downward,
yang brightness opens the yin,
bones refine and corpses vanish,
qi merges with celestial perfection.
The hun-soul ascends directly to the Southern Palace,
where, according to the merit of their studies,
they shall be reborn after a calculated span of days.
Once the Wheel of Rebirth ceases to delude,
they shall attain divine immortality.

The Dao states:
When the cycles of heaven and earth reach their end,
when constellations deviate from their courses,
when the sun and moon lose their radiance,
when the four seasons fall into disorder,
when yin and yang fail to harmonize,
when the land suffers calamity,
when pestilence and poison spread,
when the people perish and are harmed,
when teachers and companions pass away—
then too must purification rites be performed,
incense burned, and scriptures recited.
For the merit of purification rites and scripture recitation is most weighty:
above, it dispels celestial disasters and safeguards the emperor;
below, it wards off poison and harm, delivering the people.
In life and death, all depend upon it—
its blessings are beyond measure.
Thus is it called boundless,
universally delivering heaven and humanity.

The Dao states:
Whoever possesses this scripture
and performs these meritorious deeds for the lords of heaven and earth and the people,
on the day of calamity,
if they resolve in heart to perform purification rites, burn incense,
and recite the scripture ten times,
all the heavens shall record their names,
and myriad spirits shall attend and guard them.
Those who distinguish themselves as perfected ones
shall become ministers of the Golden Gates of the Sagely Lord.
The heavens record the merits and transgressions of all people,
not a hair’s breadth missed.
The true kings of the celestial realms
shall also protect and recommend such persons.
Those who attain the Dao
shall then thoroughly comprehend these most profound words.

The boundless sounds of the Great Brahma’s hidden speech in the heavens—
*Scripture of the Sun’s Essence and Yang Brightness, Middle Scroll of the Numinous Writ of the Primordial Beginning*
Eight Heavens of the Eastern Direction.

Amidst the Azure Brightness, dragon ripples surge, while mossy verdure veils in vast obscurity.
Vast and desolate, the shifting sands stretch boundless; all floating and writhing things align as one.
Sandalwood blazes, and the withered revive; gazing, life’s radiant consorts emerge.
Fierce torrents pour forth, and the Dragon Gate’s hunt for corpses begins.
Bewitching miasmas spread across the wilds; the violent shores gather what is fitting.
Chanting flows through the celestial gates; the Dipper’s rings adorn the seasons.
Lush offerings of straight-awned grain suddenly gleam, the numinous mantle unfurled.
Storks and hounds leap in bright vigor; dark brows pour forth subtle libations.

**Eight Heavens of the Southern Direction**

The nest’s warmth stirs and uplifts; blazing truth shrouds in solemn obscurity.
Jeweled tiers report their fullness; dullness and rigidity proclaim flourishing clarity.
The starry axle soars through vast clouds; rivers yield swift blossoms.
Illuminating brilliance mourns the chart; familiar light caresses the jade flask.
Wise and sagely, they gather felicity; embracing the balance, they preserve luminosity.
In hidden depths, the base finds refuge; pillars of lead take flight in song.
Lofty canopies bestow praise; the fragrant and rank are cast aside.
Deep caverns blaze with cavernous flame; the plains’ radiant souls are driven forth.

**Eight Heavens of the Western Direction**

Dhyāna’s path lies in silent obscurity; the pure peaks await the river’s confluence.
Treading the profound, they requite karmic ties; the axle’s harmony brings flourishing longevity.
The metal path congeals in stillness; the clan’s elders stand in lofty dependence.
Sagely measure transcends all bounds; sustenance gathers in restful foundation.
Autumn’s blossoms ascend in chariots; by what means do they hasten and turn?
Traversing the bamboo slips, they pace in reverence; brushes are drawn, screens held firm.
Far off in the dark abyss, exuberance delights the multitudes.
Pervasive reliance and obeisance; the old craftsmen’s brows are bowed.

**Eight Heavens of the Northern Direction**

The garrisoned fields lie upon the mounds; the Jade Pool is the font of compassion.
The sea’s reflection first reaches; the celestial fire flows in swift return.
Jade pendants and circular treasures gleam pure; the path is obscured by radiant confusion.
Boundaries and discourses fortify governance; hanging harmony invites splendor.
Devoted emaciation refines the scribes; white omens sink into fulfillment.
Plowing the reeds, they summon the serpents; clear oversight arranges the rafts.
The third continuity commands the tigers; solemn solitude abides in stillness.
Holding the *chun* drums, they unfurl the threads; the parched bells transform the ladders.

The Dao speaks: Within these heavens lies the Hidden Speech of the Great Brahma, the sound of boundless resonance. The ancient script was inscribed upon the Scarlet Gates of the Long Tower of the Sun’s Deficiency, illumined by the radiance of Yang’s pent-up splendor. This Dao is most strictly forbidden, the decree of the Supreme that must not be divulged. The myriad beings depend upon it for repose; the thousand sages roam and abide by its sway. Those who can comprehend it summon numinous spirits and gather true essence, filling the Niwan Palace to overflowing. Petals scatter and nectar flows, divine transformations perfect immortality. Nine generations of ancestors receive blessings, and the body ascends upon celestial clouds. Each character spans a full *zhang* in breadth.

In former times, the Heavenly Perfected Sovereign inscribed this text to establish the correct intonation. Those who know its sound and can intone even a fraction of it in purification rites will have the Radiant Yang Spirit-Kings of all heavens descend to observe their form. Their diligence is recorded upon their bodies, then reported to the heavens. Ten thousand spirits come to pay homage; earthly deities stand at the gates in attendance. The Great Merit Perfected Kings safeguard and recommend them as Supreme Perfected. When their Dao is complete and attained, they wander the Three Realms and ascend through the Golden Gate.

This sound repels all harm, dispels all misfortune, delivers all beings, and accomplishes all ends—it is the natural sound of the Heavenly Perfected. Thus, reciting it summons the Spirit-Kings to descend and observe. The Solar Emperor chants from afar; ten thousand spirits pay homage. The Three Realms attend in reverence; all malevolent forces bow their heads. Ghostly essences perish by day; the chiming of jade and jasper resounds. The ten directions grow solemn and clear. Rivers and seas fall silent; mountains and peaks swallow their mists. Myriad spirits tremble in submission; immortals are gathered in assembly. The heavens are free of impurity; the earth is cleansed of demonic dust. Profound wisdom illumines the depths; the vast and mysterious abides in mystery.

*The Wondrous Scripture of the Numinous Treasure, Upper Chapter on Delivering Humanity, Volume Fourteen Concludes. Volume Fifteen.*

**The Moon’s Yin Radiance Chapter**

The Dao spoke: Long ago in the Treasure Bright Heaven, within the Great Simplicity’s Radiant Land of Yellow Blossom Brahma-Light, the Primordial Beginning received the *Uppermost Wondrous Scripture of the Moon’s Yin Radiance for Delivering Humanity*. As the Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning was about to expound this scripture, he circumambulated ten times to summon the ten directions, then ascended his seat.

Heavenly Perfected, Great Spirits, exalted sages, high revered ones, Perfected of Wondrous Conduct, the Queen Consort and Lady of the Upper Palace of Broad Cold, her attendant immortals and divine officials, the Radiant Golden Lads scattering splendor, the Jade Maidens of Luminous Blossoms—an innumerable host—came riding upon the void. White clouds and jade skies, golden chariots and jasper wheels, feathered canopies casting shade, flowing essences of jade light, vast and resplendent hues, illumined the vastness of the Great Void.

For seven days and seven nights, the suns and moons of the various heavens, the stellar orbs and celestial pivots, halted their revolutions and stilled their wheels. Divine winds curled and coiled; mountains and seas grew limpid at their sources. The Eight Voids of heaven floated in emptiness; the Four Clarities of earth lay in stillness. Throughout the land, mountains, rivers, forests, and groves were leveled as one, no longer high or low. The soil transformed into golden glass and interlaced jade, their reflections merging without distinction of color.

The assembled Perfected attended the seat as the Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning sat in profound stillness upon a nine-dragon jasper terrace amid layers of cloud.

When he had expounded the scripture once, the great sages of the various heavens simultaneously proclaimed its excellence. At that time, the men and women of the land first awakened to the true cause: the Yin became the Mother of the Dao, and the Three Origins merged in primordial chaos, wherein all things were conceived.

When he had expounded it twice, their minds perceived the nature of understanding, and they awakened to the source of the Dao.

When he had expounded it thrice, they transcended the Yin womb and were instantly transformed and nurtured.

When he had expounded it four times, by the power of this scripture, they attained the Dao of flying immortality.

When he had expounded it five times, hearing the Dharma, they comprehended its principles, and their spirits became serene in the Palace of Broad Cold.

When he had expounded it six times, golden light suffused the void, and the forest of kalpa-trees trembled with resonance.

When he had expounded it seven times, the profound mysteries of the Dharma were revealed, preserving the kalpa in enduring existence.

When he had expounded it eight times, empty songs and penetrating hymns echoed, and the ten thousand heavens chanted in unison.

When he had expounded it nine times, the Moon Queen descended in her chariot, and drifting blossoms congealed in beauty.

When he had expounded it ten times, the Six Yangs all paid homage, and suddenly myriad transformations arose.

At that time, every man and woman in the land turned their hearts in devotion, all received protection and deliverance, and each attained longevity.

The Dao spoke: At that time, when the Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning had expounded the scripture once, the Great Spirits of the *Moon’s Yin Radiance of the Boundless and Immeasurable* from the East arrived floating upon the void.

When he had expounded it twice, the Great Spirits of the *Moon’s Yin Radiance of the Boundless and Immeasurable* from the South arrived floating upon the void.

When he had expounded it thrice, the Great Spirits of the *Moon’s Yin Radiance of the Boundless and Immeasurable* from the West arrived floating upon the void.

When he had expounded it four times, the Great Spirits of the *Moon’s Yin Radiance of the Boundless and Immeasurable* from the North arrived floating upon the void.

When he had expounded it five times, the Great Spirits of the *Moon’s Yin Radiance of the Boundless and Immeasurable* from the Northeast arrived floating upon the void.

When he had expounded it six times, the Great Spirits of the *Moon’s Yin Radiance of the Boundless and Immeasurable* from the Southeast arrived floating upon the void.

When he had expounded it seven times, the Great Spirits of the *Moon’s Yin Radiance of the Boundless and Immeasurable* from the Southwest arrived floating upon the void.

When he had expounded it eight times, the Great Spirits of the *Moon’s Yin Radiance of the Boundless and Immeasurable* from the Northwest arrived floating upon the void.

When he had expounded it nine times, the Great Spirits of the *Moon’s Yin Radiance of the Boundless and Immeasurable* from the Upper Realm arrived floating upon the void.

When he had expounded it ten times, the Great Spirits of the *Moon’s Yin Radiance of the Boundless and Immeasurable* from the Lower Realm arrived floating upon the void.

When the ten circumambulations were complete, the Great Spirits of the *Moon’s Yin Radiance of the Boundless and Immeasurable* from the ten directions arrived as one. The men and women of the land turned their hearts in devotion, all hearing that the Celestial Worthy was about to expound the great Dharma, the wondrous and supreme Dao of the Moon’s Yin Radiance.
