They said to one another: "Having heard the scripture ten times, we gradually align with the profound teaching, yet the mechanism of Yin radiance has not fully revealed its secret mysteries. We have only heard that the moon originally has no light, appearing as a black mirror. The sun’s brilliance shines upon the waters, reflecting to create its brightness. The *qi* of metal and water coalesce to form Yin radiance. The waxing phase is metal; the waning phase is water. At the full moon, metal and water unite, the metal body becomes perfectly round, and the celestial image reaches completion. The moon attends the sun’s brightness; the sun relies on the moon’s illumination. At the full moon, it is pure Yang; at the dark moon, pure Yin. Yet we have known only that Yang’s supremacy makes one an immortal, unaware that Yin radiance is the mother of the Six Yangs. The sages honor Yang and esteem Yin for this very reason: Yin is born of Yang, and Yang can generate Yin. The dark crow and white hare intermingle with celestial essence; those who attain this by reversal do not die. The Celestial Worthy first proclaimed the Dao of the Moon’s Yin Radiance, and we each offer our secret treasures, hoping to receive and uphold it."

Those who came were as numerous as fine rain or dense mist, an innumerable host, and half the land sank beneath their weight, unable to be restrained. Thereupon, the Celestial Worthy, with great compassion, entered the Nine Yin Contemplation and abided in profound samādhi. The great assembly gazed upward and beheld the Celestial Worthy returning his spirit without cease, still as a precious mountain. After a long while, he transformed into a bright moon. Ten blossoms emerged from the moon, their numinous rays intermingling. Layer upon layer of Yin radiance appeared like pupils of eyes, purple light soaring through the void, its inner wheel concealed. The sea of assembly was astonished; the immortals prostrated themselves upon the ground.

Suddenly, within the vast moon’s orb, palaces and towers appeared, along with the Queen Consort’s halls, the immortals’ cities and ramparts, as clear as daylight. Moon blossoms streamed with light, their hues blending with myriad treasures. The entire assembly gazed in longing, their hearts and eyes filled with awe.

Then, gathering the moon’s radiance, he transformed it into a precious pearl, as large as a millet grain, suspended in the void five *zhang* above the earth. The Celestial Worthy ascended and led the Heavenly Perfected, Great Spirits, exalted sages, Perfected of Wondrous Conduct, and the innumerable host of Great Spirits of the *Moon’s Yin Radiance of the Boundless and Immeasurable* from the ten directions—all entered into the precious pearl.

The heavenly beings looked up and saw only a shimmering light entering through the pearl’s mouth. Once within, its whereabouts became unknown. The gathered multitude dispersed, and the earth returned to levelness, no longer slanted or sunken.

Within the precious pearl, the Celestial Worthy expounded the sutra in full. The assembled Perfected oversaw the transmission, bestowing it upon me. At that moment, joy and celebration defied expression. When the Dharma rites were roughly complete, the hosts of heaven resumed their stations, and in an instant, all fell silent without a trace of sound.

At that time, the heavenly beings who encountered this sutra universally attained deliverance, preserving their allotted years without harm. The land turned in reverence, awakening to the Dao and comprehending the Yin. The Yin Radiance, Yin Spirits, Yin qi, Yin essence, Yin fire, Yin transformation, Yin birth, Yin womb, and the return of Yin to Yang—all merged with the sun and moon as one. Speech became the blossom of Yang; the mouth, the gateway of Yin. With compassion and love as their measure, even those of different bones became kin. The land knew peace, the people abundance, and all rejoiced in great harmony. From the sutra’s first revelation, the kingdom was guided by the Dao. Those who approached with utmost sincerity, reverence, and devotion all attained transcendence.

The Dao declared: All names spoken by the Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning within this sutra are the hidden appellations of the *Jielin* within the moon, the concealed resonances of its depths. They are also the inner taboo names of the Queen Consort and her ladies, the secret designations of the hundred spirits. Those who can comprehend them, draw forth their blossoms, and gather their radiance—from utmost Yin arises Yang, and from Yang’s culmination, the immortal body. The distant resonance of the Feminine Palace descends with the descent of the numinous Perfected, solidifying one’s blood and marrow, ensuring enduring existence.

The moon is the spirit of the Po; blood is the utmost Yin. Yang is detained by Yin; Yang is called the Womb of Yin. Yin is named the Ancestral Earth. The green script’s secret texts are not the common words of the world. Only the Perfected who have attained the highest sageliness, who penetrate the profound and fathom the subtle, can fully grasp their verses. Reciting them ten times summons the distant chanting of the myriad heavens, the obeisance of the ten thousand emperors. Rivers and seas fall silent; mountains and peaks conceal their clouds. The Yin Radiance of the moon descends, transforming the yellow essence and altering one’s form. Hordes of demons are bound; ghostly spirits lose their clarity. The dead are revived; white bones become living beings.

For the most devoted scholars who recite these verses ten times, the Five Emperors come to guard them. Yin aligns with Yang’s authenticity; the Six Dragons bear their chariot. The Three Realms bow in reverence. Demonic spirits lose their sight; ghostly malevolence is extinguished. The dying are delivered; the severed are restored to life. This is because the scholar’s defilements have not yet dissipated, their bodies not yet perfected in truth. They may summon and command the moon’s radiance, but their power does not govern the celestial administration. Their virtue may subdue earthly deities and bind demonic spirits, yet they can only avert death, not restore life. To recite these verses lightly brings calamity upon oneself. To honor and revere them brings prosperity to one’s household, flourishing through generations, forging good karmic ties. Ten thousand disasters will not encroach; divine luminaries will guard the gate.

This sutra is supremely wondrous, unmatched in the Jade Capital. It delivers countless beings and stands as the root of all Dao. Its majestic model of virtue is beyond measure.

The Dao declared: Whoever recites this sutra ten times will summon the assembled heavens, and the Perfected of the Moon will await at their pavilion. The Ladies of the Moon will recount to the adept the suffering souls of their countless ancestors and myriad forebears. All will immediately receive deliverance, ascending to the Vermilion Palace. After nine years of refinement, they will be transformed and reborn, becoming noble persons. Those who diligently study this sutra, fulfilling their merit and perfecting their virtue, will all attain divine transcendence, soaring to the Golden Portals and roaming the Jade Capital.

Scholars of the highest learning who cultivate and recite this sutra will see the moon’s radiance transform their fluids, transmute their bones, and refine their spirits. They will immediately receive deliverance, ascending to the Southern Palace. Those in the world who recite it will have golden essence enter their bodies, their cranial gates resonating of their own accord. Jade maidens will bear the scriptures; golden youths will attend their countenance. They will extend their years and lengthen their lives, later attaining the Dao of *shijie*, where the soul and spirit briefly dissolve, bypassing hell to swiftly regain their form and roam the great void. This sutra is subtle and wondrous, universally delivering boundless beings. All heavenly beings receive its blessings. Its immeasurable blessings extend to life and death, treasured by the heavens above. It is not transmitted to the lower world. Only the most devoted scholars, offering gold and treasures with sincerity and swearing celestial oaths, may receive it. To lightly disclose or profane it brings calamity upon nine generations, condemning them to eternal servitude under the ghostly officials.

The Five Emperors attend this sutra, accompanied by twenty-four Jade Boys and twenty-four Jade Maidens, who safeguard the sacred text and protect the bodies of those who receive it.

The Dao declared: During the first month’s extended fast, recite this sutra. Within the Yin Radiance of the moon, great spirits clad in dragon robes and tiger talismans will deliver the adept’s ancestors, liberating the souls of past generations from earthly toil and ascending them to the Southern Palace. During the seventh month’s extended fast, recite this sutra. Within the Yin Radiance of the moon, great spirits in yellow robes and jeweled script will inscribe the adept’s immortal name, granting them divine transcendence. The heavens will record their name on yellow registers and white tablets, erasing death and restoring life. During the tenth month’s extended fast, recite this sutra. Within the Yin Radiance of the moon, great spirits in embroidered robes and grand sashes will preside over the myriad spirits, ensuring the king, emperor, lord, ministers, fathers, and sons secure the nation’s destiny, preserving the heavens’ longevity. Through generations unbroken, they will remain sovereigns, ruling their lands in peace. The people will witness great harmony. On the eight seasonal nodes, recite this sutra. The Yin Radiance of the moon will spread its light across the eight heavens, granting the adept the rank of Perfected of the Nine Palaces. On one’s natal day, recite this sutra. The Yin Radiance of the moon will immediately manifest the adept’s living form, their spirit born within their abdomen. Jade pendants and golden earrings will adorn them; numinous fluids will fill their stomachs. Their bodies will attain longevity; their souls and spirits will be purified and upright. Their myriad qi will endure forever, sparing them from suffering and affliction. Their bodies will radiate light, attended by the Three Realms, welcomed by the Five Emperors, and revered by the myriad spirits. Their names will be inscribed in the heavens. Upon fulfilling their merit and perfecting their virtue, they will ascend to the Upper Clarity.

The Dao declared: On the days of practicing the Dao, one must bathe in fragrant waters, enter the chamber in purity, face east, and knock the teeth thirty-two times to reach the thirty-two heavens. Bow thirty-two times in the heart, close the eyes, and silently envision oneself seated amidst clouds of purple, yellow, and white. Within and without, all is dim and serene. A green dragon, white tiger, vermilion bird, dark warrior, lion, and white crane array themselves to the left and right. The sun and moon shine brightly, illuminating the chamber with radiance. A circular halo appears above the head, its light reflecting in all directions. All must be vividly clear.

The secret incantation states:

Supreme Mysterious Origin, Most High Dao Lord,
Summon forth from within this servant’s body the Three and Five Merit Officials,
Left and Right Attendant Messengers,
Incense-Bearing Jade Lads,
Message-Transmitting Jade Maidens,
Five Thearchs’ Direct Talismans,
Direct-Day Incense Officials—
thirty-six each—
to open and convey these words.
On this auspicious day, in a hall of purity and prolonged fasting,
we cultivate the supreme scripture to deliver boundless beings.

May these entreaties ascend directly
to the august presence of the Most High Primordial Thearch
before the throne of the Thirty-Two Heavens.
Thus concluded, draw qi thirty-two times and, facing east, recite the scripture.

*The Supreme Primordial Scripture of Boundless Salvation, Most Exalted Wondrous Chapter*
The Primordial Cavern-Mysterious Numinous Treasure’s Fundamental Scripture,
Moon’s Radiance and Yin Shadow,
Most Exalted Wondrous Beginning.
Ten revolutions deliver beings,
knotting luminous hidden rhymes,
parting and uniting naturally,
merging with yin’s shadow.
The Non-Ultimate’s perfected ones,
black-metal qi,
Mysterious Unity’s embryo,
outer yin and inner yang.
Supreme essence yet unopened,
stillness at its extreme gives birth to spirit,
metal and water gather form,
round illumination spanning kalpas.
Seas and mountains serene and bright,
yang alone transforms and rests,
yin congeals and changes cease,
the two images darkly unite.
Mysterious Female’s body conjoined,
yin ascends as rain and dew,
yang descends as abyssal springs,
Primordial Beginning’s ancestral kalpa.
Giving birth to all heavens,
the ancestor as yin’s shadow,
moon’s radiance cradling lotus,
illuminating the Three Luminaries.
This is the Heavenly Root,
above which no ancestor remains—
only the Dao as body,
the moon’s numinous script.
Yellow Writ in the Qian Forest,
each leaf bearing jade chapters,
universally planting spirit and numen.
Without script, no illumination;
without script, no clarity;
without script, no establishment;
without script, no completion;
without script, no deliverance;
without script, no birth.
This is the Great Brahmā,
heaven within heaven,
Jade Tower of Lush Array,
Golden Terrace of Pistil Abyss.
Supreme beyond the supreme,
Great Luo’s Jade Clarity,
dim and distant kalpas’ measure,
seeming absent, seeming present.
Three Flowers parting effortlessly,
Great Possession’s wondrous court,
jade doors and alchemical chambers,
purple mist arrayed in forests,
Divine Empyrean’s brahmā qi
circulating through the ten directions.
Within it, the moon’s radiance and yin shadow’s spirit;
within it, the South Culmen’s Lord of Longevity;
within it, the East Culmen’s Azure Florescence Thearch;
within it, the Ten Dragons’ Flying Chariot Marshal Great Divinity;
within it, the Life-Nurturing Elder Lord Han;
within it, the South’s Supreme Director of Destinies,
Registrar of Life-Spans,
Extender of Years and Augmenter of Calculations,
Deliverer from Calamities, Venerable Divinity.
Reversing decay and reviving the dead,
delivering boundless beings—
today’s reckoning and recording,
all heavens descend in audience.

Facing the Eastern Infinite, the Moon’s Yellow Radiance Divine King,
Great Sage of Longevity, Boundless Deliverer of Beings.
Facing the Southern Infinite, the Moon’s Vermilion Regalia Divine King,
Great Sage of Longevity, Boundless Deliverer of Beings.
Facing the Western Infinite, the Moon’s Pale Luminance Divine King,
Great Sage of Longevity, Boundless Deliverer of Beings.
Facing the Northern Infinite, the Moon’s Purple Glyph Divine King,
Great Sage of Longevity, Boundless Deliverer of Beings.
Facing the Northeastern Infinite, the Moon’s Divine Radiance Divine King,
Great Sage of Longevity, Boundless Deliverer of Beings.
Facing the Southeastern Infinite, the Moon’s Yin Fire Divine King,
Great Sage of Longevity, Boundless Deliverer of Beings.
Facing the Southwestern Infinite, the Moon’s Crimson Dew Divine King,
Great Sage of Longevity, Boundless Deliverer of Beings.
Facing the Northwestern Infinite, the Moon’s Jade Portal Divine King,
Great Sage of Longevity, Boundless Deliverer of Beings.
Facing the Upper Infinite, the Moon’s Five Empresses Divine King,
Great Sage of Longevity, Boundless Deliverer of Beings.
Facing the Lower Infinite, the Moon’s Jade Consort Divine King,
Great Sage of Longevity, Boundless Deliverer of Beings.
The Ten Directions’ Perfected Ones, Flying Heaven’s Moon Radiance and Yin Shadow Divine Kings,
Great Divinities of Longevity and World-Deliverance.

All ride plain clouds,
jade chariots and cinnabar carriages,
rosy canopies and golden wheels,
drawn by numinous phoenixes.
Ten Perfected White Dragons
bear the Broad Cold’s standards,
radiant spirit banners,
ahead the celestial music sings in unison,
behind the divine winds resound as one.
Lions and white cranes
roar and chant in harmony,
the Five Elders clear the path,
hosts of immortals flank the axle,
myriads of chariots and ten thousand riders
float through the void,
their light inclining as they turn,
overseeing the deliverance of beings.

The Jade Tower’s Chancellor,
Southern Prosperity’s Upper Palace,
Han, Director of Registrations,
Great Divinity of Life-Supervision,
holding records and grasping registers,
all arrive before the Thearch.
If the adept can inspire gratitude,
jade heavens’ flowing rosy clouds
pour into the ultimate azure mystery,
the moon’s yellow vessel
draws the radiant secret spring,
divine water penetrating the desert,
true light transforming into immortals.
Swallowing the fluid of precious chapters,
the heart contemplates White Origin.
Five Ladies assist and guide,
ascending mist and rushing chariots,
ten dragons drawing the carriage,
above stirring the lofty morn,
below connecting the hidden passes.
Wherever deliverance is needed,
the heavens’ strict reckoning proceeds.
Universally proclaimed to the Three Realms,
the Infinite’s divine lands,
the Yellow Springs’ courts,
Northern Capital’s Fengdu,
the Three Offices and Nine Bureaus,
the Twelve River Sources.
Absolving ancestors and forebears,
kalpas’ myriad kin,
swiftly erasing sin ledgers,
extinguishing evil roots.
No longer detained,
no longer pressed into ghostly throngs.
By the Moon Thearch’s talismanic command,
moment by moment ascend and advance.
Northern Capital’s Cold Pool,
guard and escort body and soul.
Subdue demons and protect promotions,
deliver ranks to the Southern Palace.
Dead souls receive refinement,
immortally transformed into humans.
Living bodies receive deliverance,
kalpa after kalpa enduring,
revolving through kalpas,
years equaling heaven’s.
Forever delivered from the Three Ways,
the Five Sufferings and Eight Hardships,
transcending the Three Realms’ bitterness,
carefree in the Upper Clarity.

The Upper Clarity’s heaven,
the Heavenly Thearch’s Luminous Gem,
the formless realm of brahmā practice.

**The Eight Heavens of the East**
Jade Grove’s Extended August Heaven, Thearch Lu Jianfeng assists.
Verdant Peak’s Azure Flower Father, Thearch Sheng governs High Peace.
Dragon Bridge’s Sage Steed Heaven, Thearch Yi drifts beyond regions.
Level Cavern’s Vast Origin Heaven, Thearch Peng Lingpi Jiang.
Aiding Perfection’s Constant Joy Heaven, Thearch Ban Zongyu Yuan.
Shaking Light’s Life-Preserving Heaven, Thearch Liao Duluo Shen.
Transforming Mystery’s Unfolding Sequence Heaven, Thearch Xian Qiong Zifan.
Nine Mountains’ Dragon Abyss Heaven, Thearch Yun Tao Mimi Cheng.

**The Eight Heavens of the South**
Crimson Yang’s Phoenix Qi Heaven, Thearch Zhu Pida Liang.

The Radiant Spirit’s Serene Contemplation Heaven, Thearch Ning Hua Jia governs.
The Fragrant Chariot’s Humble Guest Heaven, Thearch Miao Du Cigong presides.
The Bestowed Perfection’s Boundless Heaven, Thearch Yin Fan Duorong.
The Crimson Upright’s Manifest Origin Heaven, Thearch Chu Yan Yingmo.
The Fire Crag’s Trial of Transgressions Heaven, Thearch Lüe Duo Yitai.
The Primordial Mandate’s Reverent Light Heaven, Thearch Cong Gui Muming.
The Luminous Void’s Upright Unity Heaven, Thearch Bian Peng Qushi.

**The Eight Heavens of the West**
The Tail Spirit’s Registry-Supervising Heaven, Thearch Yi Kui Mian Du.
The Immortal-Refining Mysterious Transformation Heaven, Thearch Yue Jian Qiong.
The Kui Script’s Demon-Slaying Heaven, Thearch Zhen Tuoxi Gong.
The Seven Cuts’ Illuminating Inscription Heaven, Thearch Jue Lu Youji.
The Great Simplicity’s Propagating Brilliance Heaven, Thearch Yi Ning Wu Jun.
The Brahmā Light’s Soaring Strength Heaven, Thearch Zhi Jia Yun Chu.
The Fluid Spirit’s Demon-Transforming Heaven, Thearch Su Bo Yin.
The Sage Pattern’s Immortal-Attaining Heaven, Thearch Zhong Wu Jian Shi.

**The Eight Heavens of the North**
The Blended Light’s Ascending Chariot Heaven, Thearch Hao Ba Bu Yi.
The Treasure Qi’s Radiant Essence Heaven, Thearch Zheng You Wan Shi.
The Dao-Nurturing Curved Darkness Heaven, Thearch Zheng Zhao Tai Guang.
The Transcendent Dragon’s Mysterious Mirror Heaven, Thearch Hai Yu Zheng Gai.
The Life-Mandated Immortal’s Sea Border Heaven, Thearch Bao Ji Yong Sheng.
The Falling Mirror’s Total Clarity Heaven, Thearch Ji Guang Chi Lun.
The Flying Dipper’s Intent-Revealing Heaven, Thearch Yao Ci Yi Ji.
The Cloud Court’s Perfected Transcending Heaven, Thearch Zheng Ze Qian Ling.

The thirty-two heavens, the thirty-two thearchs—
the hidden taboos of the heavens, the hidden names of the heavens.
Within the heavens, empty and cavernous,
naturally resonant with numinous verses—
the hidden melodies of the heavens, the sounds within the moon.
The honored within the moon, the spirits within the moon,
the perfected within the moon, the numina within the moon.
Nine qi and ten flowers,
transforming into the Upper Clarity,
boundless mysteries, profound beyond reckoning—
scattering and descending, the divine and perfected,
universally delivering heaven and humanity.

Today, joyously celebrating the reception of deliverance,
passing through the barriers of the various heavens,
entreat the eradication of yin’s malevolence,
the severing of earthly roots,
soaring beyond the Five Dippers,
names recorded in the Great Mystery,
true kings overseeing the ascent,
unrestrained at the gates of heaven.

The Eastern Dipper’s dragon radiance,
the Western Dipper’s tiger soaring,
the Northern Dipper’s wolf crouching,
the Southern Dipper’s phoenix pendants,
the Central Dipper’s qilin couchant—
together forming resplendent brilliance,
the moon’s yin illumination,
ever-changing and wondrous.

The Azure Thearch spews rosy clouds,
the White Thearch grasps jade,
the Red Thearch wields fire,
the Black Thearch conceals the board,
the Yellow Thearch unites with spirit—
the moon’s essence refines the perfected.

The Azure Radiance Spirit-King, Horn responds to Ba Yuan.
The Red Radiance Spirit-King, Winnowing Basket and Wings uphold the heavens.
The White Radiance Spirit-King, Orion’s strength overturns mountains.
The Black Radiance Spirit-King, Dark Upright’s Chou oversees.
The Yellow Radiance Spirit-King, □□ spans the heavens.

The moon’s yin radiance, five-colored revolving.
Descending omens to the Three Palaces,
true kings elevate the immortals,
the Moon Radiance Spirit-King,
the ancestor of the myriad spirits.
Soaring in flight, drumming and following,
commanding the divine armies,
raising rosy clouds in the great void,
divine light blazing resplendent.

The various heavens unite in merit,
yin’s perfected deliver humanity,
sternly inspecting the Northern Feng,
divine lords receive their mandates,
universally sweeping away inauspiciousness.

The Azure Dragon spews venom,
the White Tiger bares its fangs on all sides,
the Vermilion Bird leads the vanguard,
the Dark Warrior bears the banner.
Hurling fire for ten thousand leagues,
streaming bells through the eight directions—
dare any test their might?
The moon’s essence is sealed and fortified.
Golden blades strike first,
jade halberds punish behind,
slaughtering and dissecting ghostly specters,
wind and fire never ceasing.
Severing a thousand thousand heads,
shearing ten thousand ten thousand forms—
demons dare not trespass,
ghosts lack malevolent essence.

The Three Officials of the Northern Feng,
clearly inspecting the ghostly camps,
permitting no concealment—
golden horses swiftly report.
Universally proclaiming without end,
the myriad spirits all listen,
the Three Realms and Five Thearchs,
declare to the Upper Clarity.

The primordial cavern’s first sprouting,
yin’s radiance gives birth to yang,
yang seeks yin,
yin abides in yang.
The beginning and end of the five movements,
from dragon to peace—
the sun resides within the moon,
water protects the metal chamber.
Yang arises from yin,
with yielding virtue overcoming hardness.
The body lacking great yin,
becomes reckless yang.
Yang severed, the form perishes,
not concealed by the sagely—
in the vastness of countless kalpas,
within primordial chaos.

Above, gold as color,
below, water as abyss,
within, the utmost non-being—
where spirit and qi find repose.
Wind and marsh pervade emptiness,
vajra ascends the heavens.
Above heaven and below heaven,
no darkness, no obscurity,
no form, no shadow,
no limit, no end.
The vast expanse of primordial chaos,
boundless and lightless—
yin’s radiance unfolds clarity,
deliverance moves naturally.

The Primordial Beginning securely governs,
scattering the five chapters,
red script on jade,
eight mighty dragon scripts.
Preserving and regulating the kalpa’s course,
ensuring heaven’s enduring existence—
brahmā qi pervades the cosmos,
myriad patterns unfold.
The primordial net flows and evolves,
the thirty-two heavens,
revolving without color,
circulating through the ten directions.
The revolving Dipper passes the Winnowing Basket,
returning through the five constants,
thirty-five divisions,
converging qi in the Upper Origin.
Eight radiant scenes merge in darkness,
qi enters the profound mystery—
within the profound, the Great August,
the Highest Perfected, the Supreme Thearch.

Floating scenes in great rosy clouds,
whistling and chanting cavernous verses,
golden perfected gleaming lushly,
flowing echoes in cloudy encampments.
Jade tones gather qi,
spirit winds assemble mist,
purple emptiness luxuriant and elegant—
yin’s radiance transforms into immortals,
a thousand harmonies, ten thousand unions,
naturally attaining perfection.

Within the perfected, there are spirits,
the Great Lord of Longevity,
the Azure Flower Noble,
the Moon’s Essence Honored Spirit,
the Great One Controller of Destinies,
Peach and Health united in extension—
grasping talismans, holding registers,
preserving life and engendering roots.

Roaming the Upper Clarity,
entering and exiting the Flowery Chamber,
within the eight obscurities,
amidst the minutest subtleties.
Below, governing the human body,
the mud-pill palace of the crimson palace,
centrally ordering the five qi,
blending the hundred spirits.

Ten revolutions return the numinous,
the myriad qi unite as immortals—
the immortal way values life,
boundlessly delivering humanity.

The moon has ten gates,
the flying heavenly treasure wheel,
sin and fortune’s prohibitions,
karmic conditions of past lives.
Universally receiving initiation and deliverance,
the dead souls reborn in bodies,
bodies attaining rebirth,
ascending to be heard by the various heavens.

Above the various heavens,
each has its gate of life—
within, empty and cavernous verses of hymns,
true kings’ numinous chapters,
words matching the Highest Perfected.

The First Moon’s Yin Radiance Soaring Void Melody.

The Six Harmonies are all empty, originally without a single thing.
The empty suddenly exhales, qi and wind turn full.
The wind is called the Rigorous Wind, qi is the Primordial Qi.
Qi like black mist, wind drums and gathers it.
Transforming into a black moon, drifting without place.
Within blackness, red is born—red orb becomes the sun.
Heaven and earth blossom and bear fruit, the moon is the sun’s root.
The ten emerge everywhere, five colors flow as essences.
Moon’s Yin Radiance, the myriad spirits look up in reverence.
Supreme Yin generates Yang, its light then flourishes.
The root of creation, Yin and Yang as its barriers.
Five draughts congeal the essence of Lin, heaven and man come to my side.

**Second Moon’s Yin Radiance True King’s Chapter**
At the bend of Dragon Mountain, green silk embraces the moon.
Heavenly light stealthily meets, fourfold flying jade snow.
Supreme Yang generates Yin, Yin is lord of things.
Yin is still and without action, the myriad things teem.
Yang moves, Yin is still—Yin’s radiance naturally aligns.
Stillness brings transformation, each rectifies its nature and life.
The omen knows not the true, constantly laboring my spirit.
Breaking the self to dwell in emptiness, not knowing to embrace the spirit.
Embracing the spirit is called stillness, Yin’s radiance issues commands.
Within, Supreme Yang is born, the flying spirit treads the Big Dipper.
Swallowing golden liquid, roaming the land of white clouds.
Why delight in the world? Crimson countenance vainly ages.

**Third Moon’s Yin Radiance True King’s Song Says**
Divine wind harnesses the bright moon, the world follows clouds in motion.
Unknowing of the myriad towers, jade beams and rainbows arise.
Heavenly empress wears yellow embroidery, trailing jade rings chiming on the balance.
Light divides above the Nine Heavens, ten dragons gallop with white blossoms.
Above, learning gazes toward the divine hut, drawing forth blossoms containing supreme essence.
Changing bones thrice, washing the intestines, the Divine Empyrean carves the immortal’s name.
Brain and blood naturally overflow, Yin’s radiance extends distant years.
Mysterious dew arises from the sea’s jade, true water comes from the distant dark.
Southern Palace delivers the seven ancestors, Northern Capital dissolves the sinful infants.
Carefree, riding the flying chariot, hastening to the vast Cold Palace.
Through kalpas, preserving a fragrant countenance, for a thousand years without sorrow’s voice.
Thus know the Way of the Supreme Perfected, wondrously transforming the host of spirits.
I sing beneath the Great Clarity, gazing down upon the jade horses’ wheel.
Golden waves surge from heaven, their beauty as if graspable.
Moon’s nectar nourishes the hundred spirits, again I sing, again I chant.
Above the Three Realms, within the flying void, the True King’s song and sound,
sound matching the cavernous chapters.
Reciting it a hundred times, the name is delivered to the Southern Palace.
Reciting it a thousand times, the True King protects and welcomes.
Ten thousand recitations, the Dao is complete, ascending to fly in the Great Void,
passing beyond the Three Realms, attaining the rank of Immortal Duke.
Those who hear the numinous sound, the True King respects their form,
commands the earth spirits, to serve and escort,
drawing them out from the earth’s gates, from the Five Sufferings and Eight Difficulties.
Seven ancestors ascend and migrate, forever departing the Dark Bureau,
souls delivered to the Crimson Mound, receiving refinement and rebirth.
This is called the Boundless, universally delivering without end.
There are secret celestial texts, revered by all heavens.
Revealing them carelessly casts one into hell, calamity extending to the seven ancestral grandfathers.

The Dao says: These two chapters are together the hidden sounds of the High Perfected of the Moon,
the Moon’s Yin Radiance Divine Kings, congealing the essence of Lin—
the Way of Yin’s radiance, the precursor of Yang’s qi.
Yang is detained by Yin, the moon wanes with the sun,
black and white divide the embryo, metal and water’s nature complete.
Abiding breath extends life, nurturing the embryo to secure the years.
Heaven and earth sustain it, the moon’s blossom is the pistil’s abyss,
within generating the mother of qi, the origin of the myriad kinds.
Concealed, the primal ancestor, true fire continues the transmission.
The Three Bureaus come and go, the work of creation is complete.
The Highest Lord is without action, Primordial Virtue stealthily spreads—
all are the words of the Great Brahma, not the common speech of the world.
Words without ornate beauty, melodies without florid grace,
thus called profound and obscure, difficult to fathom in detail.
The heavens above treasure them, secreted in the Highest Divine Empyrean Jade Clarity King’s Palace of the Mystic Capital.
The Dao Lord descends to the world, transmitting them according to the turning of the kalpa.
If there is a perfected person offering gold and treasure with sincere heart,
following the old protocols to pledge alliance with the Ten Heavens,
only then are they bestowed.

The Dao says: When the heavens’ turning reaches its end,
the sun, moon, and five stars wane and wax,
the most sagely divine persons prosper or decline,
while those of shallow learning suffer harm.
Whenever such disasters occur, those of the same qi should all unite in heart to perform the fast,
burn incense in the six periods, recite the scripture ten times—
blessings and virtue will immediately descend, dissolving all inauspicious signs.
The Boundless Text universally delivers without end.

The Dao says: Those of shallow learning in the Dao, whose immortal rank is not yet full,
when their kalpa-determined end arrives, their bodies pass through the Supreme Yin.
At the moment of crossing, fellow students and perfected persons should burn incense for them,
recite the scripture ten times to deliver the corpse according to the method.
Then the moon’s blossom halts its radiance, Yin’s radiance descends its essence,
true qi suddenly arises, the Yang spirit fully restores.
Soul and spirit directly ascend to the Southern Palace,
according to their accumulated merit, calculating the days to attain rebirth.
The turning wheel does not perish, and they become immortals.

The Dao says: When the turning of heaven and earth reaches its end,
the constellations fall into disorder, the sun and moon lose their light,
the four seasons lose their order, Yin and Yang are not in harmony,
the land suffers calamity, pestilential toxins spread,
the people perish and are harmed, masters and friends pass away—
then one should perform the fast, burn incense, and recite the scripture.
The merit of fasting and reciting the scripture is most weighty.
Above, it dissolves heavenly calamities, protecting and stabilizing the emperor;
below, it wards off poisonous harm, delivering the people.
In life and death, they receive its benefit—its blessings are beyond measure.
Thus it is called the Boundless, universally delivering heaven and humanity.

The Dao says: Whoever possesses this scripture,
able to perform these meritorious deeds for the lord of heaven and earth and the people,
on days of calamity, resolves to perform the fast, burn incense,
and recite the scripture ten times—
then the various heavens record their name, the myriad spirits serve and protect,
distinguishing the perfected persons on the right,
enabling them to become ministers of the Golden Gates of the Sage Lord.
The various heavens record people’s merits and faults, not missing even a hair’s breadth.
The True Kings of the heavens also protect and recommend their persons—
only those who attain the Dao will thoroughly understand these supreme words.

**The Boundless Hidden Sounds of the Great Brahma in the Heavens**
**The Dao Lord’s Composition**
**The Central Chapter of the Moon’s Yin Radiance Numinous Scripture**
**The Eight Heavens of the East**

The yin gaze meets the radiance, moon pearls congeal into liquid.
The mountain’s foundation shines with luminous souls, azure mists cast their traces.
Pure merit is called the net of stars, the jade pearl gleams upon the ridge.
Delivering spirits in wondrous subtlety, numinous perfected ones surge with brilliance.
Within the radiant sands of Tan, secret tones labor in rhythm.
The flourishing horns of willows and ghosts, their marvelous brightness reflects the sun.
Transmitting the admonitions of the primordial lineage, the transformative pool lies deep in mystery.
Yang perfected ones become the wind, moving blossoms in harmonious order.

**The Eight Heavens of the South**
Cinnabar luminaries flourish in numinosity, awaiting the decisive moment to receive the pendants.
The yang compass ascends transversely, its essence flowing to the utmost limit.
Jade torrents enfold the void, the true and the fixed merge in transformation.
Flowing chariots traverse the lands, mending clouds that float along the galleries.
The relay stations soar in flames, the overseers hasten in swift currents.
Waves of charm fill the cavernous valleys, the forbidden true ones bathe in jasper streams.
The sharp blades of wisdom are dew upon the lingzhi, the resonant chimes store within the barriers.
Establishing and shaking the *vidyā*, the mysterious directions branch into peace.

**The Eight Heavens of the West**
The numinous holds and initiates transmission, the cloud generals wield their sharp blades.
The offerings are arrayed in vessels of rank, the three stars and the *Bi* asterism shine in response.
The august assembly of immortals, traversing the mists beyond the outer reaches.
Blue tablets honor the light, golden thunder rests in silence.
Refining the luxuriant and the delicate within the cage, the Three Primes inspect the gates.
Expounding the assisting records of treasures, the phoenix pass gleams in lofty splendor.
The canons govern with integrity, the mysterious village surges with divine vigor.
The clear and the dominant unfold in brilliance, the Long Star floats in auspiciousness.

**The Eight Heavens of the North**
The cavernous depths surge with mighty waves, opposing currents shine in radiant display.
Fragrant stores fill the admonishing aids, the dragon perfected ones grandly transmit.
Grasping the reins to array the demons, lifting the thunder to invoke the boundaries.
Fierce mountains topple in flight, the black void’s edge is sharp and perilous.
The dark tortoise and fire serpent, the hidden springs and the Dipper’s palace.
Subduing the deviant and beheading the grotesque, the crown’s strength and the shaman’s bells.
The vast and reverent treasure springs, the celestial paths trace the perilous wheels.
The canopy of stars upholds the terrace, the imperial gaze follows the gravel’s path.

The Dao says: These are the lunar *lin* texts within the various heavens, the boundless hidden sounds of the Great Brahma. The ancient script was inscribed upon the ten-rayed gate of the moon to summon and bind the great *lin* spirits, spreading the light of the Supreme Void, calling forth yang to perfect the true, so that the myriad kinds receive the script. Yang returns to true yin, true yin solidifies yang, enabling the spirit-qi to abide. Golden body and jade bones, the moon’s radiance refines the form, sweeping away defilement to attain immortality. The exalted ones hear and revere, praising the heavens without effort, myriad billions of blessings come to fruition. Each character spans a full *zhang* in breadth.

The Heavenly Perfected Sovereign of Old inscribed these texts to establish the correct sounds. Those who know these sounds and can fast and recite them will have the various heavens dispatch flying riders and divine kings to descend and observe their persons, recording their meritorious diligence. This is reported to the various heavens, where the myriad spirits pay homage, earth deities attend at the gates, and the great merit of the True Kings ensures the protection and recommendation of the perfected. With the Dao complete and attained, one may wander the Three Realms and ascend through the Golden Gates.

These sounds repel all, exorcise all, deliver all, and accomplish all—such are the natural sounds of the Heavenly Perfected. Thus, reciting them causes flying riders to descend in observation, the moon’s consorts to chant from afar, the myriad spirits to pay homage, the Three Realms to attend in their chariots, the host of malevolent beings to bow their heads, and ghostly essences to perish of themselves. The jade-like resonance vibrates, the ten directions grow solemn and clear, rivers and seas fall silent, mountains and peaks swallow their mists. The myriad spirits tremble and submit, summoning the assembly of immortals. The heavens are free of defilement, the earth is without demonic dust. Profound wisdom illumines the depths, the great measure is profoundly mysterious.

**The Wondrous Scripture of the Upper Chapters on the Limitless Salvation of Beings, Scroll Fifteen—Concluded**
**Scroll Sixteen**

**The Chapter on the Separation and Union of Yin-Yang and the Transformation of the Five Agents**

The Dao spoke: Long ago in the Heaven of Mystic Transformation, within the sacred land of Primordial Radiance and Numinous Song, the Great Perfected received the *Upper Chapters on the Limitless Salvation of Beings: The Separation and Union of Yin-Yang and the Transformation of the Five Agents* from the Primordial Beginning.

As the Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning was about to expound this scripture, he circumambulated ten times to summon the ten directions, and only then ascended his seat. The Heavenly Perfected, the Supreme Sages, the Lofty and Venerable, and the Perfected of Wondrous Conduct—an innumerable host—came riding upon the void. Their radiance congealed in luminous emptiness; crimson chariots and cinnabar carriages bore canopies of kingfisher jade, their brilliance outshining mist, while auspicious qi swirled in eightfold veils and numinous light coiled in fourfold spirals.

For nine days and nine nights, the warp and weft of yin and yang in the myriad heavens stilled their motion; the Two Effulgences and Three Primordials halted their revolutions, and the Great Void soared in clarity, its depths too profound for naming. Wind and clouds grew hushed and solemn, while the forms of all things flourished in splendor. The land of that realm—its mountains, rivers, forests, and trees—was leveled to perfect evenness, no longer bearing high or low. The earth became patterned with jade, its veins interwoven with ten thousand hues.

The host of Perfected attended the seat as the Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning sat in profound stillness upon the Tenfold Flowering, Ninefold Radiant Seat of the Supreme Ultimate suspended in the void. With the first recitation of the scripture, the Great Sages of the myriad heavens voiced their approval in unison. At that moment, the afflictions of all men and women in that land were wholly dispelled. With the second recitation, all beings attained their proper growth. With the third, the qi of the Dao returned to their forms. With the fourth, the people prospered and lived long, all gaining longevity. With the fifth, the ascent and descent of the Two Modes harmonized of themselves. With the sixth, the four seasons followed their virtue, nurturing and transforming without error. With the seventh, the hundred spirits aligned in transformation, and the myriad treasures flourished. With the eighth, within the four seas, all was secure, abundant, and prosperous; joy and great peace reigned, and the world was preserved in glory. With the ninth, customs grew pure and sincere, and the Dao and its Perfected were revered. With the tenth, both the living and the dead received its grace, universally benefiting from its profound favor.

At that time, every man and woman in that land turned their hearts in devotion, all receiving protection and deliverance to attain long life.

The Dao spoke: When the Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning had recited the scripture once, the Boundless and Limitless Jade Treasure Great Spirits of the East—an innumerable host—arrived floating upon the void. With the second recitation, the Boundless and Limitless Mystic Perfected Great Spirits of the South—an innumerable host—arrived floating upon the void. With the third, the Boundless and Limitless Supreme Wondrous Great Spirits of the West—an innumerable host—arrived floating upon the void. With the fourth, the Boundless and Limitless Purple Yang Great Spirits of the North—an innumerable host—arrived floating upon the void. With the fifth, the Boundless and Limitless Deliverance and Transformation Great Spirits of the Northeast—an innumerable host—arrived floating upon the void. With the sixth, the Boundless and Limitless Life-Nurturing Great Spirits of the Southeast—an innumerable host—arrived floating upon the void. With the seventh, the Boundless and Limitless Radiant Flower Great Spirits of the Southwest—an innumerable host—arrived floating upon the void. With the eighth, the Boundless and Limitless Mystic Obscurity Great Spirits of the Northwest—an innumerable host—arrived floating upon the void. With the ninth, the Boundless and Limitless Jade Void Great Spirits of the Upper Realm—an innumerable host—arrived floating upon the void. With the tenth, the Boundless and Limitless Perfected August Great Spirits of the Lower Realm—an innumerable host—arrived floating upon the void.

When the ten recitations were complete, the Boundless Heavenly Perfected Great Spirits of the ten directions arrived as one. The men and women of that land turned their hearts in devotion and reverence. Those who came were like clouds in flight or mists gathering, their innumerable host pressing so closely that half the land sank beneath them, an event beyond restraint.

Thereupon, the Primordial Beginning gathered the Two Effulgences, the sun and moon, and the Mystic Root, coiling and entwining them to form a single Treasure Wheel, vast as a chariot’s hub, suspended nine *zhang* above the earth. The Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning ascended and led the Heavenly Perfected, the Supreme Sages, the Lofty and Venerable, the Perfected of Wondrous Conduct, and the Boundless Great Spirits of the Five Agents of yin and yang from the ten directions—an innumerable host—all into the Treasure Wheel. The heavenly beings gazed upward and saw only a surging brilliance entering within. Once inside the Treasure Wheel, none knew where they had gone. The people of the land dispersed, and the earth returned to levelness, no longer slanting or sinking.

Within the Treasure Wheel, the Primordial Beginning completed the recitation of the scripture in full. The host of Perfected oversaw the deliverance and transmitted it to me. At that moment, joy and celebration were beyond words. When the ritual was roughly concluded, the myriad heavens returned to their stations, and in the space of a breath, all was silent, with no trace remaining.

At that time, the heavenly beings who encountered the scripture’s teachings were universally delivered, their allotted years preserved whole, free from harm. Heaven and earth, the four seas, and the Dao merged with the Utmost Perfected. There was no loss, no decay, no disturbance, no disorder, no error, no obstruction, no discord, no divergence, no decline, no extinction. Beings did not die young, and life attained longevity. Compassion and kindness were mutually preserved, and benevolence and goodness harmonized in heart. The land was secure, the people prosperous, and all rejoiced in great peace. From the scripture’s first appearance as teaching, the land was governed by the Dao. Those who had beforehand set their minds upon it, revered and honored it, all attained deliverance across the ages.

The Dao spoke: The names spoken by the Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning in the recitation of this scripture are the inner names of the Emperors of the Myriad Heavens, the hidden rhymes of sound. They are also the inner taboos of the Perfected Kings and the concealed names of the hundred spirits. Emerging from being and entering non-being, separating and uniting yin and yang, transforming the Five Agents—these all return their forms to constancy. They can illumine, they can radiate, they can preserve, they can dissolve. Knowing and enacting them, one drives yin and moves yang, beyond the common words of the world. Only the Perfected who have already attained realization and penetrated the profound and subtle can fully grasp their verses. Reciting them ten times, the spirits of the myriad heavens and earths, of yin and yang and the Five Agents, the gods of transformation and movement, will all come to pay reverence with rites and devotion, aligning in veneration. Their wondrous efficacy remains in harmony, the upright qi is never forgotten, the wellsprings of life open of themselves, and the ten thousand kinds flourish in perfection, without ruin or decay.

Scholars of the highest learning who recite these verses ten times will find yin and yang aligning in virtue, the Five Agents harmonizing in function. They will ascend in accord with the celestial patterns, traversing the celestial degrees without end, preserving and delivering from adversity, cutting off calamity to gain extension. The reason for this is that scholars of the Dao have not yet purified their qi, their bodies have not yet merged with the divine, and though they regulate and harmonize to bring order, their station has not yet reached the profound. By their own effort, they may dispel the disasters of the times, avert and restrain the turning of fate—but this only removes harm and wards off misfortune.

To recite these verses lightly or carelessly brings punishment upon the self. To offer reverent devotion and honor to this scripture brings prosperity to one’s household, generation after generation flourishing in abundance, bound to good karmic causes. Ten thousand calamities will not touch them, and divine luminaries will guard their gates. This scripture is most exalted and wondrous, unmatched in the Jade Capital, delivering countless beings and serving as the root of all Dao. Its majestic and vast model of virtue is beyond measure.

The Dao declares: When one recites this scripture ten times, all the heavens assemble. The errant qi of yin and yang and the Five Agents, the principles of disorder and disharmony, all immediately harmonize, uniting with the utmost truth. After three years of the Dao’s completion, one’s transformative power penetrates the subtle, summoning the divine spirits to operate the mysterious gate, nurturing and bringing forth life as if wielding its authority. One’s name is recorded in the Golden Portal and inscribed in the Jade Purity.

Scholars of the highest learning who cultivate and recite this scripture find yin and yang, the Five Agents, and the inner and outer merging with the profound. Externally, they expand their scope; internally, they guard the celestial origin. The mechanisms of inner and outer align with spontaneity.

When mortals receive and recite this scripture, the sun, moon, and stars pour forth their essence upon them. Within their bodies, they later attain the Dao of liberation through simulated death, their ethereal souls briefly extinguished, sparing them the trials of hell. They immediately regain their form and roam the great void. This scripture is subtle and wondrous, universally delivering without end, and all heavenly and earthly beings receive its blessings. Boundless merit extends to life and death, for this treasure of the heavens is not transmitted to the lower world. Only the most devoted scholars, offering gold and treasures with sincere hearts and swearing oaths to heaven, may receive it. To leak or slight it lightly brings calamity upon seven generations, condemning them to long servitude under the ghostly officials.

Five Emperors attend this scripture, along with twenty-four Jade Lads and twenty-four Jade Maidens, who encircle and protect the sacred text, safeguarding those who receive it.

The Dao declares: During the long fast of the first month, recite and chant this scripture. Yin and yang separate and unite, and the ten thousand things receive life. Hard and soft harmonize, the Five Qi interweave, the transformed body remains unharmed, and form and spirit endure forever. During the long fast of the seventh month, recite and chant this scripture. Yin and yang separate and unite, and the ten thousand things receive completion. Nurturing the hun and embracing the po, the Five Virtues are fulfilled, the transformed body shines brightly, and form and spirit are eternally preserved. During the long fast of the tenth month, recite and chant this scripture. Yin and yang separate and unite, and the ten thousand things return to truth. The primordial root merges and blends, nurturing the Five Essences, the transformed body remains ever firm, and form and spirit flourish forever. In sum, the supreme Dao protects and stabilizes the emperor, ensuring the nation’s destiny endures without bound and governance knows no limit.

On the days of the eight solar terms, recite and chant this scripture to open and guide harmonious qi, gathering and aiding transformative power. Cultivate and accumulate without cease to ascend and attain the lineage of immortals. On one’s natal day, recite and chant this scripture. Yin and yang, the Five Agents, and the wondrous origin of the divine protect my life, assist my spirit, and drive away suffering. My body shines with light, the Three Realms attend me, the Five Emperors welcome me, and the myriad spirits pay homage. My name is inscribed in the heavens, and upon the completion of merit and virtue, I ascend to the Upper Clarity.

The Dao declares: On the days of practicing the Dao, one must bathe in fragrant waters, enter the chamber in purification, face east, and knock the teeth thirty-two times to ascend to the thirty-two heavens. Bow in the heart thirty-two times, close the eyes, and silently envision the body seated amidst clouds of blue, yellow, and white qi, the inner and outer shrouded in mist. A Green Dragon, White Tiger, Vermilion Bird, Dark Warrior, Lion, and White Crane array themselves to the left and right. The sun and moon illuminate brilliantly, suffusing the chamber with radiance. A circular image appears above the head, its light shining in all ten directions—all this must be clearly envisioned.

The secret incantation says:
Supreme Mysterious Origin, Most High Lord of the Dao,
Summon forth from within my body the Three and Five Merit Officers, the left and right attending messengers, the jade lads who tend the incense, the jade maidens who transmit words, the direct talismans of the Five Emperors, and the incense officials of the day—thirty-two each—to open and convey my words.
Today is an auspicious day, a long fast in the pure hall, cultivating the supreme scripture to deliver countless beings.
May what I now declare swiftly ascend to the presence of the Most High, the Primordial Lord of the Thirty-Two Heavens.
Conclude by drawing qi thirty-two times, then face east and recite the scripture.

*The Supreme, Boundless Deliverance, Uppermost Wondrous Scripture*
The Primordial, Cavernous Mystery, Numinous Treasure Root Chapter—
Yin and yang separate and unite, the Five Agents transform the body.
The wondrous uppermost beginning, delivering beings through the ten poles,
The Celestial Sovereign’s hidden rhymes, separating and uniting spontaneously.
The wondrous model of the Great Ultimate, subtle and profoundly mysterious,
The great chaos at its beginning, governing the transformations of the hundred spirits.
Pure and turbid distinguish their forms, yin and yang ascend and descend,
Intermingling and transforming, their brilliance shining forth.
The accumulated qi determines the numbers, the Five Functions divide the directions,
Below nurturing their forms, above adorning their essences.
Nurturing within, the Dao has its constancy,
Soft and hard, dry and damp, cold and heat, warmth and coolness.
The primordial harmony of the One, encompassing the numinous net,
Mutually aiding, mutually transforming, mutually overcoming, mutually completing.
Without this, nothing is established; without this, nothing is completed;
Without this, nothing is delivered; without this, nothing is born.
This is the Numinous Treasure, the true one within heaven,
The realm of jade and rosy clouds, the palace of the moon’s assembly.
Encompassing the ten thousand realms, governing the Jade Dawn,
Lush and fragrant, the root of the ethereal and distant.
The three gates and nine domains, receiving the wondrous lineage of light,
The Golden Portal and Jade Chamber, the pure and vast forest of stars.
The great flow of Brahma qi circulates through the ten directions.
Within are the gods of yin and yang’s creation and transformation,
Within are the lords who opened heaven and established the pole,
Within are the great gods who govern the mysterious mechanisms,
Within are the Three Primordials and the August Lords of the Three Origins,
Within are the deities who oversee the Five Numinosities, the Five Qi, the four seasons, the four sequences, and the honored gods of the Great Year.
Separating and uniting, transforming the body, delivering countless beings,
Today, as the recording is reviewed, all the heavens descend to the imperial terrace.

The Divine Kings of the Boundless in the East, Initiators of the Numinous, Great Sages of Eternal Life, Deliverers of Countless Beings.
The Divine Kings of the Boundless in the South, Radiant with Florid Splendor, Great Sages of Eternal Life, Deliverers of Countless Beings.
The Divine Kings of the Boundless in the West, Nurturers of the Pristine, Great Sages of Eternal Life, Deliverers of Countless Beings.
The Divine Kings of the Boundless in the North, Primal Spirits of the Origin, Great Sages of Eternal Life, Deliverers of Countless Beings.
The Divine Kings of the Boundless in the Northeast, Stabilizers of Destiny, Great Sages of Eternal Life, Deliverers of Countless Beings.
The Divine Kings of the Boundless in the Southeast, Openers of Life, Great Sages of Eternal Life, Deliverers of Countless Beings.
The Divine Kings of the Boundless in the Southwest, Perfectors of Virtue, Great Sages of Eternal Life, Deliverers of Countless Beings.
The Divine Kings of the Boundless in the Northwest, Mystic Treasures of the Profound, Great Sages of Eternal Life, Deliverers of Countless Beings.
The Divine Kings of the Boundless Above, Celestial Pivots of Heaven, Great Sages of Eternal Life, Deliverers of Countless Beings.
The Divine Kings of the Boundless Below, Keepers of Earth’s Passes, Great Sages of Eternal Life, Deliverers of Countless Beings.
The Perfected Sovereigns of the Ten Directions, Divine Kings of Transformation, Eternal Life and Deliverance, Boundless Great Gods, all ascend in flying clouds, crimson chariots, and cinnabar carriages, adorned with kingfisher canopies, drawn by auspicious beasts and five-colored dragon steeds. They bear the standards of streaming fire and the darkly radiant great banners. Before them, the wondrous music of the Ten Heavens leads the way; behind them, the chants of the Three Realms follow. Vermilion script and cavernous chapters harmonize to produce celestial sound. The Ten Floras open the path, the Seven Essences uphold the shafts. Myriad immortals and ten thousand Perfected Ones come singing, traversing the void, treading the insubstantial, summoning qi and gathering clouds.

The Prime Minister of the Celestial Pivot, the Boundless Palace of the Origin, the Nine Numinous Mystic Assistants, and the Great Gods of Transformative Qi, holding registers and talismans, arrive together at the imperial court. As they open and transform, they turn the wheels of all heavens. Universally proclaiming to the Three Realms, illuminating the Six Passes of the Cavernous Dark, the Azure Lodge and Cinnabar Pool, the Yellow Pass and Yellow Springs Terrace—separating and uniting yin and yang, transforming the body through the Five Phases, driving and commanding responsive changes, all things come to life and take form. Encompassing and spreading, the two qi soar; the great transformation interweaves, ascending and descending in mutual embrace. The primal movement of the Four Voids, the warp and weft revolve; grasping the origin’s mechanism, yin’s po and yang’s hun. Profoundly awakening to the true and wondrous, the spirit soars to the Jade Capital. Refined by the Vermilion Mound’s fire, the immortal transformation transcends and ascends. Ascending as Perfected, receiving deliverance, enduring through kalpas, the turning wheel of yin and yang, sharing the years of heaven. Forever parted from demonic ghosts and the trials of the kalpa, transcending the Three Realms, carefree in the Grand Purity.

In the Heaven of Grand Purity, the Celestial Emperor transforms through light, the colorless realm of Brahma conduct.

The Eight Heavens of the East:
The Heaven of Radiant Chess and Numinous Thicket, where the Emperor weighs the mechanisms of the profound.
The Heaven of Yu and Fang’s wisdom reaching the heavens, where the Emperor blesses the world and transforms immortals.
The Heaven of Yi and Luo’s trial and ascent, where the Emperor bestows wisdom and benefits.
The Heaven of Scenic Wonders and Exhaustive Thought, where the Emperor observes the Nine Netherworlds.
The Heaven of Tian’s numinous threads completing, where the Emperor reveals the magic mushrooms of the abyssal peaks.
The Heaven of Departed Perfection and Conjoined Profound Transformation, where the Emperor presses forward on the profound path.
The Heaven of the Dao’s reliance on manifest tranquility and the divine, where the Emperor plans and commands with thoughtful intent.
The Heaven of Sequential Thought verifying principle and illuminating communication, where the Emperor stabilizes and revolves the subtle origin.

The Eight Heavens of the South:
The Heaven of Upholding Countenance, Celebrating Threads, and Reverent Transformation, where the Emperor assists the Crimson Clarity.
The Heaven of Joyous Protection, Thoughtful Perfection, and Harmonious Prosperity, where the Emperor Meng is honored and enjoys goodness.
The Heaven of Lu’s Completion and Central Arrival, where the Emperor follows and inquires.
The Heaven of Ying’s Equality and Yu’s Governance, where the Emperor Yi seeks fulfillment of the Perfected.

The Heaven of Illuminating the Cavernous and Concealing Thought, where the Emperor anticipates and receives the marsh’s favor.
The Heaven of Kang’s Ancestry and Yang’s Righteousness surpassing the boundless, where the Emperor moves with constant humility.

The Eight Heavens of the West:
The Heaven of Reverent Ultimate and Cavernous Sovereignty, where the Emperor’s profound brilliance settles the heart.
The Heaven of Illuminating Will and Elaborating the Subtle, where the Emperor’s Dao summons the myriad existences.
The Heaven of Grand Beginning and Radiant Life, where the Emperor’s origin longs for the profound and distant.
The Heaven of Solemn Ultimate and Tranquil Cultivation, where the Emperor An rests in the mound and abides in the field.
The Heaven of Direct Wheel and Pristine Pivot, where the Emperor Yan delights in unfolding thoughts.
The Heaven of Auspicious Command and Transforming Times, where the Emperor Bi Lin arranges and returns.
The Heaven of Warm Compassion and Completing Ritual, where the Emperor Duo stores and employs goodness.
The Heaven of Solemn Roundness and Reverent Celebration, where the Emperor Xi’s virtue shines with doubled brilliance.

The Eight Heavens of the North:
The Heaven of Hui’s Ancestry and Dragon Slope, where the Emperor preserves the undetermined life.
The Heaven of Silent Emptiness and Constant Goodness, where the Emperor’s non-being fills with profound reverence.
The Heaven of Concealing the Profound and Revealing the Numinous, where the Emperor Dun follows Bo Gao.
The Heaven of Wondrous Deliverance and Advancing Goodness, where the Emperor Wang gazes upon Zong Jing’s radiance.
The Heaven of Vast Scenery and Protecting the Perfected, where the Emperor You celebrates and parts from Cheng.
The Heaven of Nine Perfected and Grand Feathers, where the Emperor transforms with constant ancestrality.
The Heaven of Silent Harmony and Exalted Deliverance, where the Emperor Yao illuminates the River Controller’s numen.
The Heaven of Secluded Emptiness and Entrusted Profundity, where the Emperor Yi’s merit assists and aids.

The Thirty-Two Heavens, the Thirty-Two Emperors—each heaven’s hidden taboos, each heaven’s concealed names. Within the heavens, the empty and cavernous, the natural numinous chapters, each heaven’s hidden rhymes, the sounds of yin and yang. The honored ones of the Five Phases, the gods of separation and union, naturally transforming bodies, the numinous of exhaustive change. Nine harmonies and ten unions, transformations of the Highest Clarity, boundless mysteries, too profound to detail. Scattering and descending, the divine and Perfected universally deliver heaven and humanity.

Today, rejoicing in receiving deliverance, passing through the heavens’ passes, calling yin and summoning yang, gathering and dispersing, stirring and refining. The wood of spring nurtures fire, becoming summer’s flame; the metal of autumn nurtures water, becoming winter’s cold. The four seasons revolve with earth, and the myriad things attain completion. The three qi transform the body, separating and uniting the dark passes; the two luminaries ascend and change, thereby distinguishing the Five Phases. The three qi congeal essence, drumming and leaping, smelting and molding. Flying and hiding, sinking and appearing, the Dao exercises its power. The Three Realms stand upright, all things are at peace; again separating, again uniting, the divine essence spreads and proclaims. The Jade Elixir congeals, form possesses spirit and substance; the body transforms myriad changes, one Perfected naturally.

The Perfected Kings hold the keys, opening and unlocking the gates of heaven. The Eastern Dipper gives birth to yang, the Western Dipper brings forth yin; yin and yang’s dipper descends, metal’s po and wood’s hun. The Northern Dipper’s profound ford, the Southern Dipper’s crimson clarity; the Central Dipper governs all, constantly overseeing the multitude of spirits. The Azure Emperor engenders life, the White Emperor completes form, the Crimson Emperor spreads nurturance, the Black Emperor communicates essence, the Yellow Emperor stabilizes intent, commanding and restraining the myriad gods.

The Azure Heavenly Demon King, Bayuan Choubo.
The Crimson Heavenly Demon King, bearing heaven and carrying stone.
The White Heavenly Demon King, six-eyed mountain-overturner.
The Black Heavenly Demon King, overseeing ugliness and bright fragrance.
The Yellow Heavenly Demon King, spanning heaven with boundless strength.
The Five Thearch Demon Kings, ancestors of the myriad spirits.
Following qi’s separation and union, their forms transform and circulate;
soaring and converging, expanding and contracting, they are companions to the Dao.
They establish and plant great vessels, distributing across the nine mounds,
administering heaven and earth, wielding divine soldiers.
Holding talismans and grasping tablets, they traverse the great void,
proclaiming their radiant majesty, with all heavens sharing their merit.
Ascending to deliver humanity, they strictly govern the Northern Feng;
the Yellow and the Old receive the decree to annihilate demonic omens.
Kui-dragons command poisons, phosphorescent riders drive the vanguard;
the Tail of the Tiger warns ahead, Red Armor raises the banner.
Hurling fire for ten thousand leagues, casting ringing bells through the eight directions—
should any dare to test them, they resist and repel the Perfected Ones.
White spirits execute the van, fire soldiers punish the rear;
yin dissolves ghostly apparitions, slaughtering and vanquishing evil essences.
At dawn the records are settled, examinations proceed without cease.
Demons dare not trespass, ghosts dare not manifest.
The Six Heavens’ bureaus inspect ghostly encampments,
permitting no concealment, reporting swiftly as wind and fire.
Universally proclaimed to the Three Origins, all spirits heed the summons;
the Nine Abysses’ upper aides submit memorials to the Great Clarity.
Through cavernous kalpas vast and boundless, from the Great Beginning’s Dragon Prosperity,
through countless eons in the midst of primordial chaos,
yin and yang separate and unite, the five natures arise spontaneously.
Forms transform through emptiness and constancy, ascending to the Three Colors,
descending to the deepest abyss, winds revolving through the Nine Voids.
Metal and fire ride heaven, above heaven and below heaven—
no darkness, no obscurity, no form, no shadow,
no limit, no end, the primordial mist transforms into qi.
Vast and expansive, intertwining, cinnabar light unfolds the chart.
Kalpas pass naturally, the Primordial Beginning remains serene.
Spreading the Five Chapters, the red script of jade characters,
the Eight Might’s dragon script, safeguarding and regulating kalpic destiny,
ensuring heaven’s eternal endurance, the Brahma-qi suffuses the cosmos.
Myriad patterns unfold, the primordial net flows and evolves.
The Thirty-Two Heavens revolve without color,
circling the ten directions, wheeling through the Dipper and Winnowing Basket.
Revolving through the Five Constants, thirty-five divisions,
the Upper Origin’s qi unites, the Eight Effulgences merge in darkness.
Qi enters the profoundest mystery, within mystery the Great August,
the Most High Lord, floating through the radiance of great rosy clouds.
Chanting cavernous hymns, golden perfected ones gleam resplendent;
their flowing resonance fills the cloudy encampments, jade tones gather qi.
Divine winds assemble mists, the Purple Void flourishes in elegance,
assisting and sheltering the myriad immortals, all proceeding from yin and yang.
Separating and uniting the Five Phases, forms transform and manifest in fullness;
wondrous qi generates and completes, responsive change is the true Dao.
Opening and transforming the utmost Perfected, within the Perfected there is spirit.

The Great Lord of Longevity, the Great Emperor of Azure Radiance,
the Venerable Luminous Spirit, the Supreme Unity of Strategic Planning,
the Controller of Destiny who governs with clarity,
the Peach Prosperity who presides over life,
the Harmonious Extension of the Imperial Lord,
who holds talismans and grasps registers, safeguarding life and engendering roots.
Above, they roam the Nine Clarities, entering and exiting the Yellow Chamber,
within the dark elixir, amid the crimson qi.
Below, they govern the Six Gates, the cavernous abodes of primordial essence;
centrally, they regulate the Five Qi, blending the hundred spirits.
Ten revolutions return the numinous, myriad qi unite as immortals.
The immortal way values life, delivering boundless multitudes.
Above, they open the Eight Gates, the flying heavenly dharma-wheel,
prohibitions of sin and blessing, karmic conditions of past lives.
Universally receiving deliverance, the dead souls gain living bodies;
bodies attain rebirth, ascending to be heard by the various heavens.
Above the various heavens, each has its gate of life;
within them are the chapters of separating and uniting transforming forms,
the Perfected Kings’ numinous scriptures, verses that match the lofty Perfected.

**First: The Melody of Separation and Union in Flight through the Void**
Once qi splits open, the myriad transformations flow freely.
Yin and yang separate and unite, great kalpas intersect and revolve.
The Nine Heavens and Eight Extremes, the Thirty-Two Passes—
one separation, one union, qi’s reckoning shifts and changes.
Luminous and resplendent, the primordial image responds below to the human body.
Forests of palaces and towers govern and prepare the hundred spirits.
To sever the wheel of rebirth, cultivate the Five Phases in sequence.
The Five Phases’ transformations are called the Heavenly Origin.
If you can recognize this, you will ascend in form as a flying immortal.
If the numinous palace is turbid and dull, the Dao will not be accomplished.
How could one know that awakening to the Dao unites spirit and qi in ascent?
Yin and yang’s separation and union follow the sprouting of the myriad things.
Wandering beyond the Three Realms, naturally there is no life or death.
Spirits fly and step through the circular net, the twin towers pay homage to the lofty Perfected.

**Second: The Perfected’s Chapter of Transforming Forms**
Controlling the chariot, roaming the Eight Darknesses, halting the radiance at Kunlun’s slopes.
Golden towers bow to the Void Thearch, luxuriant clouds ride the great rosy clouds.
Forms transform within emptiness and nothingness, life and completion bathe in dark waves.
Clinging to form, desires not yet purified, yin thoughts without bound or shore.
Karmic thoughts pursue one another, endlessly sinking into the river of love.
Once fallen into the filthy and turbid realm, the bitter path gives rise to sorrowful songs.
I now spread the utmost teaching, the upright qi suppresses the source of evil.
The red script delivers the multitudes, the yellow banner summons the great demons.
Forever enjoying great fortune, what are a hundred million years?
Alas, you children of the dust, how could you turn your backs on the true?

**Third: The Song of the Five Phases and Yin-Yang**
Vast and distant, above the Three Heavens,
towering and majestic, the White Jade Capital.
The Primordial Beginning rides the bright effulgence, establishing this great transformative root.
Yin arises and binds the yellow blossom, yang’s light spreads the crimson wheel.
The two qi intertwine and weave, the great void flows with the Five Phases.
The Seven Effulgences suddenly soar and change, the myriad things arise therefrom.
The Five Phases mutually shift and alter—who can fathom success or failure?
The Divine Empyrean holds the dark record, universally examining all heaven’s people.
To the left, it captures the demons of the Three Realms; to the right, it controls the soldiers of the Six Heavens.
Precious chapters summon harmonious qi, jade talismans gather the hundred spirits.
Heavenly soldiers wield jasper axes, the Red Thearch hurls molten metal.
Capturing and subduing the multitude of demonic ugliness, all realms become pure and clear.
The true shade universally covers heaven, protecting for a hundred million kalpas without collapse.

This is above the Three Realms, within the flight through the void,
the Perfected Kings’ song and melody, melodies that match the cavernous hymns.
Reciting them a hundred times, names are registered in the Southern Palace.
Reciting them a thousand times, the Perfected Kings protect and welcome.
Ten thousand recitations complete the Dao, ascending to the great void,
passing beyond the Three Realms, attaining the rank of Immortal Duke.
Those who hear the numinous melody, the Perfected Kings respect their forms,
commanding and restraining earthly deities, escorting and welcoming,
extracting them from the earthly gates, the Five Sufferings and Eight Difficulties.
Seven generations of ancestors ascend and depart, forever leaving the ghostly bureaus;
souls cross the Vermilion Mound, receiving refinement and rebirth.

This is called the Boundless, universally delivering the infinite. There are secret celestial texts, revered by all heavens. Those who leak them arrogantly fall into hell, with calamity extending to seven generations of ancestors.

The Dao states: These two chapters are the hidden melodies of the Celestial Emperors and the Perfected Immortal Kings, the mysteries of yin-yang separation and union, the mechanisms of the Five Phases’ transformative embodiment. They initiate the creation of heaven, earth, and the Three Realms, dissecting the primordial chaos—all are the words of the Great Brahma, not the common speech of the mundane world. Their words lack ornate beauty, their melodies lack florid grace; thus, they are called profound and obscure, difficult to fathom in detail. Treasured by the heavens, they are concealed in the Divine Empyrean’s Jade Clarity King’s Mansion, within the Eastern Florescence Scripture Chamber. After passing through countless *ren-chen* years, they are transmitted downward according to the Mysterious Regulations. If a perfected person offers gold and treasures with a sincere heart, following the old protocols to petition and ally with the Perfected Kings, only then are they bestowed.

The Dao states: The revolutions of heaven and earth also have their ends. The sun, moon, and five planets also wax and wane. Even the most sagely and divine persons have their periods of decline. Those of shallow learning may also suffer illness and harm—all are manifestations of yin-yang separation and union, the transformations of embodied qi. Whenever such disasters occur, all of shared qi must unite in heart to perform purification rites, burn incense in the six periods, and recite the scriptures ten times. Blessings and virtue will descend at once, dissolving all inauspiciousness. The boundless texts universally deliver the infinite.

The Dao states: Those of shallow learning in the Dao, whose immortal ranks are not yet full, when their destined time of passing arrives and their bodies enter the Great Yin, at the moment of transition, their fellow perfected students should burn incense for them and recite the scriptures ten times. By thus delivering the corpse-form according to the method, the soul-spirit will ascend directly to the Southern Palace. According to the merit of their studies, they will be reborn after a calculated number of days. No longer confused by the cycles of rebirth, they will attain the rank of divine immortals.

The Dao states: When the revolutions of heaven and earth reach their end, the stellar lodges fall into disorder, the sun and moon lose their light, the four seasons lose their order, yin and yang fall out of harmony, the imperial domains suffer floods and droughts, pestilential toxins spread, and the multitudes perish. When teachers and friends pass away, these are the transformations of yin-yang and the Five Phases’ separation and union. In such times, all must perform purification rites, burn incense, and recite the scriptures. The merit of purification rites and scripture recitation is exceedingly weighty. Above, they dissolve celestial disasters and protect the emperor; below, they dispel poisonous harms and deliver the multitudes. Both the living and the dead rely upon them, their blessings immeasurable. Thus, it is said: boundless, universally delivering heaven and humanity.

The Dao states: Whoever possesses these scriptures and performs these meritorious deeds for the Celestial Thearchs, the earthly rulers, and the multitudes—on days of disaster, if they resolve in their hearts to perform purification rites, burn incense, and recite the scriptures ten times—all the heavens will record their names, and the myriad spirits will attend and protect them. Those who distinguish themselves as perfected persons will be able to become ministers of the Golden Watchtower of the Sagely Lord. The heavens record the merits and transgressions of people without the slightest error. The Perfected Kings of the heavens will also protect and recommend them. Those who attain the Dao will then thoroughly comprehend these ultimate words.

The Boundless Hidden Melodies of the Great Brahma in the Heavens
Composed by the Dao Lord
The Jade Chapters of the *Book of the Separation and Union of Yin-Yang and the Transformations of the Five Phases*

The Dao speaks: Within these heavens lie the hidden words of the Great Brahmā, the boundless sounds. The primordial script of the Northern Dipper’s primal chief and the Southern Dipper’s Celestial Winnowing Basket enacts yin and yang, revolves and steers the Five Phases, stabilizes the Three Realms within the primordial chaos, and establishes the mysterious mechanism in the Great Clarity. Through separation and union, their Dao is exchanged; through water and fire, their numinous power flourishes. They govern and gather all beings, forging alliances with the perfected. Through endless kalpas, they never wane, and they present themselves at the Dark Emperor’s mystic court. Each character spans a full *zhang* in breadth.

In ancient times, the Heavenly Perfected Sovereign inscribed these words to serve as the correct intonation. Those who know these sounds and can purify themselves in fasting to recite them will have the flying heavenly spirit-kings of all heavens descend to observe their person, record their merits and diligence, and report them to the heavens.
