**Scripture of the Supreme Treasure for Delivering Beings, Supreme Perfection, Volume Forty-Six Complete**
**Volume Forty-Seven Complete**

**Supplication and Exorcism for Drought and Flood**

The Dao speaks: *"In the realm of Perfect Achievement, at dawn when the morning mist sang with the Great True One of harmonious soil, I received from the Primordial Origin the wondrous scripture for supplicating and exorcising drought and flood.*

When the Primordial Origin, Celestial Sovereign, was to proclaim this sutra, He circled ten times to summon the ten directions, and then took His seat. The Celestial True God, the Supreme Saint of High Veneration, the True Person of Marvelous Practice—along with the ten-direction Dragon Kings, the officials of drought and flood, the eight seas’ water officers, the Three Elements’ fire officials, the Four Great Rivers’ masters, the Thunder and Lightning Deities, the Wandering Fire generals, the Red Emperor’s envoys, the Spirit Officials and mounted attendants, and the countless *Wú-Yáng*—all ascended through the void.

Their carriages glided upon the flowing light, their palanquins pierced the heavens. At dawn’s curve, they cast their shade; crimson essence radiated brilliance, clustered hues unfolded their splendor, and the boundless sky blazed with splendor. For seven days and seven nights, the celestial golden gates and jade palaces, the vermilion halls and *Lín* treasuries, stood in solemn stillness. The stars shifted in radiant procession, the fragrant osmanthus congealed in perfume, the *qián* forests flourished verdant, the rainbow beams hung like sashes, and celestial light shimmered—double wheels of sun reflected in glory.

Within a single realm, earth and mountains, forests and trees, all leveled as one, no longer high or low. The soil transformed into jade of emerald hue, soft yet luminous, transparent without blemish. The assembled immortals attended the seat, while the Primordial Origin, Celestial Sovereign, sat suspended in the void, His form encircled by nine radiant clouds, a round aura, and a dancing dragon above.

When the sutra was recited once, the celestial saints all proclaimed its excellence in unison. The realm’s boundaries filled with harmonious *qi*, and all things were free of blight.

When recited twice, grasses and trees flourished in luxuriant growth, and all treasures bore fruit.

When recited thrice, the *qián* forests gathered phoenixes, their leaves displaying celestial script.

When recited four times, lotus dew contained blossoms, their cores holding elixir.

When recited five times, water and fire attained their proper measure, and all living things thrived.

When recited six times, clouds moved and rain fell, springs stabilized, and rivers flowed evenly.

When recited seven times, the Three Spirits followed their seasons, their brilliance converging in harmony.

When recited eight times, the sacred age flourished universally, and all beings shared prosperity.

When recited nine times, all nations knew peace, and yin and yang aligned with the seasons.

When recited ten times, the Imperial Dao endured in splendor, governance was complete, and virtue was fulfilled. At that moment, men and women of the realm could not but devote their hearts—all received protection and attained longevity.

The Dao speaks: *"At that time, when the Primordial Origin recited the sutra once, the Dragon King of the East, the officials of drought and flood, and the *Wú-Yáng* multitudes ascended through the void. When recited twice, the Dragon King of the South, Great Brightness, with his officials and multitudes, ascended through the void. When recited thrice, the Dragon King of the West, Upholder of Law, with his officials and multitudes, ascended through the void. When recited four times, the Dragon King of the North, Nurturer of Life, with his officials and multitudes, ascended through the void. When recited five times, the Dragon King of the Northeast, Pacifier of Mountains, with his officials and multitudes, ascended through the void. When recited six times, the Dragon King of the Southeast, Cultivator of Winds, with his officials and multitudes, ascended through the void. When recited seven times, the Dragon King of the Southwest, Holder of the Knot, with his officials and multitudes, ascended through the void. When recited eight times, the Dragon King of the Northwest, Controller of the Halter, with his officials and multitudes, ascended through the void. When recited nine times, the Dragon King of the Upper Realm, Dispenser of Moisture, with his officials and multitudes, ascended through the void. When recited ten times, the Dragon King of the Lower Realm, Transformer of Floods, with his officials and multitudes, ascended through the void.

When the ten recitations were complete, the Dragon Kings of the ten directions without limit, the masters of drought and flood, and the Celestial True Gods all arrived together. Men and women of the realm turned their hearts in reverence.

Those who came were as fine as misting rain, each bearing precious treasures to offer the Celestial Sovereign, gazing upon His holy visage, and rejoicing in the wondrous Dao. Then, the Primordial Origin scattered light through the heavens, emitting ten thousand rays of cloud, His Dharma-body manifesting in transformation—now present, now vanished. The wheels of water and fire spun their radiance, eclipsing the sun, while celestial sounds echoed, resounding a thousand *zhèn*. Heavenly flowers scattered in flight, divine music played in harmony, and auspicious *qi* gathered in the void.

The Celestial Sovereign spoke from His mouth, and jade script spread across ten thousand realms. With a smile, He spoke again to the celestial and human assembly:

*'Drought and flood arise from the excessive *qi* of Heaven and Earth—the Great Minor *qi* that affects the people differently across regions. There are also the celestial and terrestrial officials of the year, whose *qi* clashes with that of humanity, causing such calamities. When water overflows, it is yin excess; when drought strikes, it is yang excess. The ruler’s virtue must align with Heaven and Earth—if governance is just, the seasons will harmonize. Overflow becomes flood; excess becomes drought.

Sometimes, even when the Emperor’s virtue is pure and his benevolence extends to the eight extremes, drought and flood may still occur—this is the decree of the celestial officials of the year. In years *Bing*, *Xīn*, *Wù*, and *Guǐ*, during the cycles of *Tài-Yǔ* and *Tài-Zhēng*, when disasters manifest in the first, sixth, or seventh *guī*, drought and flood are inevitable.

Drought and flood are the greatest calamities of the age. When they appear in small measure, one must supplicate; when they appear in excess, one must exorcise. Summon the Dragon Kings of the ten directions, the officials of drought and flood, and the Great Gods, to regulate their *qi*, rectify their commands, and observe their seasons. Then, the people and creatures will know no sickness, yin and yang will balance, and the Dao will not be monopolized by the few.*

At that moment, the wheels of water and fire merged into a single pearl, as large as a millet grain, suspended in the void five *zhàng* above the earth. The Primordial Origin ascended, drawing in the Celestial True Gods, the Supreme Saints of High Veneration, the Dragon Kings of the ten directions, the officials of drought and flood, and the countless *Wú-Yáng*—all entered the precious pearl. The celestial and human assembly looked upward and saw only a faint rustling as they vanished into the pearl’s mouth, unknown where they had gone. The people of the realm dispersed in awe, following the teachings.

The Primordial Origin then completed the sutra within the pearl, and the assembled immortals, overseeing the deliverance, entrusted it to me. At that time, the joy and celebration were beyond words."*

The rites were now fully completed, and the celestial hosts resumed their stations. In a mere instant, all was silent, leaving no trace of sound.

At that time, the celestial and human assemblies encountered the scriptures and teachings, and all were universally delivered and saved. Their original nature was preserved, and none suffered harm. The people of the land turned in reverence, all finding peace in their hearts.

They felt no regret nor stinginess, no arrogance nor selfishness, no ignorance nor deceit, no excess nor error, no deviation nor falsehood.

Their words brought benevolent transformation, their speech held no angry tones, and they treated all with equal compassion, regarding even those of different origins as kin.

The realm was secure, the people prosperous, and they rejoiced in great peace. The teachings began to spread, and the entire land was guided by the Dao.

Those with sincere devotion revered and honored them, all attaining deliverance from the world.

The Dao speaks: The words spoken by the Primordial Origin in the scripture are the hidden names of the celestial and divine sovereigns within the heavens, the esoteric sounds of the True Kings. They are also the taboo names for invoking rain or drought, summoning dragons, and commanding spirits—the secret names of the hundred spirits. These are not the common words of the world.

The Supreme Saints, having already become True Persons, mastering the Mysterious and fathoming the subtle, could fully comprehend their meaning.

When recited ten times, the celestial hosts would respond from afar, the two symbols moving in harmony, advancing and retreating in accordance with the natural order. Rain and drought would not fail. Petitions for rain or drought relief would be answered, the written characters nurturing and flourishing life. Demons would be bound in form, and ghostly spirits would perish utterly. There would be no famine in succession, and blessings would extend to countless people.

Scholars of the highest learning, reciting it ten times, would invoke floods of grace for the world, purifying water sources, and bring peace to the realm. All living things would be blessed.

This is so because within the scholar’s body, water and fire ascend in harmony, the qi and seasons follow their natural course, and they align with the two principles. Their petitions would be granted, impurities cleansed, their bodies turning toward the Perfect Truth. They would command the ten directions, dragons and spirits descending with auspicious signs, their威 and德 complete. They would witness longevity and immortality.

To recite this chapter lightly would invite calamity upon oneself.

To honor and venerate with proper offerings would bring abundant harvests, prosperity through generations, and alignment with virtuous causes. No disaster would touch them, and divine beings would guard their gates.

This scripture is wondrous and profound, resonating through the Celestial Capital, delivering countless beings, and standing as the first among ten thousand teachings.

Its grandeur and virtue are boundless and immeasurable.

The Dao speaks: For those who recite this scripture ten times, all the celestial hosts will gather.

To pray for rain, the dragons will spew clouds, the Mysterious Dew nourishing the withered, mist and vapor gathering, the parched earth filling with waves.

To pray for clear skies, the radiant sun will shine forth, the yin dampness vanishing, the yang light blazing, and the hidden darkness opening in clarity.

Those who earnestly study this scripture, their merits complete and virtue fulfilled, will all attain divinity, ascending to the Golden Gate and feasting in the Celestial Capital.

Scholars of the highest order, practicing and reciting this scripture, will balance yin and conceal yang, water and fire harmonizing within. They will immediately receive deliverance and ascend to the Southern Palace.

Ordinary people who recite it will find their five viscera clear and flourishing, their three fields of cultivation thriving. Within their bodies, water and fire will nourish without deficiency, the yin cauldron and yang furnace refining the True Essence into the Dao. Their lifespan will extend, and all will attain the method of corpse dissolution—

Their spirits temporarily extinguished, they will not pass through the underworld but will immediately return to form, wandering the boundless void.

This scripture is subtle and wondrous, delivering without end. All celestial and human beings will receive its blessings.

Its blessings are boundless, extending over life and death.

It is a treasure of the heavens, not to be passed down to the mortal world.

Only those of the highest virtue, offering gold and treasures with sincere devotion, and swearing an oath to the heavens, may transmit it.

To leak or neglect it lightly would bring calamity upon nine generations, subjecting one to eternal servitude in the ghostly bureaucracy, attending to the scriptures of the Five Emperors. Twenty-four玉童 and twenty-four玉女 would guard the divine texts, protecting those who receive the scripture.

The Dao speaks: In the first month, observe a long fast and recite this scripture to pray for rain or drought relief, ensuring that the plants of spring and summer flourish and prosper.

In the seventh month, observe a long fast and recite this scripture to pray for rain or drought relief, restraining the qi to balance, so that the crops grow luxuriantly and all harvests succeed.

In the tenth month, observe a long fast and recite this scripture to pray for rain or drought relief, ensuring that the people and creatures thrive, celestial talents accumulate, and diseases and plagues are dispelled. For the kings and emperors, their ministers and subjects, fathers and sons, it will bring stability to the nation’s destiny, ensuring the heavens endure, year after year bringing abundant harvests, perpetually preserving the Great Harmony, securing the realm, and the people calling it the Age of Great Peace.

On the eight seasonal festivals, recite this scripture to pray for rain or drought relief, following the natural cycles of emptiness and fullness, so that rain and sun are timely, and all living things are at ease.

On one’s birthday, recite this scripture, and within the body, water and fire will ascend and descend. The two wheels of yin and yang will merge in dual radiance, aligning with the celestial order. The spirit and soul will be purified and upright, the Dao-qi enduring, free from suffering. The body will shine with light, guarded by the Three Realms, welcomed by the Five Emperors, and honored by ten thousand spirits. Their names will be inscribed in heaven, their merits complete and virtue fulfilled, ascending to the Upper Purity.

The Dao speaks: On days of practice, one must first bathe in scented water, fast and enter a purified chamber, facing east. They should strike their teeth thirty-two times, ascending to hear the thirty-two heavens. With a mind of devotion, they should bow thirty-two times, close their eyes, and quietly reflect on sitting within three colored clouds—red, black, and yellow—surrounding them internally and externally, dark and vast. There will appear a green dragon, a white tiger, a vermilion bird, a dark tortoise, a lion, and a white crane, arrayed on either side. The ten-directional Dragon Kings and the officials of drought and flood will stand guard before and behind. The sun and moon will illuminate the chamber, its brilliance penetrating the room, a round symbol forming at the neck, its light radiating to the ten directions—so clear and distinct.

**First Chapter: Praying to Avert Floods and Droughts with Sky-Soaring Sounds**
The clouds unfurl, the thunder-chariots roll.
The flying rains descend,
The hundred streams rise to the measure.
Your hearths are filled with grain,
Your homes level with abundance.
The common folk know nothing—

The scorching sun, the dreaded drought,

**Third Chapter: The Song of Ceasing Rain and Invoking Clear Skies**
The Water Official relaxes his prohibitions,
