---
The *Dao* speaks: Within these Eight Heavens, the Hidden Speech of Great Brahma resounds—
An infinite, boundless sound.
The ancient texts are carved on the Jade Hall of the Dark Palace,
Within the lodges of Purple Weave and Great Micro*,
To rectify the cycles of fire and water,
To absolve the calamities of the Three Realms*—
The eons’ trials, plagues, and strange transformations.
Thus, the sun and moon radiate with brilliance,
The yin and yang surge in harmony,
To fulfill the natural order of all things,
Without action yet achieving profound transformation.

Its characters are each a broad span of a *zhang*,
Golden and misty hues gleam in splendor,
Lush green shades mirror the patterns.
The Celestial Sage and the Yellow Emperor once inscribed these texts,
To establish the true sound.
Those who know this sound
And fast while reciting it,
The Eight Heavens shall dispatch the flying celestial kings,
To descend and observe their form,
To record their meritorious deeds,
And present them to the Heavens above.
Ten thousand spirits shall pay homage in worship,
The Earthly Deities* shall guard their gates,
The Demon King of Great Merit shall recommend them to the Pure and High,
And those who attain the Dao shall surely achieve it—
Roaming the Three Realms,
Ascending to the Golden Gate.

This sound repels all obstacles,
Dispels all calamities,
Rescues all beings,
Accomplishes all deeds—
The natural sound of the Heavens.
Thus, when recited, it draws the flying celestial kings to descend and observe,
The Heavenly Emperor’s distant chant,
Ten thousand spirits pay homage in worship,
The Three Realms guard their halls,
The Zoroastrian* hosts bow their heads,
The ghostly spirits perish of their own accord,
The resounding treasures shake the air,
The Ten Directions* stand in solemn reverence.
The rivers and seas fall silent,
The mountains and hills swallow the smoke,
All living beings tremble and submit,
Summoning the gathered immortals.
The Heavens are free of impurity,
The Earth is free of demonic dust,
The profound wisdom pierces through all things,
The boundless virtue is most mysterious.

---
**The *Lingbao* Scripture of Infinite Salvation—Supreme Chapter of the Marvelous Canon**
**The Fifty-First Volume concludes.**
**The Fifty-Second Volume begins.**」

**Chapter on Eradicating Illness and Preserving Life to Extend Years**
The Dao speaks: In days of old, within the Azure Primordial Heaven, the True Sound of the Flying Landscape, the Great Lapis Lazuli Continent, received from the Primordial Originator the Infinite Salvation Scripture for Eradicating Illness, Preserving Life, and Extending Years.

When the Primordial Originator, Heavenly Venerable, proclaimed this Scripture, circling ten times through the passes, He summoned the Ten Directions. Then the True Gods of Heaven, the Highest Saints, the Marvelous True Ones, countless as the sands of the Gobi, arrived riding the void.

The flying clouds and misty vapors, the jade pavilions and phoenix canopies, the violet expanse flowing with radiance, the emerald abyss rising in brilliance, the luminous spirits dazzling with splendor—all illuminated the boundless for five days and five nights. The celestial palaces and halls, the lofty pavilions and sacred gates, shimmered with seven hues, the revolving spheres ceased their motion, the Three Suns aligned in radiance, all phenomena fell into stillness, the Earth bore auspicious blessings, the Heavens displayed jade inscriptions, the Law’s voice echoed far, piercing through all realms. The Three Realms were purified, the Four Seas cleared, the lands of a single kingdom—its mountains, rivers, forests, and trees—all flattened to one level, with no high or low. The soil transformed into jade of uniform hue, without variation.

The gathered immortals attended His seat, while the Primordial Originator, Heavenly Venerable, hung suspended above the Nine-Dragon Treasure Platform, floating in the void.

When the Scripture was recited once, all the Great Saints of the Heavens simultaneously praised its excellence. At that time, all men and women of the kingdom, gazing upward, heard the Law’s voice and intuitively grasped the Dao of the Immortals.

When recited twice, the essence of pure nature was realized.

When recited thrice, the spiritual *qi* descended into the body.

When recited four times, the karmic burdens were dispelled, and all maladies were healed.

When recited five times, the Six Organs and Five *Zang* were refined, blossoming with vitality.

When recited six times, the vital essence ascended, transforming the form, while golden light renewed the bones.

When recited seven times, the divine mysteries were perfected within the body, eternally preserved in completeness.

When recited eight times, the transformation encompassed the Three Realms, extending grace to the Ten Directions. All plagues vanished, and the people thrived in peace and joy.

When recited nine times, the souls of the departed ascended to Heaven, and the officials of the underworld ceased their trials.

When recited ten times, all beings followed their true nature, dwelling in boundless ease and supreme tranquility. At that time, all men and women of the kingdom, without exception, turned their hearts upward in reverence, all receiving protection and attaining eternal life.

The Dao speaks: At that time, when the Primordial Originator had completed the tenfold recitation of the Infinite Salvation Scripture of the Marvelous Dao, the Great Gods of the Ten Directions—without limit or number—arrived simultaneously. The Great Gods of the Infinite in the East, the Great Gods of the Infinite in the South, the Great Gods of the Infinite in the West, the Great Gods of the Infinite in the North, the Great Gods of the Infinite in the Northeast, the Great Gods of the Infinite in the Southeast, the Great Gods of the Infinite in the Southwest, the Great Gods of the Infinite in the Northwest, the Great Gods of the Infinite in the Upper Realm, and the Great Gods of the Infinite in the Lower Realm—all came in one instant, like fine rain and dense mist. The gathered multitude, twelve kinds in all, encircled His seat.

Some had afflictions of the heart, while their bodies suffered from malevolent plagues. Within the Three Realms, all beings—countless Heavenly folk—some had attained the Dao in body yet remained bound by the underworld’s trials, shaped by the influences of Yin-Yang, the Five Phases, and the Six *Qi*. Each pondered their own fate, how they had earned the fruits of the Dao, their true forms, and the retributions of their past lives, manifesting in thirty-six transformations, appearing and vanishing in the depths and heights.

Others, in the mortal world, had once committed evil deeds, violating the officials of the Five Directions—Wood, Metal, Water, Fire, and Earth—suffering the weight of illness and plague. Some were dim-witted and benighted, opposing the Dao of Heaven, ignorant of the principles of life. The Five Phases, in their cycles of subjugation and dominance, surged and clashed, generating myriad afflictions: water plagues brought chill, fire plagues brought heat, metal plagues brought dryness and cold, earth plagues brought panting and sweat, wood plagues brought spasms and fury. The plagues spread, and malevolent spirits wrought harm.

Such beings, twelve categories in all, gathered in clouds around His seat. Having heard the Primordial Originator’s tenfold proclamation of the Infinite Salvation Scripture’s Marvelous Dao, the True Sound of the Flying Landscape, all the Three Realms and Ten Directions were delivered from suffering. The ranks of ascending immortals and saints arrived, countless as mist and rain.

Then the Primordial Originator’s divine light radiated in eight directions, illuminating the Ten Directions, surveying all the Heavens. He spoke again to the assembled gods: *"The Dao is not a matter of mere words or emotions. Its symbols are not like the paired opposites of human thought—sudden in coming, fleeting in departure, transformations beyond measure, a chaotic blend of infinite *qi*. What we call 'the heart,' is not the eternal truth.

The masses are benighted and dull, their karmic burdens heavy as earth. They cling to the heart as if it were wisdom, grasp at wisdom as if it were the spirit, and the spirit congeals to form the Dao. If one does not comprehend the true principles of the Immortal’s cultivation, then the heart’s perceptions grow coarse and impure, drawing near to the realm of ghosts. When mingled with malevolent *qi*, it becomes illness and plague, harming the very essence of life, leaving one’s natural years unfulfilled, their Heavenly lifespan incomplete.

But if one can steady the *qi* in the void, merge the spirit with the boundless, then the heart becomes the dwelling of the spirit. When the spirit’s abode is tranquil, the vital essence aligns, and the form is whole. All malevolence cannot harm, and plagues cannot enter. The body, free of sickness, preserves life and extends years.

With the aid of Daoist contemplation, resting in the natural, wielding jade talismans and golden seals, clad in clouds and mists, one attains eternal life and becomes a True Person."*

At that time, the ten-directional celestial beings and humans upon hearing these words were moved to sighs of admiration and rejoicing. Heavenly luminosity manifested auspicious omens, divine treasures radiated brilliance, and the Primordial Black Pearl encompassed the Nine Realms.

When the Celestial Sovereign’s scripture was fully expounded, the assembled True Ones oversaw the salvation of all, passing it down to me. At that moment, the joy and celebration were beyond words.

The ritual matters were now complete, and the celestial hosts returned to their stations. In the blink of an eye, the two voids fell silent, leaving no lingering echoes.

At that time, the celestial beings and humans who encountered this scriptural law universally attained deliverance and salvation, preserving their natural years unharmed. The people of the land turned in reverence, all cultivating virtuous hearts.

They did not act recklessly or covetously, nor deceive or cling. They did not cling to views or reject what was unseen. They did not guard against harm nor observe rigid precepts.

Their speech was without embellishment or deceit, their words free of malice. They harmonized in compassion, regarding even those of differing natures as kin. The land was secure, the people prosperous, and they rejoiced in great peace. The scripture’s teachings began to spread, and the entire realm was guided by the Dao.

Those with sincere aspiration reverently followed and honored it, all attaining the salvation of the world.

The Dao declares: The words spoken by the Celestial Sovereign of Primordial Origin within this scripture are indeed the inner names of the Heavenly Emperor, concealed in hidden rhymes. They are also the taboo names of the demon kings—the secret names known to the hundred spirits. These are not the common words of the world.

The Supreme Sage has already become a True Person.

The Way penetrates the Mysterious and explores the subtle, with compassionate thoughts encompassing all beings. Within the dark realms of life, it causes the Three *Qi* to shine true and the Five Constants to follow *virtue/power*, dispelling sickness and plague, safeguarding life and extending years—whether the pestilence afflicts one body or sweeps across the world.

By rectifying the heart and guarding the *qi*, amassing good deeds and accumulating merit, one attains the register of the Southern Pole (南极监簿), where Han *Ji* records names and averts calamities, pardoning faults and granting continuance.

If one thoroughly understands its principles and recites them ten times, the *Celestial Deities* (诸天) will chant from afar, and the Ten *Emperors* (万帝) will set forth their rites. The rivers and seas will fall silent, the mountains and peaks conceal their clouds, the sun and moon will emit radiant splendor, and the stars will display their luminous essence. Malignant *qi* will be extinguished, and sickness and plague will be pacified.

With the *Tiger Talisman* (虎符) commands issued, names and merits are recorded, and *demons* (鬼魔) submit to the hundred poisons. Their lineage is severed and their forms destroyed.

When the Heavenly Mandate aligns with the Dao, righteous *qi* flows freely, and the Three Officials (三官) preside over the divine court, their divine soldiers standing guard. The Great Principle (大理) captures souls, and the divine tribunal examines and verifies deeds—truly beneficial acts eliminate *demonic influences* (除祆), and the *spirits* (灵) are sustained, their essence abiding.

Those of supreme learning, reciting it ten times, will then have the Five Emperors (五帝) attend as guardians, and the Three Realms (三界) bow in reverence.

The essence of life decays the eyes, while *demonic influences* (鬼祆) vanish in brilliance, delivering from sickness and plague to attain rebirth.

This is so because scholars, their impure *qi* yet unconsumed, their bodies not yet penetrated by the True, wield authority over the ten directions but cannot yet govern the celestial order. Though they can subdue the earthly spirits and bind the *demonic spirits* (魔灵), they can only repel death—not grant life. A casual recitation of this scripture invites pestilential *demons* to spread calamity.

With reverent offerings and proper rites, households flourish eternally, their prosperity unbroken by a thousand ages, bound to virtuous causes. No harm shall touch them, and divine officials attend in service.

They master celestial secrets, unrivaled in the Jade Capital, guiding countless beings across the Dao. Vast and august is this grand framework—its virtue surpassing measure.

The Dao proclaims: Those who recite this scripture ten times shall see all the heavens converge, countless eons of ancestors and tormented souls in the underworld all receive deliverance. Celestial secrets ascend, names are recorded by the Three Officials, their fates transformed over nine years, reborn through transformation, and elevated to noble status. Those who cherish this scripture, their merits fulfilled and virtue complete, shall attain immortality, ascending to the Golden Gate and feasting in the Jade Capital.

Scholars of high learning, reciting this scripture, shall be untouched by plague, their spirits serene and *qi* refined. The turbid reservoirs disperse, and malevolent influences find no entry. Inner alchemy ignites, bones transmute to prolong life—all attain deliverance, ascending to the Southern Palace.

Mortals who recite it shall extend their years, their descendants all attaining the *shixie* (尸解) path. Their spirits, though momentarily extinguished, avoid the underworld and swiftly return to form, wandering the boundless void.

This scripture’s subtlety is boundless, its salvation without end. All heavenly and human beings rejoice in its blessings. Infinite merit spans life and death, a treasure of the heavens, not passed to the mortal world. Only the worthy, bearing gold and jewels with sincere devotion, may pledge to transmit it. Leakage or negligence invites retribution upon nine generations, eternal servitude to *demonic officials*.

Five Emperors, twenty-four Jade Boys, and twenty-four Jade Girls attend, guarding the scripture’s recipients with divine texts.

The Dao declares:
On the first month’s long fast, reciting this scripture dispels the green plague and the aged *qi* of the Nine Barbarians, which harms the body. For the departed of past ages, it severs their earthly bonds and grants ascension to the Southern Pole’s *Taixi* celestial province, transforming their station.

On the seventh month’s long fast, reciting this scripture dispels the white plague and the aged *qi* of the Six Rong, which harms the body. The practitioner attains immortality, their names inscribed by the heavens in the *Shenxiao* Jade Treasury, within the Western Hua Hall, with golden script on green tablets—erasing death to attain rebirth.

On the tenth month’s long fast, reciting this scripture dispels the black plague and the aged *qi* of the Five Di, which harms the body. It secures the nation’s emperor, stabilizing the imperial lineage, ensuring the heavens endure eternally. Generation after generation, they rule as sovereigns, their lands in eternal peace.

On the eight solar terms, reciting this scripture pacifies the Eight Sceneries, invigorates the Eight Spirits, repels the Eight Evils, and forever banishes a hundred plagues. The Three Fields yield pearls, all nodes harmonize, blood transmutes to jade nectar, and essence condenses into jade flowers. One attains the status of a True Person of the Nine Palaces.

On one’s birth-day, reciting this scripture prevents malevolent *qi* from forming, wards off plague, and secures longevity. Ghosts and monsters retreat, spirits purify, and vital *qi* endures eternally. Free from suffering, the body radiates light, with the Three Realms as guardians and the Five Emperors in attendance. They govern the celestial pivot, their retinue adorned with pearl tassels, as ten thousand spirits pay homage. They ascend to the Supreme Mysteries, their merits fulfilled and virtue complete, rising to the Upper Purity.

The Dao instructs: On days of practice, one must bathe in fragrant waters, fast in purity, enter the chamber facing east, and strike the teeth thirty-two times, ascending to the Thirty-Two Heavens. With thirty-two bows of the heart, eyes closed, one meditates upon sitting amid three-colored clouds—red, green, and yellow—inner and outer darkness enveloping them. A green dragon, white tiger, vermilion bird, dark tortoise, lion, and white crane array themselves on either side, while the Six Jia and Six Ding generals subdue demons, guarding front and rear. Sun and moon illuminate the chamber, a luminous halo forming at the nape, its radiance permeating the ten directions—thus, clearly manifest.

*"Supreme Primordial, the Most High Dao Lord, summon forth from my body the Thirty-Two Functionaries of the Three Five, the left and right officials, the attendants of fragrant jade boys, the messengers of jade women, the Five Emperors’ direct seals, the direct-day incense officials—thirty-two each—opening the way to what is spoken.*

*Today’s joyous occasion, a long fast in the pure hall. Practicing this sacred scripture, salvation without measure. May my petition ascend directly to the Supreme Thirty-Two Heavens, before the Most Venerable Primordial Emperor of the Beginning.*

*Concluded. Draw in the breath thirty-two times, rejoicing in the recitation.*

*The Primordial Scripture of Infinite Salvation, Upper Brand Mystic Treasure Original Chapter: Dispelling Plague, Preserving Life, Extending Years, Infinite Salvation.*

**Chapter 52: The Scripture of the Spiritually Precious Limitless Deliverance of Mortals**

**The Chapter of Mystic Brightness and Profound Abyss** speaks thus:

*"In days past, within the Violet Origin Heaven, the Verdant Landscape of the Empty Song of the Great Dawn’s Radiant Soil received the Limitless Deliverance of Mortals by the Mystic Brightness and Profound Abyss from the Primordial Origin. When the Primordial Origin Heavenly Venerable spoke this Scripture, circling tenfold through the heavens, he summoned the Ten Directions, and then ascended to the seat.*

*The Primordial True God, the Highest Sage and Venerable, the True Person of Wondrous Practice, the Five Spirits of Mystic Brightness and Profound Abyss, the Water Emperor of the Profound Abyss, the Dragon Kings of the Eight Directions and Nine Seas, the Profound Abyss officials and attendants of the Forty-Two Departments, and countless hosts without number—all rose through the void and came in procession. Flowing clouds and misty vapors formed the carriage of jade and darkness, the Mystic Brightness’s palanquin, the Violet Canopy’s divine wheels, descending beneath the Piercing Void, with streaming rainbows and precious lights, all hues swelling in brilliance, illuminating the vast expanse. For five days and five nights, the celestial suns, moons, and stars sank like shadows in the sea, their cords coiled around jade pivots, their pearly halos and celestial markings suspended in stillness, their wheels halted and their radiance fixed. The divine palaces stood tranquil, sacred peaks gathered clouds, the heavens floated in eight directions, and the qi cleared the Nine Wilds. All lands, mountains, rivers, forests, and trees in the realm flattened into uniformity, their soil bright as jade and crystal, their colors undifferentiated.*

*All the True Ones attended the seat, and the Primordial Origin Heavenly Venerable ascended to the floating jade-light seven-transformed Spirit Tortoise Throne of the Mystic Brightness and Profound Abyss. After one recitation of the Scripture, all the celestial assemblies simultaneously praised its excellence. At that time, all men and women of the realm turned in reverence to the Primordial Origin’s Law of Mystic Brightness and Profound Abyss, awakening to this life’s essence, first manifesting in pearly dew.*

*After two recitations, they believed and knew the True Water, its transformations infinite. After three recitations, they discerned its gentle luminosity, benefiting all things with subtle guidance. After four recitations, they pondered the generation of the divine palace, the first descent of the Profound Abyss’s qi, as the kidney essence refined and the spirit tortoise swam. After five recitations, the heart’s apertures expanded, the spirit tides moved with purpose, and the Mystic Brightness’s elixir dispersed, nourishing all the orifices. With focused observation and tranquil contemplation, they comprehended the wondrous, effortless Dao.*

*After six recitations, the celestial mist cleared and settled, its brightness dividing into spirits, each bearing my form within the Mystic Brightness. After seven recitations, the Profound Abyss fell still and serene, and the Dragon Spirits obeyed the teaching. After eight recitations, the sea clouds lifted the dew, and sweet nectar moistened life. After nine recitations, the water’s light blazed, revealing a thousand-layered palace within, where all the heavenly folk awakened to the Dao’s Law.*

*After ten recitations, the qi of Mystic Brightness transformed into violet clouds, covering all the heavens, manifesting the Effortless Sea. Its depths were boundless, its sweetness profound—all men and women of the realm, without exception, inclined their hearts in devotion, receiving protection and attaining eternal life.*

*The Dao speaks thus: When the Primordial Origin Heavenly Venerable had completed ten recitations, the Primordial True Gods of Mystic Brightness and Profound Abyss from the Ten Directions—East, South, West, North, Northeast, Southeast, Southwest, Northwest, Upper, and Lower—all, with countless hosts without number, arrived in the void simultaneously. All men and women of the realm bowed in reverence, their hearts turned upward.*

*They spoke in unison: ‘The Primordial Origin Heavenly Venerable has descended to this Violet Origin Heavenly Palace, bearing the Hundred Treasures, to reveal and exalt the Wondrous Five-Element True Water’s Law. Its virtue is called Mystic Brightness, its power called Profound Abyss. We have heard that Mystic Brightness is the True Water’s virtue—form and color both resplendent. Profound Abyss is the True Water’s power—depths fathomless, without bounds. Yet we know only the Five-Element Water we see: vast and flooding, its depths unmeasured. How can we grasp the formless Five-Element True Water, named Mystic Brightness and Profound Abyss?*

*Before Heaven and Earth were divided, there existed the True Soil. Soil could bind and contain the Ten Directions, above and below, and within it lay the True Water, limitless and boundless. Wind and breath stirred it, and it congealed into all things—this is the origin of life, the Great Dao itself. The Primordial Origin Heavenly Venerable today expounds the wondrous essence of the formless Five-Element True Qi. If we may hear it, we shall ourselves ascend to the divine realm above, all bowing in homage to the Heavenly Venerable, seeking his boundless compassion, receiving his supreme teachings, and thus declaring: With utmost respect, we bow twice.’*

*Then came those like fine rain and dense mist—countless hosts without number—causing half the realm’s soil to sink unevenly, an effect beyond restraint. Thus, the Primordial Origin suspended a precious pearl, as large as a millet grain, within the void above, five zhang from the earth. As he ascended, the Primordial True Gods, the Highest Sage and Venerable, the True Person of Wondrous Practice, the Five Spirits of Mystic Brightness and Profound Abyss, the Water Emperor, the Dragon Kings of the Eight Directions and Nine Seas, the Profound Abyss officials and countless attendants of the Forty-Two Departments, and all hosts without number—entered the precious pearl together."*

The celestial beings and mortals gazed upward, and lo, they saw a radiant surge entering the pearl’s mouth—once inside, its whereabouts became unknown. The populace dispersed, the land restored to evenness, no longer tilted or sunken.

Within the precious pearl, the Primordial Origin completed the teaching of the scripture. The assembled True Ones, having witnessed its transmission, bestowed it upon me. At that moment, joy and celebration were beyond words.

When the ritual was complete, the celestial hosts returned to their stations. In an instant, all sound ceased, leaving profound silence.

At that time, those who encountered the scripture and its teachings were universally saved and delivered, their lives preserved without harm. The land’s people turned in reverence, their conduct pure and clear.

The wondrous spirit’s wise heart flowed like water, its benefits boundless. Illumination was unified and harmonious—illumination penetrating, illumination enlightening, illumination wise and discerning, illumination profound and empty. The heart held no obstruction, silently attuned to the ineffable.

Together, they ascended the boundless void, deeply grasping the utmost truth. The realm was secure, the people at peace, in boundless ease and tranquility. The scripture’s teachings first emerged, and the land was governed by the Way.

Those with sincere devotion, who revered and followed with ritual, all attained the power to deliver beings.

The Way declares: All names spoken by the Primordial Heavenly Venerable within the scripture are the hidden, resonant names of the celestial deities. They are also the inner taboos of the True Kings, the concealed names of the myriad spirits. Their transformations are formless.

True Water, the law of Profound Brightness and Abyssal Depth—Profound Brightness being the nature of water, Abyssal Depth its dwelling. Flowing, it becomes wisdom; still, it becomes insight. Flowing, it penetrates; still, it illuminates. If you embody it, you naturally attain the Way.

Heaven and Earth generate True Water through stillness; all beings move through True Water’s stillness. Dryness and heat are fire; stillness and cold are water. Dryness conquers cold, stillness conquers heat—this is the generation of True Water. If you remain tranquil, True Water moves of its own accord, and transformations arise daily. Stillness is the primal essence; stillness brings longevity. These are not the common words of the world.

The Highest Sage, having already become a True Person, penetrated the profound and fathomed the subtle, mastering its chapters. When recited ten times, the celestial hosts sing in response from afar, the myriad emperors offer rites, the rivers and seas fall silent, and the currents of the abyss flow freely. The revolving spheres cease motion, the host of demons are bound, the spirits of ghosts vanish, the dead rise, and white bones become flesh.

For those of supreme learning, reciting it ten times summons the Five Emperors as guards, the Three Realms bow in homage, the demonic essences lose their power, the ghostly spirits perish, and those on the brink of death are saved, passing from death to life.

Yet even so, scholars whose impure *qi* has not yet dissipated, whose bodies have not penetrated the True, may summon and restrain the Ten Directions, but their authority does not extend to governing celestial law. Their virtue can subdue the earthly spirits, bind the demonic souls—but only to repel death, not to restore life. To recite this chapter lightly invites calamity upon oneself.

To honor and venerate it brings prosperity to one’s household, generation after generation, flourishing and radiant. With virtuous connections, a thousand disasters cannot approach, and the divine protects the gate.

This scripture is supremely wondrous, unmatched in the Jade Capital, delivering countless beings and serving as the root of ten thousand teachings. Its grandeur is vast, its virtue beyond measure.

The Way declares: For those who recite this scripture ten times, all celestial hosts gather, the Water Emperors speak in order, the springs and streams bend in mercy, the dark gates of the underworld open, and the myriad ancestors—even those in torment—are all delivered, ascending to the Vermilion Palace. Their term is fixed at nine years, after which they are reborn through transformation, becoming noble beings.

Those who study this scripture with devotion, their merits complete and virtue fulfilled, all attain immortality, ascending the Golden Pass and feasting in the Jade Capital.

For scholars who practice it, True Water ascends in response, nourishing the five viscera, entering the *dantian*, where the numinous frost and purple ice form—all are delivered, ascending to the Southern Palace.

For mortals who recite it, the Abyssal Spirit surges forth, the divine springs encircle the eight directions, strengthening the body and extending life, all eventually attaining the method of *tianxia* (body dissolution). Their spirits, though momentarily extinguished, avoid the underworld and return to form, wandering the boundless void.

This scripture’s subtlety is profound, its deliverance boundless. All celestial and mortal beings receive its blessings. Infinite merit spans life and death, a treasure of Heaven, not passed down to the world below.

Only those who bring gold and jade with sincere devotion, swearing by Heaven to transmit it, may do so. To leak or neglect it lightly invites retribution upon nine generations, eternal servitude in the underworld.

The Five Emperors and sixty-four玉童玉女 (*Yuting* and *Yunü*—celestial youth and maidens) attend the scripture, their divine files guarding those who receive it.

The Way declares: On the first month’s long fast, reciting and chanting this scripture brings nine transformations and three True Ones, its blessings reaching the Nine Springs, delivering the souls of past ages, severing their bonds of torment, and guiding them to the Southern Palace.

On the seventh month’s long fast, reciting and chanting this scripture causes True Water to emerge from the womb, the Way bestowing eternal life, the body attaining immortality, and the celestial hosts recording their names on yellow and white tablets, erasing death and granting rebirth.

On the tenth month’s long fast, reciting and chanting this scripture restores one to their original source, their merit returning to the Supreme Void, gathering and governing the pure *qi*, commanding the High Immortals, benefiting kings and emperors, their ministers, parents, and children—securing the nation’s fate, preserving Heaven’s longevity, ensuring their lineage never ends, and perpetually governing their domain in eternal peace.

On the eight seasonal festivals, reciting and chanting this scripture causes the divine springs to flow, the Jade Pass to surge, and one to become a True Person of the Nine Palaces.

On one’s birth-day, reciting and chanting this scripture clarifies True Water, illuminating the body and spirit within, entering purple and emerging yellow, nurturing the five viscera’s essences, purifying the soul and spirit, preserving the ten thousand *qi*, avoiding suffering, the body radiating light, the Three Realms attending in procession, the Five Emperors leading the welcome, all spirits paying homage, their names inscribed in Heaven. When merit is complete and the path fulfilled, they ascend to the Upper Clarity.
