The Great Brahman in the Heavens conceals the boundless sounds—
the Dao Sovereign composed *Yúshǔ Běiquē Wǔlíng Chánglóu* (元始靈寶北闕五靈長樓之上), the *Yuan Shǐ Shèngshū* (元始聖書) expounding the *Yōutáng Dòngpiān* (幽牢洞篇).

It spans **Lìfú Yúhéng** (歷阜舆衡), **Mó Mín Yuèlín** (謟民越琳),
**Dì Chí Yuǎnfú** (迮池宛敷), **Guǒ Jī Jùlán** (果箕拒蓝).
It reaches **Cuī Bō Yúnduǒ** (崔波雲陁), **Móyí Lùbīn** (魔夷鹿彬).
It descends to **Dī Wú Yànjiā** (滴無彦嘉), **Míng Wēi Núxián** (明微奴衔).
At **Zhì Chén Yàolú** (至陳耀廬), the **Xiānxī** (仙期) of **Ātán** (阿昙) shines.
At **Jiàn Dǎo Yùtí** (劍島玉提), **Móqī** (魔栖) dwells in **Luódūn** (珞敦).
The **Guīxīng Gāofáng** (鬼星皋房) awakens, **juétǐ yùnyuán** (覺體運元).
**Shànmǐn Lǜhuá** (善悯綠華) and **Dìsī Pīnán** (敵司毗南) take pity.
Within the **Bāzì Dàizōng Jìn sī** (八字岱宗禁司), the **Nánfāng Bātiān** (南方八天) open vast and radiant skies—
far-reaching **Cháoxū Chàngzhì** (霄虚敞炽), all guests of **Yuǎnshì** (遠釋).
They clear **Jiūchú Gāngníng** (墟除岡寧), **Yǎnnán Zhùchéng** (偃南俎澄).
The **Yuèdòu Luóqí** (月斗羅稽) and **Mènghūn Zhìróng** (孟昏祉榮) bring blessings.
**Liáohù Jǐngguī** (寥扈景瑰) and **Zǐwēi Húlíng** (紫微胡凌) shine.
At **Bōtuó Tái Ā** (波陀台阿), **Zhàozǔ Qǔzhēng** (照祖曲徵) illuminates.
**Mìngyán Zuǒwú** (命延佐芜) and **Lùbǎi Zhìlún** (路百祠輪) extend life.
The Dao is established at **Yúzhǔ** (虞渚), **Lìzhèng Fúqióng** (歷正孚琼) is verified.
**Zhào Yáo Bólán** (兆堯柏嵐) gathers, **Dòngqīng Còuyíng** (洞清凑營).

The **Xīfāng Bātiān** (西方八天) chant for liberation—
**Zòudù Qiúyí** (奏度球疑), **Chōngpéng Liánqī** (沖朋聯栖).
These **Bāzì** (八字) are the **Jiǔyōu Dàyī Hào** (九幽大一號).

**Mí Lú Sūchū** (迷盧蘇攴) and **Jìjī Qúshī** (寂幾渠施) are veiled.
**Wénmò Gǔyáo** (汶漠囗镢) and **Shéndòu Yùyí** (神斗玉儀) battle.
**Guānmóu Héjī** (觀侔合積) and **Xūchí Mǐlí** (嘘持米離) gather.
**Xuānfāng Bìluó** (玄方碧羅) and **Yángzhì Huāngshí** (陽志荒時) emerge.
**Qījué Yáozǔ** (七覺遙祖) and **Juǎnbū Suǒduì** (卷逋索逵) awaken.
**Xiáfú Guǎnjī** (霞敷管姬) and **Jǐngyù Duóyuán** (景育度元) flourish.
**Hùnjī Yāngbì** (混幾央畢) and **Gǔlóng Zé Gē** (鼓龍澤歌) resonate.
**Tādīng Bànfēi** (他墀半飛) and **Lóngxiào Yóuyī** (龍皛由嵋) ascend.
Within the **Bāzì Hēngchéng Guānhuì** (八字酆城官讳), the **Běifāng Bātiān** (北方八天) unfold:

**Yùxī Luànjī** (玉蹊亂基), **Rìyuān Mèngchí** (日渊孟池).
**Pǔzài Yuànliè** (溥載願列), **Pōhuāng Yuáncí** (坡荒元祠).
**Jiàngdòng Miàobì** (絳洞妙弼), **Qiūmù Yùnfēi** (丘目蕴飛).
**Dìngmáng Hùnzhú** (定芒混逐), **Kūnqí Jiànméng** (坤齐建蒙).
**Jīchān Guǐbǐ** (激馘鬼鄙), **Yānyíng Fāngchóu** (烟营方仇).
**Mǎochù Jìmíng** (卯畜既明), **Púláng Hǎn Tóu** (菩郎罕投).
**Yōugē Hánwā** (幽歌寒呱), **Lièfán Mèngyóu** (烈燔夢游).
**Jǐdàn Yuèzhī** (戟旦悅支), **Xiāndū Xiázhōu** (仙都霞周).

Within the **Bāzì Xuānlǎo Nèimíng** (八字玄老內名).

The Dao speaks: These hidden words of the Great Brahman in the Heavens,
the boundless sounds.
The ancient scriptures were inscribed on the **Tàixuān Běiquē Wǔlíng Chánglóu** (太玄北闕五靈長樓),
to open the **Jìu Tàishān** (九泰山) and the **Jiǔyōu** (九幽),
to arrange the **Lúohēng Quānlù** (羅酆泉曲),
to liberate the suffering souls trapped in **Míngguān Lěikǔ** (冥關累苦),
bound to the **Sānguān** (三官), unable to enlighten themselves,
wandering the **Xuánkōng** (玄空).

The **Dānshū** (丹書) is raised to rescue the fallen.
In ancient times, the **Tiānzhēn Huángrén** (天真皇人) visited the **Yèguāng Yuánhòu** (夜光元后),
imitating the scriptures, each character broad and long—
one *zhàng* (丈) in width, with eight angles and drooping beams,
like a seal’s impression, the **Jiǔliù Zhīhuì** (九六之會) as the true sound.
Those who know this sound and can fast and recite it,
all Heavens send **Fēitiān Shénwáng** (飛天神王),
descending to observe their bodies,
recording their merits and efforts,
reporting to the Heavens and the **Wànshén** (萬神),
who gather in courtly homage,
while the **Dìqí** (地祇) attend at the gates.
The **Dàmó Wáng** (大勳魔王) recommends them to the **Shàngzhēn** (上真).
When the Dao is complete, they roam the **Sānjiè** (三界),
ascending to the **Jīnmén** (金門).

This sound cleaves all obstacles,
dispels all calamities,
liberates all beings,
fulfills all desires—
the natural sound of **Tiānzhēn** (天真).
Thus, reciting it brings release from **Dìyù** (地獄),
long nights turned to dawn,
the **Yōutáng Yīnjiè** (幽牢陰界) free from suffering,
ascending to life.
Mortals find peace,
ghosts escape torment,
the **Bǐgōng** (碧宮) is covered with mist,
the **Dānlíng** (丹陵) glows with light,
calming the seas and mountains,
blessing all living beings,
Heaven bestows **Cǎiyào** (彩耀),
Earth surges with **Yùyīng** (玉英).
The **Mínghuì** (冥慧) is revealed,
the **Dàliàng Xuānxuān** (大量玄玄) is profound.

Thus ends the *Língbǎo Wúliàng Dùrén Shàngpǐn Miàojīng* (靈寶無量度人上品妙經), the **57th scroll**.
The **58th scroll** follows.

「The *Returning Life and Reviving the Dead* Chapter

The **Dao** speaks: In days of old, within the **Zǐkōng Yàojǐng Tiān** (紫空耀景天), the **Xuánfēng** (玄风) pierced through with the **Mìhǎo** (妙行) of the **Dàlíng Miàotǔ** (大灵妙土), where the **Yuánshǐ** (元始) **Tianzūn** (天尊) taught the **Wúliàng Huíshēng Qǐsǐ** (无量度人回生起死) **Dàshàngpǐn** (上品) **Miàojīng** (妙经).

The **Yuánshǐ Tianzūn** (元始天尊), when delivering this **sutra**, circled ten times through the **Ten Transgressions** (十过), summoning the **Ten Directions** (十方), before taking his seat.

The **Tiānzhēn Dàshén** (天真大神), the **Shàngshèng Gāozūn** (上圣高尊), the **Mìoxíng Zhēnrén** (妙行真人), with their **Wúyàng** (无鞅) retinues, rode upon the wind and arrived.

Their **Línghuī** (灵辉) radiance illuminated the void,
with **Qióngchē Yùyú** (琼车玉舆) and **Fúhuá Chénbì** (扶华宸盖),
four **Yúnjīng** (云旌) banners unfurled,
**Ruìǎi** (瑞霭) mists interwoven,
eight **Míluó** (弥罗) coils of light,
for five days and five nights,
all **tians** (天) and **dis** (地),
the interplay of **yīn** (阴) and **yáng** (阳) forces,
all ceased their motion at once.
The **Xuán Gāng** (玄纲) was shaken with solemnity,
the seas and mountains grew clear,
all things flourished in harmony,
and life was universally pacified.
In one land, earth, mountains, rivers, forests, and trees
all became **Níngxiān** (凝鲜) of the highest grade,
with no more decay or destruction—
the soil itself bore strange treasures,
shimmering and resplendent.

The **Zhēnshén** (众真) gathered around him,
as the **Yuánshǐ Tianzūn** (元始天尊) sat upon his **Xuánzuò Kòngfú Wànqì Yùnhuá Bǎozuò** (玄坐空浮万气云华宝座).

After one recitation of the **sutra**,
the **Dàshèng** (大圣) of all **tians** (天) simultaneously praised its virtue.
At that moment, all men and women of the land
no longer suffered calamities or untimely deaths.

After two recitations,
all **zāibìng** (灾病, afflictions and illnesses) were dispelled.

After three recitations,
the **Wēng’ài** (翁艾, aged and decrepit) returned to infancy.

After four recitations,
those at death’s door were revived,
their **shòu** (寿, lifespan) extended eternally.

After five recitations,
those condemned to the **lúnzhuǎn** (轮转, cycles of rebirth) were granted liberation.

After six recitations,
those undergoing **Chénshī Jiǔliàn** (沈尸九炼, nine trials of the corpse), their **yīnzhì** (阴质, vital essence of the dead) revived.

After seven recitations,
they were transformed by the **Tàixuán** (太玄, Great Mysterious),
their **gūgǔ** (枯骨, dried bones) regaining form.

After eight recitations,
all beings in the world awakened to clarity,
their **dàoxìng** (道性, inherent Dao-nature) restored to its original purity,
holding **virtue/power** (德) in high esteem and **zhèng** (正, rectitude) as precious,
severing all **jiānxié** (奸邪, deceit and malice).

After nine recitations,
those who sought the **Dao** attained it,
those who sought **xiān** (仙, immortality) became **xiān**.

After ten recitations,
the **miàoqì** (妙气, wondrous qi) was complete,
mixing with **shénmíng** (神明, divine luminosity).
At that time, all men and women of the land
tilted their hearts in reverence,
all receiving protection and deliverance,
universally attaining longevity.

The **Dao** speaks: When the **Yuánshǐ Tianzūn** (元始天尊) delivered the **sutra** once,
the **Wújié Wúliàng** (无极无量) **Dàshén** (大神) of the **East—Huíshēng** (回生, Reviving Life)—
with his **Wúyàng** retinue, floated through the void and arrived.

When delivered twice,
the **Wújié Wúliàng** **Míngxìng** (明性, Illuminating Nature) **Dàshén** of the **South**
with his **Wúyàng** retinue, floated through the void and arrived.

When delivered thrice,
the **Wújié Wúliàng** **Jiégài** (结气, Binding Vital Essence) **Dàshén** of the **West**
with his **Wúyàng** retinue, floated through the void and arrived.

When delivered four times,
the **Wújié Wúliàng** **Kāihuì** (开慧, Opening Wisdom) **Dàshén** of the **North**
with his **Wúyàng** retinue, floated through the void and arrived.

When delivered five times,
the **Wújié Wúliàng** **Shēnghún** (生魂, Reviving Spirit) **Dàshén** of the **East-North**
with his **Wúyàng** retinue, floated through the void and arrived.

When delivered six times,
the **Wújié Wúliàng** **Yùxíng** (育形, Nurturing Form) **Dàshén** of the **East-South**
with his **Wúyàng** retinue, floated through the void and arrived.

When delivered seven times,
the **Wújié Wúliàng** **Bǎomìng** (保命, Preserving Life) **Dàshén** of the **West-South**
with his **Wúyàng** retinue, floated through the void and arrived.

When delivered eight times,
the **Wújié Wúliàng** **Yányuán** (延年, Extending Years) **Dàshén** of the **West-North**
with his **Wúyàng** retinue, floated through the void and arrived.

When delivered nine times,
the **Wújié Wúliàng** **Huíshēng** (回生, Returning Life) **Dàshén** of the **Upper Realm**
with his **Wúyàng** retinue, floated through the void and arrived.

When delivered ten times,
the **Wújié Wúliàng** **Qǐsǐ** (起死, Reviving the Dead) **Dàshén** of the **Lower Realm**
with his **Wúyàng** retinue, floated through the void and arrived.

After ten recitations, the **Wújié Tiānzhēn Dàshén** (无极天真大神) of the **Ten Directions** all arrived together,
and all men and women of the land
tilted their hearts in homage.

All who had fallen into **lúnhuà Chénmíng Shīguò** (沦化沈冥尸过, the depths of transmigration and death),
were covered by the **Dao**’s grace,
their **shēngqì** (生气, life-giving qi) entering their bodies,
and though dead, their forms returned.

Those who came were like mountains rising from clouds,
filling all four directions, their **Wúyàng** retinues
so vast that half the land was submerged—
an unstoppable tide.

Thus, the **Yuánshǐ** (元始) opened the **Qībǎo Shān** (七宝山, Seven Treasures Mountain),
unveiled the **Wúbiān Mù** (无边目, Boundless Vision),
adjusting robes and gathering his attendants,
he focused his gaze and contemplated the distant,
then addressed the **Zhōngzhēn** (众真):

*"All beings are lost in delusion,
unaware of the **Xuánzhēn** (玄真, Mysterious Reality).
Once they leave the womb,
their passions follow the transformations of **huà** (化, transmigration).
By their **yuánlèi** (缘类, karmic affinities),
they generate **yèyīn** (业因, karmic causes),
and these **yèlěi** (业累, karmic accumulations) corrupt their nature,
enslaved by perception, they become foolish.
Strife of gain and loss assails them,
passions and desires sway their minds—
from childhood, they reach maturity,
and in the blink of an eye,
they grow old.
Their **jiāoláo** (焦牢, vital essence) is exhausted,
their **shēngqì** (生气) spent,
until they perish in decay.

Yet they do not know
that the **Dao** is the **virtue/power** (生德) of life,
and life is the root of the **Dao**.
If one’s heart abides in the **Dao**,
it remains with life forever.
All things have birth and death,
but the **Dao** has neither.
If one preserves the **Dao** in form,
the **shēngqì** (生气) will naturally endure.
When the body’s count is exhausted,
the **Dao** can revive it again.
With life and **Dao** thus established,
they do not follow **huà** (化, transmigration),
preserving form without decay,
enduring forever in unbroken continuity,
returning life and transcending death—
a feat the **Shàngzhēn** (上真) hold in highest veneration.

Now, for all of you,
I reveal this **miàoběn** (妙本, wondrous source),
universally delivering the boundless.

At that time, the **Yuánshǐ** (元始) raised his **Huáfú** (华拂, divine banner),
and **Jǐngwù** (景雾, luminous mists) billowed in all four directions,
like clouds and smoke,
floating in the void—
nine *zhàng* (丈) above the earth.

The **Yuánshǐ** (元始) gathered all,
the **Tiānzhēn Dàshén** (天真大神),
the **Shàngshèng Gāozūn** (上圣高尊),
the **Mìoxíng Zhēnrén** (妙行真人),
and the **Wújié Zhēnshén** (无极至真大神) of the **Ten Directions**,
all their **Wúyàng** retinues,
now all stood within the **Jǐngwù** (景雾).

The earth returned to its level state,
no longer tilted or sunken.

The **Yuánshǐ** (元始) then, upon the **Jǐngwù** (景雾),
completed his delivery of the **sutra**.
The **Zhōngzhēn** (众真) bore witness to its transmission,
and bestowed it upon me.
At that moment, my joy was indescribable.

The **fǎshì** (法事, ritual matters) were roughly understood,
the **tians** (天) returned to their places,
and in an instant,
all traces of sound vanished into silence.

At that time, all **tiānrén** (天人, heavenly and mortal beings)
who encountered this **jīngfǎ** (经法, sutra-teaching)
universally received deliverance,
eternally nurturing the root of life,
with none falling into ruin.
All lands turned in reverence,
all walked in **dàoxīn** (道心, Dao-heart).

They neither competed nor disturbed,
neither toiled nor labored,
neither schemed nor desired,
neither coveted nor grew angry,
neither schemed nor pondered.

Their words were without embellishment,
their mouths without grievance,
all shared the same **cí’ài** (慈爱, compassionate love),
and though of different **gǔ** (骨, essences),
they became kin.

The land was secure, its people prosperous,
rejoicing in eternal peace.
The **sutra** began its teachings,
and the land was governed by the **Dao**.」

The **Dao** speaks: With sincere devotion and reverence in worship, all attain the power to save the world.

The **Dao**’s words: What the **Yuánshǐ Tiānzūn** (元始天尊, Primordial Celestial Venerable) spoke within the **sutra**—all are the inner names of the **zhūtiān Dàdì** (诸天上帝, celestial sovereigns)—hidden, resonant sounds. They are also the **zhēnwáng** (真王, True Sovereign’s) secret names for reviving the dead and restoring life, the hidden names of the hundred spirits. These are not the common words of the world.

The **shàngshèng** (上圣, Supreme Sage), having already become a **zhēnrén** (真人, True Person), mastering the **Xuán** (玄, Mysterious) and probing the subtle, can fully comprehend its chapters.

When recited ten times, the celestial beings gather **qi**, all **dào** (道, Ways) align in truth, spiritual transformations unfold, and all receive the **Xuán**’s grace. The **shēngjīn** (生津, life-giving essence) eternally flows, the **pò** (魄, vital force) is summoned, the **hún** (魂, soul) collected. The decayed and lifeless are reborn, returning to their **shīxíng** (尸形, corporeal form), revived and restored to life—even bones become flesh.

For those of **zhìxué** (至学, supreme learning), reciting it ten times summons the **wǔdì** (五帝, Five Emperors’) sacred spirits, the **sān yuán** (三元, Three Primordials) decree truth, and the **língzhēn** (灵真, numinous truths) descend in harmony. The **sǐdào** (死道, path of death) collapses, and those at death’s door are rescued, returning from the brink of extinction.

This is so because the scholar’s **dàoqì** (道气, Dao-qi) is not yet pure, their body not yet attuned to truth. Though they command the **wànshén** (万神, myriad spirits) and their **dé** (德, virtue/power) is not yet complete, they can yet turn the wheel of fate, unlock the **shēngjīn**, and merely revive the dead—without further transformation.

To recite this chapter lightly invites calamity upon oneself.

To venerate and honor the **sutra** brings prosperity to one’s gates, flourishing through generations. Bound to virtuous causes, one escapes all calamities, with divine guardians protecting the door.

This **sutra** is supreme and wondrous, unmatched in the **Yùjīng** (玉京, Jade Capital). It saves innumerable beings and is the foundation of the **shēngdào** (生道, Way of Life).

Its grandeur is vast and boundless; its **dé** (德, virtue/power) is immeasurable.

The **Dao** speaks: For those who recite this **sutra** ten times, all celestial beings gather, the **shēngdào** (Way of Life) is illuminated, and rebirth is perfected. Countless generations of ancestors, their suffering souls released, all receive salvation, ascending to the **Zhūgōng** (朱宫, Vermilion Palace). After nine years of transformation, they are reborn, becoming **zhēnxiān** (真仙, True Immortals).

Those who earnestly study this **sutra**, their merits fulfilled and virtue complete, shall ascend in body, soaring to the **Jīnquè** (金阙, Golden Gate) and feasting in the **Yùjīng**.

Scholars of the highest learning, practicing and reciting this **sutra**, shall immediately be saved and ascend to the **Nángōng** (南宫, Southern Palace).

Mortals who recite it shall prolong their years, enduring without end. Even as their **yùnshù** (运数, fateful allotment) reaches its limit, they shall attain the **jiěhuà** (解化, Way of Liberation and Transformation). Their divine essence shall not perish, ever preserved in splendor, wandering freely through the **shí tiān** (十天, Ten Heavens).

This **sutra** is subtle and wondrous, saving all without end. All heavenly and mortal beings rejoice in its blessings. Infinite blessings bestow life and death with grace.

It is the treasure of the **shàngtiān** (上天, Highest Heaven), not to be passed down to the world below. Only the **zhìshì** (至士, supreme scholars), bearing gold and jewels with sincere hearts, may pledge allegiance to the **Shénxiāo** (神霄, Divine Exaltation) and transmit it. To leak or neglect it lightly invites retribution upon nine generations, binding one to eternal service in the **guǐguān** (鬼官, spectral bureaucracy).

The **sutra** is attended by the **wǔdì** (五帝, Five Emperors), each with twenty-four **yùtóng yùnǚ** (玉童玉女, Jade Boys and Girls), guarding the sacred scriptures and protecting those who receive the **sutra**.

The **Dao** speaks: In the first month, observe a long fast and recite this **sutra** to avert the calamity of decline, decay, death, and the **jímèi** (极会, ultimate gathering of misfortune), ensuring survival.

In the seventh month, observe a long fast and recite this **sutra** to preserve **shénqì** (神气, divine qi), dispelling disasters and misfortunes. One’s name shall be inscribed on the **qīngshù** (青箓, Blue Talisman), and eternal life shall be granted.

In the tenth month, observe a long fast and recite this **sutra** to protect all under heaven, saving the people and creatures. **Rénshòu** (仁寿, benevolent longevity) shall be attained, aligning with Heaven without deviation. Through generations, prosperity shall flourish, and the sovereign shall be revered. The nation’s fate shall be secure, and the **wànjié** (万劫, ten thousand kalpas) shall be one of eternal peace.

On the **bājié** (八节, Eight Festivals), recite this **sutra** to harmonize **zàohuà** (造化, creation and transformation). The **jīnmù** (金木, Metal and Wood) shall align, **shénqì** (divine qi) shall unite, nurturing the **huánglíng** (皇灵, sovereign spirit). The withered shall revive, and through its refining power, one shall attain **xiānzhēn** (仙真, Immortal Truth).

On one’s **běnmìng** (本命, birth-day), recite this **sutra** to preserve **qīngzhēn** (清贞, purity and integrity), renewing body and essence daily. Calamities shall vanish, and one shall long enjoy blessings. The **tiāncháo** (天曹, Heavenly Bureau) shall record virtues, the **dìshì** (地司, Earthly Officials) shall erase sins, and seven generations shall rejoice. One’s name shall be inscribed on the **sān tiān** (三天, Three Heavens), and with merits fulfilled and virtue complete, one shall ascend to **Shàngqīng** (上清, High Purity).

The **Dao** speaks: On days of practice, one must bathe in fragrant waters, fast in purity, enter the chamber facing east, and strike the teeth **sānshíèr tōng** (三十二通, thirty-two times) to ascend to the **sānshíèr tiān** (三十二天, Thirty-two Heavens). With the heart, bow thirty-two times.

Close the eyes and meditate silently, imagining oneself seated within the **qīnghuángbái** (青黄白, Azure, Yellow, and White) clouds. Within and without, all is profound darkness, where the **qīnglóng** (青龙, Azure Dragon), **báihǔ** (白虎, White Tiger), **zhūquè** (朱雀, Vermilion Bird), **Xuánwǔ** (玄武, Dark Warrior), **shīzǐ** (狮子, Lion), and **báihè** (白鹤, White Crane) array themselves on either side. The sun and moon illuminate, their radiance filling the chamber. The **huíshēng qǐsǐ** (回生起死, revival of life and resurrection of the dead) **Xuánhuà Dàshén** (玄化大神, Great Divine Transformation) stand guard before and behind, their **xiàngshēng yuánxiàng** (项生圆象, circular halos) casting light in all ten directions—thus, clearly manifest.

The secret incantation:

*"Wúshàng Xuányuán, Tàishàng Dàojūn,*
*Chāochū chénshēn zhōng sānwǔ gōngcáo,*
*zuǒyòu guānshǐzhě, shì xiāng yùtóng, chuányán yùnǚ,*
*wǔdì zhífú, zhídì xiāngguān, gè sānshíèr rén,*
*guānqǐ suǒyán.*
*Jīnrì jílè, chángzhāi qīngtáng.*
*Xiūxíng zhìjīng, wúliàng dùrén.*
*Yuàn suǒ qǐ shàngchè, jìng yù wúshàng sānshíèr tiān Yuánshǐ Dàdì Zhìzūn jī qián.*
*Bì, yǐn qì sānshíèr guò, dōngxiàng sòngjīng.*

**Yuánshǐ Wúliàng Dùrén Shàngpǐn Miàojīng**
**Yuánshǐ Dòngxuán Língbǎo Běnzhāng, Huíshēng Qǐsǐ, Wànbiàn Dùrén.**
*Zhēnwáng yǐnyùn, hùnhé zìrán,*
*Yùxū miàowén, zǒngkuò zhìshén.*
*Yuánshǐ zhī chū, dònghuà Xuányuán,*
*zhào míng sānqì, shēngyù wànlíng.*
*Zhī wéi Dàoběn, wúsuǒ bùzhēn,*
*Yīnyáng zǒnghuì, Yùhuá huànzhāng.*
*Wúwén bùguāng, wúwén bùmíng,*
*wúwén bùlì, wúwén bùchéng,*
*wúwén bùdù, wúwén bùshēng.*
*Zhī wéi Dàfàn, miàocuì zhī zōng.*
*Zǐqīng Shàngjīng, qióngshì yúnfáng.*
*Jízhēn suǒyù, shēnghuà zhī gēn.*
*Hàohào dìqì, huò jù huò fēn.*
*Zhūlíng Dāntiān, yáotái lángfēng.*
*Yùchén zǐguǎn, fāngzhū yùqīng."*

Permeating and flowing boundlessly, encircling the ten directions.

Within are gods who measure life and revive the dead,
Within are sovereigns who restore life and transform essence,
Within are the Three Primordial Sovereigns of Great Spirit,
Within are the Ten-Directional Imperial Spirits of Venerable Elders,
Within are the Southern Celestial Registrar of Life and Death, the Lord of Extending Longevity and Augmenting Fate, the Venerable Gods Who Measure and Mitigate Calamities.

Reviving the dead, measuring countless souls.

Today, the Celestial Assembly convenes—
All the heavens gather at the hallowed court.

**The Ten-Directional Sovereign Gods of Boundless Measure:**

The Eastern Sovereign God of Boundless Measure and Command of Life—
The Great Immortal Sage of Endless Measure.

The Southern Sovereign God of Boundless Soul-Refinement—
The Great Immortal Sage of Endless Measure.

The Western Sovereign God of Boundless Vitality—
The Great Immortal Sage of Endless Measure.

The Northern Sovereign God of Boundless Transformation—
The Great Immortal Sage of Endless Measure.

The Northeast Sovereign God of Boundless Ascension—
The Great Immortal Sage of Endless Measure.

The Southeast Sovereign God of Boundless Precious Qi—
The Great Immortal Sage of Endless Measure.

The Southwest Sovereign God of Boundless Revival—
The Great Immortal Sage of Endless Measure.

The Northwest Sovereign God of Boundless Resurrection—
The Great Immortal Sage of Endless Measure.

The Upper Sovereign God of Boundless Form-Transcendence—
The Great Immortal Sage of Endless Measure.

The Lower Sovereign God of Boundless Virtue-Completion—
The Great Immortal Sage of Endless Measure.

The Ten-Directional Most Authentic Flying-Heaven Sovereign Gods—
The Boundless Great Gods of Revival and Resurrection.

Together they ride upon effulgent Brahmanic qi,
Golden palaces and purple emerald halls,
Flowing with radiant clouds and scattered blossoms,
Jade chariots scattering flowers,
Eight-winged feathered carriages,
Crimson banners and brocade curtains,
Haloed wheels and pearl canopies,
Drawn by dragons and phoenixes,
Bearing ceremonial umbrellas and flags,
Before them, the Celestial Maidens sing in harmony,
Behind them, the reed pipes and flutes resound in unison,
Lions and white cranes chant in melodious tones,
Six True Ones lead the way, Four Generals guard the wheels,
Ten thousand chariots and myriad cavalry float through the void,
Their radiance sweeping back—reviving the dead, restoring life.

The Celestial Minister of Fate,
The Southern Palace of Nánchāng,
Kān the Chief Registrar,
The Supervising Gods of Birth,
Holding talismans and registers,
All assembled before the Emperor.

According to their destined measure,
Severely inspecting the heavens.
Proclaiming to the Three Realms,
The Boundless Divine Realm,
The Bureau of Springs and Valleys,
The Northern Capital of Luòchéng,
The Three Officials and Nine Ministries,
The Twelve River Sources.

Swiftly summoning the Registrar of Fate,
Restoring life to those who have perished,
Extending years to those whose fate is exhausted,
Changing decrees for those whose form has died,
Altering surnames and given names,
Burning black registers to ash.

Ascending to absolve ancestral sins,
Countless eons of karmic kin,
Swiftly erasing the ledger of offenses,
Extinguishing roots of evil,
Preventing imprisonment, severing ties with ghostly hosts.

By the Primordial Decree, ascension is ordained at the appointed hour.
In the Northern Capital’s Cold Pool,
Guarding forms and spirits.
Subduing demons, elevating worth,
Measuring souls in the Southern Palace.
Dead spirits undergo refinement,
Transformed into immortals, becoming human.
Living bodies receive measure,
Enduring through countless eons.
With the eon-wheel turning, they align with the heavens’ years.
Forever measuring the Three Paths,
Five Torments and Eight Hardships,
Transcending the Three Realms,
Adrift in Upper Clarity.

**The Upper Clarity Heaven, the Heavenly Emperor’s Cavern of Perfected Truth, the Realm of Formless Brahmanic Practice.**

**The Eight Eastern Heavens:**
The Heaven of Piercing Silence and Tranquil Stillness—
The Emperor, Radiant and Illuminating.
The Heaven of Enduring Prosperity and Auspiciousness—
The Emperor, Adorned with Jade and Pearl.
The Heaven of Bright Virtue and Han’s Virtuous Crossing—
The Emperor, Exalted and Graced.
The Heaven of Prosperous Governance and Precise Measurement—
The Emperor, Rectifying with Nine Diagrams.
The Heaven of Sudden Illumination and Daytime Void—
The Emperor, Attaining Swiftness and Manifesting.
The Heaven of Harmonious Fields and Auspicious Fortune—
The Emperor, Awakening Dragons and Swallows.
The Heaven of Complete Remoteness and Thoughtless Tranquility—
The Emperor, Contending with Mighty Stars.
The Heaven of Elevated Clarity and Skillful Arts—
The Emperor, Commanding Fate and Decrees.

**The Eight Southern Heavens:**
The Heaven of the Horn and Thousand Fires—
The Emperor, Resplendent and Illustrious.
The Heaven of Piercing Depth and Vast Yang—
The Emperor, Harmonizing and Radiant.
The Heaven of Ascending Dragons and Achieving Success—
The Emperor, Ornate and Exemplary.
The Heaven of Refined Extremes and Carved Auspiciousness—
The Emperor, Praising and Upholding.
The Heaven of Towering Chambers and Weighty Light—
The Emperor, Stabilizing with Benevolent Ascension.
The Heaven of Rectifying Virtue and Celestial Transformation—
The Emperor, Distant and Cloud-Adorned.
The Heaven of Empty Mysticism and Encompassing Vastness—
The Emperor, Assisting with Serene Stability.
The Heaven of Fragrant Isles and Condensed Perfume—
The Emperor, Wondrous and Nurturing.

**The Eight Western Heavens:**
The Heaven of Precious Harmony and Ordered Rites—
The Emperor, Distant and Commanding the Capital.
The Heaven of Dao’s Foundation and Departmental Needs—
The Emperor, Nine Palaces and Subtle Axes.
The Heaven of Measuring Refinement and Ultimate Truth—
The Emperor, Reverting with Praise and Nurturing.
The Heaven of Auspicious Continuation and Imperial Unity—
The Emperor, Extending and Preserving.
The Heaven of Subduing Demons and Vast Strategies—
The Emperor, Illuminating and Nourishing.
The Heaven of Bright Reverence and Auspicious Attendance—
The Emperor, Spreading and Documenting.
The Heaven of Dissolving Boundaries and Brilliant Light—
The Emperor, Jade and Swift Strides.
The Heaven of Summer’s Luminance and Vermilion Palaces—
The Emperor, Moonlike and Unrestrained.

**The Eight Northern Heavens:**
The Heaven of Gathering Salt and Receiving Records—
The Emperor, Displaying Pools and Jade.
The Heaven of Horse’s Response and Nurturing Origins—
The Emperor, Praising and Illuminating.
The Heaven of Lotus’s Radiance and Auspicious World—
The Emperor, Divine and Observing.
The Heaven of Imperial Edicts and Eight Swans—
The Emperor, Mastering Celestial Mechanisms.
The Heaven of Lofty Ascent and Verdant Boundaries—
The Emperor, Blazing and Unfurling.
The Heaven of Celestial Courtyards and Attendant Audience—
The Emperor, Wise and Encompassing Dragons.
The Heaven of Releasing the Void and Subtle Texts—
The Emperor, Primordial and Divine.
The Heaven of Brahmanic Origins and Supreme Joy—
The Emperor, Conducting and Overseeing Above.

Thirty-two Heavens, thirty-two Emperors.
The heavens conceal their names, the heavens conceal their titles.
The central void resonates naturally with sacred patterns,
The heavens conceal their melodies—the sounds that summon life.
The august ones who establish fate, the gods who respond to transformation.
Altering corpse-demons, freeing from the womb to become spirits.
Yang warmth and yin unity, descending qi to Upper Clarity.
Boundless mysteries, too profound to fathom.
Manifesting divine truths, universally measuring gods and humans.

Today, rejoicing in receiving measure,
Reviving the dead, restoring life,
Passing through the heavenly gates,
Requesting the annihilation of the Three Evils,
Severing earthly roots,
Flying beyond the Five Torments,
Commanding life in the Great Mystic.

The Demon Kings oversee and elevate,
No longer bound by the gates of birth.
The Eastern Star conveys the soul,
The Western Star divines the spirit,
The Northern Star determines fate,
The Southern Star calculates years,
The Central Star governs fortune,
The Great Star preserves life,
Guarding the Three Enclaves,
Overseeing all spirits.

The Green Emperor knows awareness,
The White Emperor stirs ability,
The Red Emperor moves insight,
The Black Emperor refines essence,
The Yellow Emperor receives form,
Ten thousand gods reside within the body.

The Azure Sky Demon King revives the dead and continues the severed.
The Vermilion Sky Demon King restores *qi* and revives the blood.
The White Sky Demon King draws breath like a cord.
The Black Sky Demon King masters the Six Arts and attunes the spirit.
The Yellow Sky Demon King commands ghosts and nurtures the infant.

The Five Emperors, Great Demons, are the ancestral lords of ten thousand gods.
With flying drums and banners, they command the ghostly legions.
With banners and drums, they roam the boundless void.
They proclaim their splendor, matching Heaven’s merit,
Ascending to guide mortals, sternly overseeing the Northern Tartarus.

The Celestial Capital receives its mandate,
Sweeping away all ill omens.
The Eight Wonders revive the dead,
Turning withered decay into fragrant vitality.
Divine dragons march in procession, true officials display their might.
Heavenly attendants summon the soul, the Great Marshal raises the corpse.
A hundred gods return in their glory, riding jade carriages and golden palanquins.
The fate of death is severed, ghosts locked in the Northern Mountain.
Fires are hurled ten thousand *li*, bells toll through the Eight Directions.
Dare any interfere? They shall be crushed by the Celestial Worthies.
With golden axes they strike before them, the Great Queen of the West enforces judgment.
They slaughter and cleave the ghostly host—wind and fire relentless.
Thousands beheaded, ten thousands dismembered.
No demon dares transgress, no ghost escapes their precision.

The Three Officials of the Northern Tartarus inspect the ghostly encampments,
Tolerating no concealment, presenting them at the Golden Horse Inn.
A universal proclamation is made, all gods heed it.
The Five Emperors of the Three Realms speak to the Highest Clarity.
The boundless void lies silent, the cosmic womb in tranquil embrace.
Vast and countless, life and transformation merge in primordial chaos.
No fixed hue without, no fixed depth within.
Wind courses through the Six Voids, golden elixir floats in Heaven.
Above Heaven and below, no shadow, no darkness, no form, no limit.
The Great Void, the Brahman, boundless and luminous.
Within lies the utmost essence, self-aware and self-generated.
Awareness yet no awareness, clarity yet no clarity.
Not bound by awareness or clarity, the Dao perfects the spirit.
When the spirit arrives, life emerges; when it departs, death follows.
Life is the waning of the embryo, death the falling of the root.
When *qi* connects, the spirit is born; when *qi* falters, the spirit fades.
Blood congeals, bones wither—yet the corpse stands upright.
Nine pests infest as specters, gnawing at the brain and marrow.
The spirit is hidden in the *dantian*, the Dao fixed by Heaven.
If the spirit does not leave the body, the dead may be restored to life.
You possess the Dao’s power—reviving even withered bones.
In death’s silence, the soul wanders, the spirit breathes faintly.
Like the *kalpa* yet to unfold, dim and still.
When the Crimson Clarity unveils its diagram, the course unfolds naturally.
The Primordial Origin settles, unfolding the Five Scriptures.
The Crimson Text, Jade Characters, the Eight Wonders in Dragon Script.
Preserving the cosmic cycle, ensuring Heaven’s endurance.
The Brahman’s *qi* spreads like the *mula* tree, ten thousand patterns unfold.
The Primordial Thread flows, through the Thirty-Two Heavens.
Revolving the Three Realms, circling the Ten Directions.
Turning the Celestial Abode, reviving the dead.
Returning to the Five Constants, the Thirty-Five Divisions.
Gathering the Primordial *qi*, the Eight Scenes merge in obscurity.
*Qi* enters the Profound Profound, the Supreme Sovereign within.
The Highest Sovereign, the Transcendent, drifts through the Divine Mists.
Reciting the Cavernous Chapters, the Golden Worthies radiant.
Their voices echo through the cloudy encampments, jade tones gathering *qi*.
Winds swirl, smoke gathers—purple voids bloom with splendor.
Assisting myriad immortals, in perfect harmony, life naturally obtained,
Life and spirit intertwined—Great Lord of Eternal Life.
Without the Left Minister of Merit, the White Element as Right Spirit.
The Supreme One encompasses cognition, the Lord of Fate dispenses souls.
The *peng* and *kang* *qi* is primordial, merging with the Mother’s essence.
Holding talismans and scriptures, pursuing the dead to restore life.
Ascending to the Highest Clarity, entering the Radiant Hall.
Within the Eight Obscurities, the minutest depths.
Descending to govern the mortal form, the *dantian* and Vermilion Palace.
Regulating the Five *qi*, blending with the hundred gods.
Ten revolutions restore the spirit, purifying form and essence.
The Three-in-One returns to the True, ten thousand *qi* become immortals.
The Dao of the Immortal values life, boundless in its salvation.
Opening the Eight Gates, the Flying Heavenly Wheel.
Sin and virtue, prohibitions and karmic ties,
All receive the revelation—souls reborn, bodies revived.
The body obtains life, ascending to hear the celestial realms.
Above the celestial realms, each has its gate of birth.
Within lies the hollow song of the *Returning Souls Chapter*.
Words addressed to the Highest Worthies.

**First Chapter: The Desire Realm’s Flying Void Revival Hymn**
Within the Great Void, no distinction of inner or outer.
A single spark generates light, transforming this Heaven and Earth.
How did Heaven and Earth arise? From the luminous spark, the spirit.
The spirit established, *qi* formed—yet *qi* itself is formless.
Formless and nameless, it generates the Three Purities.
The myriad classes of *Yin* and *Yang* thereby obtain life.
To preserve this life is to vanish without trace.
Heaven’s Dao values life; the ghostly Dao demands an end.
When *qi* is exhausted, the spirit does not perish.
The spirit knows no end, harmonized by Heaven’s balance.
Naturally reviving, decay does not prevail.
The dead’s spirit departs—why not retain it?
The spirit may be retained; life and death both transcended.
The corpse lies still—yet essence suddenly revealed.
Seeing nothing to see, consorting with the True.
Bones hold the Profound Void; *qi* enters like wind.
Suddenly, the spirit arrives—laughter and form restored.
What is this Dao? Merging intent with the Profound.
The Profound communicates through intent—effortless, natural.
Divine texts restore the jade calculations,
Withered corpses regain their five senses.
I recite the Highest Clarity’s Chapters,
Subduing demons at the Hall of the Red Maw.
Holding the contract, I inform the Lord of Fate,
From the depths of darkness, life is reborn.

**Second Chapter: The Form Realm’s Revival and Eternal Life Hymn**
At the Crimson Gate of the Divine Mists, purple vapors swirl around the sun.
Within stands a jade-robed figure, playing a flute atop a white lotus.
Bowing to the Jade Clarity King, he registers the myriad immortals.
With register in hand, he summons the Nine Souls,
Holding the tally, opening the Eight Gates.
When fate is exhausted, he calls upon the Imperial Sovereign,
Waving his jewel-staff to restore the spirit.
Life prolonged with the Yellow Thread, the Crimson Text radiant.
The Seven Souls enter the *dantian*, the Jade Maiden opens the Crystal Hall.
Feathered canopies shelter the Most High, the Azure Dragon dispatches the Crowing Bird.
White clouds return to the Vermilion Palace, luminous light dances with the embryonic immortal.
The Demon of Fate is sealed in the Cold Pool, the Wicked Slain at the Strange Spring.
Forms of impermanence are extinguished, reverently reciting the *Great Possession Chapter*.
A hundred gods guard the Great Mystic, pearls cascading.
---

「灵津濯枯枝，柔条翳兰鲜。」
The Luminous Elixir washes the withered branches,
Soft tendrils veiled in orchid’s fresh radiance.

「真气洒八极，玉骨同蜕蝉。」
True *qi* spills through the Eight Poles,
Jade bones shed like the cicada’s molt.

「上道贵简妙，秘语宁轻宣。」
The High Dao values simplicity and subtlety,
Sacred speech must not be lightly revealed.

「第三无色界高上神霄玉清王歌曰」
The Song of the Highest Sovereign of the Celestial *Dao*—**Yùqīng Wáng** of the Third *Formless Realm*—speaks:

「眇眇玉阙，碧顶在上。」
Lofty and distant, the Jade Gate,
Its emerald summit towering above.

「梵气如河，流演八天。」
*Fàn*’s *qi* flows like a river,
Permeating the Eight *Heavens*.

「鸣湍写炼，沸涛绞雷。」
Roaring torrents refine the essence,
Boiling waves twist with thunderous might.

「我气炎冲，万物生回。」
My *qi* surges, fierce and boundless,
All things return to life anew.

「三界有生，俱承妙气。」
In the Three Realms, beings are born,
All partaking of this wondrous breath.

「黄给金液，山横鼎峙。」
Golden elixirs bestowed in yellow,
Mountains arrayed where cauldrons stand.

「赋其巨者，高真仙王。」
To the grandest, the *High True Dao*’s Sovereign grants,
The loftiest of the Celestial Kings.

「与其细者，公侯佩珰。」
To the lesser, *gōnghóu* wear jade pendants,
Their merit refined in measure.

「研丹比豆，玉京俄就。」
Alchemy’s work, no larger than a bean,
The Celestial Capital (*Yùjīng*) swiftly manifests.

「日月交飞，我命长久。」
Sun and moon intertwine in flight,
My life prolonged through endless time.

「亹亹繁生，握珠自得。」
Endless life blooms, vigorous and bright,
Pearls grasped—self-realization attained.

「不知太空，玄道是则。」
Unknowing of the boundless void,
The *Dao*’s law stands firm and true.

「化机不运，三界休息。」
When the *transformation mechanism* stalls,
The Three Realms rest in quietude.

「真一未明，五行为贼。」
The *True One* still veiled in darkness,
The Five *Actions* become thieves of fate.

「顾彼嵯峨，风谣空歌。」
Yet lofty peaks stand, winds whisper vainly,
Empty hymns echo through the void.

「咳笑浩劫，神都可过。」
Laughing through the vast *kālpa*’s span,
The Celestial City may be crossed.

「我位上王，万变玄中。」
I, the Sovereign of the Highest Rank,
Am the *Dao*’s core through myriad change.

「惠兆绝命，九窍互通。」
Blessings seal the fate of death,
The Nine Orifices harmonized.

「返尸主形，致天六龙，至阳若无有，感和忽玄同。」
The corpse returns to life’s command,
Heaven’s Six *Dragons* obey.
The *Extreme Yang* seems nonexistent,
Yet harmony awakens—*Dao*’s mystery revealed.

「此三界之上，飞空之中，真王歌音，音参洞章。」
Above the Three Realms, within the flying void,
The Sovereign’s Song resounds—
Its melody harmonizes with the *Taoist Canon*.

「诵之百遍，名度南宫。」
Recite it a hundred times,
And the *Dao*’s passage is named in *Nán Gōng*.

「诵之千遍，灵魔保迎。」
Recite it a thousand times,
And the *Spiritual Demons* guard its path.

「万遍道备，飞升太空，过度三界，位登仙公。」
Ten thousand recitations—*Dao* complete—
Ascend to the Highest Void,
Cross the Three Realms,
And rank among the Celestial Masters.

「有闻灵音，回生返形，勑制地祇，侍卫送迎，拔出地户，五苦八难，七祖升迁，永离鬼官，魂度朱陵，受炼更生。」
Hearing the Sacred Sound,
Life returns, the form restored.
The *Earthly Deities* are commanded,
Guards attend with reverent escort.
The *Hellish Gates* are torn asunder,
Five *Sufferings* and Eight *Hardships* dispelled.
The Seven *Ancestors* ascend in glory,
Forever freed from the *Ghostly Bureaus*,
Souls pass through *Zhūlíng*,
Refined anew in eternal life.

「是谓无量，普度无穷。」
This is called the *Boundless Dharma*,
Universal salvation without end.

「有秘上天文，诸天共所崇。」
There are hidden celestial diagrams,
All *Heavens* revere them in their midst.

「泄慢堕地狱，祸及七祖翁。」
Leak or neglect?—then fall to *Yùdì*,
Misfortune befalling the Seven *Ancestors*.

「道言：此二章并是诸天上帝，及神霄真王隐秘之音。」
The *Dao* says: These two chapters
Are the hidden sounds of the Celestial Sovereigns,
And the *Yùqīng* True King of the *Divine Dao*.

「招致生真，还复尸魂，九宫扬灵辉，三府凝玉津，身被紫景，面泽朱光，超凌玄都。」
Summoning the *Living True*,
Returning the corpse to spirit,
The Nine *Palaces* radiate luminous glory,
The Three *Bureaus* condense the jade nectar.
The body clad in violet splendor,
Face bathed in crimson light,
Ascending beyond the *Mystic Capital*.

「皆是大梵之言，非世上常辞。」
All are the words of the *Great Fàn*,
Not the common speech of mortal men.

「言无韵丽，曲无华宛。」
Speech without melodious grace,
Tune without ornate adornment.

「故谓玄奥，难可寻详。」
Thus called the *profound mysteries*,
Hard to trace or fully comprehend.

「上天所宝，秘於神霄玉清上宫东华宝室，依玄科应运下传。」
Treasured by the Highest Heaven,
Hidden in the *Yùqīng*’s Celestial Palace—**East Hua’s Gem Chamber**—
Transmitted below by *Dao*’s law when fate aligns.

「若有至人赍金宝质心，依旧格告盟十天，然后而付焉。」
Should a *Perfect Adept* bring a heart of golden purity,
And pledge in ancient form to the Ten *Heavens*,
Then the secrets shall be entrusted.

「道言：夫天地运度，亦有否终，日月五星，亦有亏盈，至圣神人，亦有休否，未学之夫，亦有疾伤。」
The *Dao* says: Even the *Heavens* and Earth,
With their cycles of *fate and passage*,
Have moments of cessation and decline.
Sun and moon, the Five *Stars*,
Also wax and wane in power.
The *Most Sage* of *Divine Humans*,
Even they have periods of repose or decline.
The unlearned, too, suffer sickness and harm.

「凡有此灾，皆可回还生气，起济穷绝，同气皆当齐心修斋，六时行香，十遍转经，福德立降，消诸不详。」
For all who face such calamity,
Life’s *qi* may be restored,
The *desperate* saved from ruin.
All who share this breath must unite in heart,
Practicing *fasting* and *ritual purity*,
Offering incense at the Six *Times*,
Reciting the *Sutra* tenfold.
*Merit and Virtue* descend swiftly,
Dissolving all ill omens.

「无量之文，普度无穷。」
The *Boundless Texts*,
Universal salvation without limit.

「道言：夫末学道浅，或仙品未充，运应灭度，身经太阴。」
The *Dao* says: The *unlearned* with shallow understanding,
Or those whose *Daoist rank* is yet unripe,
When fate decrees annihilation,
Their bodies pass through *Tài Yīn*’s domain.

「临过之时，同学至人为其行香，诵经十过，以度尸形如法，则生神赴身，宫室开明，死户闭塞，秽胞荡清，天机玄省，南昌上宫，返其魂神，随其学功，计日而得更生。」
At the moment of crossing,
Let *Perfect Adepts* of shared learning
Offer incense in their stead,
Recite the *Sutra* ten times,
And guide the corpse by *Dao*’s law.
Then the *Living Spirit* returns to the body,
Palaces brighten, gates of death sealed.
The *filthy womb* is cleansed,
Heaven’s *mechanism* veiled in mystery.
The *Nán Chāng*’s High Palace
Restores their *soul and spirit*,
Following their *Daoist cultivation*,
And grants rebirth in counted days.

「转轮不惑，便得神仙。」
The *Wheel of Rebirth* does not turn,
And *Divine Immortality* is swiftly attained.

「道言：夫回生起死，灵宝所重，神霄禁书。」
The *Dao* says: To restore life and raise the dead,
The *Sacred Treasure* holds supreme weight—
A *forbidden text* of the *Divine Dao*.

「大至天地，细逮人物，皆有生死增减益算之道。」
From the grandest—*Heavens* and Earth—
To the minutest—*humans* and *beings*,
All have the *Dao* of life and death,
Of growth, decline, and fate’s reckoning.

「天地运终，己亥交气，星宿错度，日月失昏，躔次推移，四时失度，阴阳不调，金胜火伏，国境有灾，兵盗时作，太一行宫，疫毒流行，兆民死伤，人运临克，师友命过，真谱断宗。」
When *Heavens* and Earth’s cycles conclude,
And *Jǐhài*’s *qi* exchanges,
*Stars* and *constellations* stray from their paths,
Sun and moon lose their eclipses,
*Lunar stations* shift disorderly,
The Four *Seasons* fall out of measure,
*Yīn* and *Yáng* unbalanced—
Metal triumphs, Fire subdued—
Then calamities plague the realm,
Bandits and wars rise in their time.
The *Tài Yī*’s *Traveling Palace*,
Plagues and poisons spread abroad,
Countless folk perish in their beds,
Human fate nears its *Great Crisis*,
*Master* and *friend* meet untimely ends,
The *True Dao*’s lineage severed.

「亦当修斋，行香诵经、回生以成吉，起死以破凶，福应不沦，生道咸赖。」
Yet one must still practice *fasting*,
Offer incense, recite the *Sutra*,
To restore life and bring auspicious fortune,
Raise the dead and dispel malevolence.
*Merit* descends without fail,
All rely on the *Dao* of rebirth.

「切於己形，施於天下，灵秘至微，下学殊昧。」
Personal salvation for one’s own form,
Universal benevolence for all beneath the *Heavens*.
The *Sacred Secrets* are most subtle,
Yet the *unlearned* grasp them differently.

「夫斋戒诵经，功德甚重。」
Indeed, *fasting* and *ritual purity*,
Reciting the *Sutra*—
Their *merit* is most profound.

「上消天灾。」
Above all, it dispels celestial calamities.

「保镇帝王。」
And safeguards the *Imperial Sovereigns*.

The *Sacred Secrets* descend to dispel poisonous harm,
To deliver all beneath the *Heavens*.
Life and death alike find their reliance,
Their *merit* is boundless—*universal salvation* for *Heavens* and mortals.

The *Way* declares:
All who possess this *Sutra*,
Can act on behalf of *Heavens*, *Earth*, the *Imperial Sovereign*, and the myriad people,
Performing such *merit*—
On days of calamity, with a sincere heart,
Practice *fasting*, burn incense,
Recite the *Sutra* ten times.
All the *Celestial Beings* record their names,
Ten thousand *Spirits* attend as guardians.
The *Exalted Ones* of the Right Path shall
Surely become *Holy Ministers* of the *Golden Gate*.

Not a hair’s breadth is lost.
Even the *Magical Kings* of the *Heavens* shall
Recommend your virtue.
Those who attain the *Way* shall
Pierce the depths of these *Sacred Words*.

The *Great Brahman*’s hidden speech,
The *Sound of Infinite Measure*—
Composed by the *Dao Lord*,
The *Original Beginning’s Sacred Scripture*,
The *Jade Scroll of Qi-Returning Harmony*.

Bestow *Celestial Merit* of vast renown.

The *Red Seal* of *Han*’s *Sacred Strategy*,
The *Jade Bead*’s distant might.
Directing the *Celestial Procession*,
Displaying the *Mound’s* grandeur.

With *Lan*’s *Chariot* in order,
Exalted *Yì*’s boundless virtue.
Singing to chase the *Barbarians*,

Pillars of *Ten Thousand Years*,
Gold-carved *Radiant Halls*.

The *Sound of Infinite Measure*.
The *Old Texts* recorded by the *True King of the Celestial Mists*,
On the *Purple Court* of the *Azure Enclosure*,
Summoning the *Celestial Beings* to restore life,

The *Ghosts* and *Spirits* honor it to enhance *Spiritual Power*,

The *Great Measure* of the *Mysterious Mysteries*.

**The *Sacred Treasure of Infinite Salvation*—**
*The Supreme Marvelous Sutra*, Volume Fifty-Eight complete.
Volume Fifty-Nine ends.

**The Chapter on Transforming Corpses into Form**

The Dao speaks thus: In days of old, within the *Dongguang* Heaven, the *Void-Transformed Flying Song* of the *Great Primordial* cultivated the *Earth of Nurturing*. There, the *Primordial Origin* taught the method of *Transforming Corpses into Form*—an infinite, supreme teaching.

When the *Primordial Origin Heavenly Venerable* delivered this sutra, circling ten times to summon the *Ten Directions*, the *Heavenly True Great God*, the *Supreme Saintly High Venerable*, the *True Person of Marvelous Conduct in Transforming Corpses into Form*, arrived with countless hosts, riding the void.

His vast *qi* surged and receded, his strides stirring the heavens, his purple carriage and yellow canopy gleaming, his crimson clouds and jade wheels casting morning shadows. His divine essence radiated, his multicolored brilliance dazzling, his misty aura dense and thriving, illuminating the boundless expanse for three days and three nights. The celestial stars and solar rays, the pearl-strung moonbeams, all paused in their courses. Gentle winds dispersed the mists, auspicious clouds spread their blessings, the heavens knew no floating veils, and the four seasons shone clear. Across the land—its earth, mountains, forests, and streams—all became level, with no high or low. The soil bore patterns of jade-like, emerald-green luster, its hue unchanging.

The assembled *True Ones* attended at his seat. The *Primordial Origin Heavenly Venerable* ascended in silence upon the floating *Nine-Qi* *Brahman* Light *Jade Terrace* in the void.

When the sutra was recited once, the *Great Saints of Heaven* all proclaimed its excellence. At that moment, all men and women of the land, their corpses filthy and decayed, transformed into form and became immortals.

When the sutra was recited twice, clouds and mists dissolved into emptiness, and golden effigies blazed like the sun.

When the sutra was recited thrice, flowers congealed into immortal dew, and ten thousand blossoms bore pearls.

When the sutra was recited four times, divine essences refined the bones, and the corpse’s form was perfected.

When the sutra was recited five times, the *Great Knot* was unsealed, and spirit-*qi* merged.

When the sutra was recited six times, the *Register of High Clarity* was inscribed, and *Nectar of the Spirit* bathed the body.

When the sutra was recited seven times, the *Divine Ritual* hurled fire, illuminating the *Mud Ball* within.

When the sutra was recited eight times, the *Heavenly Steed* galloped on the wind, shedding the old corpse.

When the sutra was recited nine times, the *Three Officials* issued decrees, casting off the yin-corpses.

When the sutra was recited ten times, the *Divine Luster* was firmly established, the *Life-Giving Qi* clarified, and all men and women of the land—without exception—turned their hearts toward it, receiving protection and attaining eternal life.

The Dao speaks further: When the sutra was recited once, the *Great God of Silent Dao* from the *East of the Boundless Infinite* arrived with countless hosts, floating through the void.

When the sutra was recited twice, the *Great God of Divine Power* from the *South of the Boundless Infinite* arrived with countless hosts, floating through the void.

When the sutra was recited thrice, the *Great God of Concentrated Essence* from the *West of the Boundless Infinite* arrived with countless hosts, floating through the void.

When the sutra was recited four times, the *Great God of Mysterious Operation* from the *North of the Boundless Infinite* arrived with countless hosts, floating through the void.

When the sutra was recited five times, the *Great God of Corpse-Demons* from the *Northeast of the Boundless Infinite* arrived with countless hosts, floating through the void.

When the sutra was recited six times, the *Great God of Divine Ritual* from the *Southeast of the Boundless Infinite* arrived with countless hosts, floating through the void.

When the sutra was recited seven times, the *Great God of Fetal Spirits* from the *Southwest of the Boundless Infinite* arrived with countless hosts, floating through the void.

When the sutra was recited eight times, the *Great God of Mechanized Use* from the *Northwest of the Boundless Infinite* arrived with countless hosts, floating through the void.

When the sutra was recited nine times, the *Great God of Corpse-Transformation* from the *Upper Boundless Infinite* arrived with countless hosts, floating through the void.

When the sutra was recited ten times, the *Great God of Receiving Form* from the *Lower Boundless Infinite* arrived with countless hosts, floating through the void.

As the ten recitations completed, the *Heavenly True Great Gods* of the *Ten Directions* all arrived together. All men and women of the land turned their hearts in reverence, comprehending the *Great Dao*, deeply attuned to the *Divine Source*, all declaring they had attained birth, their lifespans measured in millions, yet none escaping their term. The *Mysterious Extremes* of *威神* unfolded their *Great Law*, guiding all to single-heartedness, opening the *Root Principle*, revealing their state before birth—what form they then possessed.

Within the boundless void, by what cause did they suddenly gain awareness and perception? The five phases of cold and heat—all were recognized in full. As the *Dao of Life* was about to depart, their *qi* scattered, their spirits fled, and only the filthy corpse remained.

The *Primordial Origin’s* divine wisdom nurtured all living things. At the touch of the most subtle *Spirit*, it transformed this decaying corpse, received a new form, and ascended as a *True Person*. There must be profound *Mysterious Essence*—this must be proclaimed.

Such celestial beings, their numbers infinite, young and old, wise and foolish, ordinary and saintly—all wished to hear with reverence. Though even in heaven they still clung to desires, their defilements were light, yet they had not yet attained the *Empty Clarity* of the *Marvelous Dao*. All submitted to the *Victorious Transformation*, gathering like clouds and wind.

Those who came were as dense as fine rain and mist, their countless hosts causing half the land’s soil to sink unevenly—an unstoppable tide.

Thus, the *Primordial Origin*, knowing all thoughts, emitted an auspicious light from his crown, its nine hues illuminating the *Boundless Infinite Lands* of the *Ten Directions*, the *Thirty-Two Heavens*, and the *Thirty-Two Sovereigns*—all bathed in radiance.

Within this light, the *Primordial Origin* manifested countless beings from countless eons, lost in delusion and ignorance, their habits begetting one another in endless cycles of birth and death. They saw no *True Dao*, their countless *karma* and retributions, their endless grievances and debts—all revealed as clearly as if gazing into their own minds.

The *Primordial Origin*, surveying the great assembly, spoke:

*"The Dao of *Yuqing* surpasses ten thousand heavens. Divine *qi* returns as light; the corpse perishes, the form refines. The form refines into *qi*; embracing the spirit, containing the void—hidden and revealed at will, appearing and vanishing without obstruction. Gazing back upon the world, it is finer than a single drop of dew.*

He then gathered the auspicious light, compressing the manifested realm into a *Treasure Pearl* the size of a millet grain, suspended seven *zhang* above the earth in the void.

The *Primordial Origin* then ascended, and the *Heavenly True Great God*, the *Supreme Saintly High Venerable*, the *True Person of Marvelous Conduct in Transforming Corpses into Form*, the *Silent Mysterious Immortal*—with countless hosts—all entered the *Treasure Pearl*."

The celestial beings and mortals gazed upward, and saw only a surging vitality enter through the Pearl’s mouth—once inside, its whereabouts became unknown. The populace dispersed, the land restored to evenness, no longer tilted or sunken.

Within the Treasure Pearl, the Primordial Origin completed the transmission of the scripture. The gathered immortals, overseeing the salvation, entrusted it to me. At that moment, joy and celebration were beyond words.

With the ritual matters now complete, the celestial hosts resumed their stations. In an instant, all sound vanished, leaving perfect stillness.

At that time, all who encountered the scripture’s teachings were universally saved and delivered, their lives preserved without injury. The land’s people turned in reverence, their corpses transformed into refined forms—neither obscured nor illuminated, neither arrogant nor invasive, neither pure nor defiled, neither in use nor in alarm, neither restrained nor divided. The emaciated flesh dissolved, the received form took shape, all united in boundless compassion, disparate bones forming kinship.

The realm became secure, its people prosperous, rejoicing in eternal peace. The Dao’s teachings spread, and the entire land followed the Way.

Those with sincere devotion, reverently upholding the scripture, all attained salvation in the world.

The Dao declares: All names spoken within the Primordial Origin’s scripture are the hidden, coded names of the celestial deities transforming corpses. They are also the taboo names within the True King’s received form—the concealed names of the hundred spirits. These are not the common words of the world.

The Supreme Saint, already a perfected immortal, penetrating the Mysterious and fathoming the subtle, transformed and purified the decaying corpse, receiving a refined spiritual form. Those who master its verses and recite them ten times will stir the distant heavens—old forms dissolve, new ones arise. The myriad emperors praise its marvels, their forms transmuted into true essence. The nine seas stilled their waves, the five mountains exhaled their clouds, the sun and moon doubled their brilliance, their radiant rays circulating vital essence. Yin and yang reversed, mortals became immortals, demons bound in form, ghosts and specters extinguished, corpses transformed into living beings, white bones restored to flesh.

Scholars who recite it ten times will see their five viscera regenerate, the Three Corpses flee in terror, demonic essences vanish, ghostly calamities extinguished. They will rescue the dying, restoring life from death. This is so because scholars, their impure *qi* not yet dispelled, their bodies not yet perfected in truth, still govern their corpses through life’s force. Though they may wield celestial authority and subdue earthly spirits, binding demonic essences, they can only repel death—not attain true transcendence. Lightly reciting this chapter invites misfortune.

Honoring and venerating the scripture brings prosperity to one’s lineage, generation after generation, untouched by calamity. Divine protection guards the door.

This scripture’s sublime mysteries surpass even the Jade Capital. It saves innumerable beings, standing as the root of all Daoist paths. Its grandeur is boundless, its virtue incomparable.

The Dao declares: Those who recite this scripture ten times will see the myriad heavens converge, with countless ancestral spirits and tormented souls all transformed into refined forms, ascending to the Vermilion Palace. After nine years of cultivation, they are reborn, becoming noble beings. Those who earnestly study the scripture, their merits complete and virtue fulfilled, will attain immortality, ascending to the Golden Gate and wandering the Jade Capital.

Advanced scholars who practice and recite this scripture will immediately receive salvation—their forms refined, their corpses dissolved—as they ascend to the Southern Palace. Mortals who recite it will prolong their years, all eventually attaining the Way of Corpse Dissolution. Their spirits, though momentarily extinguished, avoid the underworld and return to their forms, wandering the boundless void.

This scripture’s subtlety is profound, its salvific power endless. All celestial beings rejoice in its blessings, granting immeasurable merit across life and death. It is a treasure of the heavens, not to be passed to the mortal world. Only those who offer gold and jade with sincere devotion may swear to heaven and transmit it. Leaking or neglecting it invites retribution upon nine generations, binding one to eternal service as a ghostly official.

The scripture is attended by the Five Emperors and their twenty-four玉童玉女 (*yuétóng yǔnǚ*—jade boys and girls), who guard its divine texts and protect those who receive it.

The Dao declares:
In the first month, with prolonged fasting, recite this scripture to invoke the *Taqing* Transcendent Purple Emperor, who will deliver the suffering souls of past ages from underworld torment, transforming their corpses into refined forms and guiding them to the Southern Palace.

In the seventh month, with prolonged fasting, recite this scripture to invoke the *Shangqing* Three True Ones of the Supreme Micro Emperor, who will transform corpses into immortal forms, granting the reciter’s body immortality. Those who write it on jade tablets or gold slips will escape death and be reborn.

In the tenth month, with prolonged fasting, recite this scripture to invoke the *Yuqing* Divine and Subtle Flying Void Emperor, who will transform corpses into soaring immortals. Kings and emperors, their ministers and kin, will secure their lineage’s longevity, preserving the heavens’ stability and eternal peace for generations. They will forever govern their lands, their people calling it the Great Peace.

On the eight seasonal festivals, recite this scripture to invoke the Nine-Heaven Emperor of Corpse Transformation, who will deliver the liberated and descending immortals, granting them the rank of Nine-Palace True Ones.

On one’s birthdate, recite this scripture to summon the Nine-Heaven True King, who will ride through the void, purifying the corpse’s spirit, receiving the Supreme Mysterious form. The hundred spirits will drink the elixir, their vital essence purified, their lifespan eternal. Free from suffering, their bodies radiant, they will be attended by the Three Realms’ guardians, welcomed by the Five Emperors, and honored by the myriad spirits. Their names inscribed in heaven, their merits complete, they will ascend to the Upper Clarity.

The Dao declares:
On days of practice, one must bathe in fragrant waters, fast in seclusion, facing east. Strike the teeth thirty-two times to commune with the thirty-two heavens. Bow the heart thirty-two times in reverence. Close the eyes, meditate upon sitting within clouds of sp

On this auspicious and joyous day, one must observe a strict fast in the purified hall.
Reciting the sacred scriptures to liberate countless beings, may my invocation ascend directly before the Supreme Sovereign, the Most High Emperor of the Thirty-Two Heavens of the Primordial Origin.

When complete, draw in the *qi* thirty-two times, facing east to recite the scripture:
*The Primordial Origin’s Supreme Scripture of Infinite Liberation*
*The Primordial Origin’s Mysterious Treasure of the Soul’s Essence*
—transforming the corpse into form, wondrously awakening beings to liberation.

The hundred demons retreat in silence, their dissolution and coalescence unfolding naturally.
The Primordial *qi* ascends in crimson, refined by fire into the True.
In the Primordial Ancestor’s eon, the corpse is transformed into form.
When the spirit departs, it is called a corpse—unaware, unhearing.
When the spirit attaches, it is called form—movement arises in bending and stretching.
All this is the Dao’s mechanism, which the Most High holds in reverence.
There is none it does not transform from corpse to form,
None it does not receive into form.
When form moves, the corpse stirs not;
When the spirit flows, its motion is perfectly balanced.
Transforming the corpse into form, vital essence spontaneously generates.
Shared origin with Heaven and Earth, it opens the three luminaries.
This is the Heavenly Root—spirit without form or feature.
Taking the Dao as body, the five phases’ essence,
Spirit and *qi* swirling, responding to emotion with hue,
Shaping form through color’s influence.
The five true *qi* coalesce into five patterns,
The five patterns expand and plant divine spirits universally.
Without patterns, there is no radiance,
Without patterns, there is no clarity,
Without patterns, there is no establishment,
Without patterns, there is no completion,
Without patterns, there is no liberation,
Without patterns, there is no birth.
The True Spirit’s talisman summons—white bones take form.
The Inner Canon of the Human Sovereign—corpse-forms regenerate.
Refining the old to return to new, the True attains its True.
Transforming corpse into form, form endures and preserves.
Great and small are impermanent—ascending to the Supreme Clarity in flight.
This is the Great Brahman, the Heaven within Heaven.
The Yùluó Xiāotái, the Jade Mountain’s Upper Capital.
The Supreme Beyond Supreme, the Great Luo’s Pure Clarity.
Vast as eons, as if nonexistent, as if existing.

Golden gates, jade halls, arrayed in pristine mists.
The Great Path’s Brahman *qi* encircles the ten directions.
Within are gods of transforming corpse into form,

Within is the Great Spirit Marshal who descends essence to receive form,
Within is the Lord Han, the Cultivator of Corpse-Transformation for Life’s Sake,
Within are the Southern Sovereigns of Life’s Record, Longevity’s Extension, Fate’s Calculation, and Calamity’s Relief.

Transforming corpse into form, liberating countless beings—
Today’s recitation, all heavens assemble in attendance.

The Illuminating Guilt’s Severing Corpse Heaven, where Emperor Shànshèngqímén’s judgment is clear.

**Thirty-Two Heavens, Thirty-Two Emperors.**
All Heavens conceal their names, all Heavens hide their signs.
Within Heaven lies the Void, where natural Spirits manifest.
All Heavens conceal their melodies, the harmonies of shifting *qi*.
The Revered Sovereign of Command, the Divine of Rebirth.
The Great Magus of Corpse-Transformation, the Spirit of Form-Reception.
Nine Dissolutions and Ten Unions, transformations ascending to the Highest Purity.
The boundless Mysteries, profound beyond measure.
The Divine Essence descends, universally enlightening Heavenly Beings and mortals.
Today, rejoicing in receiving the enlightenment, passing through all Heavens,
I beseech the annihilation of the Three Evils,
the severing of the Corpse’s roots,
the flight of the True Essence into Form,
and my name to be inscribed in the Supreme Mysteries.

The True King oversees all,
unrestricted by Heaven’s gates,
the Eastern Dipper holds the calculations,
the Western Dipper records the names,
the Northern Dipper judges the dead,
the Southern Dipper nurtures life,
the Central Dipper commands the great,
transforming Corpses into Spirits.

The Green Emperor summons Souls,
the White Emperor restrains Spirits,
the Red Emperor returns *qi*,
the Black Emperor reclaims Blood,
the Yellow Emperor renews Vitality,
and all Spirits hold their sacred seals.

Swiftly summoning the Supreme One,
raising the Corpse to rebirth.
Form complete, Spirit perfected,
harmonizing the Three Passes.
The Divine Wind enters the Caverns,
and the Spring gushes from Kun Mountain.
At the call of the Jade Boy,
the Six Ding respond with might in the South.
Transformations appear fleeting,
ascending to Immortality beyond the mortal realm.
The Divine Realm stands before us,
and the Yellow Will reveals its golden face.
Granting auspicious signs,
the Tiger’s Mantle and crimson robes,
jade barriers and emerald gates.
Wearing the talismans of the Nine Heavens,
gazing upward at the Mortal’s Grain.
Thirty-Five Dipper Constellations,
purple clouds flowing with mist.

Corpses transformed, Forms refined,
ascending to the Great Abyss.
Seated in the Nine Gates,
summoning a hundred Spirits with a whistle.
The Green Heaven’s Magus King,
severing the wandering Corpses.
The Red Heaven’s Magus King,
with golden seals and jade dragons.
The White Heaven’s Magus King,
with the Primordial Sea and tortoise of jade.
The Black Heaven’s Magus King,
with the Mysterious Light and Master of the Void.
The Yellow Heaven’s Magus King,
with crimson pavilions and purple infants.

The Wind’s orders, the Fire’s commands,
urgently transforming Corpses.
The Heavenly Corpse’s Sovereign,
reciting the Emperor’s sacred talismans.
The Earthly Corpse’s Sovereign,
slaying ghosts and subduing the hidden.
The Human Corpse’s Sovereign,
beheading and decapitating the dead.

Corpses become living Forms,
in the Green Sea with misty nourishment.
Eighty thousand, four thousand,
chambers of splendor in the halls.
All Spirits gather,
returning to the One in the Boundless Void.
Bones bear the Green Frost,
marrow like the Azure Ling.
For the sake of Corpse-Transformation,
I drive away the Magus and the wronged.

The Five Great Magi,
leaders of all Spirits.
Flying and marching with drum and banner,
commanding the Divine Soldiers.
Brandishing flags and beating drums,
wandering through the Great Void.
Guarding with splendor,
recording Heaven’s deeds.
Transforming Corpses into Spirits,
strictly overseeing the Northern Du.

Heaven’s Mechanism ascends to the Highest,
the Jade Purity’s Divine Official.
Reverently receiving the Emperor’s command,
sweeping away all inauspiciousness.
Thunder and hail strike fiercely,
dragons and tigers rise in wrath.
The Heavenly Soldiers drive away evil,
the Great Marshal wields the Wind’s Spear.

Black clouds stretch ten thousand *li*,
lightning and fire surge in eight directions.
Dare any to challenge,
I bar and block the True Souls.
The Golden Axe strikes first,
the Great Serpent devours the essence.
Slaughtering and cutting the Ghost’s Vitality,
the Wind and Fire relent not.
Thousands upon thousands behead,
ten thousands upon ten thousands sever.
No Magus dares to trespass,
no Ghost lingers with its essence.

Heaven’s hidden commands,
removing names from the records.
The Three Officials and the Northern Du,
clearly inspecting the Ghostly Camps.
None may hide,
the Golden Horse presents them.
Proclaiming to the boundless,
all Spirits heed the call.
The Three Realms and Five Peaks,
all speak to the Highest Purity.

□*Mixed* Brú’s History, the Dragon’s Han’s Rites of Kang.
The Towering Platform’s Wild Calamity,
the Resounding Center.
Above, the Formless stands,
below, the Nine Abysses open.
Winds stir the waves,
thirty-six thousand revolve.
Externally firm, internally void,
golden locks flow with the Mysterious.

The Mysterious Extremes, above and below,
without depths nor darkness,
without form nor shadow,
without limit nor end.
If any Great Spirit exists,
with tiger’s teeth and dragon’s lips,
six eyes and eight horns,
riding the winds and clouds.
Hands supporting the Chaos,
shaped like an egg,
three inches and five *fen* in size,
round and white as silver.

Within lies the Three Realms,
the Sun and Moon, the Sky and Earth,
mountains and seas, grasses and trees,
the Old Father and the Young Grandson.
The living receive Form,
the extinguished transform into Corpses,
cycling endlessly,
as *qi* perpetually moves its mechanism.

Corpses transform into Ghosts,
Ghosts transform into Humans.
This is the Dao’s return,
as autumn turns to spring.

The Emperor exhales the Jade Talisman,
transforming Corpses and severing Death.
Receiving Form, generating the True,
the True beyond comparison.
The Vast Heaven’s expansive *qi*,
the Northern Dipper and Southern Star.
Uniting into the Supreme Void,
the Mysterious and the White undivided.
The Profound and Boundless Great Dao,
sprawling without light.
The Red Illumination opens the Diagram,
moving naturally through the degrees.
The Primordial Origin stands firm,
the Five Talismans descend.
The Red Book’s Jade Characters,
the Eight Auspicious Dragon Scripts,
preserving and governing the Calamities,
commanding Heaven to endure eternally.

The Dao’s Vitality spreads like the Luo,
all patterns unfurling.
The Primordial Thread flows,
through the Thirty-Two Heavens.
Revolving without color,
circuiting the Ten Directions.
The Dipper and the Arrow revolve,
the Five Constants return.
Thirty-Five divisions,
collecting the Vitality of the Highest.
Eight Scenes merge in the Dark,
the Vitality entering the Profoundest Mysteries.
Within the Profound,
the Supreme Sovereign,
the Highest Emperor of Heaven.

The Radiant Scenes of the Great Mist,
whistling and chanting through the Void.
The Golden Talisman glows,
clearing and striking down.
Corpses and Ghosts flee,
Souls and Spirits return.
Echoes resound in the Cloud Camps,
emptiness and silence gather the *qi*.
The Laws and Music produce Spirits,
the phoenix dances, the *luán* bird sings.
Jade sounds blaze in the clouds,
the wind returns, the rain descends.

The One Emperor abides in *Lí* [離],
the gathered *Zhēn* [真] arrayed in ranks.
They present the *bì* [璧] and cross the *tāo* [珰],
with *Lóng* [龍] and *Hǔ* [虎] as valiant attendants.

The *Líng* [靈] wind gathers the mists,
the *Qīng* [青] *Zhēn* [真] guarding the liver.
The *Zǐ* [紫] *Xū* [虚] is profound and resplendent,
the *Sān Guān* [三官]’s jade hall.

They assist myriad *xiān* [仙], thousands and ten-thousands linked in succession.
Ten-thousands harmonized, myriad united,
naturally forming the *Zhēn* [真].
Within the *Zhēn* [真] lies the *Shén* [神],
the Great Lord of Eternal Life.

No *Yīng* [英] nor *Dù* [度] nor *Jí* [籍],
the *Bái Yuán* [白元] holds the sacred script.
The *Tài Yī* [太一] receives life,
commanding the *Sī Mìng* [司命] to preside over fate.

The *Táotáo* [桃康] cherishes life,
uniting to prolong and nurture form.
With talismans and seals in hand,
they safeguard life and secure the roots.

Ascending the *Shàng Qīng* [上清],
entering and exiting the *Huá Fáng* [華房].
Within the Eight *Míng* [冥],
in the finest subtleties,
they subdue the human body,
the *Níhuán* [泥丸] and *Jiānggōng* [絳宮].

They regulate the Five *Qì* [氣],
mixing and harmonizing myriad *Shén* [神].
Ten revolutions return the *Líng* [靈],
myriad *Qì* [氣] unite with the *Xiān* [仙].
The *Xiān* [仙] Dao prizes life,
boundless degrees for mortals.

The Eight Gates open above,
the flying *Fǎ Lún* [法輪] ascends.
Sin and merit are forbidden,
past karma and present cause.
All receive enlightenment,
the dead soul reborn in form.
The body attains new life,
ascending to hear the celestial realms.

Above the celestial realms,
each has its own Gate of Life.
Within lies a chapter of empty void hymns,
the *Zhēnwáng* [真王]’s sacred verses,
words that match the Highest *Zhēn* [真].

**First Chapter: The *Zhēnwáng* [真王]’s Hymn of Flying Void to Form**
The *Fán* [梵] *Qì* [氣] knows no absence,
the *Yùqīng* [玉清] is profound and luminous.
Descending straight to the *Shénqiū* [神丘].
Surrounding the void’s wave-like expanse.
Seven *jié* [劫]’s golden mountains,
ten-thousand celestial jade trees.
The sun and moon both radiate,
through boundless *jié* [劫] they pass.
Blow, and *yīn* [陰] arises;
cease, and *yáng* [陽] reaches its peak.
Fragrant winds and crimson rains,
jewel towers and yew pavilions.
The *Yuánshǐ* [元始] flows its essence,
piling snow and stacking butter.
Encounter fire, it becomes liquid,
casting the *Yùjīng* [玉京].

Mighty mountains and towering stones,
comparable to the *Níhuán* [泥丸].
Within, the *Huángchì* [黃赤] is contained,
the *Tiānxiāng* [天潢] surging forth.
The tail’s orifice is sealed,
roaring like torrential waves.
Deeply rooted in Heaven’s *Dé* [德],
comparable to the spine’s nodes.
Within are the Nine *Zhēn* [真],
white clouds drifting endlessly.
The *Shénfēng* [神風] circles eight times,
no *Yīng* [英]—just the *Qīngjīn* [青巾].
Riding the *Qì* [氣], it forms thunder,
the *Yùnǚ* [玉女] blows her *shēng* [笙].
The Five *Yīn* [音] burst forth,
the Seven *Qíng* [情] weep and laugh.
The Dao possesses supreme essence,
formless, nameless.
Flying void and receiving form,
the *Xiānzhēn* [仙箓]’s purple *Líng* [靈] script.
Sing this Hymn of Void and Form,
and the ultimate truth ascends beyond naming.

The world does not comprehend the *Zhēn* [真] Dao,
the *Fǎ Lún* [法輪] turns again and again.
How many departures and returns?
Forever submerged in the *Yùhǎi* [欲海].
Above these Three Realms,
within the flying void,
the *Zhēnwáng* [真王]’s sacred hymns,
their words matching the profound chapters.

Recite this a hundred times,
and you earn the degree of *Nán Gōng* [南宮].
Recite it a thousand times,
and the Heavenly *Zhēn* [真] will welcome you.
Recite it ten-thousand times,
the Dao is complete—
ascend to the Great Void,
transcend the Three Realms,
and attain the rank of *Xiān Gōng* [仙公].

Those who hear the sacred hymns,
the *Mówáng* [魔王] reveres their forms,
and commands the *Dìzhǐ* [地祇].
Escorts and sentinels attend,
pulling them free from the earthly gates.
The Five *Kǔ* [苦] and Eight *Nàn* [難],
the Seven Ancestors ascend and depart,
forever leaving the *Kǎoguān* [考官].
Their souls cross the *Zhūlíng* [朱陵],
refined and reborn—
this is the boundless,
the endless enlightenment.

There are hidden celestial texts,
all realms hold them in veneration.
Revealing them carelessly,
one falls into the *Dìyù* [地獄].
Disaster befalls the Seven Ancestors.
The Dao says:
These two chapters belong to the Celestial Emperor
and the *Yùqīng* [玉清] *Zhēnwáng* [真王]’s hidden hymns.
They are words of transformation,
of flying void, receiving form,
attaining the Dao, and ascending to *Zhēn* [真].
They exchange *Qì* [氣] and return to life—
the natural speech of the Great *Fán* [梵],
not the common words of mortals.

No melodious harmony,
no ornate tunes.
Thus called profound and mysterious,
hard to trace and examine.
Treasure of the Highest Heaven,
hidden in the *Shénxiāo* [神霄] *Yùqīng* [玉清] *Zhēnwáng* [真王]’s Eastern *Yùtáng* [玉堂],
awaiting the Celestial Emperor’s decree to be transmitted.

If a perfected one brings a heart of gold and precious sincerity,
and according to the ancient pattern pledges to the Ten Heavens,
then they may be entrusted with it.

The Dao says:
He who strays far from the Dao loses life,
who departs from essence scatters *Qì* [氣].
When *Qì* [氣] is still and the *Shén* [神] fades,
what remains is but flesh, bones, teeth, and hair—
a lifeless corpse.

For they cannot retain the *Shén* [神] to nourish the *Qì* [氣],
nor store the essence—
only like wood and stone,
without awareness or movement.
Thus, they are called corpses.

「The Most Venerable and Divine Sage, about to return *Qì* [氣] and summon *Shén* [神],
awakens wisdom within the corpse—
suddenly aware, they regain their former form,
returning to their original abode.
The hundred spirits come to pay homage,
reveling and feasting within the golden halls and jade chambers.

If they see the world’s entanglements,
the passions and desires that arise,
and the thoughts and emotions that move them,
unaware of their source,
they gaze upward at the Three Celestial Marks,
downward at myriad things,
and find joy in themselves.

The high perfected ones,
transforming the corpse and receiving form,
all attain the Dao in this manner.

In general, when the celestial course is exhausted,
the stars and sun wane or wax,
and humans face decline or death—
sickness, injury, or passing—
all who share this fate must
unify their hearts and observe fasts,
burn incense at the six times,
recite the scriptures tenfold,
and merit will swiftly descend,
dispelling all ill omens.
The merit is boundless,
universally benefiting the endless multitudes.

The Dao says:
Those whose learning is shallow,
whose Daoic attainment is yet incomplete,
whose celestial course is destined to end,
and whose bodies must pass through the Great Yin [太陰]
—at the moment of their demise—
should have their fellow disciples and perfected ones
burn incense for them and recite the scriptures ten times,
so that they may transform the corpse and receive form as prescribed.
Their souls and spirits ascend to the Southern Palace,
following their Daoic merit,
and are reborn on the appointed day,
unhindered in the Wheel of Rebirth,
thus attaining the state of Immortals.

The Dao says:
The transformation of the corpse and reception of form
is not merely rooted in human bodies,
