but may be equated with the grandeur of Heaven and Earth.
To welcome life and prolong *Qì*,
to invite merit and extend years,
is to align with the Dao without fail.

When Heaven and Earth’s courses reach their end,
the celestial lodges are disordered,
the sun and moon lose their regular eclipses,
the four seasons falter,
the balance of *Yīn* [陰] and *Yáng* [陽] is disrupted,
and calamities strike the realm—
plagues and poisons spreading,
the common folk dying in masses,
teachers and friends perishing—
all must observe fasts,
burn incense, and recite the scriptures.

For fasting and scripture recitation
carry immense merit.
Above, they dispel celestial disasters,
preserving and safeguarding the Emperor’s land.
Below, they avert poisonous harm,
delivering the common folk.
Life and death depend upon them,
and their blessings are immeasurable.
Thus, they are called boundless,
universally benefiting Heaven and humanity.

The Dao says:
All who possess this scripture,
capable of serving as Heaven’s and Earth’s sovereigns,
and the myriad folk,
and performing these meritorious deeds—
on days of calamity,
when they resolve to fast, burn incense,
and recite the scriptures ten times,
they cleanse the corpse’s defilements,
and their bodies ascend to Immortality.
All celestial beings record their names,
and ten thousand spirits guard them,
ranking them among the perfected,
and they may become holy ministers of the Golden Gate.

The celestial beings meticulously record
each person’s merits and offenses,
not missing even a hair’s breadth.
The True Kings of the Heavens also recommend them.

Those who attain the Dao must
penetrate and comprehend these profound words.

Within the Heavens, the Great *Vajra* [大梵]’s hidden speech,
the boundless sounds,
are inscribed in the ancient, sacred, and resplendent texts.
The True King commands the *Tàixuān* [太玄] *Shìmìng* [司命] *Shàngqīng* [上清] *Língxū* [靈虛] True Person
to record them with a vermilion brush,
so that those who wear and serve them
may transform the corpse and receive new life,
and be freed from sickness and misfortune—
like dust lifted by the wind.

All manner of worldly misfortunes,
corpse anomalies, and ill omens,
are to be addressed by vermilion inscription
and fire purification.

Or if one is forbidden to enter temples and ancestral shrines,
they shall immediately comply.

The Heavenly Scriptures and Treasure Maps
have characters each a broad length of one *zhàng* [丈].
The Heavenly True and Sovereign Person
once inscribed these texts,
establishing them as the correct sounds.
Those who know these sounds
and fast while reciting them
shall have all celestial beings dispatch
attendants of the True and Illustrious Spirits
to inspect their bodies,
record their diligent merits,
and report them to the Heavens.
Ten thousand spirits shall pay homage,
the Earth spirits shall attend at the gate,
and the True Kings of Great Merit
shall recommend them for profound enlightenment,
their virtue vast and limitless,
allowing them to roam the Three Realms
and ascend into the Golden Gate.

This sound dispels all obstacles,
averts all calamities,
delivers all beings,
and achieves all objectives—
the natural sound of the Heavenly True.

Thus, when recited to manifest
the flying ascent beneath Heaven’s gaze,
the Celestial Emperor sings from afar,
ten thousand spirits pay homage,
the Three Realms attend in reverence,
all deities bow their heads,
the spirits of the dead perish of their own accord,
the resonance of the *Línláng* [琳琅] echoes,
the Ten Directions are purified,
the rivers and seas fall silent,
the mountains and hills swallow smoke,
all living beings tremble in submission,
and the gathered Immortals are summoned.
Heaven is free of *Fēn’ài* [氛秽], Earth of *Quán* [祆] dust,
the *Mínghuì* [冥慧] is clear and penetrating—
a boundless and profound mercy.

The *Língbǎo* [靈寶] *Wúliàng* [無量] *Dùrén* [度人] *Miàojīng* [妙經] concludes here.
Volume the Sixtieth.»

The *Refining Qi and Transmuting into Immortal* Chapter

The Dao speaks: In days of old, within the Azure Sky’s beginning, the vast song of the Great Floating Earth of the Spacious Void, the Primordial Origin taught the method of refining qi and transmuting into Immortal—ascending to the Supernal Pure. When the Primordial Origin, Celestial Venerable, was about to expound this scripture, circling ten times in succession to summon the Ten Directions, only then did they arrive at the seat.

The Heavenly True Great God, the Supreme Sage of High Veneration, the Mysterious Conduct True Person—all the Ten Directions’ gods who refine qi and transmute into Immortals, born of the Dao of the Spirit, their bones transmuted, their lives sustained, the Functionary Celestial Officials recording the names of those who attain True and are delivered—those who refine qi and transmute into Immortals, countless in number, and all the great gods of the heavens, innumerable hosts, riding the qi and arriving.

This qi lingers, neither void nor substantial, neither form nor hue—mixed and boundless, without limit. Like clouds and mists of the celestial heights, its essence is beyond description. Its colors shift in nine hues, now radiant, now luminous, now crimson, now verdant, dazzling the nine heavens, illuminating the Three Realms. It cannot be likened to the divine mists and sacred hues of the heavenly gods, nor to the immortal clouds and auspicious colors.

It emanated from the Primordial Origin’s Jade Capital, the Azure Chamber, the Yawning Abyss, the Mysterious Cavern—spreading softly and dispersing. Within it, countless myriad lights appeared, each displaying a red carriage and green palanquin, feathered canopies and jade wheels, dragon banners and phoenix pavilions, night-light steeds, nine fierce beasts of the absolute, jade curtains suspended in space, purple canopies shading high, flowing essence-light, vast qi surging—illuminating the boundless expanse for three days and three nights.

The celestial wheels of the heavenly hosts, the sun and moon and stars, the symbols of the constellations, the golden tripods and jade gates, the jade pivots and precious scrolls, the celestial cords and cloudy domains, the lodges of the Vermilion Gorge—all moved in unison, their courses shifting, unlike the usual order.

At that time, the Heavenly Officials, the High Ministers and their attendants, each guarding their wheels and hubs, turning the pivots and levers, could not follow their accustomed paths. All were astonished, speaking among themselves: *"What auspicious cause is this? What strange transformation do we behold?"*

They then raised the Heavenly Drum to await the Great Chariot, striking nine times. Below, they observed the Jade Capital’s twelve mountains, the Spirit Sea’s sapphire waves, the divine ferry’s tides responding, the dragon’s coils emerging and vanishing—its roar like thunder, the great abyss vast and surging, the trickling streams swallowed—all unlike the time when the Heavenly Drum sounded.

As fate aligned, the heavenly palaces of the gods, unaware of the cause, saw this marvel. They consulted the ledgers and scrolls, preparing to ascend to the Imperial Terrace to inquire into their doubts.

Swiftly, they dispatched the Mighty Spirits, sweeping the clouds to clear the path, gathering the *shen* and ordering the Dao, harnessing dragons and tigers, bearing banners and flags—yet before they could proceed, divine mists rose in four directions. The Heavenly Wind blew gently, the Three Suns reversed their light, the Mysterious Qi clarified, the circular canopy rotated left and right, celestial harmonies resounded, and the profound song played in unison. A thousand realms shone with flowing light, the Eight Directions towered high, and the gathered True Ones all took their seats.

The Primordial Origin, Celestial Venerable, sat in the void, floating above the indigo-lotus flower, its petals myriad, the stamens encircling far and wide. Each petal broadened downward, covering all beneath the heavens. Each stamen’s jewel displayed a golden, wondrous world of the heavens. Within each realm, there were heavenly Immortals and sovereign kings, their crowns adorned with precious flowers, their robes swaying with immortal hues, riding cranes and phoenixes, moving without hindrance. The lotus stem was clear as crystal, piercing the void, its roots coiled in the Jade Sea, its circular diameter ten thousand *li* wide. Within it stood precious pavilions and jade halls, layered palaces of marvel—sacred visions beyond thought or measure.

To speak of it closely, it was like gazing at the Granary of the Sky from afar.

The Primordial Origin, Celestial Venerable, sat serenely upon the lotus, surveying the heavens below. His form, great and small, was equal and without flaw.

When the scripture was expounded once, the great saints of the heavens all proclaimed its excellence. At that time, the men and women of a single realm saw their light and shadow intertwine.

When the scripture was expounded twice, the divine manifestations became boundless. The Jade Capital and Kunlun Mountains were as a speck of dust, without limit.

When the scripture was expounded thrice, all phenomena and beings spoke in unison, praising the Dao’s law, chanting the True.

When the scripture was expounded four times, the Nine Heavens of the Upper Pure resounded, thirty-six thousand days and months shone together, the sun and moon radiant as one. The nine shades of decaying corpses, the bones of those yet undelivered, rose and became whole.

When the scripture was expounded five times, golden dragons and divine beasts competed in spewing winds and clouds, their mouths merging in nine hues, penetrating the profound and the obscure.

When the scripture was expounded six times, the men and women of a realm—those of the qi-laden kind—became youthful in visage, their bodies of gold and jade, unaware of death, nourished by qi and wandering as spirits.

When the scripture was expounded seven times, Heaven hung jade-green, Earth turned to gold, red dew dripped, and sweet nectar overflowed.

When the scripture was expounded eight times, the golden-winged ceased to be born, divine dragons sang at night, the Five Peaks gathered their mists, and the Eight Auspicious Signs manifested.

When the scripture was expounded nine times, the Jade Sea raised waves, the green mountains flourished, flying Immortals came to pay homage, their cloud-chariots and phoenix banners arrayed.

When the scripture was expounded ten times, the Earth-Store opened its sweet dew, the Seven Treasures sprouted uniformly, the stubborn and impure foundations transformed under auspicious light. At that time, all men and women of the realm, without exception, turned their hearts in devotion, all receiving protection and deliverance, attaining longevity.

The Dao speaks: At that time,
when the scripture was expounded once, the Eastern gods who refine qi and transmute into Immortals, the True Gods of the Absolute, innumerable hosts, floated through the void and arrived.
When the scripture was expounded twice, the Southern gods who refine qi and transmute into Immortals, the True Gods of the Absolute, innumerable hosts, floated through the void and arrived.
When the scripture was expounded thrice, the Western gods who refine qi and transmute into Immortals, the True Gods of the Absolute, innumerable hosts, floated through the void and arrived.
When the scripture was expounded four times, the Northern gods who refine qi and transmute into Immortals, the True Gods of the Absolute, innumerable hosts, floated through the void and arrived.
When the scripture was expounded five times, the Northeast gods who refine qi and transmute into Immortals, the True Gods of the Absolute, innumerable hosts, floated through the void and arrived.

When the scripture was expounded six times, the Southeastern gods who refine qi and transmute into Immortals, the True Gods of the Absolute, innumerable hosts, floated through the void and arrived.

When the scripture was expounded seven times, the Southwestern gods who refine qi and transmute into Immortals, the True Gods of the Absolute, innumerable hosts, floated through the void and arrived.

When the scripture was expounded eight times, the Northwestern gods who refine qi and transmute into Immortals, the True Gods of the Absolute, innumerable hosts, floated through the void and arrived.

When the scripture was expounded nine times, the Upper Realm gods who refine qi and transmute into Immortals, the True Gods of the Absolute, innumerable hosts, floated through the void and arrived.

When the scripture was expounded ten times, the Lower Realm gods who refine qi and transmute into Immortals, the True Gods of the Absolute, innumerable hosts, floated through the void and arrived.

When the tenfold recitation was complete, the True Gods of the Absolute who refine qi and transmute into Immortals from the ten directions all arrived together. The people of the land, both men and women, devoted their hearts in reverence.

Those who came heard the marvelous qi, filling and permeating everywhere, vast and boundless, countless in number. Their forms merged with qi, and qi merged with form—no east or west, no boundaries. Countless figures, male and female, appeared and vanished, hid and revealed themselves, filling the great land, their qi dispersed and abundant, beyond restraint.

Then, the Primordial Beginning smiled, extending the Five-Fingered Hand of Purple-Golden Radiant Palm, gathering the qi into a luminous display. Immediately, all celestial beings, the true assembly listening to the law, the boundless Dao’s awe-inspiring spirit, the silent void’s heavenly domains, all divine officials, the Great Thunderer of the Ghostly Hosts—all were within the radiant qi, bowing in homage, circling beneath the seat, eager to hear the essential teachings.

In the vast expanse, a hundred zhang above the earth, the Primordial Beginning ascended, summoning the True Gods of the Absolute, the Highest Saints, the Marvelous Conduct Immortals, the ten-directional gods who refine qi and transmute into Immortals—innumerable hosts—all entering the radiant qi.

All celestial beings saw the Primordial Beginning, the Highest Saint, like a jewel and pure lapis lazuli, the heavens and seas intermingling, boundless and azure, their light illuminating within and without, spotlessly clear.

They saw the ten-directional void’s luminous eyes, all the True Immortals gazing upward in song and praise, stepping through the void in worship.

Only a faint stirring was seen—entering and departing, light merging with qi, their whereabouts unknown.

The people of the land dispersed, the celestial realm restored to its proper order, the void open and unobstructed.

The Primordial Beginning, within the qi’s observation of existence and nonexistence, completed the scripture’s recitation. The assembled True Ones, overseeing salvation, entrusted it to me. At that moment, joy and celebration were beyond words.

The ritual matters were now fully known. The celestial beings returned to their stations. In a fleeting instant, the void and qi merged as one, leaving no trace of sound.

At that time, all celestial officials, the Three Celestial Stems and Two Celestial Branches governing the turning of fate, and all True Gods realized the strange transformation of qi and the shifting of spirits—none knew its origin—only recognizing that the Primordial Beginning, desiring to expound the supreme marvelous Dao of refining qi and transmuting into Immortals, first revealed this auspicious sign.

All True Immortals and celestial beings, encountering this scripture and its teachings, universally attained salvation and deliverance, preserving their celestial lifespan without harm. The land’s people revered the Dao, forgetting all else.

Refining qi clarifies qi, great qi strengthens qi, empty qi is profound, surging qi flows, qi of presence and absence, qi’s transformation into Immortality.

Words do not proclaim the essence, lips do not name the object—harmonized in compassion, differing in form yet united in kinship.

The land was secure, the people prosperous, rejoicing in eternal peace. The teachings began, and the land refined qi as one.

Understanding the Twelve Methods, merging qi with the Dao, merging the Dao with the heart, the heart with spirit, the spirit transforming into Immortality.

Revering the lineage, observing rites with respect, all attained the power to save the world.

The Dao speaks: All that the Primordial Beginning spoke within the scripture are the hidden sounds of the celestial emperors refining qi, transmuting into Immortals, generating spirits, and altering bones. They are also the secret names of the ten-directional True Gods of the Absolute who transmute qi into Immortals—the hidden names of refining qi and transmuting into Immortals—not the common words of the world.

The Highest Saints have already become True Persons, penetrating the Mysterious and fathoming the subtle. Those who master its chapters, their qi having ascended to sacred ground, entering the formless yet still refining it, when recited ten times, summon the celestial qi, causing the ten thousand emperors to transmute into Immortals, the heavens and earth returning to their origin. Qi flows like a deep spring—mountains refined into qi, earth refined into qi, heavens refined into qi, humans refined into qi. The Three Celestial Stems and myriad phenomena all refined into qi.

Qi has no fixed form, its existence and nonexistence indistinct. Those who recognize it transform spirit into Immortality. Those who fail to recognize qi do not know the Dao of refining.

With fasting and recitation of the scripture, true qi naturally arises. Refining qi naturally responds to the heavens and earth. The Three Celestial Stems cease their motion, the multitude of demons bound in form. Ghostly spirits perish, the dead revive, white bones transmute into Immortals.

Scholars of the highest learning, reciting it ten times, will have their essence and blood transform into qi, their qi reaching the hundred rivers. The five viscera and six entrails function without obstruction, naturally entering the void, their qi refining endlessly, enduring forever, transforming spirit into Immortality.

They will rank among the Five Emperors’ attendants, the Three Celestial Stems will emit mist, demonic spirits will lose courage, the Ghostly Officials will wield their whips, purging the nine impurities. Their qi will reach the utmost subtlety, healing the sick and reviving the dead, restoring life to those at death’s door.

This is because scholars who refine qi without clarity, whose bodies have not penetrated the True, can summon and control the myriad qi. Their qi ascends to the celestial gate, returns to the celestial gate, yet they do not know the formless. Their virtue can subdue the earthly spirits, binding demonic souls—but only to repel death and gain life through qi.

Lightly reciting this chapter will not radiantly manifest the qi. The flowing essence will congeal into jade, sealing the passways and bright hall. The Mysterious Officials will record the words, leaving behind lingering calamities.

With reverent offerings and proper rites, one’s gates will flourish, prospering through generations. Connected to virtuous causes, they will be untouched by ten thousand calamities, with divine spirits guarding the door.

This scripture is supremely honored, unmatched in the Jade Capital, saving innumerable beings, serving as the foundation for the ten thousand methods of refining qi and transmuting into Immortals.

The vast and august Dao/Way is difficult to fathom in its virtue.

The Dao/Way speaks: *"For those who recite this scripture ten times, the qi of all the heavens arrives. Countless myriads of ancestors, tormented in the underworld, once their suffering ends, all transform into qi. Without refining, this qi remains obscure and lifeless. Those who receive the qi through recitation are all immediately liberated, ascending to the Vermilion Palace, where they dwell for nine years before being reborn and becoming noble beings. Those who love learning this scripture, fulfilling its virtue and power, refine qi and transmute into Immortals, ascending to the Golden Gate and feasting in the Jade Capital.*

*Scholars who study it, reciting this scripture, are all immediately liberated, ascending to the Southern Palace. Mortals who recite it will prolong their lifespan, and all will attain the method of corpse dissolution. The form follows the qi as it departs, dissolving into the boundless. The spirit and soul merge with the qi, which coalesces into spirit—unbound by the underworld, they immediately regain their form, drifting through the cosmic qi.*

*This scripture is supremely subtle, universally liberating the boundless. All heavenly and human beings rejoice in its blessings, receiving immeasurable fortune and grace across life and death. It is a treasure of the heavens, not transmitted to the mortal world. Only the virtuous, bearing gold and jewels with sincere devotion, pledge to the heavens before passing it down. Leakage or negligence invites calamities upon nine generations, binding one to eternal service in the ghostly bureaucracy.*

*Five Emperors and sixty-four玉童玉女 (Jade Boys and Girls) attend this scripture, guarding and protecting those who receive it with divine texts. The Dao/Way speaks: In the first month, with prolonged fasting, recite this scripture to refine the qi into verdant green—this renews the qi of departed ancestors, severing the underworld’s ensnarement and ancestral lawsuits, liberating them to the Southern Palace. In the seventh month, with prolonged fasting, recite to refine the qi into empty whiteness, transforming the body into an Immortal, with heavenly records inscribed on jade talismans and white contracts, erasing death for rebirth. In the tenth month, with solemn fasting, recite to refine the qi into the Great Yellow—this benefits the Dao/Way’s kings and emperors, their ministers, parents, and children, summoning the qi of the Nine Heavens to bestow celestial fortune, stabilizing the nation’s destiny and ensuring eternal rule, forever securing peace for their realm. On the eight seasonal nodes, recite to refine the qi into the Nine Stars, manifesting as nine colors—wearing the Nine and treading the One, with Three on the left and Seven on the right, Two and Four supporting the body, Six and Eight flanking the feet. The qi permeates the Nine Palaces, transforming into the True Body, becoming a True Person of the Nine Palaces. On one’s birth day, recite to refine the qi into the Great Micro—from stem to branch, the Six Jia officials attend, one qi transforming into the strange, the spirit and soul clarifying, ten thousand qi following, avoiding all suffering. The spirit transforms into the Mysterious and Subtle, the Three Realms offering their wheels, the Five Heavens unfurling their banners, ten thousand spirits paying homage, their names recorded in heaven. With virtue and power fulfilled, they ascend to the Upper Clarity.*

*The Dao/Way speaks: On days of practice, one must bathe in fragrant waters, fast in seclusion, facing east, striking the teeth sixty-four times to reach the sixty-four heavens, mentally bowing sixty-four times, closing the eyes, and quietly contemplating oneself seated within the three-colored clouds—green, yellow, and white—inner and outer darkness enveloping. There appear a Green Dragon, White Tiger, Vermilion Bird, Dark Warrior, Lion, and White Crane arrayed on either side, with the sun and moon illuminating, the chamber glowing brightly. A round halo forms at the neck, its light radiating ten directions, so vividly clear. The secret incantation is thus:*

*'Supreme Mysterious Origin, the Most High Dao/Way Lord, summon forth from my body the Three Five Functionaries, left and right officials and messengers, the Jade Boys bearing incense, the Jade Girls transmitting words, the Five Emperors’ direct seals, the direct-day incense officials—sixty-four each—opening the gates as spoken.*

*Today’s auspicious joy, with prolonged fasting in the pure hall, practicing this supreme scripture to liberate countless beings, may my petition reach above, directly before the Supreme Sixteen Heavens’ Elemental Beginning Emperor, the Most Honored One.*

*Finished. Draw the qi thirty-two times, facing east and reciting the scripture.*

*The Supreme Beginning’s Boundless Liberation Uppermost Marvelous Scripture,*
*The Supreme Beginning’s Cavernous Mysterious Treasure Original Chapter,*
*Refining Qi and Transmuting into Immortals,*
*Nine Transformations to Liberate Beings.*

*The Dao/Way’s qi hides in its rhythms, merging and separating naturally, blending into the boundless and formless. The formless becomes empty essence, the qi and emptiness coexisting. The qi is the Supreme Truth, subtly entering the Mysterious Void. The qi is the nature of the Dao/Way, belonging neither to being nor non-being. Transformation and divinity are unified, the spirit and qi as one. The qi is neither vaporous nor breath, neither exhaled nor mist or smoke, neither form nor substance. The True Qi has no body, yet is named as such. The qi can generate and transform, harden and return, endure and persist. My qi is not a thing, yet it generates all things. My qi is without sentiment, yet it transforms into sentient beings. The qi is the Mother of the Dao/Way, the Great Spirit—moving, it becomes existence; still, it becomes emptiness.*

*It generates the Jade Capital, its lofty towers towering. The Great Luo’s Pure Clarity, the Golden Gate’s Jade Chambers, the Purple Pavilion’s Vermilion Courtyard. The True Qi flows between, forming the Uppermost Truth. Without qi, there is no radiance, no clarity, no establishment, no completion, no liberation, no birth—this is the Great Brahman, the Mysterious within the Mysterious.*

*Its branches and offshoots spread like linked rings, coiling and winding, violet qi and white mist, ever-shifting above and below, with firm boundaries between hardness and softness. High Saints and Spirit Immortals, ten thousand emperors and a thousand truths, all merge into one qi, refined and transmuted into Immortals. Like the world’s mountains and seas, palaces and gates, all things flourish in splendor—wise and foolish, the wise and the ignorant, rulers and officials—all arise from the qi. Refined and transformed, the qi knows no birth or death, no partiality. It responds as sensed. The qi’s marvels are transmitted: sometimes absent, sometimes present, faintly manifesting in the three conveniences—Rainbow Capital and Jade Pools, the Sun’s dew and the Flowering Abyss, the Great Path’s Brahman qi, encircling the ten directions, generating and liberating beings."*

The Immortal Deities, born from transformation, arise at the Southern Pole.
The Great Lord of Longevity, born from transformation, refines the qi.
The Great Divine of Transcendence, born from transformation, generates Dao-qi.
The Natural威威神, born from transformation, produces the Upper Purity.
The Purple-Qi Divine Lord refines and transmutes the Primordial qi.
From this origin, the True and Perfect Divine is born, the Transcendent Sage.
The qi abides, deathless—endlessly liberating beings.

Today, the Celestial Records are compiled, with all the heavens gathered in attendance.
The East: The Boundless Refines Qi and Transcends—Great Sage of Longevity, endlessly liberating beings.
The South: The Boundless Refines Qi and Transcends—Great Sage of Longevity, endlessly liberating beings.
The West: The Boundless Refines Qi and Transcends—Great Sage of Longevity, endlessly liberating beings.
The North: The Boundless Refines Qi and Transcends—Great Sage of Longevity, endlessly liberating beings.
The Northeast: The Boundless Refines Qi and Transcends—Great Sage of Longevity, endlessly liberating beings.
The Southeast: The Boundless Refines Qi and Transcends—Great Sage of Longevity, endlessly liberating beings.
The Southwest: The Boundless Refines Qi and Transcends—Great Sage of Longevity, endlessly liberating beings.
The Northwest: The Boundless Refines Qi and Transcends—Great Sage of Longevity, endlessly liberating beings.
The Upper Realm: The Boundless Refines Qi and Transcends—Great Sage of Longevity, endlessly liberating beings.
The Lower Realm: The Boundless Refines Qi and Transcends—Great Sage of Longevity, endlessly liberating beings.
The Ten Directions’ Most True Refined-Qi Transcendent Sages of Longevity, Liberating the World—Great Deities without measure.

Together, they ride the Brahman qi, transforming into chariots of purple clouds and jade-lined carriages, jade phoenix palanquins, yellow canopies, and white-wheeled coaches, harnessed by nine dragons and three-qi litters, with banners of misty clouds and bells of flowing fire. They strike the golden drums and shake the imperial chimes, with the Celestial Boys singing in unison before them and the Jade Maidens playing their pipes behind. Lion-demons part the way, roaring in song—*hūxiāo*—as the Eight Extremes unfold their maps, the Five Emperors ascend in smoke, with countless carriages and myriads of steeds, floating on qi and descending with radiant light, overseeing the True and liberating beings.

The Celestial Chancellors, the Supreme Palace of Great Purity, masters of the Dao and controllers of qi, the Great Divine of Transcendence, holding talismans and registers, all assemble before the Emperor, responding as needed to liberate beings.

The Celestial Records are strictly compiled.
A universal proclamation to the Three Realms: the Boundless Divine Homeland, the Curved Springs’ Domain, the Northern Capital of Luo City, the Three Officials and Nine Ministries, the Twelve River Sources.

The departed ancestors, countless eons of kin, lingering yin-corpses and drifting souls, those who have abandoned the Three Officials, whose qi has long congealed, whose past karma swirls like wind, drifting with malevolent roots.

The qi knows no birth or death, only the boundless void. Consciousness clings to qi, drifting without foundation. The virtuous transform into the Hall of Blessings; the wicked descend into the Pool of Flames. Nature follows deluded perception, carried by the qi’s flow.

As in life, they experience joy, fear, laughter, and tears.
The demonic qi acts as officials, interrogating them.
The wandering souls, filled with sorrow, recall their past lives.
The Primordial Beginning’s Daoic grace refines and sustains the qi.
Accumulated grievances dissolve into harmony; accumulated faults renew into virtue.
The dying qi disperses, extinguishing the roots of sin.
They cannot be detained, forced into ghostly throngs—by the Primordial符命, they ascend at the appointed hour.
Returning to the Boundless Primordial, merging with the Dao’s embryo.

The Six Directions’ Heavenly Demons, the fires of hell and ice of the abyss—
when karmic debts are exhausted, the qi is refined, and jade light pierces the void.
In stillness, the emptiness remains, with only the solitary and mysterious surviving.
The dead souls undergo refinement, transforming into celestial marvels.
The Dao is my body; the qi is my spirit.
To dwell in worldly delusion brings only sorrow.
Refining the qi to transcend—endlessly liberating beings.
The living body receives liberation, enduring through countless eons, turning with the wheel of time, equal to the heavens.
Forever liberating the coarse and stained, those bound by desire in the Heavenly Prison, whose souls and spirits pass unchecked, transcending the Three Realms to roam freely in Upper Purity.

The Heaven of Upper Purity: the most true celestial qi, the formless realm of Brahman practice.
The **East’s Sixteen Heavens**—
This qi, the Great Brahman, was originally nonexistent; its arising and cessation are all manifestations of the Dao’s true and perfect essence. It has no inherent form; the Dao’s transformation is the true essence itself. This is called *qi observation*, yet it is not a refined transformation that appears. It is the natural truth of the heavens, the profound mystery of the boundless void. It does not traverse the degrees of stars or dwellings; it exists beyond the formless realm, outside the division of yin and yang—all are the abodes of the Highest Saints.

The Heaven of Void Clarity and Brahman, the Emperor of Empty Space and Childlike Innocence.
The Heaven of Purple Primordial and Lordless, the Emperor of Brightness and Returning Home.
The Heaven of Yan Jing and Obscure Need, the Emperor of Void and Self-Sustaining.
The Heaven of Pure Rectitude and Piercing Extremes, the Emperor of Radiance and Double-Ju.
The Heaven of Clear Discernment and Primordial Yellow, the Emperor of Great Boundlessness and Lingering.
The Heaven of Weighty Depth and Empty Void, the Emperor of Dao and Timely Flowering.
The Heaven of Awakened Truth and Powerful Multitude, the Emperor of Not-Tai and the Sage-Instructor.
The Heaven of Pure Microcosm and Yellow Feather, the Emperor of Ghostly Passage and Oversight.
The Heaven of Rescuing Brilliance and Gazing Upon the World, the Emperor of Ever-Roaming Jiangyin.
The Heaven of Yuefu and Questioning Time, the Emperor of Su Lai and Birth.
The Heaven of Qi Revelation and Brightening, the Emperor of Celebration and Supreme Ancestor.
The Heaven of Mysterious Void and Luminous Range, the Emperor of Summoning and Gathering Souls.
The Four Uppermost Heavens, the Emperor of Qiang Chen and Flame.

The Heaven of Easy Transformation and Rectitude, the Emperor of Du Changsheng.
The Heaven of Solitary Whirlwind and Eight Ranges, the Emperor of Kong Jianming Lou.
The Heaven of Nine Extensions and Jade Stability, the Emperor of Wisdom and Firm Resolution.

The **South’s Sixteen Heavens**—
The Heaven of Danmo’s Wandering Transformation, the Emperor of Revered Truth and Platform.
The Heaven of Fighting Mirror and Void Chariot, the Emperor of Sand Kalpa and Child An.
The Heaven of Imperial Light and Uncrossed, the Emperor of Gazing and Bright Clarity.
The Heaven of Vermilion Mound and Radiant Light, the Emperor of Penetrating Clouds and No-Truth.
The Heaven of Purple Scenery and Severed White, the Emperor of Wan Yan Luo.
The Heaven of Descending Immortals and Primordial, the Emperor of Hu Niu and Pool.
The Heaven of Serene Arrival and Deep Gratitude, the Emperor of Lu Tang and Home.
The Heaven of Idle Jiang and Cicada, the Emperor of Sun and Spring.
The Heaven of Guest Host and True Virtue, the Emperor of Zeng He and Boundless Space.
The Heaven of Valley Mystique and Dao’s Use, the Emperor of Tu Ming and Sprouting Bamboo.
The Heaven of Li Bu and Bright Microcosm, the Emperor of Tuo He and Abundance.
The Heaven of Divine Hall and Responding, the Emperor of Following Palace and Secret Master.
The Heaven of Liberating Rectitude and Overcoming Ancestral, the Emperor of Shun Jiao and Bright Foundation.
The Heaven of Great Fire and Crimson Robes, the Emperor of Han Jue and Virtuous Sage.

The Azure Emperor of Distant Caverns, the Emperor of Jiangping and the Extended Grandson.
The Heaven of Hundred Transformations at Hài, the Emperor of Xī Flow and Yè Dú.

The Western Ten Sixteen Heavens:
The Heaven of Golden Departure and Radiant Initiation, the Emperor of Fù Miào, Bǐng Chāng.
The Heaven of Supreme Destiny and Mysterious Operation, the Emperor of Yù Zhǔ, Hóng Zhào.
The Heaven of Zhou’s Tranquil Expansion, the Emperor of Guangming, the King.
The Heaven of Treasure Song and Honorous Nurture, the Emperor of Míng Fàn Zǐ, the Jade Pendant.
The Heaven of Auspicious True Primordial, the Emperor of Lú Jiāng, Supreme Clarity.
The Heaven of Sacred Offerings Without Deity, the Emperor of Yǔn Zhī, the Virtuous Achiever.
The Heaven of High Descent and Refined Splendor, the Emperor of Bǎi Jiān, the Wén Yīng.
The Heaven of Dao’s Term and Extended Chronology, the Emperor of Qū Duò, the Mī.
The Heaven of Youthful Profit and Imperial Plow, the Emperor of Xī Yú, the Zhou Wēi.
The Heaven of Cauldron Spirit and Subtle Transformation, the Emperor of Lóng Héng, the Master.
The Heaven of Great Peace and Supreme Order, the Emperor of Zhèn Gōng, the Xiao Wén.
The Heaven of Exhaustive Splendor and Illuminated Immortals, the Emperor of Lù Luó, the Qiān.
The Heaven of Purple Metropolis and Broad Moon, the Emperor of Shì Zhū, the Cong Míng.
The Heaven of Cui’s Austere and Timely, the Emperor of Kuǎn Yú, the Xià Qióng.
The Heaven of Boundless Verdant Fall and Obscured Heaven, the Emperor of Jiāng Fēi, the Chóu Jīng.

The Northern Ten Sixteen Heavens:
The Heaven of Fish Sī’s Unified Truth, the Emperor of Qín Lái, the Protector.
The Heaven of Tiger’s Convergence and Thunderous Square, the Emperor of Xián Zhū, the Bàn Wǔ.
The Heaven of Enmity’s Abyss and Remaining, the Emperor of Tái Zhēn, the Huí Yuán.
The Heaven of Golden Purity and Rectified Aid, the Emperor of Zǒng Líng, the Sī Jī.
The Heaven of Imperial Profit and Refined Cultivation, the Emperor of Yàn Láo, the Fū.
The Heaven of Yáo’s Pivot and Refined Spirit, the Emperor of Gòu Huá, the Bó Huáng.
The Heaven of Divine Chant and Xiao’s Metropolis, the Emperor of Dìng Sī, the Kuáng.
The Heaven of Auspicious Manifestation and Mountain’s Symbol, the Emperor of Yàn Xiān, the Shòu Gōng.
The Heaven of Precious Clarity and Removing Suffering, the Emperor of Qín Yí, the Gē.
The Heaven of Duān’s Faith and Verification, the Emperor of Xī Qīng, the Rán Níng.
The Heaven of Governance Entering the Leopard’s Department, the Emperor of Tuō Qiáo, the Mèng Yīng.
The Heaven of Gēng’s Fortress and Dripping Spring, the Emperor of Dú Tíng, the Jiǔ Gōng.
The Heaven of Ghostly Repository and Historian’s Music, the Emperor of Lù Xī, the Zǎi Líng.
The Heaven of Fragrant Spirit and Sea Wheel, the Emperor of Shén Wén, the Qū Bīng.
The Heaven of Supreme Extremity and Celestial Clay, the Emperor of Zhào Tiān, the Tí Píng.
The Heaven of Everlasting Verdant Cavern and Primordial, the Emperor of Luò Chí, the Sòng Chéng.

Sixty-four Heavens, sixty-four Emperors.
The Heavens conceal their names, the Heavens conceal their titles.
Heaven’s void within, refining qi into spiritual script.
The Heavens conceal their rhymes,
The sound within qi, the honor within qi, the deity within qi, the great demon within qi, the spirit within qi.
Nine transformations, ten refinements, merging into Supreme Clarity.

Dao’s nature as qi, qi merging with emptiness.
If you cannot refine, recite this Cavern Text.
If you know how to refine, refine into the utmost essence.
Qi’s origin is unrefined; refinement is but a false name.
Because you are not precise, you indulge in love and hatred.
Karma becomes filth, emotion becomes blemish.
It harms your Dao-qi, strips your splendor.
Refine with stillness, guard with rectitude.
Refined long, qi becomes steadfast—naturally, Supreme Clarity emerges.
Hold the qi scripture, smooth and level, fourfold tranquility.
Internal gaze at the eight scenes, six voids flowing luminous.
Refine beyond human Dao, distant in alignment with the True.
The boundless mysteries, profound beyond measure.
Manifest divine truth, universally liberating heaven and man.
Today, rejoicing in receiving liberation, passing through the gates of the Heavens,
Severing all evil qi, slaying the roots of wickedness,
Ascending the Three Palaces, transforming into the Supreme Mysterious,
The True King within qi, overseeing and safeguarding refinement,
Entering and exiting without gate.

The Eastern Dipper’s qi is azure, the Western Dipper’s qi is white,
The Northern Dipper’s qi is dark, the Southern Dipper’s qi is crimson,
The Central Dipper’s Yellow Court—refine the five Dipper qi.
Residing in transformed form and hue, form and hue reaching truth.
Not mere illusion’s annihilation, but where Dao directs—transforming into an immortal, equal to spirits.
Azure qi guards the soul, white qi attends the spirit,
Crimson qi nourishes harmony, black qi circulates blood,
Yellow qi centers the embryo—ten thousand Dao cannot surpass.
The Azure Qi Immortal King, pure light, profound purity.
The Crimson Qi Immortal King, surging depths, imperial extremity,
The White Qi Immortal King, vast courtyard, condensed density.
The Black Qi Immortal King, northern obscurity, flourishing scene.
The Yellow Qi Immortal King, O Dan’s eloquent and luxurious.
The Five Qi Immortal Kings, the sovereigns of ten thousand spirits.
Riding the void, commanding celestial truth.
Dao-qi as dragon, the lynx carriage and tiger banner,
Thunder and lightning, flags and banners—majestic and resplendent.
Awakening the great celestial function, ascending to liberate man.
Transforming and subduing the flying void, crushing demons and binding gods.
Severely subduing the Northern Duān, transforming into an immortal by command.
Descending to sweep away inauspiciousness, the stale qi of the Six Heavens.
Foul blood surging in eight bursts, stagnant and unilluminated,
Coiled and attacking horizontally, grimy and foul—
Ghosts and spirits hide their traces, concealed among the world, bringing calamity to all.

The Emperor commands the Nine Elders,
Issuing decrees to subdue the Duān and Luó,
Lightning and fire lead the charge, whipping tigers and barking at dragons,
Echoing through the heavens, hurling fire into the nine layers.
Harming qi for a thousand li, refining into azure void.
The Great Emperor’s roar—jade purity unfurling.
Jewel wheels grinding the sky, purple landscapes dissolving.
Dare to obstruct? Repulse the Supreme True Ones.
Boiling the heavens, beheading, gold axes severing form.
Heaven’s rotation, earth’s revolution, winds howling, flames spewing.
Shaking divine mounds, the Purple Micro constraining the capital.
Ten thousand upon ten thousand, inspecting ghosts’ names.
The Three Officials’ drums and brushes, the Five Peaks standing in awe.
No hiding allowed—golden horses’ relay presenting all.
Universally proclaiming the boundless, all spirits heed.
The Three Realms’ Five Emperors, speaking to Supreme Clarity.
The Cavern’s luminous jade, the dragon’s transformation into divine vigor.
Vast and boundless eons, within primordial chaos.
Above, qi without hue; below, no abyss.
Within, the void’s cavern—refining qi into heaven.
Above and below heaven, no darkness, no obscurity,
No form, no shadow, no limit, no end.
The boundless Great Void, vast and lightless.
Refining qi into crimson clarity, naturally ascending.
Primordial Beginning’s tranquility, the nine voids transforming into immortals.
Refining qi into existence—clouds, mists, and vapors.
Refining qi into nothingness—spiritual realms transforming into immortals.
Qi congealing into Great Void, the divine scripture’s cavernous chapters.
Fire refining water into jade—ten brilliances, resplendent.
Eight corners with drooping thorns, golden script upon azure heaven.

The jade script shines within the void, where tigers lie and dragons slumber.
The phoenix’s qi and crane’s traces, stars hooked like fishing lines, all interconnected.
The Three Primordials stand firm, their oaths echoing through ten thousand heavens.
They uphold the eternal order—preserving life through boundless eons.

The **Dharma**-bearing qi fills the **Brahma** realm, its patterns vast and unfolding.
Primordial **Qi** flows and transforms, birthing sixty-four heavens.
Revolving through colorless void, circling the ten directions.
Spinning through the void’s eternal course, ascending from crimson to mysterious depths.

Eighty-one divisions, all **Qi** ascending to the Primordial Beginning.
Nine luminous essences blend—**Qi** entering the **Xuanxuan** (profound void).
Within the profound void, the **Taihuang** (Great Sovereign) and **Shangdi** (Highest Deity) reside in lofty truth.
Bathing in wondrous **Qi**, the **Yulang** (Jade Beam) resounds with celestial hymns.
Pillars of fire refine and forge—melodies echoing through clouded camps.
Within the marvelous void, **Qi** is embraced—divine winds merging with mist.

Purple essence refined into jade-like beauty, yellow and white transforming into immortals.
Young green and crimson elixir, harmonized into supreme truth.
Natural refinement and transformation—divine truth spontaneously arises.
Within truth lies the divine, the Great Lord of Eternal Life.

They support and cherish the **Qinghua** (Azure Flower), gazing upon the **Didi** (Celestial Consorts).
Feasting in the Nine Palaces, their guests are heavenly jade attendants.
The **Taiyi** (Great Unity) kneads the **Nihuan** (Earthly Pill), dwelling in the **Xingming** (Life Command) Palace.

The **Tao** and **Kang** (Peach of Immortality) together extend—**Qi** nurturing divine spirits.
**Huang-Lao** (Yellow Emperor-Laozi) refinement and transformation—preserving life’s root essence.

Ascending to the **Shangqing** (Upper Clarity) realm, entering and exiting the **Huafang** (Flower Hall).
Within the Eight **Ming** (Obscurities), in the realm of subtlety.
Below, they govern the mortal frame—the **Nihuan** (Earthly Pill) and **Ganggong** (Vermilion Palace).
Within, they merge with **Tai xu** (Great Emptiness), void as the **Dao**’s mother.

**Qi** accompanies the void in dwelling—transformations without end.
They blend with myriad deities, nine transformations returning to essence, ten thousand **Qi** becoming immortals.
The **Dao** of immortals values life—boundless degrees of enlightenment.

Divine canopy covers the brain palace, opening the celestial gate above.
Ascending to the heavens, souls are bound—sin and virtue governed by prohibitions.
Hosted destinies and **yin-yuan** (retributive causes), all receive universal enlightenment.
**Qi** of death gives birth to divine spirits, spirits transforming into immortals, ascending to hear all heavens.

Above all heavens, each has its own gate of birth.
Within lies the void’s chapter of **Qi** refinement—sacred texts of immortals and saints,
Their words resonating with lofty truth.

---
**First Heaven’s True Sovereign, the Emperor of High Clarity, refines **Qi** in the Azure Void—King of the True Sound:**
Heaven’s light is faint and subtle, divine **Qi** endless.
Soaring through the void’s depths, left and right **Qi** flows.
Emerald waves ripple—refining this jade-like essence.
What guides the void? Crossing the Big Dipper, ascending the **Pu** (Net) constellation.

---
**Second Heaven’s True Sovereign, the Emperor of High Clarity, refines **Qi** in the Azure Void—King of the Green True Sound:**
Divine steeds move without trace, my **Qi** does not invade.
The **Dao** is the **Qi**-heaven, the royal halls linked in succession.
The **Lingchang** (Divine Maiden) wears the moon, the dragon chariot departs at dawn.
Gathering clouds, flying with fragrance, the sea is leveled beneath snow.

---
**Third Heaven’s Mysterious Sovereign, the Emperor of High Clarity, refines **Qi** in the Azure Void—King of the Pin True Sound:**
The Highest Deity’s Nine Gates, the sun’s light as their foundation.
**Qi** swallows morning mists—refined to endure eternally.
Blue and red hues merge, pouring into my **Huangfang** (Yellow Hall).
The **Dongzhi** (Cavern Mushroom) is ready to be savored—
Feasting on the young, celebrating the virtuous.

---
**Fourth Heaven’s Marvelous Sovereign, the Emperor of High Clarity, refines **Qi** in the Azure Void—King of the Azure True Sound:**
Heaven’s jade is azure, its resonance clear like chimes.
**Qi** refined enters the void—forms forgotten in their essence.
Transforming into divine, then into immortal—
Externally profound, internally golden.

The **Dao** receives its deepest mysteries—
Not held by the mundane world.

---
**Fifth Heaven’s Supreme Sovereign, the Emperor of High Clarity, refines **Qi** in the Azure Void—King of the Yellow True Sound’s Chapter:**
The phoenix chariot and tiger’s **Zhang** (stand)—
Eastern greetings to the **Fusang** (Peach Tree).
Purple script coiled around the dragon, the **Xianbo** (Immortal Lords) hang their **Yang** (ornaments).
**Qi** of the sun like a breath—
Gazing upward, I rule the crimson light.
Paying homage to the Emperor, I transform into immortal—
Refining **Qi** within the Yellow.

---
**Sixth Heaven’s Pure Sovereign, the Emperor of High Clarity, refines **Qi** in the Azure Void—King of the Purple True Sound’s Chapter:**
Red and black not yet divided—
Seeking the egg from the hen.
Swallowing that golden hue, **Qi** merges with the **Xiqí** (subtle and refined).
Refining bones into void, **Qi** flowing with form.
My **Dao** is profound and subtle—
What do vulgar immortals know?

---
**Seventh Heaven’s Void Sovereign, the Emperor of High Clarity, refines **Qi** in the Azure Void—King of the Red True Sound’s Chapter:**
The white tiger holds the **Bi** (jewel)—
Turning this into the crimson sun.
Refining **Qi** into **Peng-Heng** (boundless longevity), knowing the Three in One.
The immortal’s jade face transforms into the Nine **Qi** (nine heavens).
The void is dark—
Seated upright in the jade chamber.

---
**Eighth Heaven’s Imperial Sovereign, the Emperor of High Clarity, refines **Qi** in the Azure Void—King of the Green True Sound’s Song:**
Green emerges from azure and yellow—
Swift yet without haste.
My spirit as the chariot, clouds as its canopy—
Rolling wheels through the heavens.
The jade maid’s splendor unique—
I ride eastward, one smile and the **Er** (earrings) fall.
The depths hold twin fish.

**Ninth Heaven’s Imperial Sovereign, the Emperor of High Clarity, refines **Qi** in the Azure Void—King of the White True Sound’s Chapter:**

The Vermilion Terrace ascends a thousand steps—
How does the flying immortal enter?

Refining **Qi** like a drawn thread,
Dragon’s waist and jade **Heng** (vessel) in harmony.
Cloud nectar restores youth,
**Qi** becomes the Eight **Feng** (winds).
Morning feasts at Kunlun,
Renown ascends the Brocade Hill.

**Tenth Heaven’s Golden True Sound Imperial Sovereign, refines **Qi** in the Azure Void—King of the Mysterious True Sound’s Song:**

I hold the **Tuo** (bellows) key—
Refining **Qi**, dispelling omens.
Stars descend upon the golden arc,
The celestial rope flows five feet long.
Clad in clouds, gazing upon radiance—
Sipping the Mysterious **Ye** (dew).

The **Dao** transforms into the changing immortal—
The imperial lineage’s deep verdancy.
Above the Three **Jing** (scenes/heavens),
Within the flying void,
The True King’s song resounds—
Its melody echoes the Azure Chapter.

Recite it a hundred times,
And one’s name ascends to the Southern Palace.
Recite it a thousand times,
And the True King’s protection welcomes you.
Ten thousand recitations complete the **Dao**—
Ascending to the Great Void,
Transcending the Three Realms,
Ranking among the Immortal Lords.

Hearing the sacred sound,
Demonic kings restrain their forms;
By imperial decree, the Nine Heavens are guarded,
Divine attendants escort and welcome.
Emerging from the earthly gate,
**Qi** turns black to crimson—
A hundred knots at the Great Pass,
Three punishments and four executions,
Five paths and six calamities,
Ancestral **Qi** ascends and transforms,
Forever departing from the Ghostly Palace.
The soul crosses to Zhu Ling,
**Qi** refines into rebirth.

This is called **Wu Liang** (boundless),
Universal salvation without end.

There are hidden celestial texts,
All revered by the heavens.
Revealing them carelessly leads to the Hell of Falling,
**Qi** lost, ancestral essence extinguished.

The **Dao** says: These Azure Chapters are all the sacred words of the Heavenly Sovereigns,
The hidden sounds of refining **Qi** to become an immortal True King.
They are the speech of the Great **Fan** (Dharma),
Not the common words of the mortal world.
Without melodious charm,
Without ornate phrasing—
Thus called Mysterious and Profound,
Difficult to trace in detail.

Treasured by the heavens,
Hidden in the Purple Micro Palace of the Mysterious Capital,
Transmitted by the Mysterious Art every **40,000 kalpas**.
If a perfected adept offers a golden treasure with sincere devotion,
And according to the ancient formula swears an oath to the High Clarity,
Then it shall be entrusted to them.

The **Dao** says: Even the **Qi** of heaven and earth has its limits.
The Three Lights refining **Qi** also have their ebb and flow.
The most sacred divine person also has their **Qi** destiny.
The **Qi** of shallow learners may also bring fatal harm.
All who suffer such calamities
Should, in accordance with the pact, wholeheartedly observe fasts,
Burn incense at all six times,
Recite the sutra ten times in rotation—
Blessed **Qi** descends instantly,
Harmful **Qi** disperses like dew.
Boundless texts,
Universal salvation without end.

The **Dao** says: For those of shallow understanding or whose **Qi**-refining lacks success,
When their time of extinction approaches,
Their **Qi** halts at the Great Yin (Darkness).
At the moment of passing,
Their perfected adepts should burn incense for them,
Recite the sutra ten times over,
And refine their corpse-**Qi** according to the method—
Their soul and spirit shall ascend to the Southern Palace,
Following their own merit,
And be reborn on the calculated day.
The Wheel of Rebirth never ceases,
Transforming their spirit into an immortal.

The **Dao** says: When one’s **Qi** destiny in heaven and earth is exhausted,
They must also observe fasts,
Burn incense, and recite the sutras.
When celestial **Qi** is disordered,
The sun and moon lose their light,
They must also observe fasts,
Burn incense, and recite the sutras.
When the Four **Qi** (seasons) are misaligned,
And yin and yang are unbalanced,
They must also observe fasts,
Burn incense, and recite the sutras.
When a land suffers disaster,
And martial **Qi** rises in all directions,
They must also observe fasts,
Burn incense, and recite the sutras.
When pestilential **Qi** spreads,
And countless people perish,
They must also observe fasts,
Burn incense, and recite the sutras.
When a teacher or friend’s **Qi** is exhausted,
They must also observe fasts,
Burn incense, and recite the sutras.

The fasts and recitation of sutras,
Their virtue and power are most profound.
Above, they dispel celestial calamities,
And protect the imperial throne.
Below, they avert harmful **Qi**,
And save the countless people.
In life and death, they undergo refinement—
Their blessings are immeasurable.
Thus it is called **Wu Liang** (boundless),
Universal salvation for both heaven and man.

The **Dao** says: All who possess this sutra,
For the sake of heaven, earth, the imperial sovereigns, and the countless people,
Should perform these virtuous deeds.
On days of **Qi** calamity,
They must vow to observe fasts, burn incense,
And recite the sutra ten times over.
All shall be recorded by the heavens,
Ten thousand spirits shall attend as guardians,
Ranked among the holy ones,
And shall attain to become the golden-gated ministers of the Sacred Emperor.

The heavens record all deeds and misdeeds without omission.
Even the True King within the **Qi** shall recommend you—
Those who attain the **Dao** shall truly comprehend these profound words.

The hidden speech of the Great **Fan** within the heavens,
Boundless sounds of the **Dao**,
Refining **Qi** to become an immortal—
The nine-palace Mysterious texts.

The Heavenly Sovereign knows the origin of **Qi**,
Obtains the root of **Qi**—
When **Qi** transforms and disperses,
Its horizontal and vertical shifts form the text,
Written in cinnabar script,
Eight corners radiant,
Layered jade and ordered pearls—
Its square measures a zhang,
Four scenes brightly illuminated.
In ancient times, the text was inscribed,
To establish the proper sound.

The one who knows this sound and can fast and recite it,
Refines **qi** and cultivates the True,
His spirit hidden in the void and the dark—
The True Kings of the heavens below observe his form,
Record his merits and labors,
And present them above to the heavens.
Ten thousand spirits pay homage in worship,
Earthly deities attend at the gate,
The Great Merit True King recommends him to the Highest True,
His **Dao** complete, he attains it—
Roaming the Three Realms,
Ascending into the Golden Gate.

This sound refines all,
Nurtures all,
Transforms all,
Illuminates all—
The natural sound that refines **qi** and becomes an immortal.

Thus, when it is recited, he achieves flight beneath the heavens,
The Celestial Sovereign sings from afar,
Ten thousand spirits pay homage in worship,
The Three Realms attend at the hall,
All spirits bow their heads,
Ghostly essences vanish on their own,
**Qi** surges through the spirit palace,
Jade tones resound spontaneously,
The celestial sphere trembles with sound,
The **Dao** clears the stagnant and purifies the turbid,
The sea calms, the mountains rise,
Emerald mists encircle the golden city,
Cranes gaze upon the ramparts,
The immortal capital fills with emptiness,
Ten thousand immortals gather in procession,
Purple canopies and vermilion banners unfurl—
Heaven and Earth refine **qi**,
Transforming and changing the Celestial Capital,
Swiftly transcending the dark and obscure,
A boundless, profound, and profound **virtue**.

*Completes Volume Sixty of the Supreme Treasure Sutra of Infinite Degrees for Liberating Beings, the Supreme Excellent Scripture*
*Volume Sixty-One*

「The Eternal Cessation of the Wheel of Rebirth (品)

The **Dao/Way** speaks: In days of old, when the Azure Sky first emerged,
The Great **Dao/Way** floated in the **Void** and sang of the Mysterious and Illuminated Black Earth,
And received the **Eternal Beginning’s** instruction to liberate beings and eternally cease the Wheel of Rebirth in the Infinite Supreme Grade.

When the **Eternal Beginning** (元始) **Celestial Venerable** (天尊) was to proclaim this **sutra/scripture**,
He circled ten times through the ten directions,
To summon the ten quarters,
And then approached His seat.

The **Heavenly Pure** (天真) **Great Spirit** (大神),
The **Highest Sage** (上圣) **Exalted Venerable** (高尊),
The **Wondrous Conduct** (妙行) **True Person** (真人),
And the countless **unrestrained** (无鞅) **assemblies** (数众),
All rode upon the **Void** and came.

With **jade steeds** (玉马) and **cloud chariots** (云轺),
**Rainbow mists** (彩霞) and **flowing veils** (流霭),
**Vermilion carriages** (丹舆) and **crimson wheels** (彤毂),
**Fragrant blossoms** (阵萼) and **flying perfumes** (飞香),
The **three luminaries** (三景) gathered in pristine clarity,
Their radiance converging in the **Great Emptiness** (太空),
For seven days and seven nights.

The **celestial hosts** (诸天) displayed **dragon script** (龙文) upon the sun,
And **treasures** (宝字) upon the moon,
**Crane-observed star pavilions** (鹤观星楼),
**Abodes of constellations** (宿舍机躔),
At once halting the **Wheel of Rebirth** (轮),
With **dragon winds** (龙风) and **phoenix rains** (兼雨),
**Phoenix qi** (凤气) forming mountains,
The sky unclouded,
The **four symbols** (四象) ascendant and luminous.
Within a single realm—its lands, mountains, rivers, forests, and trees—
All stretched flat as one, with no high or low,
Its soil soft as **purple-gold** (紫金),
Encompassing the **four elements** (水火),
With **pure brilliance** (净莹) intermingling and unifying,
No hue distinct.

The **assemblies of spirits** (众真) attended His seat,
While the **Eternal Beginning** **Celestial Venerable** (元始天尊) sat in **Void** upon the **floating, colorless sea of light** (无色海光),
With the **immovable golden mountain** (金山) standing firm,
And **auspicious manifestations** (瑞相) arrayed in solemn grandeur.

After proclaiming the **sutra/scripture** once,
The **Great Saints** (大圣) of the ten quarters simultaneously extolled its virtues,
And at that time, all men and women within the realm
Beheld the **True Form** (道真) of the **Dao/Way**,
And loathed to abandon their lives, spurning birth and death.

After proclaiming the **sutra/scripture** twice,
They awakened to the **Three Realms of Existence** (三业),
As though flames gathered in kindling.

After proclaiming the **sutra/scripture** thrice,
They observed the **filth of their bodies** (身秽),
And aspired to attain the **Dharmakāya** (法体).

After proclaiming the **sutra/scripture** four times,
They pitied the **Three Realms** (三界),
Their minds revolving like wheels.

After proclaiming the **sutra/scripture** five times,
Their worldly illusions dissolved,
Their thoughts returning to the **True Dao/Way** (正道).

After proclaiming the **sutra/scripture** six times,
The **Dao/Way** could elevate their **spirits** (神),
Unsoiled by coarse defilements.

After proclaiming the **sutra/scripture** seven times,
They knew their **past lives** (宿命),
And held no regard for **communicating with spirits** (通灵).

After proclaiming the **sutra/scripture** eight times,
They abided in this **True and Eternal** (真常),
And eternally ceased the Wheel of Rebirth.

After proclaiming the **sutra/scripture** nine times,
Their lives surpassed those of Heaven and Earth,
And they attained **True Eternal Life** (真长生).

After proclaiming the **sutra/scripture** ten times,
They ascended to **Dao/Way** realization,
And eternally ceased birth and transformation.
At that time, all men and women within the realm
Could not help but incline their hearts,
All receiving protection and liberation,
And attaining eternal life.

The **Dao/Way** speaks: At that time,
When the **Eternal Beginning** **Celestial Venerable** (元始天尊) proclaimed the **sutra/scripture** once,
The **Multifarious-Hearing Great Spirit** (多闻大神) of the **Infinite Supreme Grade** (无极无量品) in the East,
And the **unrestrained assemblies** (无鞅之众),
Floated upon the **Void** and arrived.

When the **sutra/scripture** was proclaimed twice,
The **Multifarious-Eyed Great Spirit** (多目大神) of the **Infinite Supreme Grade** (无极无量品) in the South,
And the **unrestrained assemblies** (无鞅之众),
Floated upon the **Void** and arrived.

When the **sutra/scripture** was proclaimed thrice,
The **Firmly Abiding Great Spirit** (坚住大神) of the **Infinite Supreme Grade** (无极无量品) in the West,
And the **unrestrained assemblies** (无鞅之众),
Floated upon the **Void** and arrived.

When the **sutra/scripture** was proclaimed four times,
The **Stabilizing the Sea Great Spirit** (定海大神) of the **Infinite Supreme Grade** (无极无量品) in the North,
And the **unrestrained assemblies** (无鞅之众),
Floated upon the **Void** and arrived.

When the **sutra/scripture** was proclaimed five times,
The **Divine Utilization Great Spirit** (神用大神) of the **Infinite Supreme Grade** (无极无量品) in the Northeast,
And the **unrestrained assemblies** (无鞅之众),
Floated upon the **Void** and arrived.

When the **sutra/scripture** was proclaimed six times,
The **Authoritative Transformation Great Spirit** (权化大神) of the **Infinite Supreme Grade** (无极无量品) in the Southeast,
And the **unrestrained assemblies** (无鞅之众),
Floated upon the **Void** and arrived.

When the **sutra/scripture** was proclaimed seven times,
The **Dao/Way-Sound Great Spirit** (道聪大神) of the **Infinite Supreme Grade** (无极无量品) in the Southwest,
And the **unrestrained assemblies** (无鞅之众),
Floated upon the **Void** and arrived.

When the **sutra/scripture** was proclaimed eight times,
The **Mysterious Concealment Great Spirit** (玄藏大神) of the **Infinite Supreme Grade** (无极无量品) in the Northwest,
And the **unrestrained assemblies** (无鞅之众),
Floated upon the **Void** and arrived.

When the **sutra/scripture** was proclaimed nine times,
The **Eternal Life Great Spirit** (永生大神) of the **Infinite Supreme Grade** (无极无量品) in the Upper Realm,
And the **unrestrained assemblies** (无鞅之众),
Floated upon the **Void** and arrived.

When the **sutra/scripture** was proclaimed ten times,
The **Pacifying Transformation Great Spirit** (息化大神) of the **Infinite Supreme Grade** (无极无量品) in the Lower Realm,
And the **unrestrained assemblies** (无鞅之众),
Floated upon the **Void** and arrived.

After ten rounds of proclamation,
The **Great Spirits** (天真大神) of the **Infinite Supreme Grade** (无极无量品) from the ten directions
All arrived at once.
All men and women within the realm
Inclined their hearts and bowed in reverence,
And in the heavens where they dwelled,
In the palaces where they resided,
They all beheld the **Eternal Beginning** ascending to His seat in majestic splendor,
Proclaiming the **sutra/scripture** and expounding the **Dharma/Teaching** (法),
Illuminating the Infinite Ten Directions,
With radiance as clear as daybreak.
Their forms appeared, and they spoke to one another:
*"We, though attaining the ranks of the celestial hosts,
Have yet to escape the Wheel of Rebirth,
Our lives exceeding five kalpas,
And we have not yet freed ourselves from birth and death,
Our forms bright yet unspared from decay.
Now we hear the Celestial Venerable’s desire
To proclaim the Great **Dharma/Teaching** (法),
To eternally cease the Wheel of Rebirth,
And we begin to awaken,
Entering the True **Dharma/Teaching** (法) gate,
Escaping the net of birth and death."*

The arriving **unrestrained assemblies** (无鞅之众)
Sank half the realm into dense mists and fine rain,
An unchecked tide, impossible to restrain.

Thus, the **Eternal Beginning** shook out His robes and leaned upon His table,
Emitting a **Great Radiance** (大明) from His crown,
Illuminating all ten directions of the world,
The **Infinite Supreme Grade** **Dao/Way-True** (仙真) realms—
Each realm within the Infinite,
Where the **assemblies of immortals** (仙真) and **spirits** (众真) resided,
Beheld the **immortal kings** (仙王),
Who came to lead their subjects,
And gather at the **Dharma/Teaching** seat.

They also saw the **celestial hosts** (诸天) each bearing
**Strange treasures** (奇华) and **wondrous fruits** (异果),
**Jade fungi** (玉芝) and **immortal grasses** (仙草),
As offerings of reverence.

Some **immortal kings** (仙王),
Residing in great palaces,
Practiced the **Dao/Way-Immortal** arts (仙业),
And governed the **celestial administration** (天政),
Their hearts weary of sensory pleasures.
Or they sought **radiant light** (光华) and **elixir flavors** (咽味),
Feasting on **True Scenery** (真景),
Urging the **assemblies of spirits** (众真) to
Teach them **various wondrous matters** (种种妙事),
And gather the **heavenly and human** (天人) within the assembly.
All were aware, their minds and eyes fixed,
Yet dared not speak their thoughts.

The **Eternal Beginning** then slowly opened His **thunderous voice** (雷音),
And proclaimed to the Great Assembly:

*"To escape birth and death,
To not fall into wandering,
One must first attain **no-mind** (无心).

If you attain **no-mind** (无心),
Then the **Three Realms of Existence** (三业) will cease.
All beings, lost in delusion,
Take the **perception of the senses** (指识) as **mind** (心),
Distinguishing **having and not having** (有无),
And measuring **birth and death** (生死).
Yet **mind** (心) is but a false name,
A false name by which we grasp the false.
Thus, **mind** (心) is empty and illusory.
The enlightened know this—
Its essence is the **Original Dao/Way** (道元),
What concern has it for **mind’s affairs** (心事)?
To cling to **mind** (心) and be attached to **phenomena** (境),
Is to dwell within birth and death.
If you abandon the false **mind** (妄心),
You will not dwell within birth and death,
And thus eternally cease the Wheel of Rebirth.
Even the **Great Celestial Hosts** (大天偠),
The **High True** (高真) **Imperial Sovereigns** (帝王),
Through **no-mind** (无心),
Attained the ranks of **Saints** (圣真),
And naturally realized the **Dao/Way**.

To take or reject based on **mind** (心),
To incline toward death or life,
Is never the ultimate truth.
Even the **refinement of qi** (服气炼化),
The **consumption of elixirs** (饵药) to prolong life,
Are but **small vehicle** (小乘) practices for sensory response,
And none can truly **liberate** (解脱) or **ascend to the formless Dao/Way** (升入无形之道).

If you do not let **mind** (心) sway you,
Nor follow **thoughts** (念) and **emotions** (情),
And forget both **mind’s traces** (心迹) and **its movements** (用情),
Then you will behold the **True Body of the Dao/Way** (道体),
Eternally cease the Wheel of Rebirth,
Dwell not within birth and death,
And align with me—
Here, within the **colorless sea of light** (无色海光),
Proclaiming such **Dharma/Teaching** (法) as this."*

If one acts with **mind** (有心),
Then all **Dharma-protectors** (护法)—heavenly beings, humans, dragons, and ghosts—
Shall each depart in flight,
And shall not come here to pay homage and revere.

Thus it is known:
**Dao/Way** is **non-mind** (无心),
The **True Form** (真形) is **emptiness** (无),
Equality in **Dharma** (法) is the **Body** (身),
And all deeds of the **Ten Saints** (十圣) remain unknown.

Words spoken from the mouth
Are the **edicts of the Heavenly Emperor** (天帝勅).
If **mind** (心) schemes and calculates,
Then **demonic essences** (魔精) will attach themselves,
And one shall inevitably descend into the **Evil Paths** (恶道).

**Yuan Shi** suddenly emerged from the **Sea of Light** (海光),
Merging into the **colorless Great Primordial Void** (无色太玄空),
Suspended a **treasure pearl** (宝珠),
As large as a millet grain,
Within the **Great Emptiness** (太虚),
A thousand *zhang* above the earth.

**Yuan Shi** ascended and summoned:
The **Heavenly True Gods** (天真大神),
The **Supreme Saints and Exalted Ones** (上圣高尊),
The **Mysterious Conduct True Persons** (妙行真人),
The **Ten-Directional Boundless Great Dao/Way’s Mighty Spirits** (十方无极大道威神),
And countless **unfettered assemblies** (无鞅数众),
All entered the **Treasure Pearl**.

Heavenly beings gazed upward,
Only seeing a **gentle breeze** (拂拂) entering through the pearl’s mouth.
Once inside, their whereabouts became unknown,
The people dispersed, the land returned to level,
No longer tilted or sunken.
**Yuan Shi** then, within the **Treasure Pearl**,
Completed the **Sutra’s** (经) exposition.
The **True Ones** (众真) oversaw the transmission,
And entrusted it to me.
At that moment, joy and celebration were beyond words,
The **Dharma-affairs** (法事) were fully accomplished,
The heavens resumed their stations,
And in an instant, all was silent—no trace remained.

At that time, those who encountered the **Sutra’s Dharma** (经法)
Universally attained awakening,
In **mystical silence and luminous emptiness** (玄默虚明),
Unattached to **void-illusions** (空见),
All bowed in reverence, their hearts filled with virtue.
They did not kill or harm,
Nor harbor jealousy or resentment,
Nor commit lewdness, theft, gluttony, or lust,
Nor hold hatred or deceit.

Their speech was unadorned,
Their words held no malice,
Their hearts were uniformly compassionate,
And even those of differing natures became kin.

The land was secure, the people prosperous,
Rejoicing in eternal peace.
The **Sutra’s teachings** (出教) began,
And the entire realm aligned with the **Dao/Way**.
Those with sincere devotion,
Who revered and followed with ritual,
All attained the power to **deliver the world**.

The **Dao/Way’s words**:
All that **Yuan Shi, the Heavenly Venerable** (元始天尊) spoke within the **Sutra**,
Are the **inner names** (内名) of the **Heavenly Emperors** (诸天上帝),
Hidden in **mystical cadences** (隐韵之音).
They are also the **taboo names** (内讳) of the **True Kings** (真王),
The **secret names** (隐名) of the **hundred spirits** (百灵).
Not the common words of the world.
The **Supreme Saints**, already perfected as **True Persons** (真人),
Mastering the **Mysteries** (玄) and fathoming the **Subtle** (微),
Can fully comprehend their meaning.

To recite it **ten times** (十过),
The heavens will chant in response,
The **Ten Thousand Emperors** (万帝) will offer rites,
Clouds and mists will fall silent,
The deep spirits of sea and mountain will respond,
The **Two Symbols** (二象) will be pure and vast,
The **Three Manifestations** (三景) will shine brightly,
All sentient beings will harmonize with the **True Dao/Way** (真道),
Forever ceasing the **Wheel of Rebirth** (轮转).

For those of **highest learning** (至学之士),
To recite it **ten times**,
The **Five Emperors** will attend as guardians,
The **Three Realms** will prostrate in homage,
**Demonic essences** will lose their power,
**Ghostly spirits** (鬼祆) will perish,
The **spirit will soar, the form will solidify** (神飞形固),
And **eternal life** (永生) will be attained.

Yet this is because:
Scholars whose **impure qi** (秽气) has not yet dissipated,
Whose **Body** (体) has not yet penetrated to **True Reality** (洞真),
Summoning and restraining the **Ten Directions** (十方),
Whose **might** (威) has not yet governed the **Heavenly Laws** (天政),
Whose **virtue/power** (德) can only subdue the **Earthly Spirits** (地祇),
Binding and restraining **demonic spirits** (魔灵),
But can only **save myriads of lives** (济兆身),
And cannot universally **deliver all spirits** (度群灵).
To recite this **chapter lightly** (轻诵此章) brings calamity to oneself.
To **revere and supply offerings** (供养尊礼) brings prosperity to one’s gate,
Generations of flourishing fortune,
Associated with virtuous causes,
No disasters will afflict,
And **Divine Beings** (神明) will guard the door.

This **Sutra** is most **venerable and subtle** (尊妙),
Unmatched in the **Jade Capital** (玉京),
Delivering countless beings,
As the **root of all Dao/Way-paths** (万道之宗).
Its **grand framework** (大范) is awe-inspiring,
Its **virtue/power** (德) is beyond measure.

The **Dao/Way’s words**:
For those who recite this **Sutra ten times** (诵是经十过),
All the heavens will gather,
The **Three Realms** will halt the **Wheel of Rebirth** (停轮),
Myriads will attain the **Supreme Truth** (至真),
Illuminating the **roots of life** (生根),
Unattached to **being or non-being** (不着有无),
Unobstructed by **extinction or existence** (不滞亡存),
If there were great beings
As gates to **birth and death** (生死门),
Yet no forms exist,
Mingling in **undivided unity** (混洞不分),
Forever ceasing the **Wheel of Rebirth** (轮转),
Merging with the **Dao/Way in profound obscurity** (与道杳冥),
Countless ancestral souls (亿曾万祖),
Suffering in **darkness and torment** (幽魂苦爽),
All shall immediately be **delivered** (受度),
Ascending to the **Crimson Palace** (朱宫),
Forming a **rank of nine years** (格皆九年),
Receiving transformation and rebirth,
Becoming **noble beings** (贵人).
Those who love this **Sutra** and fulfill its **virtue/power** (功满德就),
Shall return to **namelessness** (无名),
Transcending **Yin and Yang** (阴阳),
Unbound by **clash or conflict** (无犯克并),
Not subject to **birth and death** (不属生死),
Forever ceasing the **Wheel of Rebirth** (轮转),
Transforming without transformation,
Rebirthing without rebirth,
Merging with the **Dao/Way’s Body** (与道合体),
All shall become **Immortal Worthies** (神仙),
Ascending to the **Golden Gate** (金阙),
Feasting in the **Jade Capital** (玉京).

Those of **high learning** (上学之士)
Who recite this **Sutra** shall immediately be **delivered** (受度),
Ascending to the **Southern Palace** (南宫).
Common folk who recite it
Shall prolong their lifespan,
Instantly attaining awakening,
Understanding the **Mystical and Profound Dao/Way** (玄解之道),
Their **spirit-awareness** (神识) unobscured,
Responding to all things without end,
Instantly mastering their **form** (运形),
Wandering and observing the **Great Darkness** (太冥).

This **Sutra** is **subtle and wondrous** (微妙),
Universally delivering all **sentient beings** (含灵).
All **heavenly beings and humans** (天人)
Shall receive its blessings.
Infinite blessings shall be bestowed upon **birth and death** (生死蒙惠).
It is a **treasure of the heavens** (上天所宝),
Not to be transmitted to the lower world.
Only those of **high virtue** (至士), bearing **gold and jewels** (赍金宝) with sincere hearts,
Shall swear by the heavens to pass it on.
To **leak or slight it** (轻泄漏慢) brings calamity to the **nine ancestral lines** (九祖),
Endless servitude to the **Examiners of the Dead** (考官),
Serving the **Five Emperors** (五帝) with the **Sutra**,
With **Twenty-Four Jade Boys and Girls** (玉童玉女) each,
Guarding and protecting the **Divine Texts** (神文) of those who receive the **Sutra**.

The **Dao/Way’s words**:
During the **first month’s long fast** (正月长斋),
Reciting and chanting this **Sutra**,
One attains the **True Extremes of the Dao/Way** (契道真极),
Halting the **vital impulse** (止息生机),
Within the heavens,
Having no **cause of coming or going** (无去来因),
Not dwelling in **extinction or samadhi** (不住灭定),
Entering the **Great Vehicle Path** (得大乘门),
For the **departed souls of past ages** (上世亡魂),
Cutting off **earthly servitude** (断地逮役),
Ascending to the **Southern Palace** (度上南宫).

During the **seventh month’s long fast** (七月长斋),
Reciting and chanting this **Sutra**,
Evil intentions dissolve,
Enmity turns to peace,
No longer bound by **human ties** (不为人缘),
The **interdependent cycles** (往返相因) cease,
The **form is exiled, the luminous is cast off** (寓形黜明),
The **Original Essence** (元精) completes its heavenly transformation,
Neither death nor birth,
The **Body attains Immortality** (身得神仙),
The heavens record their names in **Yellow Talismans and White Tablets** (黄箓白简),
Erasing death to attain rebirth.

During the **tenth month’s long fast** (十月长斋),
Reciting and chanting this **Sutra**,
One neither dwells in **eternal extinction** (不住永灭)
Nor rejoices in **endless existence** (不欣长存),
Riding the **phenomena** (乘物以游),
Manifesting as **light or dust** (为光为尘),
Demonstrating **infinite compassion** (示兆大慈),
Universally delivering beings,
Proclaiming the **teachings** (出教) and expounding the **Dharma** (演法),
The **Treasure Scripture of Heaven** (宝书天经),
For **kings and imperial rulers** (国王帝主),
Ensuring stability for **rulers and subjects, fathers and sons** (君臣父子),
Securing the **nation’s destiny** (安镇国祚),
Preserving the **Heaven’s longevity** (保天长存),
Generations without end,
Forever governing their lands as **sovereigns** (人君安镇其方),
The people calling it the **Great Peace** (太平).

On the **eight solar terms** (八节之日),
Reciting and chanting this **Sutra**,
Standing alone in **serene observation** (挺然独观),
Unshaken by the **eight winds** (八风无倾),
Transcending **birth and death** (兆出死生),
Riding the **Jade Chariot** (驾驭琼轮),
Attaining the status of the **Nine Palace True Persons** (九宫真人).

On one’s **natal day** (本命之日),
Reciting and chanting this **Sutra**,
The **true qi** (真气) waxes and wanes,
Neither perishing nor vanishing,
Forever severing the **wheel of transmigration** (轮转),
Wandering freely through the **wondrous courtyard** (妙庭),
The **soul and spirit** (魂神) cleansed and rectified,
The **ten thousand breaths** (万气) enduring forever,
Unencumbered by **suffering and tribulation** (苦恼),
The body radiant with light,
Guardians of the **Three Realms** (三界侍卫),
The **Five Emperors** (五帝) welcoming in attendance,
All spirits paying homage,
Its name inscribed in **Heaven’s records** (名书上天),
**Virtue** (功) fulfilled and **power** (德) complete,
Ascending to **Upper Purity** (上清).

The **Dao** (道) instructs:
On the **day of practice** (行道之日),
All should bathe in fragrant water,
Adhere to precepts and enter the chamber,
Facing east,
Knocking the teeth thirty-two times,
Ascending to hear the **Thirty-two Heavens** (三十二天),
Heartfully bowing to the **Thirty-two Offenses** (三十二过),
Closing the eyes,
Silently meditating on oneself seated within the **nine-colored clouds of qi** (黄绿青赤苍黑碧紫白九色云气),
Inner and outer darkness abounding,
With the **Green Dragon, White Tiger, Vermilion Bird, Dark Tortoise** (青龙、白虎、朱雀、玄武),
Lion, and White Crane arrayed on either side,
Above the head, the **Supreme Most High True Dao Lord** (无无上真道君),
Wearing the **Crown of Seven Luminaries in Harmony** (七曜交泰宝冠),
Face like jade dew,
Square pupils and white beard,
Radiance and majesty resplendent,
Clad in **emerald skirts and crimson robes** (绿霞绛章飞裙),
Wielding the **Divine Sword** (神剑),
Severing the **demons of birth and death** (断生死魔),
Slaying the **ghosts of the Three Heavens** (三天杀鬼),
Riding the **purple and white clouds** (乘紫素云),
Standing erect in **doubtless wonder** (住立疑然),
Nine feet in stature,
Corresponding to the **Nine True Ones** (上应九真).

Sun and moon illuminate,
Piercing radiance within the chamber,
A **triple-circle symbol** (三气圆象) rising at the nape,
Shining forth in all directions,
So clear and distinct.

The **secret incantation** (密咒) states:
